title: Ambush Unfolds on Video as Pennsylvania Sets Trial for Eric Frein in Killing of State Trooper
description: MILFORD, Pa.  Eric M. Frein, a self-described survivalist accused of an ambush that killed a Pennsylvania state trooper and wounded another, sat motionless during a preliminary hearing in a Pike County courtroom on Monday, his eyes riveted on a surveillance video.

title: Blood and Politics
Gov. Cuomos Expanded Horizons
description: Gov. Andrew Cuomo of New York gave a politically important speech last week that got lost in the news that his father, former Gov. Mario Cuomo, had died that same afternoon. The speech  his second inaugural address  touched on some of the high points of his first term while laying out an ambitious agenda for his next four years.

title: CES: A Push for Higher Resolution and Better-Looking TVs
description: The International CES took a turn toward the familiar on Monday: televisions.

title: Migrant Deaths on the Mediterranean
description: Well-organized criminal gangs are increasing the pressure on Europe to deal with illegal migration across the Mediterranean by using a terrible new tactic: Sending rusty old freighters filled with refugees hurtling full throttle toward Italys shores and certain disaster. Its a game of chicken, and the smugglers know that Europe has no moral option but to rescue the ships human cargo.

title: Obama Nears Goal for Guantnamo With Faster Pace of Releases
description: WASHINGTON  In a series of secret nighttime flights in the last two months, the Obama administration made more progress toward the presidents goal of emptying the military prison at Guantnamo Bay, Cuba, than it had since 2009. The accelerated pace came after an era of political infighting and long bureaucratic delays.

title: Egypts Appalling Crackdown on Gays
description: Even if they were acquitted on the ludicrous charge of debauchery, the 26 Egyptian men on trial in the governments latest crackdown on gays are likely to suffer a lifetime of public scorn.

title: Feistier de Blasio Appears, Uncowed by Police Unions
description: This time, Mayor Bill de Blasio came out swinging.

title: Aces Obstacle on Way to Hall: A Modest Hitter
description: The newest members of the Baseball Hall of Fame will be revealed on Tuesday, and three overpowering aces of the 1990s  Randy Johnson, Pedro Martinez and John Smoltz  seem certain to be cast in bronze in Cooperstown.

title: Mourners Pay Their Respects to Mario Cuomo
description: They waited in the bitter cold, in some cases for more than two hours, drawn to pay their respects to a gifted politician they admired. Many came from the highest ranks of New Yorks political world.

title: The Problem With Meaning
description: Not long ago, a friend sent me a speech that the great civic leader John Gardner gave to the Stanford Alumni Association 61 years after he graduated from that college. The speech is chock-full of practical wisdom. I especially liked this passage:

title: Resistance From Right Slows G.O.P. Press to Redefine Full-Time Worker
description: WASHINGTON  One of the new Republican Congresss first legislative priorities  redefining a full-time worker under the Affordable Care Act  is gaining opposition just days before passage from a surprising group: conservatives.

title: Gilead Strikes Hepatitis Drug Deal With CVS Health
description: Gilead Sciences struck back on Monday against its rival AbbVie in a budding marketing war over costly hepatitis C drugs, winning exclusive access to many patients whose prescriptions are managed by CVS Health.

title: Martin Anderson, White House Adviser to Reagan, Dies at 78
description: Martin Anderson, a conservative economist who helped shape American economic policy in the 1980s as a top adviser to President Ronald Reagan, died on Saturday at his home in Portola Valley, Calif. He was 78.

title: Hezbollah Appears to Acknowledge a Spy at the Top
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon  The admission from Hezbollahs deputy chief was startling. The group, he said over the weekend, is battling espionage within its ranks and has uncovered some major infiltrations.

title: Rams OwnerStan Kroenke Reveals Plan for Field in Los Angeles Area
description: The owner Stan Kroenke of the St. Louis Rams on Monday announced plans to build an 80,000-seat football stadium in Inglewood, Calif., about 10 miles from downtown Los Angeles.

title: When Mark Zuckerberg Likes a Book, Sales Soar
description: The Facebook chief executive Mark Zuckerberg made a New Years resolution to read two books a month in 2015, and hes inviting his 31 million Facebook friends to join him.

title: Not Embracing Christies Love of the Dallas Cowboys
description: Embracing President Obama was one thing. But hugging Jerry Jones?

title: Winning Lottery Numbers for Jan. 5, 2015
The Moral of the Kulluk
description: The cover story of The New York Times Magazine on Sunday, The Wreck of the Kulluk, by McKenzie Funk, is one of those articles that you cant put down even though you know how it turns out. The Kulluk was an offshore exploratory drilling rig, owned by Royal Dutch Shell, which, in December 2012, ran aground in some of the most inhospitable waters in the world.

title: Q. and A. on Palestinian Statehood
description: Q. What determines statehood?

title: Palestinians Seen Gaining Momentum in Quest for Statehood
description: JERUSALEM  When the Palestinians sought statehood at the United Nations in 2011, it was widely dismissed as a symbolic gambit to skirt negotiations with Israel and Washingtons influence over the long-running conflict. But the Palestinians have begun to translate a series of such symbolic steps, culminating in last weeks move to join the International Criminal Court, into a strategy that has begun to create pressure on Israel.

title: An Unusual Boardroom Battle, in Academia
description: A normally academic question about corporate governance has erupted into a nasty, often personal battle among elite professors, regulators and white-shoe lawyers that has raised the suggestion of securities fraud on one side and abuse of authority on the other.

title: At 5-32, Knicks Look to the Future by Trading Smith and Shumpert
description: The Knicks, in their continuing quest to shed salaries and reshape the franchise, were involved in a major, three-team trade on Monday night, sending J. R. Smith and Iman Shumpert to the Cleveland Cavaliers in exchange for several players with nonguaranteed contracts and a future draft pick.

title: Justice Dept. Sues Doctor Paid Richly by Medicare
description: One of the nations top-billing doctors, a cardiologist who collected more than $18 million in payments from Medicare in 2012, has been accused by the federal government of performing unnecessary procedures on patients.

title: Sound Investments
description: TUESDAY PUZZLE The curvaceous black-square pattern going down the center of the grid tipped me off that something was going on in Joel Faglianos grid. I wasnt sure what that might be until I got to the revealer at 62 Down, when I realized it was meant to invoke the sinewy nature of DNA strands. It was clever to hold out until the last Down entry, although, personally, I dont feel that the gray squares do much for the solving experience.

title: Sacvan Bercovitch, Scholar Who Traced Americas Self-Image, Dies at 81
description: Sacvan Bercovitch, a distinguished literary scholar who traced Americas self-image of exceptionalism to the rhetoric of the colonial Puritans of New England, died on Dec. 9 at his home in Brookline, Mass. He was 81.

title: After His Ex-Wifes Death, a Struggle to Raise His Daughters
description: Yefim Ulitskiy, 55, did not know how to tell his two young daughters that their mother, his ex-wife, had died.

title: Leo Tindemans, 92, Dies; Belgian Prime Minister and Voice for European Unity
description: PARIS  Leo Tindemans, a former prime minister of Belgium who pushed for greater European integration and helped set the stage for the introduction of the European Unions single currency, the euro, died on Dec. 26 in Edegem, in the Flemish province of Antwerp. He was 92.

title: In Memphis, Knicks Can Only Watch Marc Gasol and Wish He Were One of Them
description: MEMPHIS  As the Knicks were trying to complete a major three-team trade on Monday  a deal that sent J. R. Smith and Iman Shumpert to the Cleveland Cavaliers in exchange for several players with nonguaranteed contracts and a future draft pick  Jose Calderon was going through a pregame drill.

title: Rysheed JordanReturns for St. Johns in Time to Play Villanova
description: The puzzling disappearance of the sophomore guard Rysheed Jordan from the St. Johns lineup this past weekend was resolved at least somewhat on Monday afternoon, when the program announced that Jordan would return for Tuesdays crucial home contest against Villanova.

title: Chris Christie Supports Cowboys Owner, but Not Eagles Fans
description: Chris Christie relishes his proximity to the owner of the Dallas Cowboys, Jerry Jones, whose friendship has caused the New Jersey governor a new round of headaches this week.

title: Bronx School Ousts Priest After Admissions of Abuse
description: An assistant principal at Cardinal Hayes High School in the Bronx has been dismissed after admitting just before the Christmas break that he sexually abused 10 minors in the 1970s and 1980s, authorities from his religious order saidon Monday.

title: Conviction to Be Cleared in 1991 Brooklyn Murder Case
description: Saying the sole eyewitness at a murder trial gave patently false testimony, the Brooklyn district attorney saidon Mondaythat he would move to clear the conviction of Derrick Hamilton, who spent about two decades in prison for a 1991 murder.

title: Nets Make It Interesting but Wither in Overtime
description: Consider the Nets statistics in the first quarter of their game Monday night against the Dallas Mavericks: 35 points, 61.5 percent shooting, 13 team assists and no turnovers.

title: Two Plainclothes Officers Are Shot in the Bronx
description: Two plainclothes New York City police officers were shot in the Bronx on Monday night while they were investigating an armed robbery at a grocery store, the police said.

title: Game of Thrones Takes a Trailer of Its New Season to Imax
description: The dragons, dire wolves, White Walkers and power-hungry political factions in HBOs fantasy epic Game of Thrones will invade movie theaters later this month  on the big, big screen. An exclusive trailer for the coming season along with the final two episodes of the previous season will be shown in 150 Imax theaters across the country.

title: Word of the Day | spat
description: spat \spat\ noun and verb

title: Real Estate in Manhattan Set Sales Records in 2014
description: It was a banner year for Manhattan real estate. In 2014, buoyed by sales of ultraluxury apartments in new developments, the real estate market rebounded to surpass its previous peak, reached in 2008, when the financial crisis hit, according to Jonathan J. Miller, the president of the appraisal firm Miller Samuel.

title: Holding Off Russia, Canada Wins First Title in 6 Years
description: TORONTO  With Canadas prime minister on hand and fans clad in the red and white of the national flag rocking Air Canada Centre, Canada scored on its first two shots and held on to defeat Russia, 5-4, on Monday and win the gold medal at the World Junior Championship.

title: How Nonemployed Americans Spend Their Weekdays: Men vs. Women
description: An interactive comparison of a day in the life of 147 men and 147 women without jobs.

title: Where Working Women Are Most Common
description: Female employment rates have continued rising in most rich countries, but they have been falling in the United States since 2000.

title: Last Ship to Close on Broadway
description: The Broadway musical The Last Ship will close on Jan. 24 despite an unusual attempt by Sting, its composer, to try to increase ticket sales and spread word about the show by joining its cast last month. Two of the musicals producers, Jeffrey Seller and Kathryn Schenker, shared the news in an email on Monday night to members of the production and other supporters of The Last Ship.

title: Whats on TV Tuesday
description: 6:30 P.M. (HBO Signature) THE GREAT GATSBY (2013) Leonardo DiCaprio stars as the enigmatic millionaire Jay Gatsby and Carey Mulligan portrays Daisy Buchanan, the object of his obsession. Tobey Maguire is Nick Carraway, the Yale graduate  and, conveniently, Daisys cousin  renting the cottage next to Gatsbys colossal Long Island mansion in Baz Luhrmanns stylized musical take on this F. Scott Fitzgerald novel. Despite what you may have heard, it is an eminently enjoyable movie, A. O. Scott wrote in The New York Times about this film, which won Oscars for best costume and production design. Still, is the tale a credible love story? he asked. Fitzgerald himself was not sure, but Mr. Luhrmann, Mr. DiCaprio and Ms. Mulligan make it an effective one.

description: NATIONAL

title: Quotation of the Day

description: In the article Battling Up a Sheer Yosemite Face, Seizing a Dream, Not a Rope, John Branch writes about what is thought to be the worlds toughest climb.

title: Telling Stories in a Tennessee Coal Town
description: Robert Heller felt out of place when he first arrived in Knoxville to teach photography at the University of Tennessee in 1986. Mr. Heller  who had been raised on Long Island, N.Y., by second-generation Russian-Jewish immigrant parents  had never been to Tennessee and didnt know much about the state other than it is a center of country and bluegrass music (so much so that it has at least five official state songs, including Tennessee Waltz and Rocky Top).

description: Good morning.

description: Good morning on this white Tuesday.

title: University in Xian Opens School of Cyberengineering
description: Xidian University, with more than 30,000 students on two campuses in the ancient city of Xian, has a storied history. The original academy was personally established by Mao Zedong in 1931, when the Communist Party and Red Army were leading an insurgent movement to overthrow the Kuomintang government. Based in Jiangxi Province, where the Communists had their headquarters for a period, the schools mission was to train radio operators for the military. Mao had set it up in his role as head of the partys Central Military Commission.

description: Will Greece stay in the eurozone?

title: Deputy Chief Executive Departs Royal Bank of Scotland Earlier Than Expected
description: LONDON  Chris Sullivan, the deputy chief executive of the Royal Bank of Scotland, has left the bank earlier than expected, departing several months after his testimony toa Parliament committee was criticized.

title: Wasserstein & Co. Goes on Deal Spree
description: Wasserstein & Company, the small private equity firm that specializes in media, consumer and industrial companies, is having a busy start to the year. In less than a week, the firm, founded by the late Bruce Wasserstein, has announced four deals.

title: Nestl Health Science to Invest $65 Million in a Biotech Start-Up
description: Four years after opening for business, a subsidiary of Nestl specializing in nutritional therapy is striking one of its most prominent investments to date with a bet on experimental treatments for the bacteria within the human body.

title: Bob McDonnell, Ex-Governor of Virginia, Is Sentenced to 2 Years for Corruption
description: RICHMOND, Va.  Bob McDonnell, the former governor of Virginia who was convicted in September on corruption charges, was sentenced to 24 months in prison on Tuesday in one of the most spectacular falls of a statewide official in the history of the commonwealth.

description: Season 1, Episode 11, Rogues Gallery

title: SpaceX Rocket Launch Is Called Off Minutes Before Liftoff
description: The launch countdown of a rocket carrying equipment and supplies for the International Space Station was called off just minutes before the rocket was to lift off from Cape Canaveral, Fla., on Tuesday morning.

title: A Chinese Propaganda Icon Loses a Layer of Myth
description: When Lei Feng was a rustless screw in Mao Zedongs revolution, he enthusiastically devoted himself to tasks that forwarded the socialist cause: He darned his fellow soldiers socks, gave up his lunch to hungrier comrades and donated his wages to the local commune.

title: Hong Kong Leaders Insist Election Will Follow Beijings Rules
description: HONG KONG  The Hong Kong government vowed on Tuesday to press ahead with an election proposal that ignited months of street protests last year, using a report originally offered as a concession to student demonstrators to warn that the authorities would not shift course from plans laid down by Beijing.

title: Weekly News Quiz | Jan. 1-5, 2015
description: Happy New Year and welcome back to the Weekly News Quiz, a new edition of which can be found here every Tuesday morning.

title: Britain Fines Former Banco Esprito Santo Unit
description: LONDON  British regulators have fined the former investment banking business of the troubled Portuguese lender Banco Esprito Santo for failing to disclose the departure of centralstaff members from one of its capital markets teams in 2013.

title: Video of Police Shooting Suspect
description: A surveillance video released by the New York Police Department shows the suspect the police say shot two plainclothes officers on Monday night.

title: Coach Expands Luxury Fashion Brand Buying Shoemaker Stuart Weitzman
description: Stuart Weitzmans strappy sandals have graced the feet of the actresses Jennifer Lawrence and Lupita Nyongo. The Duchess of Cambridge sports his wedge heels.

title: Morning Agenda: Data Leak at Morgan Stanley
description: After account records for clients of Morgan Stanley were put up for sale last month on the information-sharing site Pastebin, the bank traced the breach to a financial adviser working out of its New York offices, a 30-year-old named Galen Marsh, Nathaniel Popper writes in DealBook, citing a person involved in the investigation. Mr. Marsh, who had been with Morgan Stanley since 2008, was quickly fired and is currently the subject of a criminal investigation by the Federal Bureau of Investigation, a person briefed on the investigation said. The Financial Industry Regulatory Authority is also examining the matter.

title: In Performance: Courtney Love of Kansas City Choir Boy
description: This weeks video features Courtney Love performing the number All I Ever Wanted from Kansas City Choir Boy, a song cycle about a singer and her musician boyfriend. Ms. Love, the lead singer of the band Hole, is accompanied on piano by Todd Almond, her co-star and the shows songwriter, and the cellist Eric Allen. The piece runs at the performance space Here from Thursday to Jan. 17 as part of Prototype, the annual music and theater festival.

title: An Appeal to Listen and Learn
description: Sometimes a book arrives in your life exactly when you need it. Such was the case for me with Outline, Rachel Cusks new novel.

title: Daily Clip Report
description: Good morning. Here is Daily Clip Report, a collection of articles about The Times and the media sent by email each morning to senior executives and newsroom editors. The email is produced by the Corporate Communications Department at The Times.

title: First Draft Focus: A Snowy Start for Congress
Moving Videos Between Mac and Android Gadgets
description: Moving Videos

title: China Arrests Activist Amid a Clampdown
description: BEIJING  Guo Yushan, a young activist who helped the prominent rights advocate Chen Guangcheng flee house arrest in 2012, has been arrested and charged with operating an illegal business, according to a police notice posted online on Tuesday by Mr. Guos wife, Pan Haixia.

title: A Fire in the Night
description: Dear Diary:

title: Anne Hathaways Oscars Advice: Do the Opposite of What I Did
description: The actress speaks with Taffy Brodesser-Akner about her new film, Song One, and learning to deal with the Hathahaters.

title: Iowa and New Hampshire Have Already Seen Cash From 2016 Contenders
description: The next two years are a good time to be a local candidate or party organization in Iowa and New Hampshire.

title: Long a Walled-Off Secret, the Paris Mint Transforms Into a Dining and Art Destination
description: The three-Michelin-starred chef Guy Savoy is impatient. A 4,300-square-foot space at the top of the Monnaie de Paris  one of the citys most beautiful buildings  is scheduled to open this spring as the reincarnation of his flagship restaurant on the other side of town. But the kitchen has no refrigerators and only partial electrical and heating systems. Buckets of water and cans of paint line the floors. Some of the light fixtures have not been installed. Paintings have not been hung.

title: About That French Time Bomb
description: Ive written often about the remarkable track record of U.S. debt-and-inflation doomsayers, who have warned again and again that were about to turn into Greece if not Zimbabwe, and are now completely unwilling to admit that they were wrong, or even that their model of how the world works needs some revision. But as interest rates plunge almost everywhere, lets look back at the bad-mouthing of another economy, which looks equally wrong-headed if not more so.

title: Coach Is Buying Stuart Weitzman: Why It Matters
description: Coach, the accessible luxury company long rumored to be a possible acquisition target for a big group, and in the midst of a revamp of its stores and image under the creative director Stuart Vevers, has turned the tables. It announced Tuesday that it was acquiring the shoe brand Stuart Weitzman from Sycamore Partners in a deal that values the company at $574 million.

title: Daily Report: Getting the Apps to Talk to Each Other
description: Navigating the Internet used to mean painstakingly typing the exact address you wanted into your computer. The web browser and the search engine simplified that, giving us the Internet we take for granted today.

title: A Memorial in Shanghai for Victims of Stampede
description: SHANGHAI  Nearly a week after a stampede killed at least 36 people and injured 49 others during an outdoor New Years Eve gathering in one of this citys most popular tourist spots, a solemn memorial service was held here Tuesday morning.

title: Snowball Fight. After School. Be There.
Lego Movie Wiseacres and Sincere Actors at the Critics Circle Awards
description: The New York Film Critics Circle Awards ceremony is one of those slightly odd, staple Oscar-season events in which the winners have long ago been named (Boyhood collected three awards  for best supporting actress, director and film) and the member critics are each given a round of applause, one by one, for doing their jobs.

title: Paying for the TV Shows You Want
description: The new streaming TV service from Dish Network is not going to kill the cable bundleat least not in its current form. But the service, which Dish is calling Sling TV, should help some people save money by allowing them to pay only for the TV shows that they actually want to watch.

title: Why Do We Hate Clich?
description: Each week in Bookends, two writers take on questions about the world of books. This week, Rivka Galchen and Leslie Jamison discuss why we react so strongly against clichs.

title: Dean Baquets Charting the Future Note to Times Staff
description: A turbulent year at The Times is over, and with that, the executive editor, Dean Baquet, has written a lengthy note to the newsroom staff, titled Charting the Future. After writing about this myself last week, I thought that readers might like this inside look. Mr. Baquet did not object to the internal document being made public. Here it is:

title: National Portrait Gallery Names New Director
description: LONDON  Nicholas Cullinan, who has been the curator of modern and contemporary art at the Metropolitan Museum of Art in New York for the last two years, has been appointed the new director of the National Portrait Gallery here, the gallery announced on Tuesday.

title: Resolutions for a Year of Change in a Military Family
description: Ive never cared much for New Years resolutions. Mostly, I subscribe to the mentality that if you want to make a change in your life, you dont need a specific date to do it. This year, however, Im giving it a chance, hoping that if I write it down, Ill be more inclined to commit.

title: With New PAC, Jeb Bush Steps Closer to a Run
description: In his latest step toward running for president, former Gov. Jeb Bush of Florida is organizing a political action committee that will allow him to raise and spend money on campaign activities, he announced on Tuesday on his Facebook page.

title: Everything Must Go! Knicks Start Over, Again
description: Swing that wrecking ball. Bring down the ceiling, tear down the walls, pull out the porticos. Jimmy Dolan, grab your chandelier, and be quick about it! Your Knicks franchise is going right down to the concrete floor.

title: Are Blockbusters Destroying the Movies?
description: Itsred-carpet season inHollywood, rolling on until the Academy Awards, an abundance of trophies and best-of lists.

title: 1940: A Warning to the Soviets
description: BUCHAREST  Speaking today [Jan. 6] in Chisinau, the main town in Bessarabia at a distance of twenty miles from the Soviet frontier, King Carol virtually defied the Soviet Union to try to attack his kingdom.

title: Jeb Bushs Mission Statement, in Translation
description: In which First Draft reads between the lines of the mission statement for Jeb Bushs new PAC, Right to Rise.We believe passionately that the Right to Rise  to move up the income ladder based on merit, hard work and earned success  is the central moral promise of American economic life.Besides paying homage to Paul Ryan, who coined the phrase right to rise, Mr. Bush is playing to the G.O.P.s linguistic foundation, with words like earned and merit to telegraph a message of personal responsibility, rather than government help.

title: Kappo Masa
description: Masayoshi Takayamas restaurant in the basement of Larry Gagosians Upper East Side art gallery.

title: Restaurant Review: Kappo Masa on the Upper East Side
description: Galleries owned by Larry Gagosian, the powerful and well-connected dealer who has spent his career goosing the prices of contemporary art higher and higher: 14.

title: Junk Food in the New Year
description: People buy extra groceries during the holidays, much of it junk food. But what happens once the holidays are over? They keep buying the extra junk, a new study has found.

title: Whiplash Script Puts Academy at Odds With Writers Guild
description: The drama Whiplash, filmed in 19 days on a shoestring budget, starring J.K. Simmons, and considered a contender for best screenplay, found itself in a pickle on Monday, when it was discovered that the Academy had deemed the script an adaptation.

title: Prince Ali of Jordan Will Challenge Sepp Blatter for FIFA Presidency
description: Prince Ali bin al-Hussein of Jordan, who has been critical of FIFAs leadership from his seat on the organizations ruling executive committee, announced Tuesday that he would challenge Sepp Blatter for the FIFA presidency in elections in May.

title: How to Get More Women to Join the Debate
description: When Dylan Farrow posted a letter on this blog accusing Woody Allen of sexual assault, female commenters overwhelmingly supported her; male commenters were evenly split.

title: Finishing Touches
1975: A Quarterback Named Bloomberg
description: This feature looks at the first time famous names or terms appeared in The Times. Have an idea for someone or something you would like to read about? Send a suggestion in the comments section.

title: Reid, Recuperating, Is Staying at Home as Congress Opens
description: Senator Harry Reid, Democrat of

title: At Funeral for Mario Cuomo, Praise for a Leaders Role as a Humanist
description: In the end there were the words, and the words were the sons, and the words were about his father, former Gov. Mario M. Cuomo.

title: CNBC to Stop UsingNielsen Ratings for Daytime Shows
description: CNBC announced Tuesday that it was abandoning Nielsen ratings for its daytime programming in favor of a research firm that will survey financial advisers and investment professionals to gauge the effectiveness of ad campaigns on the business news network.

title: McCarthy Assesses Boehners Chances
description: Representative Kevin McCarthy, the majority leader, on John A. Boehners chances of being re-elected speaker in a potentially contentious vote.

title: Newport Panel Approves Visitor Center for the Breakers
description: A controversial visitor center proposed for the grounds of the Gilded Age Vanderbilt mansion, the Breakers, was approved by the Newport, R.I., Zoning Board of Review on Monday.

title: Detroit Institute of Arts Meets Bankruptcy Plan Fund-Raising Goal
description: The Detroit Institute of Arts  whose world-class collection was saved last year in an agreement that kept it intact under Detroits federal bankruptcy plan  announced Monday that it had secured enough pledges from donors to meet a $100-million obligation as its part of the agreement, known as the grand bargain.

title: Have You Noticed the Decline in Arrests and Tickets in New York City?
description: The number of arrests and tickets has fallen sharply in New York City for the second straight week, J. David Goodman and Al Baker reported. Police statistics showed that some precincts recorded not even a single parking ticket, traffic summons or ticket for a low-level crime like public urination or drinking.

title: Boehner Fends Off Dissent as G.O.P. Takes the Reins
description: WASHINGTON  Representative John A. Boehner beat back an embarrassing challenge to his speakership from aggrieved conservatives on Tuesday as Republicans assumed control of both houses of Congress, pledging to restore function and civility to a body that has become a symbol of disorder for most Americans.

title: How Amy Adams Overcame Her Resistance to Big Eyes
description: Amy Adams has played the real-life aspiring culinarist Julie Powell in Julie & Julia (2009); Charlene Fleming, another real person, in The Fighter (2010); and Sydney Prosser, who is based on the Englishwoman Evelyn Knight, in American Hustle (2013).

title: For Jeb Bush, a Video in the Shadow of Private Equity
description: Former Gov. Jeb Bush of Florida published videos in English and Spanish this morning announcing Right to Rise, his new political action committee, and it looks as though he did it on the doorstep of some potential donors.

title: Suicide Bomber in Istanbul Kills Officer at Police Station
description: ISTANBUL  A suicide bomber wearing a large coat that concealed her explosives attacked a police station in the heart of Istanbuls most tourist-filled district on Tuesday, killing herself and wounding two police officers, one fatally.

title: A Send-Off for a Former Governor
description: Mourners gathered for the funeral of former Gov. Mario M. Cuomo on Tuesday.

title: Bipartisan Nod in Senates First Bill, on Keystone Pipeline
description: Amid all Tuesdays pomp and circumstance at the Capitol, Republicans actually introduced legislation  specifically, S. 1, the first bill to hit the Senate floor in the 114th Congress, which would authorize construction of the Keystone XL pipeline.

title: Wanted: Better Basketball for a Beleaguered Reporter
description: The Knicks, in an effort to rebuild through the N.B.A. draft and free agency, appear to have officially given up on this season. Theyre an unthinkable 5-32, and on Monday night they traded away J. R. Smith and Iman Shumpert, leaving a roster that might struggle against an N.B.A. Development League team.

title: Long a College Town, Worcester Now Looks the Part
description: WORCESTER, Mass.  Although College of the Holy Cross was founded here in 1843, and eight other prominent institutions of higher learning followed, it has taken most of the last two centuries for this sizable New England city to consider itself a college town.

title: First Draft Focus: Cuomo Funeral
description: At Funeral for Mario Cuomo, Praise for a Leaders Role as a Humanist

title: Same-Sex Pairs in Florida Say Jubilant I Dos
description: MIAMI  Wedding ceremonies began and ended in the middle of the night in Fort Lauderdale and Key West, and hundreds of other marriages played out under blue skies in Miami Beach and Orlando, as Florida completed its long, arduous journey Tuesday to become the 36th state to legalize same-sex marriage.

title: Jitters After Bitcoin Exchange Suspends Services
description: One of the biggest Bitcoin exchanges suspended services on Tuesday, prompting unease in a virtual currency industry already scarred by the collapse last year of Mt. Gox, once its most prominent exchange.

title: Same-Sex Couples Marry in Florida
description: Now the nations third largest state, Florida became the 36th state to allow same-sex marriage.

title: 1965: Congo May Hire African Troops
description: WASHINGTON  Congolese Premier Moise Tshombe is considering hiring African soldiers dismissed from the French Army, it was reported today. Authoritative sources said the Africans, if hired, would replace the white mercenaries employed by Mr. Tshombe in his fight against Congolese rebels. The Africans Mr. Tshombe reportedly is considering hiring are well-trained, disciplined men who have been without jobs since the reduction of French forces in Africa.  New York Herald Tribune, European Edition, Jan. 7, 1965

title: The Jeb Bush Optimism Challenge
description: In preparation for his 2016 attempt to become the third of his name in the White House, former Florida Gov. Jeb Bush has launched a new PAC called Right to Rise. Michael Barbaro has ably translated Mr. Bushs mission statement on First Draft, but I wanted to call attention to an apparent contradiction.

title: The Child-Averse Sperm Donor
description: I hadnt even fastened my seatbelt before the woman next to me tapped me on my shoulder. I just have to show you something! she exclaimed. Just my luck, I thought. Not only was I stuck in the middle seat on a five-hour red-eye, but now I also had to deal with Chatty Cathy here the whole flight home.

title: Obamas Choice for Fed Is a Nod to Smaller Banks
description: WASHINGTON  President Obama said on Tuesday that he would nominate Allan R. Landon, the former chief executive of one of the largest banks in Hawaii, to a seat on the Federal Reserves Board of Governors.

title: With Desks Shuffled, a New G.O.P. Senate Is Seated
description: The new Senate was seated with the usual ceremony just after noon today as 13 new members were sworn in and Senator Mitch McConnell assumed the majority leader position.

title: So Many Earth-Like Planets, So Few Telescopes
description: Its a big universe, but its full of small planets.

title: Alcohol Poisoning Kills 6 Americans a Day, a Federal Report Finds
description: Six Americans die from alcohol poisoning daily on average, and mortality rates are highest among middle-aged men, federal health authorities reported on Tuesday.

title: A Final Tribute to Mario Cuomo
description: Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo of New York spoke at the funeral service for his father, which was held at the Church of St. Ignatius Loyola in Manhattan.

title: Fear Spread Through Ranks as Officers Shootings Seemed Like an Ambush
description: Word spread in a flurry of messages across the Police Department: two officers shot, conditions unknown.

title: The Year in Market Doublespeak
description: As the market perpetually shifts, so do the rhetorical stylings its players use to talk their way out of problems. The past year saw above-average creativity when it came to saying one thing and meaning another. Here, Reuters Breakingviews offers 10 euphemisms wed most like to see disappear.

title: Recipe for a Small Planet
description: Astronomers have found a recipe for rocky, Earth-like planets orbiting other stars.

title: The Record of Austerity
description: Let me jump right in here. How many people, I wonder  even among economists who have eagerly taken sides in the austerity debate  have a sense of what the overall picture looks like since the great turn to austerity in 2010? I dont mean what happened in country X in year Y, which you imagine supports your position; I mean the overall shape of events across many countries and multiple years.

title: Where Will Americans Travel in 2015?
description: Americans today are taking less vacation time than at any point in nearly 40 years, according to an October report for the U.S. Travel Association by Oxford Economics. So where and how will we be spending our precious leisure time in 2015?

title: Obama Invites Congressional Leaders to White House
description: President Obama has invited the bipartisan leadership of Congress to a meeting next Tuesday to discuss his legislative agenda for 2015 and to update congressional leaders on international issues, White House officials said.

title: White House Says Obama Would Veto Keystone Pipeline Bill
description: President Obama will veto a bill authorizing the construction of the Keystone XL oil pipeline if it passes Congress, his spokesman said on Tuesday, setting up a clash between the White House and the new Republican-led Congress.

title: Forget the Cowboys. This Is Why Chris Christie Needs Texas.
description: The social media reaction to Chris Christie's jubilation over a Dallas Cowboys playoff victory Sunday may be harsh and unforgiving. But there may be a political upside to Mr. Christies devotion to the Cowboys: campaign cash.

title: Rocky Start in Senate as Democrats Slow G.O.P. Pipeline Plan
description: Relations in the new Senate got off to a rough start Tuesday as Democrats at least temporarily blocked Republican plans to convene a hearing Wednesday on the Keystone XL pipeline, the new majoritys first legislative priority.

title: A Veteran Who Captured Imaginations on D-Day Anniversary Dies at 90
description: LONDON  A veteran of World War II who slipped away from a nursing home in England last year to attend the celebrations of the 70th anniversary of D-Day in France has died at the age of 90.

title: House Re-elects Boehner as Speaker
description: Fending off a challenge from the right wing of his party, Speaker John A. Boehner was re-elected on Tuesday as the top Republican in the House.

title: N.B.A.s Futility Record Seems Safe, Even From These Knicks and 76ers
description: It is already January, and three teams in the N.B.A., the Philadelphia 76ers, the Minnesota Timberwolves and the Knicks, have managed only five wins each. These teams are so woeful that there has been talk that one (or more) might break the leagues futility mark, the legendary 9-73 record of the 1972-73 Sixers.

title: Oh, Mr. Vice President
Palestinian Gets 3 Life Sentences in Killing of Israeli Teenagers
description: JERUSALEM  An Israeli military court on Tuesday sentenced a Palestinian man to three life terms for his role as logistics commander in the abduction and murder of three Israeli teenagers in the occupied West Bank in June, a crucial chapter in last years deterioration of Israeli-Palestinian relations.

title: Baseball Writers Elect Three Aces and a Doubles Machine
description: Three ace pitchers and one durable doubles machine achieved baseballs highest honor on Tuesday. Randy Johnson, Pedro Martinez, John Smoltz and Craig Biggio were elected to the Hall of Fame. It was the first time in 60 years that the baseball writers chose four players in the same class.

title: Transport Groups New Season to Feature Jackie Hoffman and John Lypsinka Epperson in Once Upon a Mattress
description: Jackie Hoffman and John Lypsinka Epperson will star in a Transport Group revival of the musical Once Upon a Mattress, the company announced on Tuesday. Ms. Hoffman will play Princess Winnifred and Mr. Epperson (whose alter ego is the drag persona Lypsinka) will be Queen Aggravain in the comic retelling of the story The Princess and the Pea. (Carol Burnett and Jane White played the roles in the original Broadway production in 1959.) Ms. Hoffman and Mr. Epperson will reprise their roles from a concert version of the show that Transport Group mounted in 2013 (above). The new production is set to run Nov. 29 through Jan. 3, 2016, at the Abrons Arts Center.

title: Wall Street Regulator Plans to Scrutinize Electronic Bond Trading
description: Wall Streets self-regulator plans to take a closer look at electronic trading in bonds this year, as part of an expanded review of fixed-income markets.

title: Bone Broth
description: Spurred on by the popularity of the Paleo diet, bone broth is replacing chai on the morning commute.

title: Bones, Broth, Bliss
description: When Michelle Tam was growing up in Menlo Park, Calif., in the 1980s, her family sipped broth with dinner every single night.

title: Drake, AC/DC and Jack White Headline Coachella
description: Spanning generations, AC/DC, Jack White, and Drake will headline the 16th annual Coachella Valley Music and Arts Festival across two weekends, April 10 through 12 and 17 through 19, in Indio, Calif., its organizers announced on Tuesday via Twitter.

title: From The Upshot: One Upside to Christies Far-Flung Fandom
description: Forget the Cowboys. This Is Why Chris Christie Needs Texas.

title: Lena Dunham in Cut-Out Creatures of the Wind
description: The Star: Lena Dunham

title: Police in India Say Politicians Wife Was Murdered
description: NEW DELHI  Almost a year after the shocking death of Sunanda Pushkar, the glamorous wife of a well-known South Indian member of Parliament, the Delhi Police have finally decided what to call it: murder.

title: A Secret Hidden in the Mediterranean
description: Even the most adventuresome wine drinkers have probably never tasted a Maltese wine. How could they? The Maltese themselves drink almost all that their handful of wineries produce. A mere trickle of the countrys modest output makes it to England and Italy, and none is shipped to the United States.

title: Dominique Ansel Sets Up a New Bakery
description: Headliner

title: Girls Grows Up to Season 4
description: Lena Dunham and her fellow Girls celebrate the new HBO season.

title: A Look at the Hall of Fame Class of 2015
description: Seasons 22 (1988 to 2009)

title: Dynastic, in a Hip-Hop Sort of Way
description: The president of the United States has extended an invitation to a state dinner. Lucious Lyon (Terrence Howard), a music industry kingpin, looks put upon. O.K., he instructs his assistant, tell Barack that, yes, but this is the last one for the next few months. Lucious strides on, busy as a head of state with the final details for taking his record company, Empire Entertainment, public.

title: For Freshman Lawmakers, Even the Small Stuff Is Cool
description: It was the question echoing through the Capitol halls on Tuesday: Wheres the restroom?

title: Farm Dinners, Winter Edition
description: Annually, from May through early November, Jim Denevan organizes farm-based dinners in more than 30 states and Canadian provinces through his traveling pop-up party Outstanding in the Field.

title: Jeb Bush Begins Wooing Donors for a 2016 Bid
description: Jeb Bush on Tuesday delivered a powerful message about two of the most vital ingredients in a presidential campaign, money and ideas, transforming himself from a figure who once seemed paralyzed by ambivalence over a White House run into the most forceful presence within the emerging Republican field.

title: John Boehners Back
description: At first blush, it might seem like a positive sign that two dozen Republicans voted against giving John Boehner another term as Speaker of the House. Congressional approval levels are at all-time lows, so it makes sense that at least that many members of Mr. Boehners own party thought better of giving him yet another opportunity to lead.

title: N.C.A.A. to Allow Family Travel Aid for Top Title Games
description: COLUMBUS, Ohio  Ohio State Coach Urban Meyer reiterated a theme on Tuesday that he had sounded loudly after the Buckeyes secured a spot opposite Oregon in the first College Football Playoff title game, to be played Monday. Players families, he said, should not have to pay to travel to Arlington, Tex., to watch those players compete for a championship.

title: CES: F.T.C. Chairwoman Notes Concerns Raised by Connected Devices
description: The head of the Federal Trade Commission on Tuesday offered a prescription for protecting consumer data collected by Internet-connected gadgets like wearable fitness trackers and smart home devices, previewing themes of a coming report by the agency on Internet privacy and security.

title: CES: Visions of Cars on Autopilot
description: No more dancing around it: The major automakers now see a world of completely self-driving cars.

title: Ernst Given Special Plaque by New Senate Colleagues
description: Joni Ernst, the newly sworn-in Republican senator from Iowa, came to national prominence last year with a bold commercial promoting her pig castrating credentials and promising to make Washingtons big spenders squeal.

title: What Rising Airline Fees Tell Us About the Cable Industry
description: The day when people are no longer forced to pay for dozens of cable channels they never watch seems to be coming nearer. But subscribers may want to be careful what they wish for.

title: Thom Browne
description: The prefall collection included roomy pants paired with blazers and ties or bow ties.

title: Lanvin
description: The prefall collection played on proportions with roomy graphic print pants and slouchy dresses.

title: Coachs Purchase of Red Carpet Shoemaker Aims to Tap Growth Opportunities
description: There can be no clearer admission that Coach has exhausted the growth opportunities of its core brand than the $574 million purchase of the luxury shoemaker Stuart Weitzman.

title: Bone Broth
description: Spurred on by the popularity of the Paleo diet, bone broth is replacing chai on the morning commute.

title: The Row
description: Drawing from a mostly neutral palette, The Rows prefall collection included long tunics and capelike jackets.

title: Cavaliers Are a Case of Missing Identity
description: When LeBron James was last in New York with the Cleveland Cavaliers, during an eight-game winning streak, he referred to his team as a work in progress. One month later, with the Cavaliers battered by injury and bloodied by six losses in eight games, the temptation is to call them a withering mess.

title: Alan Dershowitz Denies Suits Allegations of Sex With a Minor
description: A well-known criminal defense lawyer, who along with Prince Andrew has been accused of having sex with an under-age girl, has denied the allegations in a federal court filing and asked that his name be removed from the case.

title: Video of Armed Robbery in Bronx Store
description: Surveillance video shows two armed men robbing a grocery store, Yemen Deli, in the Bronx on Monday night. Two police officers were later shot nearby.

title: Producers Struggle to Fathom the Fall of Stings The Last Ship
description: Why do some serious-minded Broadway shows flourish and others flop? Monday nights announcement that the new musical The Last Ship will close on Jan. 24 after a meager four-month run, despite unusual efforts by Sting, its composer, to increase ticket sales, raises that question more than most other foundering musicals in recent years.

title: What Were Reading
description: Get recommendations from New York Times reporters and editors, highlighting great stories from around the web. What Were Reading emails are sent twice a week. Sign up

title: Lawmakers in Pakistan Approve Military Tribunals
description: ISLAMABAD, Pakistan  Pakistans Parliament passed a constitutional amendment on Tuesday that allows a parallel system of military courts to try Islamist militants, significantly enlarging the armys power during a period of political unrest in the civilian government.

title: Anna Kendricks Beauty Routine, Complete With Schmancy-Schmancy Lip Cream
description: An Academy Award and Tony Award nominee, Anna Kendrick is known for her roles in film (Up in the Air, Pitch Perfect and the Twilight Saga movies) and theater (High Society). She is also quite the Twitter star, issuing pithy pronouncements  Im so humble its crazy. Im like the Kanye West of humility  to her three million followers. She plays Cinderella in the musical film Into the Woods, which is nominated for a Golden Globe in the best motion picture, musical or comedy category. A native of Portland, Me., Ms. Kendrick, 29, lives in Los Angeles. BEE SHAPIRO

title: Boehner and Pelosi Embrace
description: John A. Boehner of Ohio, the re-elected Speaker of the House, and Nancy Pelosi, Democrat of California, as the new Republican-led Congress convened.

title: Meet Norways Bernhoft, the Years Most Unlikely Grammy Nominee
description: With his oversize Buddy Holly glasses, trim suits and carefully coiffed hair, 38-year-old Jarle Bernhoft certainly looks the part of fledgling R&B star. The rest of his story, however, is more unexpected. Before breaking through last year with the release of Islander, a silky-smooth mash-up of disco grooves and soaring falsetto melodies that gracefully picks up the neo-soul torch Robin Thicke so clumsily dropped last year, the Oslo native toiled in Norway for years as the frontman for the rock bands Explicit Lyrics and Span. After a string of successes with the latter  It wasnt massive, but we were pretty big in Norway, he says  the singer was left to rethink his path after the band dissolved in 2005.

title: A Sublime Touch, From Head to Heel
description: CHENNAI, India  Who are the greatest dancers in the world today? Most of the contenders considered in the West for this category are the roving international stars of ballet. But many of todays finest dance artists have been performing here at the Music Academys weeklong dance festival, which ends on Friday. Some  all women  have touched on the sublime.

title: Pictures of the Day: New York and Elsewhere
description: New York and More  Pictures of the Day

title: Pictures of the Day  Jan. 6, 2015
description: Photos from New York, China, Afghanistan and Bulgaria.

title: Greenhill Hires Energy Lawyer as Vice Chairman
description: The investment banking firm Greenhill & Company said on Tuesday that it had hired Joseph C. Dilg, a veteran deal maker in the energy industry, as a vice chairman in its Houston office.

title: A Message to New York City From Mario Cuomo, Through His Son
description: Gov. Andrew Cuomo gave one of the more poignant speeches of his careerTuesday at the Church of St. Ignatius Loyola in Manhattan, a eulogy for his father, former Gov. Mario Cuomo. It was full of humanity, wit and self-deprecation  qualities not always on display with this intensely political governor.

title: Oh, to Have the 90s, and All Those Bad Judgment Calls, Back
description: Hindsight, a clever, affecting and sly new show about bad choices begetting worse ones, begins somewhere near the intersection of romance and horror. On the eve of her second wedding, to a onetime childhood friend turned midlife paramour, Becca (Laura Ramsey) blacks out in a New York elevator and wakes up back in 1995, on the eve of her first wedding, to a set of oily abdominals named Sean (Craig Horner). Sean has an appealing Australian accent, and looks like an extra from Singles: He is, of course, a tortured artist. The new guy is, of course, neither of those things.

title: Streits Matzo Factory, a Piece of Lower East Side History, Is Moving On
description: The grandchildren and great-grandchildren of the people who abandoned the squalor of the Lower East Side tenements have been moving back into those very same buildings, paying sums like $3,000 to rent apartments that a few decades before went for under $50, turning the neighborhood into one of New York Citys hippest.

title: A Beach House on Ambergris Caye
description: On the Caribbean coast of Belizes largest island, this five-bedroom home is on the market for $995,000.

title: Suno
description: The prefall collection included woven insets and boxy shapes.

title: Mexicos Leader,PeaNieto, Praises Obama on Immigration
description: WASHINGTON  Mexicos president, Enrique Pea Nieto, on Tuesday praised the steps President Obama has taken to shield millions of unauthorized immigrants from deportation, describing them as an act of justice after meeting with Mr. Obama at the White House.

title: Why McDonalds Isnt Shake Shack and Probably Shouldnt Be
description: Wall Street wants McDonalds to be more like Shake Shack, the hamburger purveyor in New York that just filed for an initial public offering that could value it at a billion dollars. But perhaps instead, Wall Street should let McDonalds be McDonalds and be careful about whether Shake Shack is a burger bubble.

title: Taking Time to Mine Portraits
description: Sean Hawkey figured out a way to distinguish himself, making portraits of miners using silver they mined themselves.

title: Gates Foundation Uses Art to Encourage Vaccination
description: Artists, its fair to say, usually dont know much about bacteria. Vik Muniz is an exception. Mr. Muniz, the Brazilian-born photographer known for his unorthodox materials, has been working with the M.I.T. bioengineer and designer Tal Danino on a series of trompe loeil images of microscopic organisms: cancer cells, healthy cells and bacteria.

title: The Symbiotic Evolution of Partita and Ensemble
description: There arent many words among the sighs, belts and purrs of Caroline Shaws vocal octet Partita (2009-12), and at first hearing they sound like gibberish. Take these, purloined from Sol LeWitts Wall Drawing 305: The eighty-sixth, eighty-seventh and eighty-eighth points are located symmetrically across the central vertical axis of the wall. Its about lines and connections, words that in Ms. Shaws Passacaglia movement disappear into a thicket of nonsensical sibilance as eight speakers overlap.

title: Fleeting Sweetness, and Pits
description: A gentle reminder to hedge fund managers everywhere: The sweet things in life to you were just loaned/So how can you lose what you never owned. These words from Life Is Just a Bowl of Cherries have never sounded more pertinent than in our new gilded age. This breezy but profound standard was introduced by Ethel Merman in 1931, and it was a latter-day Merman, the brass-knuckled belter Mary Testa, who punched it out as the opening salvo of her terrific show, Have Faith, at the Laurie Beechman Theater on Monday evening.

title: Your Evening Briefing
description: Catch up on the days top stories.

title: A Conversation With Daniel Miller, President of Fundrise
description: Mr. Miller, 27, is the president of Fundrise, a real estate crowdfunding website that he founded with his brother Benjamin, the chief executive. Fundrise has its headquarters in Washington; Mr. Miller works out of the companys New York office.

title: No Justice, No Police
description: Mayor Bill de Blasio has been in office barely a year, and already forces of entropy are roaming the streets, turning their backs on the law, defying civil authority and trying to unravel the social fabric.

title: Recent Commercial Transactions
description: RECENT SALE

title: What You Get for  $1,200,000
description: A contemporary in Colorado, an adobe in Albuquerque and a 1907 house in Georgia.

title: A Family on the Path Toward Greater Self-Sufficiency
description: Every day, Aida Mizquiri and her children contend with numerous limitations. Fear, she said, will no longer be one of them.

title: Obama on Mexican Cartels and Security
description: President Obama discussed drug cartels, border security and the United States broken immigration system during a meeting with President Enrique Pea Nieto of Mexico.

title: Ex-Governor of Virginia Apologizes
description: Bob McDonnell, former governor of Virginia, thanked the judge for showing mercy with his sentence of two years in prison and apologized for his mistakes in life, saying, I am a fallen human being.

title: 2 Dead in Shooting at Texas V.A. Clinic
description: HOUSTON  Two people were killed in a shooting on Tuesday afternoon at a veterans health clinic at the Fort Bliss Army base in El Paso, including the suspected gunman, officials said.

title: Girls Grows Up to Season 4
description: Is Kathy Griffin here? Lena Dunham said. Im going to pee my pants.

title: Bank of England Minutes Underscore Turbulence of Financial Crisis
description: LONDON  This just in: British regulators made missteps in the handling of the 2008 financial crisis.

title: House Republicans Change Rules on Calculating Economic Impact of Bills
description: WASHINGTON  After the drama of electing a new speaker of the House and the changing of control in the Senate, the House on Tuesday approved an obscure but significant rule change requiring the economic effects of legislation to be included in a bills official cost to the Treasury.

title: How to Save Your Life
description: THEY placed an unlit candle in my hands. Hundreds of people sat quietly in chairs. This was at the L.G.B.T. Community Center in Greenwich Village in November, at an event called the Transgender Day of Remembrance.

title: On Patz Juror Questionnaire, Queries About TV Shows and Mental Health History
description: The questionnaire is longer than most job applications: 109 questions covering everything from where one attended elementary school to whether one had ever seen a psychiatrist.

title: An Aging Europe in Decline
description: IVE fallen and I cant get up.

title: Pimco Cuts Access to Some Quarterly Investment Reports
description: The bond giant Pimco has removed from its website the quarterly investment reports of two large mutual funds that were managed by William H. Gross before he was forced to leave the firm last year.

title: The Man or the Moment
description: We measure our presidents against not only our hopes for the present, which are sometimes unreasonable, but also our understanding of the past, which can be just as flawed.

title: As Vote Nears, Astrologer for Sri Lankas President Faces Ultimate Test of His Skills
description: GALLE, Sri Lanka  Few people will be watching this weeks presidential election in Sri Lanka with more pointed interest than a balding, prosperous-looking man wearing a gold amulet under his shirt, who claims the title of royal astrologer.

description: To the Editor:

description: Little ideology, much decay and an awakening of business were on display during a drive across the island.

title: Atlanta Ousts Fire Chief Who Has Antigay Views
description: ATLANTA  Mayor Kasim Reed announced Tuesday that he had fired the chief of the citys Fire Rescue Department, Kelvin Cochran, after Mr. Cochran gave workers a religious book he wrote containing passages that condemn homosexuality.

title: Utah: Rope-Swinging on Rock Arches Is Banned
description: Federal land officials on Tuesday announced new restrictions on the daredevil pursuit of rope-swinging from giant natural rock arches in the desert canyonlands outside the tourist destination of Moab. The Bureau of Land Management placed a two-year ban on activities including zip-lining, rope-swinging and rappelling. The move came after a handful of serious accidents and dozens of complaints from hikers and tourists, who said that the screams and whoops of swinging adrenaline junkies were ruining a tranquil natural setting.

title: Climatologists Balk as Brazil Picks Skeptic for Key Post
description: RIO DE JANEIRO  Calling Aldo Rebelo a climate-change skeptic would be putting it mildly. In his days as a fiery legislator in the Communist Party of Brazil, he railed against those who say human activity is warming the globe and called the international environmental movement nothing less, in its geopolitical essence, than the bridgehead of imperialism.

title: Missouri: Tear Gas Restrictions Extended
description: A judge in St. Louis granted a 45-day extension to an order she issued in December that bars the police from using tear gas unless they provide a warning, give peaceful demonstrators time to leave and try to minimize the impact of the tear gas. Judge Carol. E. Jackson of the United States District Court for the Eastern District of Missouri took the action Tuesday after lawyers for protesters and law enforcement said they needed more time to negotiate policy changes regarding the gas. The issue arose during unrest after the shooting in August of an unarmed black teenager by a white police officer in Ferguson.

title: Soaring Bond Prices May Sound an Economic Warning
description: The United States economy is accelerating, unemployment is falling and wages are even beginning to creep higher.

title: Mike Piazzas Turnfor Election Could Be Next
description: Now on deck for the Hall of Fame is Mike Piazza, who finished a strong fifth in the voting results disclosed on Tuesday, with the support of nearly 70 percent of the baseball writers who submitted ballots.

title: Intel Allocates $300 Million for Workplace Diversity
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Over the last year, Apple, Google and other big technology companies have faced mounting criticism by civil rights leaders about the lack of diversity in their work forces, which are populated mostly by white and Asian men.

title: Mercedes to Move U.S. Headquarters From New Jersey to Georgia
description: In the latest blow to New Jersey, which is still staggering from the recession, Mercedes-Benz USA said on Tuesday that it would move its headquarters to Georgia from Montvale, N.J.

title: The 114th Congress Brushes Off the Snow and Gets Its Bearings
description: WASHINGTON  As members of the 114th Congress trudged to work Tuesday amid wet white flurries and congressional formalities, the Capitol felt both like the first day of school and a potential snow day.

title: Fighter Defects, Citing Ties to the Fugitive African Warlord Joseph Kony
description: A man claiming to be a senior commander in the Lords Resistance Army, the ruthless renegade guerrilla organization in central Africa led by Joseph Kony, the fugitive warlord, has surrendered to a joint military task force of the United States and the African Union, a State Department spokeswoman said Tuesday in Washington.

title: Anti-Immigration Movement in Germany Reignites Debate Over National Identity
description: BERLIN  The appearance of thousands of anti-immigrant marchers in Dresden has galvanized both sides of the immigration debate in Germany and reignited a discussion about national identity.

title: Life in New York City, Where Arrests Are Down and Tickets Are Rarities
description: In a city of more than eight million people and 33 million subway rides a week, police officers arrested or ticketed just 22 people for jumping the turnstile last week. In the same period a year ago, nearly 1,400 fare-beaters were caught.

title: Florida Joins the Wave on Same-Sex Marriage
description: Now that Florida has become the 36th state to allow same-sex couples to marry, more than 70 percent of Americans live in jurisdictions that permit such unions. Whats made this possible is a string of supportive federal court rulings following the Supreme Courts pivotal 2013 decision striking down provisions of the Defense of Marriage Act  the 1996 federal law that denied federal benefits to lawfully married same-sex couples.

title: Ban on Cellphones in New York City Schools to Be Lifted
description: New York Citys Department of Education plans to announce on Wednesday that it will lift the ban on cellphones in schools, a person familiar with the decision said Tuesday.

title: To Gov. Jerry Brown, a Legacy Project; to Critics, a Runaway Train
description: FRESNO, Calif.  One day after being sworn in to a final term as governor, Jerry Brown, a chief executive who tends to disdain the trappings of political ceremony, came to this Central Valley city on Tuesday for a decidedly ceremonial groundbreaking for his Los Angeles-to-San Francisco high-speed train  a defiant and defining act for Mr. Brown as he enters his final stretch in public life.

title: NewHall of Fame Class Is the Biggest in 60 Years
description: When writers elected Randy Johnson, Pedro Martinez, John Smoltz and Craig Biggio to the Baseball Hall of Fame on Tuesday, it was only the third time a four-man class was created.

title: Time for a Pause
description: You could easily write a book, or, better yet, make a movie about the drama that engulfed Sony Pictures and The Interview, Sonys own movie about the fictionalized assassination of North Koreas real-life dictator. The whole saga reflects so many of the changes that are roiling and reshaping todays world before weve learned to adjust to them.

title: Losing the Tea Party Baggage
description: With the demographic composition of the electorate rapidly changing, what is the best way for Republicans in diverse states to campaign? The election in November of Senator Cory Gardner of Colorado provides a template for the party on how to succeed in a battleground state with two ascendant constituencies: well-educated social liberals and increasingly assertive Hispanic voters.

title: Winning Lottery Numbers for Jan. 6, 2015
Do Immigrants Take Jobs From American-Born Workers?
Hank Peters, 90, Dies; Built Baseball Winners in Baltimore and Cleveland
description: Hank Peters, a longtime baseball executive who won two pennants and a World Series as general manager of the Baltimore Orioles before helping to rejuvenate the Cleveland Indians franchise, died on Sunday in Boca Raton, Fla. He was 90.

title: With Veto Threat, Obama and Congress Head for Collision Over Keystone Pipeline
description: WASHINGTON  The White House on Tuesday made it clear that President Obama would veto a bill authorizing construction of the Keystone XL oil pipeline, setting up an immediate clash with Republicans just as they assume control of Congress.

title: Effort on Ebola Hurt W.H.O. Chief
description: GENEVA  Under a stormy sky, on a boat to a G-8 summit meeting, a media-savvy Hong Kong pediatrician named Margaret Chan first met her countrys president, Hu Jintao. In a preview of the political maneuvering to come, he told her privately that China was considering backing her for the top post at the World Health Organization.

title: As Power in Congress Shifts to G.O.P., Lives of Freshmen in Transition
description: WASHINGTON  Three hours after he was sworn in as a new member of Congress on Tuesday, Representative Ted Lieu, Democrat of California, stood outside the House chamber looking bewildered as a colleague breezed past him, asking, Wheres Nancys thing?  a reference to the opening day open house of Nancy Pelosi, the Democratic leader.

title: Friendship Frays, a Topic at a Time
description: Americans are often accused of having a mania for competition, of seeing the world through a prism of success and failure. But Winners and Losers, a frisky theatrical symposium in which all manner of people and things are categorized as one or the other, is created and performed by  whats this?  two Canadians.

title: Maze Runner
description: Administrivial Win Valuable Prizes Alert! The Enigma Variations is a puzzle suite contest being run by George Barany and friends, which includes multiple fun prizes. Solve the suite and you can win puzzle books (some autographed) and subscriptions, and if you put everything together and successfully solve the meta that ties the suite together, you might win a paid registration to the 2015 American Crossword Puzzle Tournament. This contest ends on January 11 at midnight, P.S.T., so get solving.

title: Postal Chief Says Congress and Unions Block Progress
description: WASHINGTON  Critical changes needed to turn around the financially troubled United States Postal Service have been held up by Congress and by opposition from postal labor unions that want to preserve jobs and benefits, the postmaster general said Tuesday.

title: Reports of Civilian Deaths Prompt Inquiry Into Strikes Against ISIS
description: WASHINGTON  The United States military is investigating reports of civilian casualties that may have occurred as part of the American-led fight against the Sunni militancy known as the Islamic State, a senior Pentagon official said Tuesday.

title: North Korea Has Made Significant Advances in Nuclear Arms Program, South Says
description: SEOUL, South Korea  The Defense Ministry of South Korea said Tuesday that North Korea appeared to have made a significant advance toward making a nuclear warhead small enough to fit onto a long-range missile capable of reaching the West Coast of the United States. The ministry, which included the assessment in its latest white paper, also suggested that the North now had a missile that could fly that far.

title: Knicks Bet Firmly on the Future, Which Is Anything but Firm
description: On a Friday afternoon in late September, Phil Jackson sat on a dais at the Knicks training site in Greenburgh, N.Y. He wore a gray suit and a smile as he answered questions from reporters about the season ahead. It was a time for cautious optimism and quiet expectations.

title: Rangers Find Top Form, but a Tough Trip Looms
description: GREENBURGH, N.Y.  Winners of 10 of their past 11 games, the Rangers are a confident group heading west to play in three arenas that haunted them last season.

title: Egyptian Leader Visits Coptic Christmas Eve Service
description: CAIRO  President Abdel Fattah el-Sisi on Tuesday visited the main Coptic Christian cathedral during its Christmas Eve Mass, and the Egyptian state news media declared him the first Egyptian president to attend such a service.

title: New York State Legislature Will Convene Amid a Changed Political Landscape
description: ALBANY  Clouds of controversy, intraparty sniping, the pall of the passing of an iconic leader: The 2015 New York State legislative session has everything a pessimist could ever want.

title: Fans of Liberty State Park Leery of Proposed Agency
description: When Liberty State Park opened in 1976, it was said to be New Jerseys bicentennial gift to the United States. Sitting at the southeastern end of Jersey City, it stretches along the Hudson River for 1,200 acres, offering a collection of stunning vistas: The Statue of Liberty seems almost within reach, and Ellis Island beckons. The waters of the Verrazano Straits and New York Harbor stretch east; the Manhattan skyline shimmers in the distance.

title: Death of Infant Boy in East Harlem Is Ruled a Homicide
description: The death of a 23-day-old boy in East Harlem last week has been ruled a homicide, the police said on Tuesday.

title: Revealing a Slowly Changing Cuba
description: Little ideology, much decay and an awakening of business were on display during a drive across the island.

title: James Hester, 90, Dies; Guided N.Y.U. to Become a Major University
description: James M. Hester, who steered New York University through campus unrest in the 1960s and helped chart its evolution from a commuter school on the brink of bankruptcy to a highly selective institution with national academic stature, died on Dec. 31 at his home in Princeton, N.J. He was 90.

title: On the Open Road, Signs of a Changing Cuba
description: HAVANA  The signs of the times speak loudly in Cuba, sometimes through their silence.

title: Yankees Are Said to Be Close to a Deal With Stephen Drew
description: The Yankees and infielder Stephen Drew were very close to finalizing a one-year, $5 million deal with incentives Tuesday, according to a baseball executive with knowledge of the negotiations. Drew is expected to play mostly second base in 2015, as the Yankees continue to groom the prospects Jose Pirela and Rob Refsnyder.

title: When Courtney Love Wears (and Serenades) Zac Posen
description: When the fashion designer Zac Posen first met Courtney Love in the summer of 1997, he realized that with her, nothing is what it seems. That couldnt ring any truer today, as the grunge music icon prepares to star in Kansas City Choir Boy a provocative new opera love story about a singer and her musician boyfriend which was written by Todd Almond and opens tomorrow. And for her dramatic finale on stage, shell be wearing an equally spectacular number that she handpicked from Posens fall 2014 collection: a voluminous ball gown in black taffeta jacquard and duchesse satin (the performance space is so small that the gown balloons out over much of the floor). Its a far cry from the baby-doll and slip dresses that make up the singers personal wardrobe. I thought it was really important to do something that felt transformative for her, Posen explains. The first dress I had designed and draped didnt feel right, and it just wasnt surprising enough.

title: In D.C., a Vibrant New Restaurant From the Obamas Favorite Local Chef
description: In the District of Columbias historic Penn Quarter, the newly opened China Chilcano is a departure from the usual Spanish sprawl of Jos Andrs, the tapas pioneer (and arguably the citys most famous chef) who runs a mini-empire of restaurants, frequented by Barack and Michelle Obama, in the city.

title: For Super Bowl, Anheuser-Busch Aims at Younger Crowd
description: The Super Bowl attracts more than 100 million viewers every year. Anheuser-Busch is trying to connect with the texting and Snapchat- and Instagram-using millennials among them.

title: Whiplash and Those Bleeding Hands
description: At 29, the New Jersey native Damien Chazelle has entered the Oscar fray with the much lauded feature he wrote and directed, Whiplash. Starring Miles Teller as a music-school drumming student terrorized by his sadistic teacher, played by J.K. Simmons, the film is loosely based on Mr. Chazelles own experience as a high school drummer. (He confirmed that as is the case of Mr. Tellers character, his hands did bleed in those years.)

title: How Exercise Keeps Us Young
description: Active older people resemble much younger people physiologically, according to a new study of the effects of exercise on aging. The findings suggest that many of our expectations about the inevitability of physical decline with advancing years may be incorrect and that how we age is, to a large degree, up to us.

title: Word of the Day | subsidiary
description: subsidiary \sb-si-de-er-e, -si-d-re\ adjective and noun

title: Big East Struggles of St. Johns Provide Unwelcome Reminder of Last Year
description: It was a hole that St. Johns proved unable to dig itself out from: five straight losses to open Big East Conference play, a lesson that players said they never wanted to repeat.

title: Whats On TV Wednesday
description: 8 P.M. (HBO) THE TALENTED MR. RIPLEY (1999) Starting with the loan of a jacket with a Princeton insignia, Tom Ripley, a New York mens room attendant played by Matt Damon, begins his ascent of the social ladder  then murders his way up the rest of the rungs  in Anthony Minghellas adaptation of the Patricia Highsmith thriller. Jude Law (above right, with Mr. Damon, center, and Rosario Fiorello) is Dickie Greenleaf, the scion of a rich American family, whose father has hired Tom to bring him back to the United States from Italy; Gwyneth Paltrow is Marge, who must share Dickies affections with his new friend. And Philip Seymour Hoffman is Freddie, who isnt buying Toms act. Writing in The New York Times, Janet Maslin said the film offers diabolically smart surprises wherever you care to look.

title: Corrections: January 7, 2015
description: INTERNATIONAL

title: Quotation of the Day
description: I stand before you as a heartbroken and humbled man.

title: Tail of Missing AirAsia Plane Is Found, Indonesian Official Says
description: JAKARTA, Indonesia  The head of Indonesias search and rescue agency said Wednesday that the tail of AirAsia Flight 8501 had been spotted in the Java Sea, a development that could be significant because the planes so-called black boxes were contained there.

title: Test Yourself | Chris Christie and the Dallas Cowboys
description: Below are the first several paragraphs from a Jan. 5 Sports article, Not Embracing Christies Love of the Dallas Cowboys.

title: Car Bombing Kills Dozens at Yemeni Police Academy
description: SANA, Yemen  A large car bomb exploded outside a police academy in Yemens capital, Sana, early Wednesday, killing or wounding dozens of applicants who were lined up at the buildings gate, according to security officials.

title: 6 Qs About the News | Pressure, and Mystery, on the Rise
description: In the article Pressure, and Mystery, on the Rise, Henry Fountain writes about why volcanoes activity is hard to predict.

title: Taking Time to Mine Portraits
description: Sean Hawkey was fed up with sitting at a computer to process his photos. He wondered, in an age when there are hundreds of millions of digital cameras out there, how could he be different? That got him thinking about the history of photography, which in turn led him to learning the wet plate process.

title: Do You Ever Hang Out at the Mall?
description: For decades the mall was the cool place to hang out for millions of American teenagers. But have times changed?

title: Extremist Group Claims Responsibility for Suicide Attack at Istanbul Police Station
description: ISTANBUL  A Marxist extremist group has claimed responsibility for a suicide attack on Tuesday in the heart of Istanbuls tourist district that left the assailant and a police officer dead.

title: Prices Fall and Worry Escalates in the Eurozone
description: PARIS  Europes economy has reached a psychological inflection point.

title: The Marches in Dresden
description: When 18,000 Germans turn out for an anti-immigration rally in Dresden, it is sadly inevitable that the specter of Germanys past will be invoked, both outside Germany and within. Sadly, because anti-foreigner sentiments are hardly limited to Germany and political parties espousing resentment of foreigners  especially Muslim refugees and immigrants  have proliferated all across Europe, reaching even to traditionally welcoming Nordic lands like Sweden, Finland and Denmark.

title: Former Executive of Korean Air Is Indicted in Nut Rage Episode
description: SEOUL, South Korea  A former Korean Air executive who flew into a rage over the way she was served nuts in a first-class cabin, forcing a plane back to the gate at Kennedy Airport to kick out a flight attendant, was indicted on Wednesday on criminal charges of violating aviation safety regulations and conspiring to hush up the episode.

title: Your Wednesday Briefing
description: Good morning.

title: Obama, on 3-State Tour, Is Expected to Offer State of the Union Spoilers
description: President Obama went to Detroit on Wednesday to kick off a three-day, three-state presidential trip that is intended to steal the political spotlight from the newly empowered Republicans on Capitol Hill during their first week in control of Congress.

title: New York Today: Slowdown City
description: Good morning on this very cold and windy Wednesday.

title: Terrorists Strike Charlie Hebdo Newspaper in Paris, Leaving 12 Dead
description: PARIS  The police organized an enormous manhunt across the Paris region on Wednesday for three suspects they said were involved in a brazen and methodical midday slaughter at a satirical newspaper that had lampooned Islam.
