title: Drake to Headline Governors Ball
description: Drake is gearing up for a big festival season.

title: Today in Politics
description: Things Can Only Get Better on Capitol Hill

title: Silver Lake Makes Big Bet on Red Ventures, a Digital Marketing Company
description: Nestled in a suburban town just south of Charlotte, N.C., the digital marketing company Red Ventures has spent most of its nearly 15-year existence in relative obscurity. But two major private equity firms are betting that it will grow into a giant.

title: Daily Report: Intel Pledges $300 Million to Increase Diversity in Tech Industry
description: Over the last year, Apple, Google and other big technology companies have faced mounting criticism by civil rights leaders about the lack of diversity in their work forces, which are populated mostly by white and Asian men.

title: China Strives to Be on African Minds, and TV Sets
description: While China imposes strict controls on foreign-produced entertainment at home, it is also eager to see its cultural products embraced abroad. And in Africa, Chinese television shows have become immensely popular  at least according to the Chinese state news media.

title: Morning Agenda: Bond Prices Flash Warning
description: Despite signs that the United States economy is accelerating, a huge bond market with a strong track record for predicting economic problems may be sounding a warning, DealBooks Peter Eavis reports. As they do in times of stress, investors are seeking the safety of government bonds. In turn, the prices of government bonds are rallying, pushing their yields to lows. The yield on the 10-year Treasury note, for instance, fell to 1.94 percent on Tuesday. In Europe, yields are even lower.

title: A Young Private, Killed in World War II, Still Leaps Off the Page
description: Pvt. Richard Halvey scribbled his last letter home in the passenger seat of an Army radio vehicle rumbling somewhere through North Africa in February 1943. He wrote on the desk built into the front of the car while his friend Ryan drove, passing across chocolate bars and sticks of gum. He complained about his warts (I even have an idea they are bringing friends). He asked after his drivers license and his brother, Bob. He spoke of regret that he had to shave his mustache without taking a photo first (Beards arent permitted in this company and mustache was starting to strain coffee etc so rather than have it dry cleaned I decided to dispense with it). The last letter addressed to my grandmother, Patricia, his sister, was just a quick note about a $30 money order, later carefully pressed flat; his mistake in dating the top delicately corrected in Pats spindly hand.

title: C. Wonders Demise: A Teachable Moment
description: The news on Tuesday that C. Wonder, the accessibly priced, bright-n-busy womens lifestyle brand started by J. Christopher Burch in 2011, had ceased operations, closing its stores, firing employees and starting to evaluate its best alternative to maintain the C. Wonder experience for its customers, according to an official statement (whatever that means in this context), has caused much gleeful commentary among fashion watchers about the problems with revenge retail.

title: Updates on Search for Suspects in Paris Newspaper Shooting
description: Masked gunmen opened fire in the Paris offices of Charlie Hebdo, a French satirical newspaper, on Wednesday.

title: Deadly Attack in Paris
description: Masked gunman opened fire Wednesday at the Paris offices of Charlie Hebdo, a satirical weekly newspaper.

title: Midwest and New England Are Shivering and Coping
description: CHICAGO  Walk outside, the meteorologists allowed, but dont stay long. In a mere 30 minutes, your cheeks could be frostbitten.

title: Daily Clip Report
description: Good morning. Here is Daily Clip Report, a collection of articles about The Times and the media sent by email each morning to senior executives and newsroom editors. The email is produced by the Corporate Communications Department at The Times.

title: Deadly Attack in Paris
description: Masked gunman opened fire Wednesday at the Paris offices of Charlie Hebdo, a satirical weekly.

title: Bringing Home a Cactus
description: Dear Diary:

title: Blake Leyh Discusses Sounds of Into the Woods
description: The supervising sound editor for Into the Woods discusses some of the sounds he used in the films forest setting.

title: Rural Justice Focus of Ex-Police Chiefs Murder Trial
description: ORANGEBURG, S.C.  The austere courtroom was nearly empty Wednesday morning when Judge Edgar W. Dickson looked toward jurors and spoke of what many have called the greatest justice system ever created.

title: The Search for Petr Khokhlov
description: After their father died and their mother fell into drink, Petr Khokhlov and his brother, Sergey, were sent to an orphanage in Novouzensk, a small, dusty town of low-slung Soviet-era apartment blocks on Russias border with Kazakhstan. The two boys had only each other. Petr was quiet and well behaved, scolding other students at the orphanage when they addressed their teachers with the familiar ty, rather than the more formal vy. He played the balalaika in music class and carried himself as a little gentleman, with any number of pretty girls in tow. As they grew up, Petr would consult with his older brother on just about every decision, down to what T-shirts he should buy. When Sergey was courting the woman who would later become his wife, Petr  just two years Sergeys junior, but with a soft, boyish face that made him look even younger  would tag along on their dates to the movies and fall asleep in the back seat on the drive home.

title: Putting the Cloak of Rachel to Rest
description: You can star in one of the most beloved sitcoms of the last quarter century, win an Emmy, be paid $1 million per episode, find as much success in movies and still have more than a little something to prove, along with a whole lot to lose.

title: Miranda July: By the Book
description: The director, screenwriter, actor, artist and author, most recently, of The First Bad Man, cant stand Garfield. That dumb man and his dumb, mean cat have gotten more of our attention than they deserve.

title: Obama Condemns Attack on French Newspaper
description: President Obama issued the following statement on Wednesday in response to the attack on the offices of Charlie Hebdo, a satirical newspaper in Paris, that killed 12 people.

title: Sorrowful Quest of an Empty Kettle
description: L. Frank Baums novel The Wonderful Wizard of Oz (1900) certainly has dark elements, like those creepy flying monkeys, but the story is just one part of Baums Oz series. In 1918, he wrote the even darker back story of one character in The Tin Woodsman of Oz.

title: Rachel Cusks Outline
description: I was out to dinner recently with a man who observed of a mutual friend: Hes a cipher. He just stands there and doesnt speak. He felt our friend did not pull his weight in social situations. I countered that there were participatory ways of saying nothing; that I experienced our friends silence as encouragement to display, for his appreciation and scrutiny, the more typically hidden parts of myself.

title: Reaching for Beauty
description: The world has no shortage of interesting people who make a big impact without ever quite becoming household names, and lately weve seen a plentiful crop of picture-book biographies about some of them. Among several good recent examples are Jen Bryant and Melissa Sweets The Right Word: Roget and His Thesaurus and Jeanette Winters Mr. Cornells Dream Boxes. Both found a whimsical, child-friendly charm in the eccentricities of subjects few would have called ideal picture-book material: the neurotic Victorian Peter Mark Roget, who came up with the idea for the thesaurus, and the reclusive avant-garde artist Joseph Cornell, who innovated with assemblage. Two new ones are particularly welcome additions to the genre, for both their beautiful illustrations and their stirring stories: Each takes up the life of a 20th-century artist whose accomplishments are no doubt too rarefied to be already familiar to the average elementary schooler; but the subjects experiences growing up African-American in the segregated South, then making their ways through civil-rights-era America, give a natural storybook feel to their life trajectories.

title: Aftermath of Paris Terror Attack
description: At least 12 people were killed in a shooting at the Paris offices of the satirical weekly Charlie Hebdo on Wednesday.

title: Annalee Newitz on the Future: I Want People to Be Able to Have Cultural Debates Without Having War
description: In Telling the Future, Op-Talk asks people from a variety of fields to speculate on what we have to look forward to  and what we should watch out for.

title: 1915: Prince Will Visit  Fiance
description: As mentioned in the letter printed yesterday from the Heralds correspondent at The Hague, Miss Elizabeth Reid Rogers, whose engagement to Prince Christian of Hesse has just been announced, is passing the winter in Berlin. The prince is a German submarine officer, now at Kiel, but has received a few days leave and will visit his fiance. Miss Rogers is the daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Richard R. Rogers, of Washington, D.C. Miss Rogers, who made her dbut in Washington three years ago, first met the prince in Cairo.  The New York Herald, European Edition, Jan. 8, 1915

title: Brought to You by the G.O.P.
Panic, Fast and Slow
description: Some people are suddenly panicking over the announcement that the euro area is officially in deflation. But sudden panic is the wrong reaction; you should have been gradually panicking over an extended period. Todays news isnt actually any worse than what weve been seeing for a while.

title: An Online Jeweler Creates Links With Brick-and-Mortar Shops
description: Craig Rottenberg worked as an investment banker and started a tech company, but a decade ago he returned to his familys roots. As president of Longs Jewelers, a chain based in the Boston area, I am a fourth-generation jeweler, he said.

title: Deadly Attack in Paris
description: Masked gunman opened fire Wednesday at the Paris offices of Charlie Hebdo, a satirical weekly newspaper.

title: Hollande Reacts to Charlie Hebdo Attack
description: President Franois Hollande of France said the shooting at the headquarters of the French satirical newspaper Charlie Hebdo was a terrorist attack.

title: Cyberattack in Germany Shuts Down Official Sites
description: BERLIN  At least three official German websites, including Chancellor Angela Merkels page, were inaccessible on Wednesday after an apparent cyberattack.

title: In a World of Phones, Gadgets Must Adapt
description: Technology fanatics descend every January on Las Vegas for the International CES, a colossal gathering of gadgetry and geekery where some of the worlds largest companies show off their best ideas for the future.

title: Americas Bitter Pill, by Steven Brill
description: Steven Brill is not easily intimidated. The founder of Court TV and Brills Content, among many other ventures, Brill likes to dive deeply and quickly into complicated national policy issues  public education, health care  that he, by his own admission, knows relatively little about when he begins. This is his great appeal and can be a great frustration. It makes him vulnerable to the charisma of his sources, as was apparent in his 2011 book, Class Warfare, in which he seemed dazzled by individuals involved in privatizing public education, while he largely ignored the existing research.

title: Hearing Oscar Buzz In Genre-Busting Scores
description: The musical tastes of the Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences have rarely been synonymous with cutting edge. For every Oscar doled out to the likes of Eminem and Three 6 Mafia, who in the last dozen years became the first rap and hip-hop acts to win best song, umpteen more have landed in the hands of such syrupy crooners as Phil Collins, or, God bless him, the inarguably talented, sardonically chipper Randy Newman.

title: A Governor Who Will Not Be Hugging Jerry Jones
description: For Gov. Chris Christie, its the hug that wont go away. And now Mr. Christie is being poked fun of by his self-described friend Gov. Scott Walker.

title: Ditmas Park for Front Porches
description: If New York is a patchwork quilt of neighborhoods, the part of Brooklyn that spreads out south of Prospect Park could be compared to gingham. What may look more or less uniform from a distance can seem at close range like a grid of tiny but distinct enclaves, each with its own vibe and style.

title: Crowns Amid Controversies
description: Big hair. Rhinestones. Frequent smiling.

title: In Paris, a Sweet New Destination
description: Pierre Herm is regarded as one of the worlds best dessert chefs, and he has a showcase at the new Chocolate Bar at the Le Royal Monceau, Raffles Paris hotel.

title: The Rich Tradition of Filipino Embutido
description: Before she showed me how to make the egg-stuffed, raisin-speckled meatloaf of her Filipino youth, Emma Phojanakong took me to the curiously named Johnny Air Mart. Its a Filipino store on the East Side of Manhattan near her home in Stuyvesant Town, its shelves crammed with instant Pinoy comforts: just-add-water noodle bowls with artificial bone marrow flavor, sugary breads folded around electric swaths of purple yam and, prominently, rows of canned meats: Pop the top, heat and eat. Nostalgia, I figured, is a hunger that wants to be fed now.

title: Scalise Questions Persist as Republicans Roll Out Agenda
description: House Republicans on Wednesday rolled out their New American Congress agenda in their first news conference of the year, but questions surrounding Representative Steve Scalise, the third-ranking leader in the chamber, continued to dominate the political discussion.

title: Below the Line: The Sounds of Into the Woods
description: If a tree falls in the forest during Into the Woods, does it make a sound? For one of the films supervising sound editors, Blake Leyh, the answer is a definitive yes. That noise, along with others like the plodding footsteps of a giant, were meticulously crafted and layered.

title: Did Mitch McConnell Just Take Credit for the Economic Recovery?
description: The new Senate majority leader, Mitch McConnell, suggested earlier today that the Republican Party deserves credit for recent data showing that the economic recovery has picked up speed. As ridiculous as that statement is, at least it is intellectually consistent with the partys past statements. After the financial crisis, Republicans said President Obama had hurt the economy by (occasionally) criticizing Wall Street bankers for their misdeeds. Now, Mr. McConnell is claiming credit for a recovery based solely on the fact that Republicans have just taken control of both houses of Congress, even though the year has barely begun and they have not yet passed any bills.Heres what Mr. McConnell said on the floor this morning:

title: Phylicia Rashad Defends Cosby, Saying Forget His Accusers
description: Phylicia Rashad, who played Bill Cosbys wife on two popular sitcoms, broke her silence on Tuesday to defend the comedian, who has been accused of sexually assaulting many women.

title: Among the Disrupted
description: Amid the bacchanal of disruption, let us pause to honor the disrupted. The streets of American cities are haunted by the ghosts of bookstores and record stores, which have been destroyed by the greatest thugs in the history of the culture industry. Writers hover between a decent poverty and an indecent one; they are expected to render the fruits of their labors for little and even for nothing, and all the miracles of electronic dissemination somehow do not suffice for compensation, either of the fiscal or the spiritual kind. Everybody talks frantically about media, a second-order subject if ever there was one, as content disappears into content. What does the understanding of media contribute to the understanding of life? Journalistic institutions slowly transform themselves into silent sweatshops in which words cannot wait for thoughts, and first responses are promoted into best responses, and patience is a professional liability. As the frequency of expression grows, the force of expression diminishes: Digital expectations of alacrity and terseness confer the highest prestige upon the twittering cacophony of one-liners and promotional announcements. It was always the case that all things must pass, but this is ridiculous.

title: What You Get for ... $1,200,000
description: TELLURIDE, COLO.

title: White House Opposes a Health Law Proposal
Lawrence Ingrassia, Former New York Times Editor, Joins Los Angeles Times
description: Lawrence Ingrassia, a former deputy managing editor and business editor at the New York Times, will join The Los Angeles Times as an associate editor, focusing on new ventures, the paper said Wednesday.

title: Giants Start Shake-Up by Firing Perry Fewell, Defenses Leader
description: The usually staid Giants will enter the 2015 season with a new defensive coordinator, a second-year offensive coordinator and a head coach who, for the time being, has no contract beyond next season and has been warned to win or face dismissal.

title: House Hunting in ... Belize
description: A BEACH HOUSE WITH FOREIGN ACCENTS ON AMBERGRIS CAYE

title: Charlie Hebdo Editor Made Provocation His Mission
description: Stphane Charbonnier, the editorial director of the French satirical newspaper Charlie Hebdo, was often pictured with his fist aloft.

title: All Tied Up
description: HUGH JACKMAN wasnt feeling the magic.

title: Red Bulls Fire Mike Petke Amid a Whirl of Activity in M.L.S.
description: Don Garber, the Major League Soccer commissioner, let out a quiet laugh Wednesday as he admitted that even he was having trouble catching up with the news from around his league.

title: Bringing Time-Lapse Photo Studies Into Real Time, Online
description: Camilo Jos Vergara, the Chilean-born photographer who has documented the street culture and the changing face of Americas inner cities for 40 years, agreed to place his entire photographic archive with the Library of Congress in 2013, and now more than 400 images have been digitized and put on the librarys website. This is the first step toward making more than 10,000 works available to the public.

title: Ava DuVernay Defends the History in Selma
description: Defenders of the historical accuracy of Selma, which has been questioned by assorted scholars and ex-politicos for weeks, stepped forward this week.

title: Public Reading to Mark Release of Guantnamo Detainees Diary
description: Michael Cunningham, Joshua Ferris, Nicole Krauss and Lili Taylor will be among the participants at a reading in New York on Jan. 26 in honor of the publication of Guantnamo Diary, described as the first and only diary written by a still-detained prisoner at Guantnamo Bay to be publicly released.

title: Remembering the Lost
description: You may have noticed the discreet way in which many nursing homes and assisted living places acknowledge a residents death: A bud vase on the mantle or at the reception desk. A single rose. A card announcing the deceaseds name.

title: Tracking the Aftermath of the Charlie Hebdo Attack
description: A visual timeline of the attack and the events that followed.

title: App Smart | Learn Physics With Games
description: You might not realize it, but playing some popular games like Angry Birds can teach you about the laws of physics.

title: Teaser | John Waters Kiddie Flamingos
description: For a new multimedia show at Marianne Boesky Gallery, the perennially tongue-in-cheek provocateur reimagined his X-rated 1972 cult classic with a cast of children.

title: Games Played by the Laws of Physics (Though Bent a Little in Some Cases)
description: LONG before I wrote about apps for a living, I spent many years at university learning to be a physicist, and I worked as a professional scientist for a while. So I get an extra-special kick out of all the physics-based games that can be played on a smartphone.

title: Parenting in the Age of Online Pornography
description: It had been another long day for Eliza, a 41-year-old stay-at-home mother who lives in Los Angeles with her two sons. She had taken the boys, 10 and 13 at the time, to school, taken care of the house, and after putting them to bed, planned to relax in front of her computer.

title: Christoph Waltz on Walter Keane
description: The actor Christoph Waltz talks to Cara Buckley about playing the role of a man who stole credit for his wifes art.

title: When GoFundMe Is the Safety Net
description: Families and parents struggling to get out of a financial hole and hoping to use GoFundMe to help have been all over my social media of late. The single mother who graduated from high school with a baby and is now hoping to graduate from college with a 7-year-old. The military family with the broken-down car and no money for repairs, or anything else.

title: Cinematographers Pick Their Contenders
description: A mix of previous nominees and newcomers figure into the contenders for the American Society of Cinematographers Award. The finalists are:

title: Verbatim: Standing Together
description: President Obama, pledging American support to France after an attack on a Paris newspaper.

title: Uh Oh, Republicans Are Trying to Protect Social Security Again
description: Whenever Republicans start talking about protecting Social Security, warning bells go off in my head.

title: A Timeline of Threats and Acts of Violence Over Blasphemy and Insults to Islam
description: The assault on the Paris offices of Charlie Hebdo, a French newspaper that has repeatedly satirized religion, was one of the deadliest in a history of violent responses and threats against the news media over the mockery of Islam.

title: 36 Hours in Milan
description: Explore street view, find our points of interest and sign in to your Google account to save your map.

title: Many Healthy Obese Dont Stay Healthy
description: The idea of healthy obesity  that there are obese people who are nevertheless in good health, with normal cholesterol levels, blood pressure and other metabolic risk factors  has gained traction in recent years. But a small study suggests this apparently healthy state of affairs does not last.

title: 1965: Gunman Caught After Chase
description: LONDON  Unarmed police captured a dangerous gunman last night [Jan. 7] after cornering him in a basement club and felling him with a barrage of stones, bottles and chairs. But before being captured, the gunman injured two policemen and killed an Alsatian police dog. The gunman, identified as John Marson, a 22-year-old jailbreaker, was charged today with attempted murder. His capture last night took place after he had forced a restaurant owner into a white Mercedes sportscar and led 14 London police cars and motorcycles on a 100-mile-per-hour chase back and forth across the bridges over the River Thames. New York Herald Tribune, European Edition, Jan. 8, 1965

title: 36 Hours in Milan
description: New energy courses through cosmopolitan Milan, site of this years World Expo, with new bars, shops, restaurants and cultural centers adding to the allure of this most international of Italian cities.

title: Classical Playlist: Beethoven, Brahms, John Luther Adams and More
description: BEETHOVEN, BRAHMS, WEBER Jon Manasse, clarinetist; Jon Nakamatsu, pianist; Clive Greensmith, cellist (Harmonia Mundi) The clarinetist Jon Manasse, the pianist Jon Nakamatsu and the cellist Clive Greensmith open this disc with Beethovens Trio in B flat (Op. 11), Mr. Nakamatsus fleet-fingered clarity enhancing the vivacious outer movements and all three playing with deep expression in the Adagio. Mr. Manasse demonstrates a lovely, limpid tone throughout, such as in the second movement of Webers Grand Duo Concertant in E flat (Op. 48). Also included on the disc is a passionate rendition of Brahmss autumnal Trio in A minor (Op. 114). (Vivien Schweitzer)

title: For First Time, F.D.A. Panel Approves Generic Copy of Costly Biologic Drug
description: SILVER SPRING, Md.  An expert panel unanimously recommended on Wednesday that the Food and Drug Administration approve a cheaper copy of a special drug used in cancer therapy, paving the way for alternatives to an entire class of complex and costly drugs to enter the United States market.

title: 36 Hours in Milan
description: If its been a few years since you last visited Milan (our top choice for 52 Places to Go in 2015), youre in for a pleasant shock. Yes, the preparations for the World Expo being held here this year (May through October) turned large swaths of the city into construction zones, many of which are still in progress. But alongside these urban development projects, a more organic wave of rejuvenation has swept through the city. Old structures of various stripes  among them a sawmill, a foundry, a bank and a farmhouse  have recently been repurposed as bars, shops, restaurants and cultural centers worthy of this most international of Italian cities. Put simply, theres new energy coursing through cosmopolitan Milan, and its likely to last long after the Expo.

title: New Antibiotic Stirs Hope Against Resistant Bacteria
description: An unusual method for producing antibiotics may help solve an urgent global problem: the rise in infections that resist treatment with commonly used drugs, and the lack of new antibiotics to replace ones that no longer work.

title: From the Director John Waters, a Kiddie-Friendly Pink Flamingos
description: In 1972, John Waters raised eyebrows with the X-rated film Pink Flamingos, the story of Divine, played by the drag queen of the same name, a criminal hiding under the moniker Babs Johnson in a pink trailer with two plastic flamingos at the front. Waters filled it with the types of raunchy, lewd acts that turned his movies into cult favorites. More than four decades later, Waters has reinvented Pink Flamingos as video art for his new exhibition Beverly Hills John, on view at Marianne Boesky Gallerys Chelsea location through February 14. Ive become my own worst enemy and rewrote the script so that its G-rated, explains Waters, who hired a cast full of children  most, he says, were friends kids  to do a costumed table reading that was filmed over the course of one day. The 72-minute video, titled Kiddie Flamingos, pokes fun at the original; an exclusive preview runs here. I see it as a new kind of perversity not to ever make an X-rated thing again, he said.

title: Patti Smiths Cinematic Lullaby
description: Patti Smith, the godmother of punk, crossed a new frontier when she wrote an original song for the movie Noah, based on the biblical flood.

title: Writers Guild Gives Nightcrawler, Whiplash More Momentum
description: The debate this week over whether Whiplash was an original screenplay or an adaptation (as the Academy has designated it) didnt hurt the movie with the Writers Guild. That organization has announced its nominees, and the film, written and directed by Damien Chazelle, is among the contenders.

title: Carmelo Anthony Reiterates Faith in Phil Jackson as the Knicks Look to the Long Term
description: WASHINGTON  Carmelo Anthony said his decision to sign a new, five-year deal with the Knicks last summer was based partly on his trust that Phil Jackson, the teams new president, would know how to turn the clubs fortunes around.

title: First Draft Focus: Democratic Women Bundle Up and Smile
Witness Videos of Paris Terror Attack
description: Several videos showing the gunmen outside the office of Charlie Hebdo, a satirical newspaper, have surfaced online. The footage includes scenes of graphic violence.

title: In Two Languages, Kerry Condemns Attack
description: Speaking in both English and French, Secretary of State John Kerry expressed solidarity with France against an attack on the French satirical newspaper Charlie Hebdo that killed 12 people.

title: Laphroaig
description: The people of Laphroaig show the very human process of their whisky making.

title: Charlie Hebdo Shooting Recalls the Paris Magazines Previous Attack
description: In the wake of the killing of 12people at the offices of the French magazine Charlie Hebdo on Wednesday, many are noting that this attack isnot the first the magazine has suffered. And now, responses to an earlier assault may be, unfortunately, relevant again.

title: Methodology of Calculating Company Payments to Doctors
description: The pharmaceutical and medical device industries, even when required by the federal government, have not made it easy to track their expenditures on doctors and teaching hospitals.

title: The Drugs That Companies Promote to Doctors Are Rarely Breakthroughs
description: For more than five decades, the blood thinner Coumadin was the only option for millions of patients at risk for life-threatening blood clots. But now, a furious battle is underway among the makers of three newer competitors for the prescription pads of doctors across the country.

title: Sienna Miller Will Join Cabaret on Broadway
description: Sienna Miller will be the next and final actress to play Sally Bowles in the Broadway revival of Cabaret, starting Feb. 17 and running through the productions scheduled closing date of March 29, Roundabout Theater Company announced on Wednesday.

title: To Lift Market, Obama Will Lower Mortgage-Insurance Cost
description: The Obama administration, struggling to get the housing market running again for low-income and first-time home buyers, will lower the premium that the Federal Housing Administration charges on mortgage insurance, officials said Wednesday.

title: Fed Committee Hopeful, but Wary at Last Session
description: WASHINGTON  Federal Reserve officials spoke with growing optimism about the strength of the economy at the December meeting of the Feds policy-making committee, according to an official account published on Wednesday.

title: After Lift, Skiers Are on Their Own
description: Veteran skier Sage Cattabriga-Alosa comes face to face with the dangers of big mountain skiing as he balances precariously on the edge of a large peak.

title: Video: After Helicopter Lift, Skiers Are on Their Own
description: Behind the Line is a video series produced by Teton Gravity Research that takes you into the minds of skiers. In each episode, the athletes will look back on a line, a jump or a session, and discuss the moment.

title: Joan Didion on theCline Ad
description: When Vogue, a former employer of the esteemed writer Joan Didion, announced on Tuesday that she was starring in Clines latest ad campaign, with a photograph featuring her in black shirt, oversize gold pendant and dark sunglasses, the fashion Internet quivered in a way it hasnt at least since Kim Kardashian stripped nude for Paper magazine two months ago.

title: In Assessing 2015 Goals, Be Wary of Risk Creep
description: The day after Christmas, a skier was caught in an avalanche near my home in Park City, Utah. Part of a foursome, the skier slid with the snow for about 500 feet before ending up buried to his neck. Luckily, his party found him, dug him out, and discovered he hadnt been injured.

title: How Cold Is It? As Cold as  ________
description: An ice-fishermans hut. The grave. A witchs, um, toe. The welcome for the mayor at a police gathering.

title: The Year Ahead in Extreme Sports
description: This is the year of the niche athlete, the retroactive sport, the shirtless uniform. Its an opportunity to travel to remote destinations to watch those who believe that competing with the elements, as well as with one another, makes for a neat challenge.

title: Where to Eat, and Where Dance It Off
description: All of us may be trying desperately (or at least occasionally) to eat enough wild Alaskan salmon, leafy greens and quinoa salads. But lets be honest; if were making the effort to pack a bag and book a flight in search of flavor, its going to be for something decadent.

title: How to Travel in 2015
description: There are plenty of exciting places to go this year, but there also will be new ways to get there. Here are a few of our favorites.

title: Big Eyes and the Pact Between Writers and Painter
description: It took more than a decade for the screenwriting partners Scott Alexander and Larry Karaszewski  whose films include Ed Wood, The People vs. Larry Flynt and Man on the Moon  to get Big Eyes made.

title: Historic Anniversaries, From Rio to Selma
description: Anniversaries are great for catching a look in the rearview mirror, remembering where we came from and rethinking where were going.

title: Mr. Speaker, Lets Just Forget My Vote Against You. Now Smile!
description: Opposing John A. Boehner for speaker evidently does not mean you are opposed to having your picture taken with John A. Boehner after he is elected speaker.

title: Massacre at Charlie Hebdo
description: In memory of Cabu, Wolinski, Charb and Tignous.

title: Black Holes Inch Ahead to Violent Cosmic Union
description: In a galaxy far, far away, a pair of supermassive black holes appear to be spiraling together toward a cosmic collision of unimaginable scale, astronomers said on Wednesday.

title: Front Page History: Teaching About Selma Using Original Times Reporting
description: Updated | Jan. 13, 2015

title: First Draft Focus: Snowy Takeoff
In New Role in Senate, Democrats Grind Gears
description: WASHINGTON  Democrats were adjusting grudgingly to their reduced role in the Senate on Wednesday, displaying some surliness and a lot of suspicion while making the case that they would not be silent or passive players in the new Republican-controlled Congress.

title: Yale Library Acquires Paula Vogel Archive
description: The Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library at Yale has acquired the literary archive of Paula Vogel, whose play How I Learned to Drive won the Pulitzer Prize for drama in 1998. Ms. Vogel, who has taught at the Yale School of Drama since 2008 and is a playwright in residence at Yale Repertory Theater, is the first female playwright to be included in the librarys Yale Collection of American Literature, a repository that includes the papers of Eugene ONeill, Thornton Wilder. A. R. Gurney and John Guare.

title: Reports of Army Deployment in Sri Lanka Investigated Ahead of Election
description: COLOMBO, Sri Lanka  The Sri Lankan election authorities are investigating reports that the military has troops standing by, ready to deploy during the presidential election Thursday, the countrys election commissioner said on Wednesday.

title: Jameis Winston to Enter N.F.L. Draft; His Accuser Sues Florida State
description: Quarterback Jameis Winston on Wednesday announced that he would make himself available for the N.F.L. draft, the same day that Florida State was sued by the woman who accused him of rape.

title: John Travolta to Play Lawyer in O.J. Simpson Mini-Series
description: Its, like, so weird: despite a decades-long acting career that includes the films Grease, Saturday Night Fever and Pulp Fiction, John Travolta has played relatively few television roles. Hes been Vinnie Barbarino on four seasons of Welcome Back, Kotter; the title character in TV movies like The Boy in the Plastic Bubble; and a creative enunciator of names on the Academy Awards.

title: Paris Assault Examined for Qaeda and ISIS Methods
description: Wednesdays attack on a satirical newspaper in Paris prompted speculation about the involvement of an organized terrorist group, possibly the Islamic State, whose leaders have called for sympathizers to carry out assaults wherever they can. These lone wolf attacks have included the siege of a cafe in Sydney, Australia, last month; an attack on the Jewish Museum in Brussels in May; and a gunmans rampage through the Parliament building in Ottawa in October.

title: Obama on U.S. Solidarity With France
description: In reaction to the deadly attack on the French satirical newspaper Charlie Hebdo, President Obama said the United States would provide France with every bit of assistance in fighting terrorism.

title: With a Friendlier 42nd Street, Mario Cuomo Left His Mark on Times Square
description: If you seek Mario M. Cuomos monument, look around.

title: Panorama Photos Show the Decisive Minute
description: Chuy Benitez makes sweeping panoramas of everyday scenes, turning a moment into a minute.

title: U.S. Asks Poland to Extradite Polanski
description: WARSAW  Polish officials on Wednesday received an official request from the United States government to extradite the filmmaker Roman Polanski, who fled the United States before final sentencing on a statutory rape charge in 1978.

title: A New Retrospective of Jess Rafael Soto Debuts on Both Sides of the Atlantic
description: The late midcentury artist is the subject of an exhibition at Emmanuel Perrotins galleries in New York and Paris.

title: Fashions Two-Faced Relationship With Age
description: For the last three years at about this time  which is to say, in the nascent days of the new year, when the calendar lies clear and the sense of possibility is at its apex  Selfridges, the British department store, has dedicated its windows, all 13 of them, to a new class of Bright Young Things: dozens of up-and-coming stars of fashion and art, including names like Simone Rocha, Christopher Shannon and Maarten van der Horst, who it thinks will shape what we wear and how we shop in the year to come.

title: Jack OConnell in Sharp, Casual Separates
description: The Star: Jack OConnell

title: Redshirting Kindergarten-Age Kids Can Lead to Regrets
description: Last week we had our 4-year-olds parent-teacher conference. Shes in pre-K, turning 5 next summer, and so one of her teachers first questions for us was, What are you thinking about kindergarten?

title: Cuban Road Trip: Reporters Notebook
description: The reporter William Neuman wrote a front-page article about his 17-hour road trip, in a 1956 Ford Fairlane, across Cuba. Here he reflects on the trip and ideas of modern and new.

title: Dangerous Moment for Europe, as Fear and Resentment Grow
description: LONDON  The sophisticated, military-style strike Wednesday on a French newspaper known for satirizing Islam staggered a continent already seething with anti-immigrant sentiments in some quarters, feeding far-right nationalist parties like Frances National Front.

title: Texas Abortion Clinic Rules Tested in Appeals Court
description: NEW ORLEANS  Lawyers for abortion clinics squared off with Texas state attorneys in a federal appeals court here on Wednesday, arguing over the constitutionality of stringent abortion clinic rules that would force more than half the remaining abortion providers in Texas to close.

title: For January, Cooking the Pantry (and Freezer, and Fridge) Dry
description: It started when my husband bought me a new appliance for Christmas. (An air fryer. Its very entertaining if not exactly necessary.)

title: A New Retrospective of Jess Rafael Soto Debuts on Both Sides of the Atlantic
description: Jess Rafael Soto is not a forgotten master, says the curator Matthieu Poirier. That term has lately has been tossed around in art circles as frequently as the very same names being put up at auction. But Poirier may, in fact, have an informed perspective on the matter. After all, he wrote the book (or rather, the catalogue) on Soto, the late Venezuelan-born midcentury artist who pioneered the practice known as kinetic art. Poirier, an art history lecturer at the Sorbonne, curated Dynamo: A Century of Light and Movement in Art 19132013 last year at the Galeries Nationales du Grand Palais, which he says tried to demonstrate, with 143 artists contribution, that Sotos context and influence goes much beyond the South American historical and geographic borders within which he is regularly considered.

title: The Blasphemy We Need
description: In the wake of the vicious murders at the offices of the satirical French newspaper Charlie Hebdo today, let me offer three tentative premises about blasphemy in a free society.

title: F.B.I. Says Little Doubt North Korea Hit Sony
description: WASHINGTON  The F.B.I.s director, James B. Comey, said on Wednesday that the United States had concluded that North Korea was behind the destructive attacks on Sony Pictures partly because the hackers failed to mask their location when they broke into the companys servers.

title: G.O.P. Leaders Question Obamas Intent
description: Republican leaders, now in control of both houses of Congress, said the onus for bipartisan cooperation was on President Obama and questioned whether he would seriously pursue it.

title: Gearing Up for Re-election, Reid Said to Shake Up Staff
description: David Krone, Senator Harry Reids lightning rod  or chief of staff  will be replaced by Drew Willison, the Senates former sergeant-at-arms, according to a source familiar with the personnel change.

title: Abduction. Lost Finger. Now, a Rock Climbers Tallest Hurdle.
description: YOSEMITE NATIONAL PARK, Calif.  Whatever part inside of Tommy Caldwell that made him attempt the seemingly impossible  a free climb of El Capitans Dawn Wall  might have been born in 2000 when he and three others were kidnapped by militants while climbing in the Pamir-Alai range of Kyrgyzstan. They escaped after six days on the run when Caldwell shoved an armed guard over a cliff.

title: Taylor Swifts Reign Continues in 2015
description: Taylor Swift had the best-selling album of 2014, and she is starting off the new year on top, as her hit 1989 notches an eighth week as Billboards No. 1 album.

title: Hollande Pledges to Defend Freedom
description: President Franois Hollande of France declared Thursday a national day of mourning after a terror attack on the French satirical newspaper Charlie Hebdo left 12 dead.

title: Barnes Foundation Recruits Director From Miami
description: The Barnes Foundation  now in its third year in its gleaming new home in downtown Philadelphia after a contentious relocation  announced on Wednesday that it had chosen Thomas Collins, a longtime museum leader and curator, to become its new executive director and president after a search of almost a year.

title: A New Resort for Nevis
description: While St. Kitts has been the focus of development with the recent opening of Belle Mont Farm and an anticipated Park Hyatt, Nevis, the smaller sibling in the Caribbean nation of St. Kitts and Nevis, will get a new villa resort Jan. 15 when Paradise Beach Nevis opens.

title: A Visceral Slide Into Darkness
description: The members of the chorus pace restlessly around the stage, periodically halting in ominous formations. Sometimes they sing at one another in a whisper, but using megaphones. The floor is littered with lemons, and the lighting is stark. Some of the performers wear elaborate, antiquated black gowns, as if mourners at a Victorian funeral. Some don combat boots.

title: The Charlie Hebdo Massacre in Paris
description: The brutal terrorist attack on the French satirical weekly Charlie Hebdo in Paris on Wednesday has badly shaken France. But the French have reacted with a fierce determination to defend their freedoms. President Franois Hollande, speaking from outside the magazines office a couple of hours after the murder of 12 people, was crystal clear: This was an assault, he said, on the expression of freedom that is the spirit of the republic.

title: Is Islam to Blame for the Shooting at Charlie Hebdo in Paris?
description: The French satirical newspaper Charlie Hebdo skewers people of all faiths and backgrounds. One cartoon showed rolls of toilet paper marked Bible, Torah and Quran, and the explanation: In the toilet, all religions.

title: A Wide Range of Works, With Some Sexiness Thrown Into the Mix
description: For Bodytraffic, a Los Angeles repertory company formed in 2007, variety counts for much and a dose of sexy never hurts. Still, the four choreographers featured in its latest program, shown Tuesday at the Joyce Theater, shared some similar sensibilities. Along with jolts of speed contrasted with slowness, there was the frequent use of the spotlight and, as usual in a certain strain of contemporary dance, plenty of gestures gone wild.

title: Pictures of the Day: France and Elsewhere
description: France and More  Pictures of the Day

title: First Draft Focus: Mustang Barry
A Tense Paris After Charlie Hebdo Attack
description: Parisians discussed what the terrorist attack in the heart of the city could mean for France and its large Muslim population.

title: Tensions Between Mayor and the Police
description: To the Editor:

title: Sothebys and ChristiesReturn to Guaranteeing Art Prices
description: Perhaps its a mark of confidence in the art market. Or a sign that profit margins are thin. Or simply another big gamble, like the ones taken in 2008.

title: Paper-and-Scissors Game Is Now a Designers Mtier
description: Kiki van Eijks Paper Cut light fixtures were inspired by the childs game of cutting out objects from double-folded scraps, a pastime she enjoyed as a child.

title: Japanese Masters at Play
description: Time is arrested in an auction preview of art pieces by two Japanese masters. Shiro Kuramata and Hiroshi Sugimoto: Works From the Absent Past displays limited-edition furniture by Mr. Kuramata (1934-1991) alongside photographic seascapes by Mr. Sugimoto. The show is at Wrights New York gallery, 980 Madison Avenue (East 77th Street).

title: G.O.P. vs. Obama Agenda
description: To the Editor:

title: Hard-Luck Heroes on Streets and the Set
description: Its well known that George Pelecanos has a terrific ear for street talk, and that his crime novels, populated mostly by black characters in tougher parts of Washington, sound as credible and unforced as they do cutting-edge. But the novella in this short-story collection, Mr. Pelecanoss first, shows that his ear for movie-set argot is just as good. He has named both the novella and the book The Martini Shot. Thats industry talk for the last shot, the one after which work ends and night life begins  the idea being that the next shot will be coming out of a glass.

title: Careful, Eve. This One Is Crystal.
description: In his first collection for Daum, the French crystal manufacturer, Martyn Lawrence Bullard put an artful twist on a Garden of Eden theme. The infamous apple assumes three forms: a paperweight ($675); a candleholder ($1,470) with a niche for an LED candle; and the centerpiece of a chandelier with pale green leaves and a gilded serpent (price upon request). All are made using the companys technique of pte de cristal, a modern refinement of pte de verre, the ancient Egyptian glass-casting method, which results in the bold, saturated color evident in the ruby red of the apple. They will be introduced at the Maison et Objet home furnishings show in Paris on Jan. 23.

title: White House Digital Project
description: To the Editor:

title: A Big Barrel Is Refilled
description: Los Angeles was once lousy with fanciful buildings made to look like other things: The Brown Derby restaurants are an example. Most are gone or living out a shabby old age.

title: Cultivating a More Youthful Orchestra
description: Despite the graying of the classical music audience  or perhaps because of it  American orchestras and major music institutions are chasing youth with ever more ambitious programs to reach, and teach, the next generation of players.

title: Suicide Among Native Peoples
description: To the Editor:

title: Jarring Reality, Doused With Humor
description: The British series Babylon, a complicated and darkly satirical comedy about law enforcement and its discontents that runs on the Sundance Channel starting Thursday, is eerily timely for American viewers. It touches on issues from pensions to prison privatization, but the story is built around two questionable police shootings. One, of a young black man, leads to riots that escalate because aggrieved police officers refuse to leave their stations.

title: Brick by Tiny Brick
description: It took Adam Reed Tucker several exhausting months to build what he considers the masterwork of his career, up to this point. In fact, what he built was the masterwork of Frank Lloyd Wrights career, only with tiny plastic bricks.

title: What to Do About Chipped Tiles in the Bathroom?
Tax Returns Complicated by Health Care Law and I.R.S. Staff Cuts
description: The filing season for tax year 2014 starts in less than two weeks. While some people wont have all the forms needed to file their returns until the beginning of next month, theres good reason to start gearing up now  whether you prepare your own taxes, or pay someone to do it for you.

title: Testing Out a Twilight Stir of Melody, Before Heading to the Studio
description: The moments of clarity came scattered throughout Matt Mitchells first set at the Jazz Gallery on Tuesday night, each making a distinct impression before receding into the churn. One such moment was an improvised piano interlude, played by Mr. Mitchell in a two-handed, crab-scuttling counterpoint, on a composition wryly titled Numb Trudge.

title: Galvanized Near the Gowanus
description: An architects dream home coexists with its industrial surroundings.

title: New York City Taxi Medallion Prices Keep Falling, Now Down About 25 Percent
description: Taxi medallion prices continue to fall under pressure from new taxi competitors, including Uber. New York City individual taxi medallions, whose owners must drive a taxi for at least part of the year, fell to $805,000, down 23 percent from 2013s peak of $1.05 million. Corporate medallions, which may be owned in fleets, traded on average at $950,000, down 28 percent from their peak.

title: Padding the Edge
description: The lot was on the edge of the residential neighborhood of Carroll Gardens in Brooklyn, near a concrete plant and the Gowanus Canal, and it had an old garage on it. To many people, it wouldnt have seemed like an obvious place to build a dream home. But when Philippe Baumann and Lisa Sardinas saw the property, they knew they wanted it.

title: A Deal From the World Mind Games in Beijing
description: At the fourth SportAccord World Mind Games in Beijing last month, two Americans won a pair of medals: Justin Lall of Plano, Tex., and Roger Lee of Las Vegas. They were third in both the open teams and the open pairs. They said nothing noteworthy happened to them, so lets look at a deal that occurred during the concluding individual event.

title: Proud to Offend, Charlie Hebdo Carries Torch of Political Provocation
description: PARIS  In 2012, when Charlie Hebdo editors defied the governments advice and published crude caricatures of the Prophet Muhammad naked and in sexual poses, the French authorities shut down embassies, cultural centers and schools in about 20 countries.

title: Where Being in Denial Is Right at Home
description: If youre fishing for reality-TV viewers, you want to start the year off with something attention-getting, and normally a show about men with a fetish for dressing in latex suits that make them look like giant female dolls would do the trick. But for TLC, the network that loves to make itself hateable, guys-as-dolls (Wednesday nights Season 6 premiere of My Strange Addiction) was only an appetizer.

title: Pick a Country, Any Country
description: Behomm, a home-exchange website, lets you inhabit magazine-perfect residences, but only if you qualify.

title: Brazils Former Sports Minister is Moved to Science Post Despite Rejection of Global Warming Science
description: For the president in any democracy, compromises are often necessary in assembling a cabinet that satisfies a range of constituencies. But even with that in mind, its really hard to understand howPresident Dilma Rousseffof Brazil, who has repeatedly pressed for strong global action to curb climate change, could possibly justify her choice of Aldo Rebelo as her new minister of science, technology and innovation.

title: Shopping With Anna Rabinowicz
description: Even a toothbrush can be a collectible. At the very least, it can make you smile in the morning.

title: Adventurous Offerings in San Francisco Opera Season
description: Rising young singers, a mix of old and new works, star directors and a new, intimate theater will all be features of the San Francisco Operas 2015-16 season, the last under its transformative general director, David Gockley, the company announced Wednesday.

title: Toothbrushes: Saying Ah (and Ooh)
description: It all began with a kiss: Dr. Kiss, the toothbrush designed by Philippe Starck for Alessi in 1996, which looks something like a pen curving out of an inkwell.

title: Pictures of the Day  Jan. 7, 2015
description: Photos from France, Yemen, England and the United States.

title: Trading Places, in Style
description: Sara Frisk never thought about traveling to Mexico City until a stranger named Pilar Muoz invited her. Ms. Muoz, a publicist for designers, lives in a 4,300-square-foot penthouse apartment with glass walls and luscious green views. The home has richly grained wood floors, trim modern sofas and a kitchen island you could sacrifice an ox on.

title: Following T-Mobile, AT&T Allows Some Customers to Roll Over Unused Data
description: T-Mobile USA is the small fry among the big American phone carriers, but its moves continue to influence its competitors. Just a few weeks after T-Mobile said it would allow phone customers to roll over their unused data month after month, AT&T said it would provide a similar offering.

title: Your Evening Briefing
description: Catch up on the days top stories.

title: Paris Attack Slideshow
description: Paris Attack Slideshow

title: Sales at Ankasa, Gracious Home, Jayson Home and the MoMA Design Store
description: Ankasa is discounting duvets and coverlets by 30 percent and sheets by 20 percent through Jan. 15 (a queen-size Bonne Terre duvet, originally $625, is about $437); 424 Broome Street (Crosby Street), 212-226-8002, and 1200 Madison Avenue (East 88th Street), 212-996-5200.

title: Emma Stone
description: Ms. Stones outfits seem to be synced partly with her chameleonic changes of coiffure.

title: Sleepy Hollow Recap: What Was That Winged Creature?
description: Season 2, Episode 12: Paradise Lost

title: Learn, Baby, Learn
description: Last July, Jeremy Slutskin and his neighbors in a four-story condo building in Clinton Hill, Brooklyn, experienced a reverse miracle: A fire broke out in a top-floor apartment due to  wait for it  spontaneous combustion of chemicals.

title: China Wants Taxes Paid by Citizens Living Afar
description: HONG KONG  As Chinese individuals and companies head overseas in greater numbers, the countrys tax authorities are starting to follow.

title: The Soft Sway of Suede
description: A suede skirt could be the first investment you consider for the new year.

title: Irans Supreme Leader Is Skeptical of Nuclear Talks With U.S.
description: TEHRAN  Irans supreme leader said on Wednesday that his country should find internal solutions for dealing with economic sanctions and that the United States could not be trusted to lift sanctions in the event that a nuclear agreement is reached.

title: Inhofe Says He Would Consider a Gas Tax Increase
description: Add Senator James Inhofe, the conservative Republican from Oklahoma, to a small but growing list of senators who would consider backing an increase in the gasoline tax. Just dont call it a tax.

title: CES: Security Risks From the Smart Home
description: LAS VEGAS  THE Internet of Things arrived in force at this years International CES, the huge trade show here. But while manufacturers at the event painted a rosy picture of connected grills, coffee makers, refrigerators and door locks, security experts and regulators warned that the Internet of Things could be a threat to both security and privacy.

title: Our Doctors May Be Listening, but ...
Why Were So Mad at de Blasio
description: ON Sunday, at the funeral of the slain New York City police officer Wenjian Liu, his grieving father described how his son would call him at the end of each days tour of duty, just to let him know he was O.K.

title: Hollywoods Leading Men Embrace Fashion
description: Male actors, such as Benedict Cumberbatch and Bradley Cooper, are suddenly appearing everywhere, always looking like a million bucks.

title: Deadly Attack in Paris
description: Masked gunman opened fire Wednesday at the Paris offices of Charlie Hebdo, a satirical weekly newspaper.

title: Spring Fashion: What to Get Excited About Now
description: In these first days of 2015, resolve to have a stylish new year. Designers have already done most of the deep thinking, looking ahead by looking back to the 1970s, the indulgent decade that dominated the spring runways. The jewelry will be bigger, the platforms higher, the denim more statement-making. And theres more suede in the shops than at a Topanga Canyon love-in. Its time to get started. Happy New Year!

title: A Race to the Front Row
description: Greccia Clausen, a Manhattan accountant, approaches her quest for a front-row bike at SoulCycle like the numbers game it is. Every Monday at noon, when the booking window opens, she and a friend each try to grab two front-row bikes. Then they compare notes and choose the two best placed, preferably front and center.

title: French Humor, Turned Into Tragedy
description: PARIS  IN September 2012, the satirical newspaper Charlie Hebdo, defying the advice of the French government, published several lewd caricatures of the Prophet Muhammad.

title: CES: A Fitness Watch, Smart Light Bulbs and a Self-Watering Flower Pot
description: LAS VEGAS  AT the International CES, tens of thousands of gadgets from thousands of manufacturers are on display. And yet, each year, a few rise to the surface.

title: Its All Right With Sam
description: Samuel A. Alito Jr. may be the least recognizable of Supreme Court justices. I doubt if one American in a thousand could pick him out of a lineup. Those who do know the name, if not the face, of the 64-year-old justice most likely lump him with the other conservatives who as a bloc dominate the Roberts court.

title: How Stylish Male Actors Have Upped the Red Carpet Game
description: By the time awards season rolls around each year, the inbox of anyone covering style fills up with so much pressing fashion minutiae that trepanation can suddenly seem like a desirable option.

title: Shopping Sales and Events in New York City
description: For those returning to the nest after holiday journeys, Dover Street Market has a temporary Rick Owens Maison/Objet installation featuring a selection of furniture, tableware and flatware, including an Urnette bronze vase ($6,300), which is displayed across a black plinth with mural artwork by Mr. Owenss stepdaughter, Scarlett Rouge. At 160 Lexington Avenue.

title: Plan for Offshore Wind Farm in Nantucket Sound Hits a Snag
description: BOSTON  Cape Wind, a massive wind farm proposed in Nantucket Sound, has been dealt a setback that threatens its finances and throws into doubt whether it will become the nations first such offshore project.

title: At Tomas Maier, a Vision of the Closet as Toolbox
description: The best way to experience a Tomas Maier store is to emerge from the No. 6 train like a gremlin, brushing subway grime from your coat and scraping your shoe against the ground to remove a spilled slushie that you and 50 other passengers stepped in on the way out. These are conditions that contrast optimally with the new store on Madison Avenue, which is among the cleanest and brightest-lit vendors of luxury goods on its Upper East Side block. Its the kind of environment you wander into and think, If I lived in a place like this, Id never be filthy again.

title: From Caretaker to Computer Analyst Via a Nonprofit Technology School
description: In 2008, Sydney Almorales was wrapping up his senior year at Brownsville Academy High School, plotting his course to college. But by the middle of the year, his future as a student was abruptly overtaken by a more immediate duty: caretaker.

title: Professors, Politicians, and Moments of Truth
description: Simon Wren-Lewis offers a clever way to think about whether US growth despite sequestration is a huge problem for Keynesians  he shows that under a hypothetical in which the US maintained spending at 2009 levels, a Keynesian analysis says that growth would have been higher  but not enormously higher. Another way of saying this is that US austerity, while real and destructive, hasnt been world-class, and is well within the range that is consistent with some growth.

title: A Bus Takes a Local Route to Fighting Mexican Corruption
description: MONTERREY, Mexico  Inside a large, open-air bus, a corrupt politician quarrels over the loudspeakers with a fed-up citizen who tells the passengers about the millions of pesos lost in a series of corruption scandals.

title: Two Mississippi Men Plead Guilty to Hate Crimes
description: The two remaining defendants among a group of young white Mississippians charged with carrying out racially motivated attacks on African-Americans in Jackson in 2011 pleaded guilty Wednesday to violations of the federal hate-crime law, with one of them admitting his role in the killing of a 47-year-old man.

title: Its Plastic Foam Packaging, Not the Food, Thats to Go Under a New York Rule
description: The proposed mayoral ban  swift, decisive, stirring in the moment  does not always take.

title: For Fashion Week This Fall: Location, Location, Location
description: This fall, the leaves will change, the days will grow short and Fashion Week, that autumn perennial, will head downtown.

title: Iraq Veteran, Now a West Point Professor, Seeks to Rein In Disability Pay
description: COLORADO SPRINGS  Nearly 200 sick and wounded soldiers in a gym at Fort Carson last month listened silently as Lt. Col. Daniel Gade offered a surprising warning: The disability checks designed to help troops like them after they leave the service might actually be harmful.

title: Good Room, a New Nightclub in Greenpoint, Brooklyn
description: In the demographic battle for Greenpoint, Brooklyn, Club Europa was a symbolic stronghold for Polish tough guys who still live with their parents against the invasion of real-life Girls characters who still live off their parents. But with the recent opening of Good Room in Europas surrendered hull, its not hard to imagine a shirtless Hannah Horvath hoisting her victory banner over Greenpoint, perhaps once and for all.

title: Weather Makes Bad Situation Worse for SyrianRefugees
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon  A fierce winter storm that has unleashed barrages of rain and snow on parts of the Middle East this week has compounded the misery of the millions of Syrians displaced by their countrys civil war and left the organizations that seek to help them scrambling to keep up.

title: Pakistan: Court Condemns Americans Kidnapper to Death
description: An Antiterrorism Court in Lahore sentenced Hafiz Imran to death on Wednesday in the kidnapping of the American aid worker Warren Weinstein. Prosecutors said that Mr. Imran was among the men who seized Mr. Weinstein at his home in Lahore in 2011, and that he now joined a growing list of men scheduled to be executed since the reinstatement of capital punishment in Pakistan last month. Mr. Weinstein, 73, has been shown in hostage videos released by Al Qaeda, which claims to be holding him. Mr. Weinstein had been working in Pakistan for a development consulting company based in Arlington, Va.

title: U.S. Oil Producers Cut Rigs as Price Declines
description: HOUSTON  With oil prices plunging at an ever-quickening rate, producers are beginning to slash the number of drilling rigs around the country.

title: F.A.A. Orders Airlines to Devise Plans to Identify Risks
description: Federal regulators said on Wednesday that airlines would be required to develop new safety management programs by 2018 to help identify potential hazards and prevent accidents.

title: Back to the Future
description: Its a new year in Washington, and I cannot tell you how harmonious things are looking.

title: Massachusetts: Prospective Jurors Screened for Trial of Dzhokhar Tsarnaev
description: The first phase of jury selection in the trial ofDzhokharTsarnaev in the Boston Marathon bombing ended Wednesdayas the last ofmore than1,350prospective jurors filled out questionnaires intended to help lawyers and the court find 12 jurors and six alternates for the capital case. For the third day,several hundredprospective jurors were introduced by Judge George OToole to the defendant, who is accused of killing three people and injuring more than 260. One of those injured, Jaymi Cohen, a college student, watched the proceedings alongside Carmen Ortiz, the United States attorney for the District of Massachusetts. The questionnaireswill be reviewed, and some of the prospective jurors will be summoned for further questioning.

title: Who Should Apologize in Police Conflict?
description: Patrick Lynch, the president of New York Citys largest police union, has once again called on Mayor Bill de Blasio to apologize to the police officers.

title: Jenni Kayne
description: The prefall collection included plaid pants and all-white ensembles.

title: Preen
description: The prefall collection included a sweatshirt with lace insets and sequin skirts.

title: When a Local Jury Won't Do
Challenged by Upstarts, Lenders Try New Strategy: Cooperation
description: Employees at MasterCard thought they saw a drop-off in credit card volume last spring at one of their merchants, a legal services provider. Checking further, they found they had a new competitor, Behalf, a start-up small-business lender backed by two venture capital firms that makes credit decisions in just a few seconds.

title: More Life at the Javits Center
description: For all the complaints about the Jacob K. Javits Convention Center over the years  its too small, too outdated, too gloomy  it never reported a bat invasion until its ambitious eco-friendly renovation was completed. The center now features a 6.75-acre living green roof, bird protective glass and a new population of insects that bats cant resist. Five species of bats have unexpectedly been attracted to this new urban habitat on the West Side along with a flurry of bird species like foraging American kestrels, according to delighted watchers at the New York City Audubon Society.

title: California: Ban on Foie Gras Is Ended
description: A federal judge on Wednesday struck down a state law barring sale of foie gras, ending a ban of the fatty duck liver that had lasted more than two years. Animal rights groups have long condemned foie gras, which has traditionally been produced by force-feeding ducks and geese, as inhumane. Many chefs across the state, who had lamented the loss of a favored ingredient, were elated by the ruling. The person who buys our foie gras called us from the courthouse crying with happiness, said Jon Shook, one of the chef-owners of Animal in Los Angeles. The judge ruled the ban unconstitutional because it attempted to override existing federal law regulating poultry products. The state can appeal the decision, and animal rights groups warned that restaurants that serve it could face protests. Foie gras is French for fatty liver, and fathead is the American word for the shameless chefs who actually need a law to make them stop serving the swollen, near-bursting organ of a cruelly force-fed bird, Ingrid E. Newkirk, the president of People for the Ethical Treatment of Animals, said in an email.

title: Spring Rush at the University of Virginia
description: Before it was discredited, a coeds sensational story alleging gang rape at the University of Virginia prompted the universitys president, Teresa Sullivan, to suspend fraternity and sorority activities on campus so that underlying problems of frat-house excesses could be addressed. The result, announced Tuesday, is an encouraging and realistic agreement by student and university leaders to crack down on the sort of binge drinking and partying abuses that have given frat-house behavior a notorious reputation on campuses across the nation.

title: Ruth Popkin Dies at 101; Hadassah Leader Worked to Resettle Refugees
description: Ruth Popkin, who emerged from a secular background to lead two major Jewish organizations, Hadassah and the Jewish National Fund, in work that benefited Israelis and refugees in the 1980s and 90s, died on Jan. 2 at her home in Manhattan. She was 101.

title: Texas: Fort Bliss Shooter and Victim Identified
description: Authorities in El Pasoon Wednesdayreleased the names of two men who died in a shooting at a Department of Veterans Affairs mental health clinic at Fort Bliss on Tuesday. An Army veteran, Jerrry Serrato, 48, killed a psychologist, Timothy Fjordbak, 63, before shooting himself, the authorities said. Mr. Serrato worked at the clinic in 2013 as a scheduling clerk. At the time, according to an F.B.I. spokesman, he made verbal threats to Mr. Fjordbak at a local supermarket. The F.B.I. spokesman, who said Mr. Fjordbak did not recognize Mr. Serrato, paraphrased the threat as, I know what you did and I will take care of it. The agency has not established that the two men had a professional relationship. The clinic will remain closed Thursday.

title: For States That Dont File Carbon-Cutting Plans, E.P.A. Will Impose Model Rule
description: WASHINGTON  The Environmental Protection Agency will force states to comply with a federal model rule to cut their carbon emissions if the states do not submit customized plans under the Obama administrations new climate change regulations, a senior official said Wednesday.

title: A Lifelong Packers Fan Chuckles as Fame Tugs
description: GREEN BAY, Wis.  The man with the most famous red beard in Wisconsin was three bites into his chicken sandwich Tuesday night when someone approached his table at Krolls West, a bar and restaurant across the street from Lambeau Field, with a small placard and a Sharpie.

title: Violence Grows in Yemen as Al Qaeda Tries to Fight Its Way Back
description: RADA CITY, Yemen  When Houthi fighters swept into this town and broke the grip of Al Qaeda, they were greeted by grateful residents, relieved that a months-long ordeal of bombings and assassinations by the militants might be coming to an end.

title: Judge Overturns California Ban on Foie Gras
description: LOS ANGELES  Foie gras is back on the menu in California. A federal judge on Wednesday struck down a state law barring sale of the fatty duck or goose liver, ending a ban that had lasted more than two years.

title: New Research Links Scores of Earthquakes to Fracking Wells Near a Fault in Ohio
description: Not long after two mild earthquakes jolted the normally steady terrain outside Youngstown, Ohio, last March, geologists quickly decided that hydraulic fracturing operations at new oil-and-gas wells in the area had set off the tremors.

title: In Paris, Solidarity Against Terrorism
description: Hours after the deadly attacks on Charlie Hebdo in Paris, thousands gathered in the Place de la Rpublique to show support for free speech.

title: Obama to Outline Proposals to Bolster a Lagging Housing Sector
description: WASHINGTON  The job market is stirring, gas prices are plunging and stocks are near record levels, but a housing sector that dragged the nation into the worst recession since the Depression remains the black spot in an otherwise resurgent economy.

title: An Industry Will Vanish, Along With a Cellphone Ban in New York City Schools
description: For every hour of light on Wednesday, Dorinne Concepcion sat on a folding chair in a drafty box truck, in front of a propane heater, wrapped in a blanket.

title: Deadly Attack in Paris
description: Masked gunmen opened fire Wednesday at the Paris offices of Charlie Hebdo, a satirical weekly newspaper.

title: Two Paths to Cooperstown Are Tinged With Black and Blue
description: Few people know the feeling of a baseball thrown 95 miles an hour thumping into their flesh. Few understand the panic of unleashing such a pitch and watching it veer toward a head, instead of a glove or a bat. In that way, we are lucky.

title: How to Raise Wages in New York
description: New York is one of 29 states with a minimum wage that exceeds the meager federal minimum of $7.25 an hour. But, with an hourly minimum of $8.75, rising to $9 next year, it still lags nine states  including California, Connecticut, Maryland, Massachusetts, Oregon and Washington  and the District of Columbia, which have or soon will have hourly minimums higher than $9.

title: Numerous Injuries in Brooklyn Bus Crash
description: Four men were critically injured and more than a dozen others suffered minor injuries on Wednesday in Brooklyn after a BMW struck a Nissan Altima on Utica Avenue, causing the BMW to hit a Metropolitan Transportation Authority bus, the police said.

title: Samsung Predicts Big Drop in Its End-of-Year Quarter
description: HONG KONG  Samsung, the worlds No. 1 maker of smartphones, had a tough end to 2014: On Thursday, the South Korean company said its operating profit and revenue probably fell almost 40 percent in the quarter ending in December compared with the same period in 2013.

title: Clickbait Has a New Address
description: Some of the most popular reading material on the Internet, at least among the meta-humor-loving tech-industry types, is now being provided by URLs. You know, the name of the website you are perusing, plus the string of words, numbers and dashes that follow.

title: Other Teams Have Designs on Dan Quinn, Seahawks Defensive Wizard
description: RENTON, Wash.  The night before a recent Seahawks game, about 90 minutes after the teams final meeting, defensive end Cliff Avril walked past a room he presumed was empty.

title: Years of Repetition Help Sharpshooter Equal a Record
description: As Kaleena Mosqueda-Lewis took aim at one of the most significant scoring records in womens basketball at Connecticut, perhaps the most meaningful assist had nothing to do with any teammate.

title: In G.O.P., a Divide of Ideology and Age
description: WASHINGTON  Three years before he ran for president in 2008, a newly slim Mike Huckabee peddled a book with a title that doubled as a lecture: Quit Digging Your Grave With a Knife and Fork. Now, as he considers a second White House run, he has written another book with a decidedly different but equally direct title: God, Guns, Grits and Gravy.

title: A Small Sign of Progress? The Knicks Lose by Only 10
description: WASHINGTON  The Knicks have 44 games left.

title: Merkels Visit to Britain Sets New Tone After E.U. Rift
description: LONDON  The first thing Prime Minister David Cameron did when Chancellor Angela Merkel of Germany arrived Wednesday for a half-day visit here was to take her to a German history exhibition at the British Museum.

title: Prof. Philip E. Converse, Expert on How Voters Decide, Dies at 86
description: You have the vote of every thinking person, a woman assured Adlai E. Stevenson during one of his presidential campaigns. To which Stevenson, so the story goes, replied skeptically: Thats not enough, madam  we need a majority!

title: Inadequate Effort
description: THURSDAY PUZZLE  All together now: Deb probably had trouble with this one because it was a rebus. Even more so, because, technically, it was a double rebus, with two rebus entries in each theme entry. And because, if we as a group could take an educated guess, Deb has never heard of a measurement called a GILL. Also, Deb was not warned that there would be math that required that she cleave her brain in two. So she tanked on this one.

title: Lee Israel, a Writer Proudest of Her Literary Forgeries, Dies at 75
description: In a rented storage locker on Manhattans Upper West Side, the writer Lee Israel kept a cache of antique typewriters: Remingtons and Royals, Adlers and Olympias. Each was tenderly curated, hung with a tag whose carefully lettered names  Edna, Dorothy, Nol, Eugene ONeill, Hellman, Bogart, Louise Brooks  hinted at the felonious intimacy for which the machines were used.

title: Winning Lottery Numbers for Jan. 7, 2015
As Police Go Idle, So Do New York City Courts
description: One arraignment courtroom instead of two. Clerks watching Batman on their computer screens and playing with their cellphones as they wait for something to happen. And Manhattans night court shutting down an hour early because there are no more cases to call.

title: New York Vaccine Requirement Is Lawful, a 2nd Court Says
description: New York States requirement that children be vaccinated before attending public school does not violate their constitutional rights, a federal appeals court in Manhattan said on Wednesday.

title: After 2 Deaths, New York City Adopts New Strategy to Protect Homeless Children
description: There were no complaints of child abuse or domestic violence that would warrant a closer look at the young family staying at a homeless shelter in Brooklyn.

title: New York Officers on Even Higher Alert After Paris Attack
description: The New York Police Department, already on high alert after the ambush killings of two officers last month, issued a call for further precautions in the wake of a deadly attack in Paris, including telling its patrol force not to sit in pairs in squad cars when at a fixed post.

title: Police Shooting Suspect Was Seen as Defiant or Gentle
description: Jason Polanco, who was known to stride out of his local deli with food that he had not always paid for, stepped into a nearby bodega in the Bronx on Monday night with more grandiose plans, according to the police.

title: Making a Meal With Mission Chinese Foods (Really Cool) Executive Chef
description: Craveable is something thats really important to me because thats why I go back to certain restaurants for maybe a singular dish, explains Angela Dimayuga, executive chef of Mission Chinese Food New York, in the above video. In October 2013, much to the dismay of Manhattans foodie set, the original Lower East Side location of Danny Bowiens buzzy downtown joint was shut down by the citys health department for sanitary violations. But as New Yorkers recently toasted the end of 2014, they celebrated, too, the much-anticipated reopening of Mission Chinese Food.

title: The Artist Devin Troy Strother Turns to Michael Jordan  and Joan Mir
description: When the gallery Marlborough Chelsea called the Los Angeles-based artist Devin Troy Strother in September to ask whether hed like to do a show with them this winter, he initially misunderstood the request: he thought they were asking him to have new work ready by December 2015. When he called back, he learned he had only a few months to conceive of an entire exhibition. For inspiration, he turned to the movie that was still queued up on his computer: the 1996 Michael Jordan vehicle Space Jam. The play on words proved too good to resist. My initial thought was the idea of Space Jam  I had to fill this huge space in a short amount of time and work very quickly, Strother says.

title: Military-Inspired Looks From the Resort Collections
description: Military style has been a recurring theme in fashion ever since Burberry invented the trench coat. And for the resort 2015 season, designers once again explored such motifs as gabardine twill, cargo pockets and olive-drab hues.
