title: An Artist Favored by the U.S. Embassy in Pakistan
description: Though plenty of ink is spilled about the intersection of politics and aesthetics, less is said about the artwork hanging in the rooms where statesmanship is actually conducted. Recently, one of the most geopolitically sensitive locations in the world, the U.S. embassy in Islamabad, Pakistan, reserved a multimedia wall piece and watercolors by the Los Angeles-based artist Jennifer Nocon, whose solo show You See Ocean I See Sky opens tomorrow in New York. Assembled from wool, clay and steel, standout pieces in the exhibition combine the artists signature motifs, branching tendrils and small scales, layered into a gathering storm of color.

title: Westbury, N.Y., a Melting Pot Village

title: In Salt Lake City, a Proposal to Link Ski Trails
description: Perhaps the biggest news lately in North American skiing has been the announcement in 2014 that seven ski resorts perched high above Salt Lake City hope to join hands to create the largest megaresort in North America. OneWasatch, as its being billed, would be a colossus, with one ski pass linking more than 100 lifts across Utahs Wasatch Mountains, more than double the acreage of Whistler-Blackcomb in Canada, currently the continents largest ski resort. Its backers say OneWasatch would offer an experience akin to Europes linked valley-to-valley ski systems like Arlberg in Austria or Trois Valles in France.

title: 1890: The Rouble Takes a Drop
description: ST. PETERSBURG  The Budget announcement has made a very unfavorable impression. The Finance Minister has himself admitted how real and widespread is the agricultural distress, and has publicly declared the opinion that there will be an immediate fall in the value of the rouble. Yet he has calmly augmented the expenditure by no less than 60,000,000 roubles. Probably the Minister could not help himself against the pressure of the war party. It is significant that most of the increase is due to the demands of the War Office.  The New York Herald, European Edition, Jan. 15, 1890

title: Crazy All the Time
description: After reading aloud to my children virtually every night for over a decade  my daughter just turned 12, and my sons are 9 and 4  I have, of course, many book recommendations, but I also have some strategic suggestions. The first is, if you cant picture yourself reading a particular book nightly for, oh, two straight months, dont even bring it into the house. Small children have a huge appetite for repetition, and you never know what will catch their interest. So be wary. I recently brought home Hello Kitty Goes to Camp, which comes with postcards to send home, thinking it would be an opportunity for ironic bonding with my frighteningly culturally sophisticated preteenage daughter. She didnt bite. Then the 4-year-old found it and, fascinated by his sisters two recent sleepaway camp disappearances, has demanded to hear it for many, many nights now.

description: In the United States, Simn Bolvar is remembered, vaguely, as a kind of George Washington of South America, commander of an army that freed a half-dozen countries, including his native Venezuela, from Spanish colonial rule. In Latin America, though, he is known simply as The Liberator, which happens to be the title of a biopic, by the Venezuelan director Alberto Arvelo, that is one of nine movies shortlisted for the Academy Award for best foreign-language film.

title: Corduroy Gets a Luxurious Reboot at the London Mens Wear Shows
description: Its clear that 70s nostalgia is the trend of the moment, with designers of both womens and mens fashion lately taking cues from the decade in their collections. So it comes as no surprise that one of the favored fabrics of the era, corduroy, found its way into the mens shows in London this week. These werent the thrifty sort of cords one might expect, however. The new designer Alex Mullins, who debuted his collection in a fluorescent-lit room filled with empty cardboard boxes, featured Me Decade-inspired knits and denim as well as corduroy. One look referenced the classic professorial type (think Donald Sutherland in the 1978 comedy Animal House), but its slightly odd proportions  cropped and flared trousers with a fitted jacket  made the suit more eccentric than dowdy. J.W. Anderson incorporated the durable ridged fabric  in a very 70s powder blue, to boot  into a short zipped jacket with a contrasting black collar. Styled with a pair of leather trousers on a model with slick hair, the jacket looked sharp, urbane and dangerously cool. And at Burberry Prorsum, the British fashion houses traditional trench was fabricated in a larger-scaled corduroy, giving the coat a bit more heft and the retro cloth a much more modern vibe.

title: Parcel for Sale: Plenty of Space. Very Quiet. Light? Well ...

title: Returning to a Mix Thats Hard to Unscramble
description: PHOENIX  The eye was inexorably drawn to LeBron James during his return to the Cleveland Cavaliers lineup on Tuesday night. In a 107-100 loss to the Phoenix Suns  Clevelands sixth straight defeat and ninth in 10 games  James played so many roles it was as if he were channeling the actor Alan Cumming in his 2013 one-man Broadway show, Macbeth.

title: A Strategy in the Fight Over Dodd-Frank: Go Big
description: The banks have fought their war against financial reform on four fronts.

title: Two Ex-Googlers Reunite at Venture Capital Firm
description: Wesley Chan, an early Google product manager who helped build Googles advertising system, along with Google Analytics and Google Voice, has joined Felicis Ventures, a boutique venture capital firm in Palo Alto, Calif. Mr. Chan had most recently been a partner at Googles venture capital arm, Google Ventures.

title: Dont Be Afraid of Robots, Says Ayanna Howard
description: In Telling the Future, Op-Talk asks people from a variety of fields to speculate on what we have to look forward to  and what we should watch out for.

title: Below the Line: Designing The Imitation Game
description: World War II England has been depicted in so many films that audiences are extremely familiar with looks from the era. For The Imitation Game, the biopic about the mathematician Alan Turing, the films designers wanted to portray that time with some accuracy, but to also enliven it.

title: Ted Cruz Sends a Message That Hes No Enemy of Science
description: Senator Ted Cruz wants everyone, especially his fellow Texans, to know that he supports NASAs contributions to science and discovery, and that they should not fear his appointment to lead the subcommittee that oversees the space agency.

title: Austria May Force Sale of Hitler Birthplace
description: BERLIN  Austrian authorities are exploring whether they can expropriate the house where Adolf Hitler was born if the current owner refuses to sell the pale yellow building in the heart of Braunau, in northern Austria, near the border with Germany.

title: A Promotion for Lydia Davis in French Order of Arts and Letters
description: Lydia Davis, the writer and translator acclaimed for her elegant English versions of Marcel Prousts Swanns Way and Gustave Flauberts Madame Bovary, and Kent Jones, the director of the New York Film Festival at Lincoln Center, will be honored by the French Ministry of Culture and Communication for their contributions to the arts. Ms. Davis will be named an officer, and Mr. Jones a chevalier, of the Order of Arts and Letters on Thursday at the Cultural Services of the French Embassy in Manhattan.

title: Qatar's Eyes Are on 2018 World Cup, Not 2022
description: CANBERRA, Australia  When Qatar takes on Iran on Thursday, it will desperately be trying to avoid the humiliation of an early exit from the 2015 Asian Cup.

title: Video: David Oyelowo Talks Selma and Overnight Success
description: Will David Oyelowo make the cut in the very crowded race for a best actor Oscar nomination? Well know Thursday, but either way, 2014 was a breakout year for him, with a raved-about performance as the Rev. Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. in Selma and roles in Interstellar and A Most Violent Year. Its well-known by now that he was a major force in getting Selma made after several abortive attempts. But as he told the Bagger in this video, he was halfway to gaining the extra 30 pounds he needed to play the part of the civil rights leader when one of those efforts was abandoned.

title: State Attorneys General Press JPMorgan for More Details on Hacking
description: A group of state attorneys general who are investigating a computer systems breach last summer at JPMorgan Chase, which potentially exposed some information for 83 million consumers and small businesses, wants the bank to explain how it can be certain no sensitive information was compromised.

title: 1915: Thousands Dead in Earthquake
description: ROME  Despatches which have arrived from the provinces last night and this morning show that yesterdays earthquake is a disaster second only in extent to that which devastated Messina in 1908. Only the most general estimates can yet be made of the number of victims, and even these vary between 20,000 and 30,000. Two new shocks were felt this morning. The worst fears are confirmed with regard to the town of Avezzano and the surrounding district. As far as can be at present ascertained, only 800 inhabitants out of a population of 11,000 have escaped and the majority of these are injured.  The New York Herald, European Edition, Jan. 15, 1915

title: 10 Are Killed When Prison Bus Slides Off Highway and Hits Train in Texas
description: DALLAS  Two corrections officers and eight prisoners were killed on Wednesday when a prison bus skidded off an icy highway overpass in West Texas, slid down an embankment and collided with a train, officials said.

title: Fearing Total Chaos in Libya, U.N. Plans New Peace Talks
description: GENEVA  The United Nations said Wednesday that it was starting a new round of talks here aimed at ending the chaos and violence in Libya, as international concern grows over the widening influence of Muslim extremists there.

title: App Smart | Phone Data Calculators
description: New apps that help you track the data usage on your smartphone can help you save money on your next cellphone bill.

title: Forever 14 and Hungry for Love
description: Most of us wouldnt go back to middle school age for 15 minutes if we could avoid it. Rebecca Benson has done it voluntarily since 2013 in Let the Right One In  which sounds awful until you realize that her character has been that age for nearly 400 years.

title: There Will Be Blood (a Lot)
description: After the openings last week of Constellations and Honeymoon in Vegas, Broadway will slow for a bit before a flurry of spring openings leading up to the Tony Awards in June. So now is a good time to catch some lower-budget theater, and the New York Shakespeare Exchanges coming production of Titus Andronicus ought to be a good place to start.

title: Tracking Data Use to Avoid Hefty Phone Fees
description: THE smartphone in your pocket gives you the power to chat, text, take selfies and a million other things. But it also burns through your data plan with your wireless carrier faster than you think.

title: Oscarology Delivers a Long View
description: The Oscar nominations are upon us, the ceremony is 38 days away, and a few surprises may yet lie in store in the newly narrowed universe of possible outcomes.

title: Why One Cookie Mom Still Loves the Girl Scouts
description: Heading into my fifth season as a cookie mom, I have this weird feeling in my gut. The most logical feeling would be dread; Im looking at eight weeks of late-night cookie accounting crises, which I will be tempted to soothe with boxes of the Thin Mints stacked by the case in my bedroom.

title: Johnson & Johnson Will Make Clinical Data Available to Outside Researchers
description: The health care giant Johnson & Johnson has agreed to make detailed clinical trial data on its medical devices and diagnostic tests available to outside researchers through a collaboration with Yale University, making it the first large device manufacturer to systematically make such data public.

title: 36 Hours in Memphis
description: Explore street view, find our points of interest and sign in to your Google account to save your map.

title: 36 Hours in Memphis
description: Theres more to Memphis than blues, barbecue and Elvis; youll also find trendy bars, 70s disco and gourmet snow cones.

title: New David Mitchell Novel Coming in October
description: Fans of the writer David Mitchell should wake up from their long winters naps long enough to take note: He will publish his seventh novel, Slade House, on Oct. 27, Random House announced on Wednesday.

title: Inside the Piers Harbor House
description: For the first time in many years, the public is welcome on Pier A in Battery Park City.

title: 36 Hours in Memphis
description: Maybe even more Music City than its country cousin to the east, Memphis has strong affiliations with not one musical genre but three. It is the birthplace of rock n roll, the cradle of soul and, though the blues werent born here (that distinction goes to the rural parts of the Mississippi Delta), it was the Memphis-based musician and Father of the Blues, W. C. Handy, who helped get those lonesome songs out into the world. But there is far more to Bluff City than blues and barbecue. A watermelon and feta salad can be found alongside great smokehouse meats; zydeco and indie rock are within earshot of soul; and up-and-coming areas like Cooper-Young are giving the citys older haunts some stiff competition. For this short visit, leave out the Graceland juggernaut, though if Elvis is on your bucket list, head out any morning to Gracelands Meditation Garden where the King is buried  its peaceful and free.

title: Blasphemy Revisited
description: My post last week in the immediate aftermath of the Charlie Hebdo murders received an unusual amount of favorable feedback from readers of varying persuasions, for which Im grateful. It was also written in a mood that was perhaps not completelynuanced and reflective, so I want to return to the issues now in the hopes ofboth clarifyingand qualifying certain elements of the argument. This will be the first of at least twoposts trying to do just that.

title: French Halls Architect Shuns Opening,  Calling it Premature
description: Paris  Hours before the official inauguration of the Philharmonie de Paris concert hall on Wednesday, its architect, Jean Nouvel, declared his intention to boycott the gala because he said the towering, 386 million euro (about $455 million) building is not ready to open.

title: Driehaus Prize for Architecture Goes to David M. Schwarz
description: The 2015 Richard H. Driehaus Prize  which recognizes classic architecture in modern society  has been awarded to the architect David M. Schwarz. Mr. Schwarz will be awarded the prize, for $200,000, on March 21 in Chicago.

title: Freeing a PC From Malware
Envisioned for Decades, a Revival of a Manhattan Pier Is Complete
description: Battery Park City was supposed to have obliterated the picturesque Pier A at the tip of Manhattan, whose clock tower  pealing the time in ships bells  is believed to have been the first permanent World War I memorial erected in the United States.

title: Classical Playlist: Bach, Anders Koppel, Mahler and More
description: BACH: English Suites Nos. 1, 3 and 5Piotr Anderszewski, pianist(Warner Classics 0825646219391; one CD)The Polish-Hungarian pianist Piotr Anderszewski brings superb facility and probing musicianship to everything he plays. His deeply personal Bach performances are especially compelling. In this essential new recording of three of Bachs English Suites (No. 3 in G minor, No. 1 in A, No. 5 in E minor), he uses the full tonal and colorist resources of the modern piano while vividly conveying Baroque style and sensibility. I particularly admire the way he combines articulate rhythmic vitality with lyrical treatment of inner voices. (Anthony Tommasini)

title: No Imminent Plans to Cut PATH Service, Port Authority Says
description: Late-night PATH service will not be cut any time soon, the Port Authority of New York and New Jersey told New Jersey legislators this week.

title: Directors Guild Unveils Its Documentary Nominees
description: The DGA Award nominees for feature film were announced Tuesday. Now comes news of the contenders in the documentary category. They are:

title: Slipping Into Something a Little More Political
description: After meeting (in full suit) with state lawmakers at a diner in Manchester, N.H., on Wednesday, Senator Rand Paul of Kentucky made a pro-Second Amendment fashion statement for a gun-rights rally at the Londonderry Fish and Game Club.

title: The Break-Up Question Over JPMorgan Chase
description: JPMorgan Chase is the nations largest bank, but investors certainly dont think its the best. That mismatch is a major force behind the growing calls to break up JPMorgan.

title: Virginia Politician Serves 2 Terms: In Jail and in the State Legislature
description: To be clear, late-night votes might be a bit of a problem for Joseph Morrissey, the newly sworn-in Virginia House delegate who must report to his jail cell about 7:30 each evening.

title: At the Fall 2015 London Mens Collections, Designers Had a Few Words to Put on Their Chests
description: A handful of designers at the fall/winter 2015 London shows this week had something to say  so much so that their clothes came emblazoned with messages that ranged from the promotional to the polemical. Christopher Shannon, who has made it his signature to deconstruct and dissect active sportswear, used his designs as commentary on commercial industries and the economy. With slogans like Thanks 4 Nothing, Save Me and Broke knitted into brightly colored intarsia jumpers, the ostensibly humorous collection revealed a darker undercurrent. While Sarah Burtons military-inspired collection for Alexander McQueen displayed a mastery of tailoring, the bold capitalized words HONOUR, VALOUR and TRUTH inscribed across blazers and coats made a bigger statement. And lastly, the American designer Shaun Samson, who returned with a runway show after two seasons away, brought a Southern California flair to the London scene with his collection of bold flannel plaids, Dickies-inspired chinos and aprons adorned with the phrases DELUSIONAL RADICAL BLISS and GNARLY DANK DUDE.

title: A Calculated Look Behind the Lust
description: In The Duke of Burgundy, due Jan. 23, a couple (Sidse Babett Knudsen and Chiara DAnna) blend sadomasochism and role play into their lives. Viewers might think they know what a movie like this looks like. But the films director, Peter Strickland, has a more fanciful visual in mind. Rather than just leather and lace, the film is also about butterflies, capes and mansions. Its often more Hans Christian Andersen than Fifty Shades of Grey, creating a melodramatic fantasia that seems to exist both in the real world and outside it.

title: Savings Rates Are Anemic, but a Survey Shows They Are Less Paltry Online
description: Americans are not known as great savers, and a tough economy, combined with anemic interest rates on savings, havent offered them much opportunity to change.

title: Injustice Treated Like a Thriller
description: Its not just the United States that has sensational criminal cases that mesmerize the tabloids. In Accused, one of nine films shortlisted for the Oscar for best foreign-language film, a Dutch nurse is falsely accused of murdering patients, demonized in the press as an angel of death and sentenced to life in prison, gaining her freedom only when a team of crusading lawyers establishes her innocence.

title: Alexandra Fullers Leaving Before the Rains Come
description: A memoir often takes one of two basic forms: In the first, the writer has an extraordinary story to tell; in the second, she has the ability to tell the common story in an extraordinary way. Sometimes  Mary McCarthys Memories of a Catholic Girlhood is an example, Paula Foxs Borrowed Finery another  the two are conflated in events on whose extremity the artistic mind succeeds in imposing literary form. I once heard the writer Aharon Appelfeld, asked why he had underplayed the savagery of his Holocaust childhood in one of his books, give the answer that extremity, whether imaginary or real, is harmful to art. What he perhaps meant was that the artists aim is to represent truth, and that certain experiences  those that infringe or violate the common sense of reality  can never be made to seem true. Joan Didion dealt interestingly with this problem in The Year of Magical Thinking, making the surreality of her husbands death at the dinner table a space the reader could philosophically inhabit. And likewise Alexandra Fuller, writing about her often tragically idiosyncratic African childhood in Dont Lets Go to the Dogs Tonight, brilliantly succeeded in retaining a childs astonished objectivity at the unfolding of bizarre events.

title: At Versailles, a Very French Response to Terrorist Attack
description: The Chteau de Versailles has mounted its own response to the attack on Charlie Hebdo, placing a rarely seen portrait of Voltaire front and center in the main tourist circuit inside the palace.

title: House Passes Legislation to Ease Some Dodd-Frank Financial Rules
description: WASHINGTON  The House on Wednesday easily passed legislation to ease some of the banking regulations adopted after the financial crisis, with 29 Democrats shrugging off President Obamas veto threat to join united House Republicans.

title: Alan Gilbert: By the Book
description: The conductor and music director of The New York Philharmonic says that after his cameo appearance on 30 Rock, he read Tina Feys Bossypants: It is brilliant, insightful and spot on in its crazy observations about life.

title: Devil May Be in the Details on European Central Bank Bond-Buying
description: FRANKFURT  A court opinion issued on Wednesday makes it all but certain that the European Central Bank will announce a major round of economic stimulus next week, after months of contentious internal debate.

title: Evocative Nudes that Allude to Matisse, Bonnard and Balthus
description: The painter Tal Rs Alstadt Girl series features a variety of women in states of repose  some of whom Tal R stops on the street to ask to pose.

title: New Charlie Hebdo Muhammad Cartoon Stirs Muslim Anger in Mideast
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon  A cover illustration of Prophet Muhammad in the latest edition of the French satirical newspaper Charlie Hebdo ignited controversy in the Middle East on Wednesday, prompting Egypt and Turkey to issue or threaten restrictions on publication of the images and stirring wide debate over religion and free speech.

title: A Conversation With Tommy Caldwell
description: EpicTV spoke with Tommy Caldwell before he embarked on the Dawn Wall climb.

title: With Familiar Bluster, Rex Ryan Signals Change Is Ahead for Buffalo Bills
description: ORCHARD PARK, N.Y.  The Buffalo Bills on Wednesday introduced their new coach, a man who needed no introduction.

title: JPMorgan Chases Results Augur a Year of Mediocrity for Big Banks
description: JPMorgan Chases fourth-quarter results augur a year of benign mediocrity for big banks.

title: House Measure Defies Obama on Immigrants
description: WASHINGTON  The House voted on Wednesday to gut major provisions of President Obamas immigration policy, approving legislation that would revoke legal protections for millions of unauthorized immigrants, including children, and put them at risk of deportation.

title: Bjrks New Album, Vulnicura, Coming in March
description: Bjrk, the singular Icelandic experimentalist, will release her ninth studio album in March, she announced on Tuesday night in a handwritten note on her website.

title: Inside Charlie Hebdo: Reporters Notebook
description: Rachel Donadio, culture correspondent in Paris, wrote about the Charlie Hebdo effort to put together the first, post-terror attack, issue of the paper; here, she describes the scene inside the Charlie Hebdo office.

title: Cooking From the Freezer and Pantry: Miscellaneous Pork and Chicken Posole
description: Cooking the pantry dry is definitely not something that can be done with a high reliance on actual recipes. No, this is a process that takes a whole lot of winging it.

title: Apple and Ericsson Sue Each Other Over Mobile Patents
description: Apple and Ericsson have sued each other in federal courts after reaching an impasse over mobile patents.

title: Improvements Made to Crossword iOS App
description: SPECIAL POST  A long list of improvements and bug fixes have been made to The New York Times Crossword app for iPhone and iPad, the mobile app team reports.

title: The Most Debated Room for Debates
Rival Palestinian Checkpoints in Gaza Show Cracks in Reconciliation Pact
description: BEIT HANOUN, Gaza Strip  A potent symbol of the schism between the Palestinian Authority and Hamas, the Islamist group that dominates Gaza, has been visible at the border crossing here for years: The two maintain separate checkpoints a half-mile apart, and travelers crossing to or from Israel have to pass through both.

title: Mutual Fund Billionaire Accused of Fraud in Suit
description: Charles B. Johnson has been lauded for numerous accomplishments.

title: Approval Update: Obama Up, G.O.P. Down
description: President Obama took a drubbing in the November elections and is the subject of constant attacks by the new Republican majority in Congress, which has taken issue with his recent executive action on immigration. But Americans appear to be gaining confidence in the president as he enters his seventh year on the job.

title: Brando as Godfather of Housing Crisis
description: Marlon Brando made his 21st-century Off Off Broadway debut this week, at the Ellen Stewart Theater on East Fourth Street. Dead for more than a decade, Brando looks great and not so great in the role of Sir John Brickman, a self-made British property baron of the 19th century.

title: Ninth Week at No. 1 for Taylor Swift
description: Taylor Swift rules the album charts yet again, in a slow week of sales as the music industry gears up for the Grammy Awards next month.

title: Holder Fortifies Protection of News Medias Phone Records, Notes or Emails
description: WASHINGTON  Attorney General Eric H. Holder Jr. on Wednesday eliminated what journalism groups worried could be used as a loophole in the rules governing how and when prosecutors can subpoena journalists.

title: Getting Government Into the Broadband Internet Business
description: Broadband Internet service in most American cities is slow and expensive because cable and telephone companies have locked up the market. Despite years of trying, regulators and lawmakers have struggled to introduce more competition, which is why President Obama said on Wednesday that he wants to make it easier for local governments to get into the broadband business.

title: Readers Sound Off to Public Editor on Decision Not to Publish Cartoons
description: Ive seen intense response from Times readers before. When I wrote about the test drive of a Tesla electric car, or Nate Silvers offer to place a bet on his prognostications, hundreds of readers commented and emailed. When I wrote about coverage of the Israeli-Palestinian conflict, readers certainly let me know what they thought.

title: Gigi, With Vanessa Hudgens, Sets Spring Broadway Opening Date
description: A Broadway revival of Gigi, the 1973 musical by Alan Jay Lerner and Frederick Loewe about a Parisian girl being trained as a courtesan, will begin performances in March at the Neil Simon Theater with Vanessa Hudgens (Disney Channels High School Musical) in the title role, the producers announced on Wednesday.

title: Charlie Hebdos New Cartoon
Cash Is Piling Up for Ben Carson, With a Tea Party Tilt
description: As a political outsider, Ben Carson, a retired pediatric neurosurgeon, is given only a slight chance of winning the Republican presidential nomination.

title: Lincoln Center and New York Philharmonic to Collaborate on Operas
description: For years, the Metropolitan Opera has gently encroached on the symphonic terrain of its Lincoln Center neighbors with orchestral concerts at Carnegie Hall. Now the shoe is on the other foot: Lincoln Center and the New York Philharmonic said on Wednesday that they would join forces to mount several fully staged opera productions.

title: Bernie Sanders Forces Republicans to State Their Views on Climate Change
description: With Senate majority leader Mitch McConnell promising an open debate on the Keystone XL pipeline bill, Senator Bernie Sanders, the maverick Independent from Vermont, has crafted a beauty of an amendment. He plans to offer a sense of Congress resolution in the debate asking each senator if he or she agrees with the opinion of virtually the entire worldwide scientific community that climate change is a factually proven problem resulting in devastating problems in the United States and around the world.

title: A Pro Skiers Birthday Present
description: For pro skier Tim Durtschis birthday, he traveled into the backcountry of Jackson Hole, Wyo., to make a huge backcountry jump.

title: Tempering His Strut, a Peacock Soars Without Overpowering
description: Tenors, as a group, are notorious for supposed musical bad behavior. They add in high notes where none exist and sit for hours on the ones actually in the score. They are said to ignore their colleagues and milk the crowd.

title: Carlos Slim More Than Doubles His Stake in Times Company
description: The Mexican billionaire Carlos Slim Hel has more than doubled his stake in The New York Times Company, to nearly 17 percent, the company said on Wednesday.

title: Tony Nominees Pepper Broadway Cast of Something Rotten!
description: Three Tony-nominated character actors will round out the cast of the upcoming Broadway musical comedy Something Rotten!, its producer, Kevin McCollum, announced on Wednesday.

title: Je Suis Charlie et Ahmed: Teaching and Learning About the Charlie Hebdo Attacks
description: Overview |  Three days of bloodshed last week shook France, a nation struggling with Islamic extremists, and sent shock waves through Europe and beyond. On Jan. 7, a terrorist attack by masked gunmen on the newspaper Charlie Hebdo left 12 people dead. On Jan. 9, the French police killed three terrorists in raids at a printing plant and a kosher supermarket that left the gunmen and four Jewish hostages dead. In all, at least 17 French citizens were killed by terrorists in the chaos.

title: Video: A Pro Skiers Birthday Present
description: Behind the Line is a video series produced by Teton Gravity Research that takes you into the minds of skiers. In each episode, the athletes will look back on a line, a jump or a session, and discuss the moment.

title: Argentine President Accused of Cover-Up in Bombing Inquiry
description: BUENOS AIRES  A special prosecutor on Wednesday formally accused President Cristina Fernndez de Kirchner and Hctor Timerman, her foreign minister, of a cover-up related to an agreement between Iran and Argentina to expedite the investigation into a 1994 bombing of a Jewish community center here.

title: A New Trip to See Tigers in India
description: Although the newest Jungle Book movie adaptation isnt due in theaters until the fall, one outfitter is offering jungle excursions in the Indian wilderness that inspired Rudyard Kiplings original 1894 story.

title: Tapping the Past for Fresh Sounds
description: Not every career has a watershed moment. But the violinist Johnny Gandelsman, who gave a mesmerizing performance of Bachs sonatas and partitas for unaccompanied violin at Bargemusic on Saturday, recalled the pivotal experience that forever changed his approach to this music.

title: Pictures of the Day: France and Elsewhere
description: France and More  Pictures of the Day

title: Amazon Comes Out Swinging
description: Amazon wont be sneaking up on anyone this time. Its posting its latest batch of original pilots on Thursday, just a few days after winning a Golden Globe for one of the shows from the last batch, Transparent. Last week it was the supporting player of streaming video on demand; now its pushing Netflix for the lead role.

title: A Crooner and a Belter All in One
description: As Cheyenne Jackson closed his eyes and crooned Falling Slowly with an unwavering intensity on Tuesday evening at Caf Carlyle, this great ballad from Once never sounded more profound and mysterious. For a moment, Mr. Jackson, who was joined on harmony vocal by his excellent musical director, Willy Beaman, transcended his wholesome image of a handsome, genial all-American boy from northeast Washington State who once played Elvis Presley on Broadway and went deep.

title: Evocative Nudes That Allude to Matisse, Bonnard and Balthus
description: Ever been stopped on the street and been asked to pose nude for a painting? There are people you look at that you want to draw, says Tal R, the figurative painter whose mysterious last initial hides as much as the whispers of his aspirated English. The Israeli-born artist  the R stands for Rosenzweig  specializes in florid canvases, especially his new series Altstadt Girl: naked women in all states of repose, vivid in red. One is a 16-year-old whose mother granted permission for her to model: She was smoking in this beautiful arrogant way that you do when you are young because you own the world, the artist says.

title: Facing a Desert Plague of Poisonings
description: Becky Mastermans first book, Rage Against the Dying (2013), introduced a highly original heroine for a detective series. She was Brigid Quinn, an ex-F.B.I. agent old enough to be mistaken for a fragile granny by a sexual predator, who spied her out hiking one day and tried to shove her into his van. Boy, was that sexual predator ever sorry. At 59, Brigid had a white ponytail and a walking stick  but she also had 40 years worth of vigorous conditioning and a wicked way of fighting. That walking stick came equipped with a razor blade.

title: Latest Witness Video of Gunmen Outside Charlie Hebdo Office Adds to Picture of Attack Aftermath
description: Video recorded by a witness minutes after the deadly attack on the offices of the satirical weekly Charlie Hebdo last Wednesday in Paris offers the clearest images of the gunmen claiming responsibility, and linking the killings to cartoons mocking the Prophet Muhammad.

title: Resignation of President Will Test Italys Premier
description: ROME  President Giorgio Napolitano resigned on Wednesday, and the intense political maneuvering to choose his successor may become a minefield for Prime Minister Matteo Renzi.

title: Paddingtons Forebear: A Talk With Michael Bond
description: LONDON  Mr. and Mrs. Brown first met Paddington on a railway platform. In fact, that was how he came to have such an unusual name for a bear, for Paddington was the name of the station.

title: An Epic, Sequined Hit Parade
description: Imagine running a marathon in stilettos. While singing your heart out. Thats the kind of mad feat the singular performer Taylor Mac has embarked upon in his magnum opus, A 24-Decade History of Popular Music, which will ultimately climax in an epic show to be performed for 24 straight hours.

title: Use the iPhones iOS 8 Like a Pro
description: You probably didnt know about these five features hidden in the iPhones iOS 8 operating system. Use them, and youll be using your phone like a pro.

title: Video Feature: Getting the Most Out of Apple iOS 8
description: EVERY new mobile operating system needs a little time to settle in. But now that Apples iOS 8 has been out about four months  long enough to fix some bugs in iOS 8.1  we have had some time to get used to its new features.

title: Jennifer Aniston
description: Ms. Aniston, who plays a woman in chronic pain in Cake, is more closely associated with her hairdresser, Chris McMillan, than any wardrobe stylist.

title: Four Demoted at Secret Service in Wake of Scandals
description: WASHINGTON  The Secret Services interim director has demoted four of the agencys senior executives as part of a management shake-up after a series of scandals, the agency said Wednesday.

title: Remembering a Musician Who Specialized in Empathy
description: Charlie didnt have sarcasm or irony, the bassist Putter Smith said at Charlie Hadens memorial concert at Town Hall on Tuesday. He had true empathy.

title: Police in Dresden, Germany, Investigate Refugees Murder
description: BERLIN  The police in Dresden are investigating the murder of a 20-year-old Eritrean refugee who was found dead Tuesday with stab wounds to his chest and neck, officials said Wednesday.

title: Man Is Held in Inquiry on Capitol Attack Plot
description: WASHINGTON  An Ohio man who had hoped to ally himself with the Islamic State was arrested Wednesday in connection with a planned attack on the United States Capitol, federal authorities said.

description: Crocheted style.

description: Investor confidence in the education technology sector suddenly looks a lot more serious  at least for digital learning companies with proven business models.

description: Catch up on the days top story.

title: Shopping with Ben Bischoff
description: The proper cabinet hardware looks good and feels special on your fingertips.

title: Like Snow, Only More Fun
description: Winter white pointy-toe ankle boots.

title: Undetected Defense at Edgar Kaplan Winter Regional
description: On Dec. 30, the final day of the Edgar Kaplan Winter Regional in Manhattan, the Truscott Board-a-Match Teams was won by Jared Lilienstein, Michael Polowan and Sam Lev of New York City, and Ron Smith of Las Vegas. They finished more than three boards ahead of Melanie Tucker, Radu Nistor and John Hurd of New York City, and John Kranyak of Las Vegas. Third were Dori Byrnes of Morris Plains, N.J.; Michael Kopera and Craig Ganzer of New York City; William Ehlers of Livingston, N.J.; and Robert Brady of McLean, Va.

description: I

title: New Research May Solve Puzzle in Sea Levels Rise
description: A team of researchers reported Wednesday that the ocean did not rise quite as much as previously believed in the 20th century. They proposed a seemingly tiny adjustment that could make a big difference in scientific understanding of the looming problem of sea-level rise.

title: The Other Detroit Auto Show
description: While automakers show off new cars at the Cobo Center this week, plenty of classics can be found abandoned around the city.

title: The Other Auto Show in Detroit
description: Not far from the glamour of the Detroit International Auto Show this week, one photographer found an auto show of another sort  like in many cities, there were cars of yesterday, slowing rusting and rotting around town.

title: Pursuing the Impossible, and Coming Out on Top
description: YOSEMITE NATIONAL PARK, Calif.  On the 19th day of their climb, Tommy Caldwell and Kevin Jorgeson, both now bearded, reached the summit of El Capitans Dawn Wall, completing a quest that included years of planning and that many considered the most challenging rock climb in the world.

title: Justin Bieber for Calvin Klein: Seeing May Not Be Believing
description: After days of fevered speculation, charges of Photoshopping and retaliatory threats of legal action, as well as hundreds of tweets and retweets on the subject, Elle magazine sent out a news alert on Sunday afternoon that seemed designed to put the first big controversy of 2015 to rest:

title: Focusing on the Margins of Society
description: GIUSEPPE MAKES A MOVIE

title: Inhabiting Wes Andersons Universe
description: Matt Zoller Seitz is a film historian, TV critic (for New York magazine and Vulture.com), filmmaker and the editor of Rogerebert.com. He is also a connoisseur of the oeuvre of the idiosyncratic filmmaker Wes Anderson and the creator of The Wes Anderson Collection, a medley of essays, interviews and illustrations in a coffee-table-size book published last year. It is as hyper-designed and meticulous as an Anderson film.

title: The Uproar Over Amal Clooneys White Gloves
description: At the Golden Globes on Sunday night, the fastidious Amal Clooney made what passed for red carpet history, turning the proceedings at the Beverly Hilton hotel into something resembling an affair of state. For better or worse, depending on which critic one consults, she pulled off that dubious feat by accenting her dramatic one-shoulder Dior haute couture dress with a pair of pristine opera gloves.

title: At Home with Peggy Cooper Cafritz
description: The Washington saloniste has had epic triumphs and losses, including a fire that destroyed her art collection. Now shes built it all back.

title: Obama Calls for Broadband Competition
description: President Obama said he wanted more competition between Internet providers so that more Americans could have access to affordable high-speed connections.

title: Sales at ABC Carpet & Home, Design Within Reach, Treillage and the Metropolitan Museum of Art Store
description: Many items are up to 70 percent off at ABC Carpet & Home through Jan. 26 (a Glas Italia pink Calice side table, originally $1,295, is $649); 881 and 888 Broadway (19th Street), 212-473-3000, and 1055 Bronx River Avenue (Bruckner Boulevard), 718-842-8772, and locations nationwide, abchome.com.

title: Jan. 14, 2015  Pictures of the Day
description: Photos from France, Kosovo, India and Spain.

title: Thank You for Supporting The Collection Newsletter
description: Dear readers,

title: Peggy Cooper Cafritz: Everything in a Big Way
description: WASHINGTON  It was five years ago last August that Peggy Cooper Cafritzs entire life was erased by a fire that tore through her elegant, art-filled house here.

title: Sensory Overload Is Part of the Script
description: You could say that the performer Andrew Schneider has tricks up his sleeve. Except he isnt wearing any. In Mr. Schneiders inventive, astounding and inexplicably shirtless Youarenowhere, part of the Coil festival, digital marvels synchronize with analog dance and personal revelation.

title: System Design: More Than 100 Years of Everyday Chaos Opens in Cologne
description: System Design: More Than 100 Years of Everyday Chaos, which opens Tuesday at the Museum of Applied Arts in Cologne, Germany, makes the case for the role of chaos as the principle governing our lives. The curator, Ren Spitz, believes that the systems seen in the design that surrounds us wage a fight against chaos, but that the systems inevitably lose.

title: What Happened to Risk on the Red Carpet?
description: Will that go off in a metal detector? Ryan Seacrest asked as he greeted Emma Stone, who met his gaze with a coy smile and plenty of attitude.

title: Eric Foners Gateway to Freedom
description: Mr. Foners new book about the Underground Railroad began with the notebook of an abolitionist newspaper editor.

title: Sleepy Thoughts
description: Alessandra Baldereschis soft headboards could easily be mistaken for puffy wall art. Yet these upholstered pieces are entirely functional and were created out of necessity.

title: From Deborah Bowness, Wallpaper That Mimics Walls Themselves
description: For years, Deborah Bowness, a British wallpaper artist, has designed photographic murals showing the kinds of objects that sit against walls: things like bookcases, chairs and frames. Now she is producing wallpaper that displays the walls themselves. Her new digitally printed collection offers rusted corrugated tin siding, Russian graffiti, postings on a notice board in Hastings, England, and simple brick or cinder block.

title: In Remote Thai Villages, Legacy of Chinas Lost Army Endures
description: BAN RAK THAI, Thailand  At night, traditional Chinese red lanterns illuminate the hotels, shop fronts and Yunnanese-style restaurants lining the main road in this highland village of just over 1,000 people. On one recent evening, as the mist rose off a nearby reservoir, the mellifluous voice of the popular Taiwanese singer Teresa Teng could be heard wafting out from one of the villages several tea shops.

title: What Would You Grab in a Fire?
description: CHICAGO  I was getting ready for bed when I heard sirens. No big deal in the city, right? We hear them all the time. I brushed my teeth  they got louder. Tossed my pants on the bathroom floor  louder, closer, and when I went into the living room I saw red lights slicing through the blinds.

title: Words From the Past Illuminate a Station on the Way to Freedom
description: Eric Foner has won a place in the front rank of American historians with books that seem to vacuum up all available sources to produce bold new interpretations of the countrys reckoning with the big questions of slavery and freedom.

title: The One-in-a-Million Farmhouse
description: It was easy to embrace a dilapidated farmhouse when the buyers saw the chunk of property it sat on.

title: With Wide-Open Acres
description: There is a lesson to be taken from how Christina Salway and her husband, John Moskowitz, came to buy a farmhouse near Callicoon, N.Y., in Sullivan County, a year and a half ago. The lesson, depending on your point of view, is either dont peer into the windows of real estate offices or  if you do and find the country home youve always wanted  seize the opportunity.

title: What Can I Do About Messy Foot Traffic During Winter Open Houses?
description: Q. What can I do about messy foot traffic during winter showings?

title: Cabinet Pulls: All the Right Touches
description: The hardware you put on your cabinets is just as important as the faucets you pick out for your kitchen and bathroom sinks or the doorknobs you choose.

title: Its Like Money in the Bank
description: The glazed ceramic Nola money box is an adult spin on the childs piggy bank. Instead of coins, it holds bills.

title: Study Highlights Silicon Valleys Powerful Economic Mix
description: Silicon Valley, for all its costs and social woes, is still a technology industry paradise, according to a report issued on Wednesday.

title: Fort Fisher II: Fiasco
description: After the failed attack on Fort Fisher in December 1864, General Grant, knowing the character of both General Butler and Admiral Porter, the co- commanders of the Union forces, had no doubt which man was at fault.

title: Designers Offer Daring Outfit Ideas for Awards Shows.
description: A handful of designers were invited, in advance of awards season, to sketch their hypothetical concepts for modern red-carpet looks.

title: Robert Frank, Telling It Like It Was
description: Robert Franks favorite image from The Americans captures the contradiction of racism in the liberal climes of mid-century San Francisco.

title: Tools to Improve That Christmas Present
description: FOUND yourself with a new tablet, smartphone or flat-screen TV as a holiday gift? These handy products and services will help you get the most out of your new electronic device.

title: Some Copies of Charlie Hebdo Heading to U.S.
description: Readers in America clamoring for the latest copy of the French satirical newspaper Charlie Hebdo will probably struggle to find one the next few days, its distributors and stores seeking the latest issue said Wednesday.

title: Conservatives in Name Only
description: WASHINGTON  WE live in an era of unusual political polarization, but the polarization isnt simply between the two parties; there are also splits within them.

title: Modern Red-Carpet Looks, in a Perfect World
description: His scrollwork embroideries and sophisticated florals have yet to garner a reliable red-carpet following for Antonio Marras. No matter. The designers aims are lofty: Nothing less, he said, than to try to defeat banality and platitudes in fashion.

title: Winter Wardrobe Refreshers
description: Crochet, a prominent spring runway trend, has made an unexpected early showing on the red carpet. At a recent premiere in London, the Swedish actress Alicia Vikander wore an airy crochet number from Louis Vuitton (above right). Dakota Fanning and Kim Kardashian also got their hands on hot runway looks, Ms. Fanning in a crochet Proenza Schouler (right) and Ms. Kardashian in a revealing wide-mesh Balenciaga (above left). Day or evening, any of these dresses would be pretty fabulous to pack for a warmer place, where they could appropriately be worn over, say, just two pieces.

title: Whispers Amid the Shouts at the New DSquared Store
description: Of all the ways to get dressed  for work, for exercise, for relaxation, for sex, for travel, for war  getting dressed whimsically is maybe the least credible.

title: Why Drugs Cost So Much
description: ELI LILLY charges more than $13,000 a month for Cyramza, the newest drug to treat stomach cancer. The latest medicine for lung cancer, Novartiss Zykadia, costs almost $14,000 a month. Amgens Blincyto, for leukemia, will cost $64,000 a month.

title: The Jihadist in Our Family
description: Why would Mohd Lotfi Ariffin leave his wife and children behind in Malaysia in search of martyrdom in Syria?

title: The Jihadist in Our Family
description: KUALA KETIL, Malaysia  A year ago, Mohd Lotfi Ariffin bid his family goodbye and headed for Syria, where he intended to fulfill what he saw as his religious duty fighting President Bashar al-Assad. He left behind his wife, their six children and his job as a religious school teacher here to fight with his fellow Sunnis more than 4,000 miles away.

title: The Complexity of Deadly Force
description: Another video in another police shooting emerged this week  and it shows yet another case that demands empathy, and an understanding of the fraught moments that can lead to such an outcome, and the complexity of the legal process that follows.

title: F.D.A. Approves Surgical Implant to Treat Obesity
description: The Food and Drug Administration on Wednesday approved a surgically implanted device to treat obesity in some adults.

title: Is Disability Pay Hampering Veterans Future?
description: To the Editor:

title: A Girl Used as a Bomber
description: To the Editor:

title: Obamas First Two Years
description: To the Editor:

title: Cellphones in New York Public Schools
description: To the Editor:

title: West Virginia Withdraws Altered Climate Curriculum
description: West Virginia education officials on Wednesday retreated from an earlier curriculum decision that expressed doubts about widely held views of climate change.

title: Bring Back Cubicles?
After Suspending Supplier, Chipotle Takes Pork Off Menu in 600 Stores
description: Signs have gone up in about 600 Chipotle Mexican Grill restaurants, informing customers that no carnitas will be served.

title: Shopping Sales and Events in New York City
description: Its normal this time of year for stores to be making room for new merchandise, but leave it to Dover Street Market to close for three days for a full-on seasonal changeover. Reopening Saturday, the luxury emporium will debut several dedicated shop-in-shops and exclusive collections. On the third floor, look out for the first permanent United States retail space for Idea Books, the London distributor of rare art and fashion books and magazines  4 x 4 by Richard Prince ($195) and Visionaire No. 20: Comme des Garons ($1,750) may entice  and a new home for Miu Miu. In the DSM Showroom for emerging designers on the fourth floor, youll find an oversize V-neck mesh top ($1,530) and a neoprene and space-mesh skirt with bow ($930) designed by Andrea Jiapei Li, a recent graduate from the M.F.A. program at Parsons the New School of Design; and a conceptual taffeta party frock ($2,675) from the Central Saint Martins alumna Molly Goddard. At 160 Lexington Avenue.

title: Fistfuls of Cash Spilled on Expressway Swirl in Young Imaginations Only
description: Five teenage boys in Corona, Queens, awoke on Wednesday to the sort of question that can shape a young mans future, dividing life into two sections: the part before that morning, and the part that followed.

title: Flocking to Buy Charlie Hebdo, Citizens Signal Their Support of Free Speech
description: For people who are supporters of not just free speech but newspapers, too, the images of Parisians queued up at dawn Wednesday to get their hands on a printed artifact was heartening. The French distributors of the satirical newspaper Charlie Hebdo said the latest issues initial printing of three million copies had been increased to perhaps five million, and there were reports that the now-precious editions were being auctioned on eBay for hundreds of dollars.

title: Far Ahead of Curve, a 6-Year-Old Thrills a Nation
description: ABU DHABI, United Arab Emirates  On a sparkling morning here in December, I stepped into a red-and-black driving suit, slipped on a helmet and eased my car up to the start line alongside this countrys most famous motorsports star.

title: Facebook Looks to the Workplace for Future Growth
description: Facebook doesnt just want to be the worlds leading social network for people to communicate about their personal lives. It wants to host workplace chatter, too.

title: Manhattan Judge Offers Deal to Driver Who Killed Girl, 4
description: A Manhattan judge offered a plea deal on Wednesday to a troubled teenage driver accused of killing a 4-year-old girl while racing away from the police, putting forward a more lenient punishment than prosecutors proposed.

title: Web Failure Slows New York Citys ID Program
description: On Monday, the de Blasio administration introduced its municipal identification program, attracting long lines and waits as applicants strained to navigate the fledgling system.

title: One Person Dies and Many Others Fall Ill After Saline Infusions
description: One person has died and many more were sickened after receiving infusions of a saline solution produced by Wallcur, a San Diego-based company, the Food and Drug Administration said Wednesday. The saline solution was meant for training purposes and was not sterile, officials said. It was shipped to medical clinics, surgical centers and urgent care facilities, some of which administered it to patients. More than 40 people are known to have received infusions, according to federal health officials. Many suffered fever, chills, tremors and headaches. So far cases have been reported in seven states: Florida, Georgia, Idaho, Louisiana, North Carolina, New York and Colorado.

title: C.I.A. Officers Are Cleared in Senate Computer Search
description: WASHINGTON  The panel investigating the Central Intelligence Agencys search of a computer network used by the Senate Intelligence Committee found that five agency officers had acted in good faith during an episode marked by confusion and poor communication, and should not be punished.

title: Obama Plans to Push Paid Family and Sick Leave for Workers
description: WASHINGTON  President Obama will announce Thursday that he is directing federal agencies to give their employees up to six weeks of paid leave after the birth or adoption of a child, a benefit he wants to extend to all American workers.

title: I Would Love for This to Open Peoples Minds
description: Minutes after reaching the top of El Capitan, after the hugs and the sprays of sparkling wine, the rock climbers Tommy Caldwell and Kevin Jorgeson spoke exclusively with John Branch of The New York Times.

title: Home, Underground
description: A decommissioned missile silo 20 miles from downtown Roswell, N.M., is looking for a new occupant.

title: As a Player, Todd Bowles Had the Aura of a Future Head Coach
description: Woody Johnson was hardly alone in believing Todd Bowles possessed N.F.L. head coaching potential. But Johnson, the Jets owner, was the first person to test that conviction, hiring Bowles to lead the team at what Johnson has defined as a critical time in its history.

title: An Islamic Reformer, Lashed
description: As one group of Islamic militants was waging war in Paris, another was slaughtering vast numbers of civilians in Baga in northern Nigeria  as many as 2,000, according to Amnesty International; only 150, according to the Nigerian government.

title: Dropouts and Politics and Cats
description: Lets talk about governors. Or college dropouts.

title: Court Takes Paternity Suit Against Spains Ex-King
description: MADRID  The Spanish Supreme Court agreed Wednesday to examine a paternity suit against King Juan Carlos filed by a Belgian woman who claims he had an affair with her mother.

title: Readers in Europe Respond to the Paris Attacks
description: In the aftermath of the deadly terrorist attacks on the Charlie Hebdo offices and a kosher grocery store in Paris last week, anxieties in France, and elsewhere in Europe, have been high. Increased security in the country has recalled the situation in the United States after the Sept. 11 attacks.

title: President of New York City Police Union Faces Internal Opposition
description: The head of the union for New York Citys police lieutenants laid out ideas for repairing a rift with Mayor Bill de Blasio. The leader of the sergeants union planned a trip to Texas to talk to black clergy members and offer suggestions for mending the police-civilian divide.

title: After an Absence, NBC Agrees to a Ringside Seat
description: To announce the return of boxing to network television, NBC staged a media event without bellowing promoters, snarling fighters, eccentric fight camp hangers-on or bitten ears. It was oddly civilized, with sushi for lunch.

title: Put In for Extra Time
description: Administrivial Win Valuable Prizes Alert! Registration is now open for the American Crossword Puzzle Tournament (which returns to its original home in Stamford, Connecticut this year), and, if you sign up before March 24, 2015, you can get $10 off the registration fee. Theres a Friday night interactive puzzle that can be solved in teams, as well as the usual conviviality and puzzle solving. Be there or be a whole bunch of tiny black and white squares.

title: Attack Raises Questions on Roots of Muslim Objection to Image-Making
description: Many Muslims upset by the caricatures of the Prophet Muhammad published in Charlie Hebdo, the French satirical newspaper, argue that the issue is not free speech but the insult to a religious figure revered by roughly a quarter of the worlds population.

title: A Business Collapse Froze His Income, and Then the Pharmacy Bills Came
description: When you are glazing doughnuts, they have to be really warm, just moments out of the fryer, for the glaze to coat them properly.

title: In Detroit, Google Makes a Case for Driverless Cars
description: DETROIT  The automobile industry has spent the last century trying to forge a visceral connection between drivers and their cars. On Wednesday, the head of Googles driverless-car program came here to declare much of that bond may soon be a thing of the past.

title: Crisis in France Is Seen as Sign of Chronic Ills
description: VAULX-EN-VELIN, France  France may have just hosted its biggest outpouring of solidarity since the end of World War II in response to the terrorist attacks last week in and around Paris that left 17 dead at the satirical newspaper Charlie Hebdo and a kosher supermarket.

title: Winning Lottery Numbers for Jan. 14, 2015
Obama Announces Moves to Encourage Expansion of Public Broadband Networks
description: CEDAR FALLS, Iowa  President Obama announced executive actions on Wednesday to expand high-speed Internet access and make it more affordable, including an effort to spur the creation of municipal broadband networks that could challenge the nations large telecommunications companies.

title: Republican Convention Set Earlier Next Year
description: WASHINGTON  The Republican National Committee announced Wednesday that it would hold next years presidential nominating convention from July 18-21, a month or more earlier than usual.

title: Phil Africa, of Black-Liberation Group Move, Long in Prison, Dies at 59
description: Phil Africa, a high-ranking member of the Philadelphia-based black-liberation group Move, who was serving a 30- to 100-year sentence in the 1978 fatal shooting of a police officer, died on Saturday at the state prison in Dallas, Pa., near Wilkes-Barre. He was 59.

title: Iran Charges, and Will Try, Jason Rezaian, WashingtonPost Reporter
description: The Washington Posts correspondent in Iran, who has been imprisoned since July for unspecified reasons, has been formally charged and will be tried in a Revolutionary Court, the countrys official Islamic Republic News Agency said Wednesday. It did not describe the charges or say when the trial would begin.

title: Nets Put On Sleepy Show After Morning Workout
description: Lionel Hollins summoned the Nets to the teams practice center in East Rutherford, N.J., to go through a shootaround Wednesday morning before a night game against the Memphis Grizzlies.

title: New York Attorney General Seeks Expanded Reports on Data Breaches
description: Across much of the United States, companies are not required to report a data breach if it is limited to the theft of email addresses and passwords, even though many companies do so of their own volition.

title: Under New Agreement, U.S. Will End Oversight of the Teamsters in Five Years
description: The federal government and the Teamsters union have agreed to replace a consent decree that has governed union affairs for more than a quarter-century with a settlement that would phase out court supervision of its activities after five years, prosecutors said on Wednesday.

title: U.S. Moves Five Yemenis From Guantnamo
description: WASHINGTON  The United States transferred five more detainees  all of them Yemenis  from the military prison at Guantnamo Bay, Cuba, on Wednesday, the Defense Department announced. Their release intensified the dispute between the Obama administration and several Republican senators over President Obamas recent flurry of transfers as he seeks to empty the American-run prison.

title: Suddenly, India Cuts Interest Rates
description: MUMBAI  Indias central bank unexpectedly cut its benchmark short-term interest rates Thursday morning by a quarter percentage point as steeply falling prices for oil and other commodities have helped bring inflation under control and allowed the bank to focus more on allowing faster economic growth.

title: Alternate-Side Parking Rules in New York in 2015
description: Following are the days on which alternate-side street-cleaning rules will be suspended in 2015.

title: New York City Education Department to Add or Expand 40 Dual-Language Programs
description: The New York City Education Department plans to expand dual-language programs offered in public schools, using the orchestra of local languages to spread bilingual little symphonies across the five boroughs  and perhaps to attract more middle-class families to poorer schools in the process.

title: Police Slowdown Cost New York City an Estimated $5 Million in Lost Fines
description: Now that New Yorks police force has returned to enforcing the laws at a pace closer to normal, city officials are calculating the costs of its protracted slowdown. Their best guess so far is that the tally will be no more than several million dollars.

title: A Most Dangerous Profession
description: On the North Shore of Oahu, 42 full-time lifeguards patrol a stretch of beach that attracts both pro surfers and amateur swimmers seeking to tangle with massive swells.

title: A Photographic  and Romantic  Duo Creates Double Self-Portraits With a Sense of Humor
description: In this weekly series, Ts photo editors share the most compelling visual projects theyve discovered.

title: Rangers Derek Stepan Is Day to Day
description: Rangers center Derek Stepan was listed as day to day after sustaining what the team called an upper-body injury Tuesday night against the Islanders.

title: Signs of a Decline in Financial Distress Connected to Medical Bills
description: After rising for a decade, the number of Americans experiencing financial distress from their medical bills has started to decline, a new survey has found.

title: Word of the Day | humanitarian
description: humanitarian \hy-ma-n-ter-e-n, y-\ adjective and noun

title: Report on New York City Jails Hiring Practices
description: Findings in the report, by the Department of Investigation, underscore the profound dysfunction at Rikers Island and help explain how a culture of violence and corruption has come to flourish in the city jails.

title: Warning Signs Overlooked in Hiring for New York City Jails
description: A recent applicant for a job as a correction officer at New York City jails had several friends who were gang members. Another had been arrested four times and had been fired from a job as a security guard for stealing from the business he was supposedly guarding.

title: Seeking Luxury Deals as Euro Falls
description: The strong dollar and threat of deflation may be wreaking havoc on European economies, but as an American consumer it has made me feel flush.

title: Defense Contractor Scheduled to Change Plea in Navy Bribery Case
description: A Malaysian defense contractor awaiting trial on corruption charges is scheduled to change his plea in a multimillion dollar bribery scheme that led to the arrest of several high-ranking Navy officials.

title: Whats on TV Thursday
description: 10:15 P.M. (TMC) IN THE NAME OF THE FATHER (1993) Daniel Day-Lewis and Pete Postlethwaite star in Jim Sheridans adaptation of Proved Innocent, Gerry Conlons memoir about an Irishman whose coerced confession for an Irish Republican Army bombing he didnt commit imprisons his father as well. Emma Thompson plays the lawyer who tries to free them. Writing in The New York Times, Janet Maslin called the film, which was nominated for seven Oscars, scathingly brilliant and Mr. Day-Lewiss performance dazzling.

title: The Other Detroit Auto Show
description: While automakers show off new cars at the Cobo Center this week, plenty of classics can be found abandoned around the city.

title: Quotation of the Day
description: I think everyone has their own secret Dawn Wall to complete one day, and maybe they can put this project in their own context.

title: Corrections: January 15, 2015
description: FRONT PAGE

title: Trying to Solve the Great Wage Slowdown
description: After almost 15 years of a disappointing economy, its easy to get pessimistic. Incomes for the middle class and poor have now been stagnating over a two-term Republican presidency and well into a two-term Democratic one. The great wage slowdown of the 21st century has frustrated Americans, polls show, and raised serious questions about what kind of policies, if any, might change the situation.

title: Time to Test North Koreas Intentions
description: North Korea thrust itself back into the international limelight with its recent hacking of Sony Pictures. As always, however, the gravest danger from North Korea is the threat that its unpredictable leaders could one day unleash a nuclear weapon, either in anger or by mistake.

title: How to Spend New Yorks Spare $5 Billion
description: Heres a scary thought: New York States politicians suddenly have an extra $5 billion to spend. Albanys treasury is fat with the states share of fines paid by financial institutions for past misconduct. And in all but a few cases, there are no real strings attached. So the scrum has started, with virtually every politician and interest group and government entity scrambling for a share of the windfall.

title: Expanding Community College Access
description: In the abstract, President Obamas proposal for making community college tuition-free seems a reasonable response to a troublesome fact: The American work force is less educated than it needs to be at a time when most jobs in the new economy will require some college education. But for such an idea to work, states and localities that have been starving community colleges for decades will need to begin holding them to higher standards and commit to sustained financing instead of using the new federal money to dodge their own financial obligations.

title: Test Yourself | In Case You Missed It
description: Below are the first six paragraphs from a Jan. 2 article, The Unending Anxiety of an ICYMI World.

title: 6 Qs About the News | Impossible Task? Climbers Come Out on Top
description: In Impossible Task? Climbers Come Out on Top John Branch writes about two men who just completed what is considered to be the most challenging rock climb in the world.

title: Hired, Fired and Ready for a New Tennis Season
description: As another tennis season begins in earnest with next weeks Australian Open, the cards may or may not have been reshuffled but the support staffs definitely have been.

title: Should Newspapers Reprint Cartoons of the Prophet Muhammad That Some Deem Offensive?
description: Newspapers around the world had a choice this past week. They could republish cartoons of the Prophet Muhammad that originally ran in the French satirical paper Charlie Hebdo, which was attacked last week by terrorists. Or they could choose not to.

title: Robert Frank, Telling It Like It Was
description: One of the most consequential images in Robert Franks The Americans is a raw, cinematic photograph of a black couple in San Francisco in 1956. Approaching them from behind as the pair relaxed on a grassy hill overlooking the city, Mr. Frank disrupted their solitude. Startled, they turned to acknowledge him. The woman was annoyed. The man crouched protectively. As his eyes locked on the photographer, his expression hardened into a scowl.The couple seemed determined to protect themselves and their dignity.

title: German Economy Expanded 1.5% in 2014
description: FRANKFURT  Germanys economy accelerated in the final quarter of 2014 as consumer spending picked up, according to data published on Thursday, a sign that the largest economy in the eurozone could perform moderately better than expected in 2015.

title: Filipinos, Their Faith Strong but Shifting, Hail Pope
description: MANILA  Cheering throngs greeted Pope Francis when he arrived in the deeply Catholic Philippines on Thursday evening, the first papal visit in 20 years to a country whose church is struggling with profound social changes and a decline in political power.

title: In India, a Banker in Defense Mode
description: MUMBAI  Few central bankers in emerging markets have been as internationally lionized as Raghuram G. Rajan of India.

title: Your Thursday Briefing
description: Good morning.

title: New York Today: Get-Rich-Quick Dreams
description: Good morning on this somewhat warmer Thursday.

title: Swiss Franc Soars After Central Bank Drops Cap
description: PARIS  Switzerland stunned the markets on Thursday by abandoning a crucial part of its effort to hold down the value of its currency, concluding that the strategy was too risky and too costly given the enormous forces pushing in the other direction.

title: Daily Report: Starring in Your Own Snapchat Story
description: An original promise of social media was that it mimicked real life. Sites like Facebook, Twitter and Instagram offered places to capture and share your memories, but after using them for several years, I feel like someone who was sold a lemon by a used-car salesman, Nick Bilton writes in his Disruptions column.

title: Oscar Nominations 2015: Birdman and Grand Budapest Hotel Lead the Pack
description: LOS ANGELES Alejandro G. Irritus Birdman and Richard Linklaters Boyhood were showered with honors on Thursday as the Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences confirmed whats been whispered for months: Those are the films to beat at the 87th Oscar show on Feb. 22.

title: 1890: Moving Day in Paris
description: PARIS  The highways and byeways of the metropolis were disfigured yesterday from dawn till dark with countless furniture vans, which, laden down and creaking under the weight of beds, boxes, book cases, chairs, stoves, carpets, tables and all the thousand and one things which go to make up a home, crawled along with cracking whips and swearing drivers, bringing the penates of many an unsettled family to some new abiding place. It was the fifteenth of January, dreaded day when grinding landlords and landladies insist on having their quarters rent.  The New York Herald, European Edition, Jan. 16, 1890

title: French Rein In Speech Backing Acts of Terror
description: PARIS  The French authorities are moving aggressively to rein in speech supporting terrorism, employing a new law to mete out tough prison sentences in a crackdown that is stoking a free-speech debate after last weeks attacks in Paris.

title: Caesars Unit Files for Chapter 11 Bankruptcy Protection
description: The casino operator Caesars Entertainment was locked in a bitter standoff with some creditors on Thursday after it put its largest unit into bankruptcy.

title: Throwback Thursday | Cat People and Dog People
description: Its worth reading all of this 1872 editiorial (PDF), headlined Cats and Craziness, to follow the authors full argument that lunatics often have an excessive fondness for cats.

title: Oklahoma Executes First Inmate Since Slipshod Injection in April
description: McALESTER, Okla.  With a renovated death chamber, new training and a higher dose of drugs, Oklahoma on Thursday carried out its first execution since April, when the slipshod, prolonged killing of Clayton D. Lockett led the state to suspend lethal injections and change its procedures.

title: Today in Politics
description: Senate Democrats Regroup in Baltimore as G.O.P. Savors Victory

title: Court Winnows Jury Pool in Boston Marathon Bombing Trial
description: BOSTON  One potential juror said his wife was an intensive care nurse who had treated victims of the Boston Marathon bombing. Another had posted comments on social media while his neighborhood was on lockdown during a manhunt for the suspects. Yet another said he could not imagine any evidence that would make him think the defendant was innocent  and his friends had told him it would be cool to impose the death sentence.

title: Researchers Propose Earths Anthropocene Age of Humans Began With Fallout and Plastics
description: As many readers are aware, Ive been writing since 1992 about the notion that weve left the Holocene behind  thats the geological epoch since the end of the last ice age  and entered a post-Holocenegeological age of our own making, now best known as the Anthropocene.

title: China Debates How to Manage Unruly Airline Passengers
description: A spate of passengers opening the emergency doors of taxiing airplanes in China has led to calls for tougher punishment of unruly fliers.

title: Bank of Americas Profit Falls 11%, Hurt by Consumer Loans and Investment Banking
description: Bank of America on Thursday reported fourth-quarter results that fell short of expectations, sending a lackluster signal about the state of banking and the wider economy.

title: A Dark Prince Steps Into the Light
description: WEST HOLLYWOOD, Calif.  Were drinking wodka, Marilyn Manson said, pronouncing the word like he was a fur-hatted Russian cartoon character, and filling a tumbler. Two tumblers: Like any peacocking musician, he knew that a drinking buddy makes for a ready audience.

title: Cartoons Spoofing Corrupt Politicians in China Anger City
description: President Xi Jinping of China has vowed that there will be no relenting in his sweeping crackdown on official corruption, but an artist in the central city of Changsha who mounted his own campaign is facing a government slap down.

title: Morning Agenda: Profit Slides at Bank of America
description: Bank of America reported uninspiring fourth-quarter results on Thursday, saying its earnings fell to $3.05 billion, or 25 cents a share, from $3.44 billion, or 29 cents a share, in the period a year earlier, DealBooks Peter Eavis reports. Analysts polled by Thomson Reuters had forecast that the bank would earn 31 cents a share in the latest quarter.

title: Daily Clip Report
description: Good morning. Here is Daily Clip Report, a collection of articles about The Times and the media sent by email each morning to senior executives and newsroom editors. The email is produced by the Corporate Communications Department at The Times.

title: Frances Jews Have No Choice but Israel
description: TEL AVIV  There is great irony to Israels instinctive response to terror attacks on Jews in Europe  and the devastating attack last week on a kosher grocery store in Paris was no different.

title: Citigroup Profit Plunges on Weak Trading and Legal Costs
description: A steeper than expected trading slowdown dented Citigroups earnings in the fourth quarter, contributing to the banks failure to meet analysts profit expectations and raising a fresh round of questions about the future of the Wall Street trading machine.

title: U.S. to Help Bulgaria Depend Less on Russians
description: SOFIA, Bulgaria  Secretary of State John Kerry said Thursday that the United States would help Bulgaria reduce its dependence on Russia for energy supplies.

title: A Pair of Familiar Boots
description: John Cameron Mitchell stars in Hedwig and the Angry Inch on Broadway, in a part he has played elsewhere.

title: Its Just a Shot Away
description: More than 50 years of Rolling Stones images, collected.

title: Jumpin Jack Flash Bulb
description: Last June, I experienced the Rolling Stones live like I never had in the past: four shows, four European cities, four countries  in a frenetic two-week stretch.

title: BlackRocks Profit Slips Despite Strong Flows Into Its Funds
description: BlackRock, the worlds largest money manager, continued to benefit from strong investor inflows in the fourth quarter, although the companys growth was down slightly compared with results in the period a year earlier.

title: 2015 Oscar Nominations
description: Nominations for the 87th Academy Awards were announced on Thursday.

title: Show Leigh Steinberg the Money (Again)
description: Leigh Steinberg stepped onto the football field at Southern Methodist University under a cloudy Texas sky. At events he hosts  like his gigantic annual Super Bowl bash  Steinberg, a sports agent, is accustomed to parading around like a presidential candidate, working the crowd with a boyish smile and a pinstripe suit. On the Dallas campus last March, in his sweatshirt and baggy bluejeans, Steinberg looked more like a guy at the local horse track. He riffled through a booklet of notes and popped a stick of Nicorette into his mouth. His client, the quarterback Garrett Gilbert, was the one who had to put on a show in front of more than 30 N.F.L. scouts, but Steinbergs own prospects were also being tested.

title: Surf Is Fierce, but So Are They
description: HALEIWA, Hawaii  Dusk masked the approaching waves at Banzai Pipeline on the North Shore of Oahu as they climbed to 15 feet before pounding the shallow, jagged reef below. Adrift in the rapid current and foamy sea was a photographer, exhausted from battling the relentless waves and fighting for his life.

title: An Upper East Side Apartment in a Hurry
description: Joseph Nawy grew up on Manhattans Upper West Side. After his marriage, he lived first in Queens and then in New Jersey. When his two sons were grown, he and his wife moved to Tennessee for work. Shortly thereafter, his wife died.

title: The Weird Science of Naming New Products
