description: Workplace dysfunction, indifference and power struggles at the Hartford Registrar of Voters office contributed to problems on Election Day, according to a report the city released on Friday.

title: French Theaters to Screen Film About Charlie Hebdo
description: PARIS  More than a week after Charlie Hebdo lost members of its staff in a terrorist attack, movie theaters across France will screen a documentary on the satirical newspapers 2007 trial for public offense in an effort to support the newspaper and defend freedom of speech.

title: Patriots, Using Full Extent of Rules, Shock (Almost) Everyone
description: FOXBOROUGH, Mass.  Like millions of football fans, Doug Martin saw the play. Unlike those millions, Martin had an investment of sorts in Julian Edelman, the Patriots wide receiver who threw the surprising 51-yard touchdown pass to Danny Amendola in New Englands A.F.C. divisional playoff game against the Baltimore Ravens last Saturday.

title: No, No, No, No Becomes Maybe for Ann Romney
description: In an interview last fall, Ann Romney made clear that her husbands political career  and his familys support for it  were over.

title: A Sofa Was Pushed From a Sixth-Floor Window. Or Maybe Not.
description: A man stood outside Patisserie Claude on West Fourth Street in Greenwich Village for a short while, then got into his parked van and drove away. Nothing more.

title: The Keystone XL Illusion
description: Greg Rickford, Canadas minister of natural resources, was in the United States most of this past week, on a trip that didnt get much attention in the media with so much bigger news swirling about. So let me fill you in.

title: Texas Is Sending You a Present
description: Rick Perry!

title: Suspect Held in Disappearance of 43 Mexican Students
description: MEXICO CITY  Mexican officials said Friday that they had detained a leader of the criminal group that prosecutors believe killed 43 college students, then burned their bodies in a case that continues to roil the country more than three months after the young men disappeared.

title: Versatile and Ferocious, Seattle Safety Is a Hybrid
description: SEATTLE  For the second straight season, the Seahawks had the N.F.L.s best defense. And for the second straight season, Kam Chancellor was perhaps the third-best player in the teams vaunted secondary.

title: Robert E. White, Ex-Ambassador to Latin America, Dies at 88
description: On Dec. 1, 1980, two churchwomen, Jean Donovan and Sister Dorothy Kazel, spent the night at the American Embassy in San Salvador as guests of Ambassador Robert E. White and his wife. The next day, the two women and two other nuns, all crusaders for human rights, were abducted, raped and murdered.

title: Ervin Drake, Composer of Pop Songs, Dies at 95
description: Ervin Drakes Now That I Have Everything debuted the same day he was inducted into the Songwriters Hall of Fame in 1983, a fitting coda for a career that was punctuated by hit versions of his songs, like Frank Sinatras It Was a Very Good Year, Billie Holidays Good Morning Heartache and the inspirational I Believe, sung by Frankie Laine.

title: Patriot Act Idea Rises in France, and Is Ridiculed
description: WASHINGTON  The arrests came quickly after the Sept. 11, 2001, attacks. There was the Muslim man suspected of making anti-American statements. The Middle Eastern grocer, whose shop, a tipster said, had more clerks than it needed. Soon hundreds of men, mostly Muslims, were in American jails on immigration charges, suspected of being involved in the attacks.

title: With Eclipse Awards Set to Be Announced, Horse of the Year Honor Raises Questions
description: HALLANDALE BEACH, Fla.  California Chrome, the winner of last years Kentucky Derby and Preakness Stakes, was not the same scintillating performer in the second half of the season that he was in the first. Bayern won a controversial Breeders Cup Classic and faltered in other key races. Main Sequence had a perfect record in four races, but all of them came on grass.

title: Istanbul is Apparently on It
description: SATURDAY PUZZLE  Usually, fill-in-the-blank clues are an easy way to get a toehold in a crossword puzzle. Thats why you dont see too many of them in the tougher, late-week puzzles. Youre supposed to struggle. Youre supposed to think.

title: A Tailor Looks Beyond His Criminal Past by Connecting With His Roots
description: Allah-ade Jenkins grew up under rolls of fabric and thread, with the constant rhythmic thump of sewing machines above him. His parents were both master tailors, and he spent his first years wandering the floors of their shop in Harlem. He always loved the machines, he said, and one day, when his mother was away, he climbed up on one.

title: Google Said to Be in Talks to Acquire Softcard, a Mobile Payments Company
description: Softcard, a mobile payments company developed by the largest wireless carriers in the country, never caught on with the mainstream.

title: Winning Lottery Numbers for Jan. 16, 2015
Dorothy Thomas, the Mother of Bone Marrow Transplants, Dies at 92
description: Dorothy Thomas, a partner in her husbands Nobel Prize-winning research into bone marrow transplants, died on Jan. 9 at her home near Seattle. She was 92.

title: A Former Commander of Liberian Rebels Is Arrested in Switzerland
description: MONROVIA, Liberia  The Swiss authorities have arrested a former commander of a Liberian rebel military faction who is accused of ordering civilian massacres, rapes and other atrocities in northern Liberia during the nations first civil war from 1989 to 1996.

title: Tadeusz Konwicki, Leading Polish Novelist and Filmmaker, Dies at 88
description: WARSAW  Tadeusz Konwicki, whose alternately grim, surreal and acidly ironic novels and films made him one of Polands most important cultural figures, died on Jan. 7 at his home in central Warsaw. He was 88.

title: Postseason Feel Comes Early as Isles Rally to Top a Rival
description: UNIONDALE, N.Y.  Stephanie Beige, an Islanders fan since 1979, loves this kind of hockey week.

title: Nigeria: 2 Regions Report New Outbreaks of Bird Flu
description: The health and veterinary authorities on Friday reported outbreaks of avian flu hundreds of miles apart on opposite ends of Nigeria. In Lagos, the southern commercial center, 3,300 birds at a live bird market showing symptoms were culled, said Nigerias chief veterinary officer, Dr. Abdulganiyu Abubakar, in a report to the World Organization for Animal Health, an agency that tracks disease outbreaks. In Kano State, in northern Nigeria, an unspecified number of birds showing a high mortality rate were culled from a poultry farm. In both cases, blood samples tested positive for an H5 strain of avian influenza, officials quoted by Nigerian news media said. It was not immediately clear whether the birds were afflicted with H5N1, which is highly pathogenic and can infect humans. H5N1 first spread from Asia to Europe and Africa in the late 1990s and is a recurrent problem in domesticated bird populations. Nigeria was the first country in Africa to report H5N1 in poultry, in 2006, according to the World Health Organization.

title: Turkey Threatens to Block Social Media Over Released Documents
description: ANKARA, Turkey  Turkish officials threatened to shut down Twitter in the country unless the social-media company blocked the account of a left-wing newspaper that had circulated documents about a military police raid on Turkish Intelligence Agency trucks that were traveling to Syria last January.

title: Horses Deaths at Aqueduct Prompt New Rules
description: It was Shewreckstheplaces 36th start, and second in seven days, and she had yet to win a race. In a bottom-level race at Aqueduct Racetrack in Queens on Jan. 4, she was pulled up at the eighth pole, taken away in a van and subsequently euthanized. Five days later, the gelding Apex, another old warhorse, broke a leg near the three-eighths pole and was put down on the track.

title: Storm Ends Part of Popes Philippine Trip
description: MANILA  Before he left Rome for the Philippines, Pope Francis said that consoling the victims of a devastating 2013 typhoon was his primary reason for visiting the country.

title: Romney Signals Interest in 2016 Run for President
description: SAN DIEGO  Mitt Romney made clear publicly on Friday night what he has spent the last week conveying in private to Republicans across the country: He is considering another presidential campaign.

title: The Strip
description: A weekly comic strip featured in the Sunday Review.

title: Video Released in Case of Man Found Dead in His Car
description: The police released a video on Friday of a man who officials said was seen getting out of the car belonging to a northern New Jersey man who was found dead in the trunk in the Bronx on Thursday.

title: Corrections: January 17, 2015
description: FRONT PAGE

title: Quotation of the Day
description: No freedom should be abandoned.

title: Whats on TV Saturday
description: 9 P.M. (CUNY) ARMY OF CRIME (2009) The Armenian poet Missak Manouchian (Simon Abkarian) leads a heroic ragtag group of anti-Fascist partisans to sabotage the Nazi regime in occupied Paris in this biopic, directed by Robert Gudiguian, a Marseille-based filmmaker of German and Armenian parentage. Virginie Ledoyen portrays Missaks beautiful, adoring French wife, Mline; Jean-Pierre Darroussin is a double-dealing inspector in the neighborhood where the Resistance is centered. Was it all for naught? Stephen Holden wrote in The New York Times. Only weeks after the 23 partisans were arrested (and all but two promptly executed), Paris was liberated. Army of Crime is a passionate act of remembrance.

title: Ermenegildo Zegna: Fall 2015 Menswear
description: Milan

title: Green-Energy Inspiration Off the Coast of Denmark
description: Before dawn one morning in October, a handful of Americans gathered at a lonely pier on Samso, a small Danish island about four hours from Copenhagen. Bundled in layers of fleece and wool, the Americans, mostly from islands off the Maine coast, had come to get a closer look at a wind farm  10 mighty turbines spinning in the Kattegat strait  that has helped make Samso a symbol for a greener future, one powered entirely by renewable energy.

title: For Charlie Hebdo Gunman, a Discreet Burial in Reims
description: PARIS  Sad Kouachi, one of the gunmen who killed 12 people at the satirical French newspaper Charlie Hebdo, was buried Friday evening in Reims, a city in northeastern France, where he had settled several years ago, the citys mayor, Arnaud Robinet, said on Saturday.

title: Dreaming of a Basement Playroom or Gym
description: Ask Real Estate is a weekly column that answers questions from across the New York region. Submit yours to realestateqa@nytimes.com.

title: Before a Show, a Fireside Meal at the Black Mountain Wine House
description: Around this time of year, when the holidays are over and the nighttime temperature descends to nostril-numbing levels, many heat-seeking residents of Carroll Gardens, Brooklyn, spend their evenings at the Black Mountain Wine House at 415 Union Street. The quiet saloon, just blocks from busy Smith Street, exudes a rustic warmth: A fireplace crackles in the corner; agricultural bric-a-brac hangs from the walls. The only thing to dispel the impression that youve just walked into a farmhouse in Vermont is the aproned chef slicing and sauting in the open-window kitchen. On Tuesday nights, Black Mountain offers a fondue special ($16), increasing its cold-weather allure, and this past Tuesday, in the after-work chill, the place was full of whispering couples, book-reading singles and three women: a mother, her daughter and her daughter-in-law, taking in a meal before the theater.

title: Taking Up Gay Marriage, but on Its Own Terms
description: WASHINGTON  The first page of a petition seeking Supreme Court review is the most important. It sets out the question presented, the one the court will answer if it takes the case.

title: An Open Office (No Names)
description: Ryan Janssen, the founder of a new app called Memo, comes across as an idealist. He maintains that the state of the American professional classes is one of constant repression and hierarchical miscommunication. Or in less dramatic terms: People are scared to be themselves at work, and to tell their managers what they think about their companies.

title: Ready, Aim, Talk
description: Im the most honest gun dealer in the world, John DeLoca said, on why he has no need to censor himself or temper his pro-gun opinions, even in New York City.

title: Dolce & Gabbana: Fall 2015 Menswear
description: Milan

title: Mediterranean With a Touch of Hospitality
description: Lemon. Garlic. Mint. Yogurt. Lamb. Spices. Smoke. The mantra evokes cuisines from Greece to Egypt, a medley of foods and flavors linking the Balkans with the Levant, whose geographical center is that beautiful, much-loved and long-suffering land, Lebanon.

title: Fashion a Mask for Carnival in Venice
description: The Carnival in Venice festival, which will be held this year from Jan. 31 to Feb. 17, is famous for the elaborate masks worn by revelers, and now travelers can design their own at classes around the city.

title: Cuisine With Bite to Soothe Jack Frosts Nipping
description: Outside it was 7 degrees and windy.

title: A Grass-Roots Pitch in Greece Could Pay Off
description: ATHENS  Alexis Tsipras, the left-wing candidate who may well become prime minister of Greece next weekend, was taking questions from the public the other night on Twitter. Someone asked if he would eliminate the countrys hefty value-added taxes on basic necessities.

title: Sunnis in Iraq Are Kept Waiting for Reforms, and Word on Loved Ones
description: BAGHDAD  Under her black chador, Awatif al-Azawy clutched a few things for her imprisoned husband: a can of 7Up, two falafel sandwiches and a tube of skin cream.

title: Helping the Poor in Education: The Power of a Simple Nudge
description: There are enormous inequalities in education in the United States. A child born into a poor family has only a 9 percent chance of getting a college degree, but the odds are 54 percent for a child in a high-income family. These gaps open early, with poor children less prepared than their kindergarten classmates.

title: This Cast Works Without a Script
description: Havent we already seen ride-along shows set in Louisiana? Yes, we have. So whats different about Nightwatch, which begins Thursday on A&E and follows police, firefighters and ambulance workers on the overnight shift in New Orleans?

title: Variety: A Restful Diagramless Puzzle
description: VARIETY PUZZLE  One of the advantages of this job is having the answers at your disposal if they are absolutely needed. I normally dont peek, but one of my weaknesses is remembering names. Today, one name in particular gave me trouble. I got hung up on Franz LEHAR as the composer of The Merry Widow.

title: Whats So Bad About Cheap Oil?
description: The sharp drop in oil prices will benefit American consumers, many of the nations businesses and the economy as a whole. So why are stock market investors behaving as though oil under $50 a barrel and gasoline prices hovering around $2 a gallon are bad news?

title: The Patio Furniture That Nobody Wanted
description: Lets start with an update from our last episode, which you may recall concerned a battle between a monk and United Airlines. The confrontation between a tranquillity-seeking man and an immovable corporation proved irresistible to websites like Yahoo News, Gawker and Boing Boing, to name a few. And a reporter from a local TV station was dispatched to the Monastery of Christ in the Desert, in Abiquiu, N.M., where the monk, Brother Noah, was asked to repeat his not very hostile kiss-off to an unyielding United phone rep: Thank you for speaking. God bless you. I will pray for you. But you have not been helpful.

title: Charlie Hebdo Attackers Path to Radicalization
description: Key moments in the lives of Chrif and Sad Kouachi, based on accounts from thousands of pages of legal documents obtained by The New York Times.

title: From Amateur to Ruthless Jihadist in France
description: PARIS  In the year after the United States invasion of Iraq, a 22-year-old pizza delivery man here couldnt take it anymore. Sickened by images of American soldiers humiliating Muslims at the Abu Ghraib prison, he made plans to go fight United States forces. He studied a virtual AK-47 on a website. Then he took lessons from a man, using a hand-drawn picture of a gun.

title: Jil Sander: Fall 2015 Menswear
description: Milan

title: Morocco Crushed Dissent Using a U.S. Interrogation Site, Rights Advocates Say
description: RABAT, Morocco  After landing at the Rabat airport in 2010, Zakaria Moumni, a former kickboxing world champion, was distressed when he was taken aside by security agents, arrested, blindfolded and taken on a ride under a blanket in the back seat of a car to a secret facility. He says he was held there for four days, during which he was deprived of food and water.

title: Houthi Rebels Abduct Aide to Yemens President
description: SANA, Yemen  Gunmen abducted a senior aide to Yemens president early Saturday, highlighting the frailty of the central government and the growing sense of lawlessness as Yemen suffers its most severe political crisis in years.

title: Lower Oil Prices Provide Benefits to U.S. Workers
description: LEWISTON, Me.  Wall Street may be growing anxious about the negative impact of falling oil prices on energy producers, but the steep declines of recent weeks are delivering substantial benefits to American working-class families and retirees who have largely missed out on the fruits of the five-and-a-half-year economic recovery.

title: Republicans Like Their 2016 Options, Assuming They Avoid Chaos
description: CORONADO, Calif.  At the end of the last Democratic presidential administration, Republicans hungry to recapture the White House rallied behind an all-but-anointed candidate to take on Bill Clintons heir apparent of that era.

title: A Shakespearean Drama With Two Raging Heroes
description: LOS ANGELES  To go wheels down at LAX and travel the practice and game circuit with the Cleveland Cavaliers as they clashed with the Clippers and the Lakers in the past week was to observe a near perfect cosmology of talent, ego and insecurity, rumor and anxiety.

title: Juan Martn del Potro Decides Wrist Isnt Ready for Australian Open
description: MELBOURNE, Australia  Out of action for nearly a year because of a wrist injury, Juan Martn del Potro will remain out of action for the Australian Open, too.

title: By Many Measures, Its a Quarterbacks League
description: Rules changes to protect quarterbacks and receivers have resulted in a further explosion in passing offense.

title: Restroom Ordinance Is Just One More Sign of a Citys Acceptance
description: WEST HOLLYWOOD, Calif.  This city was one of the first in the nation to pass a same-sex marriage law. It was one of the first communities viewed as a haven for gay people: When the city was incorporated in 1984, a majority of the City Council members were openly gay, helping earn West Hollywood the nickname the Gay Camelot. Even today, it has rainbow-colored crosswalks.

title: Better Check the Beds, Edwardians
description: I was fascinated by The Manners of Downton Abbey, a special about Edwardian-era etiquette for highborn families that aired on PBS early this month.

title: A Young Woman Tries Hard to Be the Kind of Mother That She Never Had
description: Masicqua Andrews scoffs at the mention of family, summoning a guttural sound to match the disdain and neglect she said her relatives had long shown her.

title: Kristin Muhlner of NewBrand Analytics: The Upside of Being Replaceable
description: This interview with Kristin Muhlner, chief executive of NewBrand Analytics, a social-media-monitoring company, was conducted and condensed by  Adam Bryant.

title: As Rules Protect Quarterbacks, N.F.L. Defenses Are on the Defensive
description: As Tony Romo, the Dallas Cowboys quarterback, dropped back to pass last Sunday in an N.F.L. playoff game, the Green Bay Packers Clay Matthews dashed past an offensive lineman and into the backfield.

title: Belgium Deploys Troops After Foiling Possible Plot
description: BRUSSELS  Tightening security around Jewish sites, embassies and other potential terrorist targets, Belgium deployed scores of heavily armed paratroopers on Saturday in Brussels, the capital, and in the port city of Antwerp, a diamond-trading center with a large Orthodox Jewish population.

title: Redefining Mental Illness
description: TWO months ago, the British Psychological Society released a remarkable document entitled Understanding Psychosis and Schizophrenia. Its authors say that hearing voices and feeling paranoid are common experiences, and are often a reaction to trauma, abuse or deprivation: Calling them symptoms of mental illness, psychosis or schizophrenia is only one way of thinking about them, with advantages and disadvantages.

title: Howard S. Becker
description: Howard S. Becker is a sociologist known as much for his dry wit as for his groundbreaking work examining deviancy, art and music. His most recent book is What About Mozart? What About Murder?

title: Not Just a Movie
description: WASHINGTON  I WENT Friday morning to see Selma and found myself watching it in a theater full of black teenagers.

title: The Dangerous Erosion of Taxation
description: The obsession among House conservatives to hobble the Internal Revenue Service is about to pay off this tax season in foolhardy budget cuts to the agency that will cost the government an estimated $2 billion in lost revenue.

title: How Mexicans Became Americans
description: SOUTH GATE, Calif.  A FEW weeks ago, the City Council in this suburb southeast of Los Angeles appointed a Mexican immigrant to its advisory council. Jesus Miranda is from Michoacn and owns a taco restaurant here. Hell advise the council on housing development and other issues.

title: In Nigeria, the Terror Continues
description: They commanded global attention for a fleeting few days last spring. Across the world, millions prayed for and tweeted about the plight of the more than 200 Nigerian schoolgirls abducted in northeastern Nigeria by the vicious militant group Boko Haram. The first lady, Michelle Obama, joined the cause, posting a selfie looking downcast and demanding that the militants #BringBackOurGirls. The United States government hastily put together a task force of experts and dispatched drones to search for the hostages.

title: Mark Wahlberg, Penance and Pardons
description: EVERY time I read about the actor Mark Wahlbergs bid to be pardoned by the state of Massachusetts for crimes he committed in his youth, I flash back to the days I spent with him for a Times magazine profile just before Boogie Nights came out. I remember a specific detail.

title: Perpetuating Guantnamos Travesty
description: Standing before the press last Tuesday on Capitol Hill, Senator Kelly Ayotte, Republican of New Hampshire, argued that this is no time to be releasing detainees from the military prison in Guantnamo Bay, Cuba. Opportunistically, she cited the recent massacre in Paris and deteriorating security in Yemen, which she oddly described as the wild, wild West for terrorists. She warned that American officials suspect or know that roughly 30 percent of the men released from Guantnamo have returned to the fight.

title: Your Annual Checkup
description: Doctors and patients debate an assertion that the yearly exam is basically worthless.

title: Smart Guns Save Lives. So Where Are They?
description: BOULDER, Colo.  JUST after Christmas, Veronica Rutledge of Blackfoot, Idaho, took her 2-year-old son to a Walmart store to spend holiday gift cards. As they strolled by the electronics section, according to news reports, the toddler reached into his moms purse and pulled out a handgun that she legally carried. He pulled the trigger once and killed her.

title: Packing Heat at the Airport? Oops
description: WHO hasnt smacked their forehead at an airport security checkpoint because someone ahead in line had packed more than 3.4 ounces of shampoo or forgotten to take a laptop out of its case? Did they miss the big screaming signs?

title: Mean Girls in the Retirement Home
description: ABOUT 18 months ago, my 97-year-old grandmother went out to dinner with some friends. As Nanna got out of the car, she tripped over her friend Shirleys cane, fell to the pavement and came down hard on her elbow. Back at home, she headed to the kitchen to get some dessert  and my left leg just crumpled.

title: Mitt the Insurgent
description: THE idea of yet a third Mitt Romney campaign for the presidency, once the idle dream of a few Romney bundlers and now apparently something embraced by the Man From Bain Capital himself, has been greeted by most Republicans with a mixture of horror, exhaustion and embarrassment. The polite ones sound like a girl before the senior prom who cant believe that the stumblebum date who ruined her last school dance is in line first to ask her again: No, please, not this time. The rest sound like the characters in the third act of a horror movie, confronting a shambling revenant that just keeps coming: How do we kill this thing?

title: Is a Climate Disaster Inevitable?
description: OUR galaxy, the Milky Way, is home to almost 300 billion stars, and over the last decade, astronomers have made a startling discovery  almost all those stars have planets. The fact that nearly every pinprick of light you see in the night sky hosts a family of worlds raises a powerful but simple question: Where is everybody? Hundreds of billions of planets translate into a lot of chances for evolving intelligent, technologically sophisticated species. So why dont we see evidence for E.T.s everywhere?

title: After PTSD, More Trauma
description: Going in for therapy at a Veterans Affairs hospital is a lot like arriving at a large airport in a foreign country. You pass through a maze of confusing signage. Your documents are scrutinized. There are long lines you must stand in and a series of bureaucratic rituals that must be endured before anything resembling a human encounter occurs.

title: An Opulent Bet on Housing
description: Jeff Greene became a billionaire during the recession by betting that people would default on their mortgages. Now, happily ensconced in a 35,000-square-foot estate in Palm Beach, Fla., Mr. Greene has a more optimistic outlook about real estate, at least when it comes to the very rich.

title: Replacing a Colts Legend, and Not Missing a Beat
description: INDIANAPOLIS  The owner Jim Irsay laid the foundation for a new beginning for the Indianapolis Colts on April 26, 2012.

title: Prospect of Peace: Talking With the FARC
description: Two members of the Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia talk about their goals and their accountability in five decades of armed conflict.

title: Spacious, Gracious and Priced in the Nine Figures
description: Jeff Greene made a fortune on mortgage defaults. Now he sells to the extra-superrich. HIs estate in Beverly Hills is listed for $195 million.

title: The Men Who Haunted Me as a Child in Colombia
description: HAVANA  A VARIATION of the scene has played out in sporadic nightmares I began having as a child. A band of guerrilla fighters with scraggly beards, dirty camouflage uniforms and rifles slung over their shoulders walk toward me. Their glares are callous, their words gruff. I watch as black rubber boots caked with mud advance toward me. It is too late. I am cornered, trapped.

title: Even as a Player, Butlers Unlikely Coach Did Things His Own Way
description: Chris Holtmann had played horribly. Here was a senior guard for Taylor University, a small N.A.I.A. school in Upland, Ind., and his team had won the game, but that was not enough. Holtmanns performance was beneath his standards, with turnovers, poor shot selection and porous defense. Teammates and coaches chalked it up to an off night.

title: Neil Barrett: Fall 2015 Menswear
description: Milan

title: In Charge, and Sounding the Part
description: Science has not proved the trope that power changes everything. But it does suggest, at least, that it changes the vocal cords.

title: What Were Watching: Sunday Shows
description: Following the attacks in Paris, the arrest of terrorism suspects across Western Europe this week highlighted the challenges in preventing threats from radical jihadists. Prime Minister David Cameron of Britain, who met with President Obama at the White House this week to discuss how to bolster cybersecurity, will talk about the terrorism threat in Europe on CBSs Face the Nation.

title: Decoding the Paradox of Rising Cable Stocks
description: The stock market is often an early indicator of major developments in finance, the economy and geopolitics. But sometimes that collective wisdom generates signals so difficult to decipher that they seem contradictory.

title: Savoring the Sweet Taste of Acceptance
description: Supposte, the doctor said.

title: Vernon B. Mountcastle, Brain Explorer, Dies at 96
description: Dr. Vernon B. Mountcastle, whose studies of how brain cells conspire to process perceptions and movement laid the foundations of modern neuroscience, died last Sunday at his home in Baltimore. He was 96.

title: U.S. Lawmakers in Cuba for 3-Day Visit
description: WASHINGTON  A delegation of American legislators led by Senator Patrick J. Leahy arrived in Cuba on Saturday to discuss greater cooperation and remaining areas of disagreement, the first congressional delegation to visit the island nation since President Obama announced last month that he was restoring full diplomatic ties with it.

title: Unselfish Hawks Resemble Winners, Namely, the Spurs
description: Only two teams in the N.B.A. rank in the top six in both offense and defense. One is the Golden State Warriors (31-5 entering Friday), a talented team with seven players who were drafted with lottery picks. The other is the Atlanta Hawks, who have only three such players, and one is the 35-year-old Elton Brand. Still, the Hawks are the hottest team in the league; entering Saturday, they were 32-8, had won 25 of their last 27 games and led the Eastern Conference by five games.

title: Phil Jackson Confidant Studies Historically Bad Teams, Like Knicks
description: Over 40 years, Phil Jackson and Charley Rosen have coached and written books together, played hundreds of games of one-on-one, and discussed basketball philosophy as if Descartes equaled Holzman.

title: On Long Island, Restaurants Offer Super Bowl Takeout
description: Standout game-day cuisine, whether traditional Buffalo chicken wings or buckets of meatballs and growlers of beer to go, is easy to come by if you plan a bit in advance. Rick Ritacco, a co-owner of Wings Plus in Port Washington, advises booking a week before the Super Bowl. Everyone wants their food at 5 p.m., and those pickup times book up fast, he said, adding that most people prefer to eat and imbibe in one anothers homes for the big game. Its all about the house parties because its more relaxing, more fun and more communal.

title: On Long Island, Bookstores and Libraries Expand Their Offerings
description: When Marty Schwartz and Melinda Nasti take a vacation, they make a point of finding live-music venues.

title: Two Unsigned Aces Play a Waiting Game
description: In terms of travel expenses, Max Scherzer and James Shields may have reached the point of costing themselves money. The two aces remain unsigned, and with pitchers and catchers scheduled to report to spring training on Feb. 19, they have missed the 54-day advance purchase that a study of four million flights by CheapAir.com found was necessary to maximize savings.

title: In One Act, a Troubled Life Recounted
description: Not all the music lovers recalling the first time they heard the Doors song Light My Fire bother to mention Ray Manzareks organ solo. Dael Orlandersmith does in the opening moments of Forever, her brave and heartfelt new solo show at the Long Wharf Theater. She describes the sound as something otherworldly, which is a particularly apt comment because she is standing beside Jim Morrisons grave at the time.

title: As Baseball Games Drag On, Timelessness Becomes Less Than Sacred
description: Every five games during the baseball season, Jerry Howarth gets to travel back in time. Howarth settles in behind his microphone in the Toronto Blue Jays radio booth and watches Mark Buehrle move briskly through the innings, the way the old guys did.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: Inching Upward Toward a Dream

title: Already a Hub for the Arts, New Brunswick Enters Its Jazz Age
description: This months cold snap did not deter the drummer Rudy Royston, a fixture on the New York jazz scene, from making his way to New Brunswick, where on a particularly frigid Thursday night, he could be found burning up the bandstand at Hotoke, a restaurant and lounge on George Street.

title: Bob Boyd, Who Battled a Basketball Giant, Dies at 84
description: Bob Boyd coached the University of Southern California to more than 200 basketball victories and three Top 20 national rankings in the 1960s and 70s. But he was a victim of unfortunate timing.

title: A Leader in Socially Conscious Architecture Is Closing Amid Financial Woes
description: Architecture for Humanity, a nonprofit design group that sought to repair the world with socially conscious construction in places like Kosovo, Haiti and hurricane-ravaged Mississippi, has abruptly closed its San Francisco headquarters and plans to file for Chapter 7 bankruptcy protection.

title: Both Were Born Hamilton Fish, but Their Paths Differed
description: When Hillary Fontana entered the black-box theater at the Hudson Valley Center for Contemporary Art in Peekskill last fall for a screening of the film The Lives of Hamilton Fish, which also included a performance by its director, it was with a low-grade sense of anxiety.

title: Unfamiliar Territory
description: As a player and coach, Phil Jackson is used to his teams being well above .500. But now as an executive, his Knicks are exploring unimagined depths.

title: Events on Long Island for Jan. 18-24, 2015
description: A guide to cultural and recreational events on Long Island. Items for the calendar should be sent at least three weeks in advance to lical@nytimes.com.

title: Versace: Fall 2015 Menswear
description: Milan

title: Anchor Leaves CNN After Tweets
description: The veteran CNN anchor Jim Clancy has left the network after a series of Twitter messages he wrote about the terrorist attack on the French satirical newspaper Charlie Hebdo that left 12 people dead.

title: Ex-Speaker of New York Council Becomes an Adviser to Cuomo
description: Christine C. Quinn, the former New York City Council speaker and mayoral candidate, is now a special adviser to Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo.

title: Events in Westchester for Jan. 18-24, 2015
description: A guide to cultural and recreational events in the Hudson Valley. Items for the calendar should be sent at least three weeks in advance to westweek@nytimes.com.

title: Events in New Jersey for Jan. 18-24, 2015
description: A guide to cultural and recreational events in New Jersey. Items for the calendar should be sent at least three weeks in advance to njtowns@nytimes.com.

title: Events in Connecticut for Jan. 18-24, 2015
description: A guide to cultural and recreational events in Connecticut. Items for the calendar should be sent at least three weeks in advance to ctcal@nytimes.com.

title: Odd Byproduct of Legal Marijuana: Homes That Blow Up
description: DENVER  When Colorado legalized marijuana two years ago, nobody was quite ready for the problem of exploding houses.

title: A Multiethnic Movement Emerges in Guyana to Counter Politics-as-Usual
description: GEORGETOWN, Guyana  Swaying to the rhythms of Afro-Guyanese reggae, the protesters, descendants of African slaves and indentured laborers from India, gathered on the streets of Georgetown in a show of unity against the countrys president.

title: 54 Miles And 5 Cameras
description: Even as the film Selma has recreated the civil rights march to Montgomery for moviegoers, the New-York Historical Society is about to present images of the event captured by someone who was actually there. The exhibition, Freedom Journey 1965, features photographs by Stephen Somerstein, who traveled to Alabama to document the march as a student in City College of New Yorks night school, where he was picture editor of his student newspaper.

title: For Indonesians, Presidents Political Outsider Status Loses Its Luster
description: JAKARTA, Indonesia  When the political outsider Joko Widodo was sworn in as president of Indonesia, promising people-centric politics and a common touch, supporters hoped for miracles while opponents confidently predicted he would be destroyed politically within a year.

title: A Young Star And a Master
description: This winter the dazzling young Russian pianist Daniil Trifonov has been almost in residence in New York. Mr. Trifonov, who won both the Arthur Rubinstein Competition in Tel Aviv and the Tchaikovsky Competition in Moscow in 2011, played an acclaimed solo recital at Carnegie Hall in December. He then appeared with the New York Philharmonic at Avery Fisher Hall, exciting audiences in Rachmaninoffs First Piano Concerto.

title: Everyone Here Is Part of the Act
description: Every live theater event convenes an impromptu community in which artist and audience create a shared experience. The choreographer Moriah Evans examines this in much of her work, including Social Dance 1-8: Index, a new piece commissioned by the Issue Project Room.

title: Unearthing Fear and Mistrust
description: The unsettling work of the Swedish filmmaker Ruben Ostlund, whose 2014 movie Force Majeure was one the years most acclaimed films, has been described as Michael Haneke lite. Like Mr. Haneke, Mr. Ostlund digs under the surface sheen of affluent bourgeois life to discern deep currents of fear and mistrust. His previous two features, Play (2011) and Involuntary (2008), both running through Thursday at the Elinor Bunin Munroe Film Center in Lincoln Center, are calculated to make you squirm.

title: Rodeo, Rockabilly And Ample Mixing
description: For Sufjan Stevens, America is an expanse of history, myth, memory, fantasy, ideals and quirks, reflected in music that might be gently homespun, orchestral, jazz-tinged or electronic. Round-Up takes on an institution that is a sport and a cultural touchstone: rodeo. Its a live score for slow-motion footage from the Pendleton Round-Up; Mr. Stevens plays electronics with the ensemble Yarn/Wire. Maybe hell be glancing over his shoulder at Aaron Coplands Rodeo. (Tuesday through Jan. 25 at 7:30 p.m., BAM Harvey Theater, bam.org)

title: Changelings
description: SUNDAY PUZZLE  On July 17, 1935, the entertainment industry newspaper Variety printed a headline that entered the lore of journalism for its creativity: Sticks Nix Hick Pix was meant to communicate that rural moviegoers did not necessarily want to see movies about country life, as the movie industry had assumed.

title: Bench That Killed 7-Year-Old New Jersey Boy Wasnt Secure
description: A fold-up bench that fell from a school wall and killed a 7-year-old New Jersey boy this month was not properly fastened at the time, an investigation into the cause of the fatal accident has found.

title: Elena Obraztsova, Jewel of the Bolshoi Opera, Is Dead at 75
description: MOSCOW  Elena Obraztsova, a mezzo-soprano who survived the siege of Leningrad to become one of the Soviet Unions greatest opera singers and an international star during the Cold War, died on Jan. 12 at a clinic in Germany. She was 75.

title: Opposites Day
description: And, Im back  for some reason the local internet access didnt like the Times servers, leaving me unable to post. But I have found a workaround, so I can weigh in briefly on stuff that has been happening.

title: The Bushes, as Distinct and Alike as Brothers Can Be
description: WASHINGTON  One day last fall, former President George W. Bush called Mel Sembler, a Republican donor from Florida who had served as his ambassador to Italy. Mr. Sembler had just had a pacemaker implanted into his chest, and his wife had also recently had surgery. Mr. Bush wanted to check on how they were faring.

title: Spacious, Gracious and Priced in the Nine Figures
description: Jeff Greene made a fortune on mortgage defaults. Now he sells to the extra-superrich. HIs estate in Beverly Hills is listed for $195 million.

title: Obama Will Seek to Raise Taxes on Wealthy to Finance Cuts for Middle Class
description: WASHINGTON  President Obama will use his State of the Union address to call on Congress to raise taxes and fees on the wealthiest taxpayers and the largest financial firms to finance an array of tax cuts for the middle class, pressing to reshape the tax code to help working families, administration officials said on Saturday.

title: Chicago No Longer Seems a Lock to Host Obamas Library, and Many Are Alarmed
description: CHICAGO  People who live in Chicago know a few things to be true about their city. Winters are brutal. The architecture is first-rate. The Cubs will lose.

title: Top Conferences to Allow Aid for Athletes Full Bills

title: Protesters Out to Reclaim Kings Legacy, but in Era That Defies Comparison

title: Tentative Deal to Avert Strike at Produce Market in Hunts Point

title: Prominent North Korean Defector Recants Parts of His Story of Captivity
description: SEOUL, South Korea  He was the poster boy for human rights atrocities in North Korea; a soft-spoken survivor of the Norths cruel gulags who eventually met such dignitaries as John Kerry in his campaign to focus attention on the Norths abuses. His harrowing tales of life in a prison camp  including being forced to watch his mother and brother being executed  stunned even those steeped in defectors stories and made him a star witness for an unprecedented United Nations investigation of abuses by the Norths rulers.

title: 1890: Is John Ruskin Insane?
description: The mental condition of Mr. John Ruskin, the great leader in English critical literature, is causing much sorrow among his friends. There has been a great deal of whispered talk in the upper art circles of London for months past concerning Mr. Ruskins state and the peculiar circumstances by which he is environed. There has been no public comment on the matter, because of the general desire, among his most intimate friends, Mr. Swinburne, Mr. Burne Jones and others, to have nothing said about it. Now, however, the removal of his publisher from Orpington to London, and the change in the sale of Mr. Buskins books from the no discount system, which he instituted, to the ordinary methods prevailing in the book trade, with other circumstances, make further secrecy impossible.

title: Costume National and John Varvatos Reach for Rock n Roll
description: MILAN  A recurring beef a person who writes about style and fashion might develop is the lazy reference designers inevitably make to rockers. Depending on who youre consulting, rock n roll has been around for a good 70 years. Thats a lot of music. When someone like Ennio Capasa of Costume National, a decent man and equally so a designer, cites rock musicians as his inspiration, a listener is often left to wonder which ones: the Rolling Stones, the Kills, the Pretenders, the White Stripes, Sleater-Kinney?

En effet, le nom des choses, cest ce que Laurent Fabius, ministre franais des Affaires trangres, nose mme plus prononcer.

title: 1940: French Are Seeking a Walt Disney, Artists Asked to Submit Work
description: French motion-picture producers, pointing to the artistic triumphs and box-office successes of Walt Disney, have been casting about lately for Gallic talent to give Walt a little competition, and, incidentally, to capture some of the money flowing so copiously into the coffers of the creators of animated screen cartoons. Determined to find native counterparts of Mickey Mouse and Popeye, the Frenchmen have sent out an invitation to all artists, cartoonists and designers to submit their most fanciful brainchildren for study and possible adaptation. The invitation has been answered by scores of good, and  no doubt  bad and indifferent artists. At the Centrale de Coordination des Mtiers, 5 Rue de Logelbach, one can see the results of the response in the form of drawings, silhouettes, cutouts and marionettes. Sergent Badu, Poilu de lAvant, is the only war character. Should the war last, he might prove the most popular of the lot.  New York Herald Tribune, European Edition, Jan. 19, 1940

title: Will the F.D.A. Kill Off E-Cigs?
description: WASHINGTON  ELECTRONIC cigarettes, battery-powered devices that convert a solution of nicotine and other chemicals into a vapor that can be inhaled, or vaped, have the potential to wean a vast number of smokers off cigarettes. No burned tobacco leaves, no cancer-causing tar: a public health revolution in waiting.

title: High Noon for the Gray Wolf
description: TUCSON  IN December 2011, a wild gray wolf set foot in California, the first sighting in almost a century. Hed wandered in from Oregon, looking for a mate. In October 2014, for the first time in almost three-quarters of a century, a gray wolf was seen loping along the forested North Rim of the Grand Canyon, in Arizona. She had walked hundreds of miles, probably from Wyoming or Idaho.

title: Aiming to Create a Jazz Capital
description: PANAMA  In the wee hours of Friday morning, Danilo Prez climbed onstage at his jazz club here to play a set. Mr. Prez, the Panama-born pianist and composer who has for more than a decade been a member of Wayne Shorters acclaimed quartet, had already headlined shows for the Panama Jazz Festival, which he founded 12 years ago. There he had performed alongside the Puerto Rican saxophonist Miguel Zenn and his fellow Panamanian, the salsa singer Rubn Blades, and in the festivals gala concert at the 106-year-old National Theater.

title: A Hip-Hop Spirit Guide and Online Taste Maker
description: Hip-hops past is littered with secret histories, scenes and stories and sounds that never got their full hearing, remembered only by a few. Thanks to the Internet, though, secret histories arent so secret anymore. Those stories are now rescued, amplified and recontextualized by a new wave of agents who are fluent in the past, and who use it to build a more creative future.

title: Not From Here, Are You?
description: Originally premiering in 1966, Arch Obolers 3-D science-fiction puzzler, The Bubble, gets a New York theatrical run to show off its Space-Vision technology in an extraordinary restoration. Mr. Oboler, a titan from radio days, predicted in 1967 that in 20 years there will be no flat movies. He was a little off, but not for lack of trying: This film thrusts not only a tray of beers but a cancan dancers high-kick at the audience.

title: An Entitled Executive as Mozart May Have Imagined Him

So it was on Thursday night when the Paris National Opera opened a revival of its boldly contemporary 2006 production of Mozarts Don Giovanni by the Austrian film director and screenwriter Michael Haneke.

description: Peace, love and respect are excellent values for a theatrical production to promote, especially one directed at children. title: Purgatory at Home In Wartime
description: The American government made no secret of the fact that it had rounded up Japanese residents of this country, even if they had been born here, and kept them in detention camps during World War II. At first glance, The Train to Crystal City appears to be about some version of that story, since the people depicted on its cover are Asian and some are being transported somewhere. But the facts Jan Jarboe Russell has unveiled are much thornier, more complex and terrible. The tale they tell is almost more than her mind-boggling but awkwardly organized book can handle.

title: If Mahler Were Writing Now
description: Gustav Mahler, maker of gigantic symphonies, may seem an odd preoccupation for a chamber group. But preoccupation he is, this season, for the adventurous Argento Chamber Ensemble, which presented the second concert in its series Mahler as New York Contemporary on Thursday evening in the Board of Officers Room at the Park Avenue Armory.

title: A Win for Sothebys in Dispute Over Painting
description: A British judge ruled last week that Sothebys had not been negligent in the case of a painting that the auction house sold in 2006 for 42,000 pounds (about $63,600), only to be declared worth 10 million a year later, the Financial Times reported. Lancelot Thwaytes sued Sothebys for 11 million (about $16.7 million) in damages, claiming that the auctioneers had insufficiently researched his painting The Cardsharps. The auction house described the work, below, which depicts two hustlers trying to cheat another man in a card game, as a 17th-century copy of the original by the Italian master Caravaggio. The painting was purchased by a friend of the British collector Denis Mahon, who died in 2011 and who, after further analysis, declared it an authentic Caravaggio and valued the painting at 10 million. The Financial Times reported that Judge Vivien Rose dismissed Mr. Thwaytess claim, saying in her ruling that the auctioneers had examined the painting thoroughly, and reasonably concluded that the painting was not of high enough quality to be a Caravaggio. The disputed painting is currently on loan to the Museum of the Order of St John in London.

title: Good Eggs

And up pops an offer of, say, 30 percent off the standard $15 price to buy Against the Sun, a new feature film about real Navy fliers who spent 34 days adrift on the Pacific during World War II.

title: Cuomo to Propose 2 New Minimum Wages, for New York City and State
description: Flanked by a collection of liberal groups and labor leaders, Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo on Sunday announced a raft of proposals on social issues, among them a plan that would raise the minimum wage to $11.50 an hour in New York City and $10.50 an hour in the rest of the state.

title: ASAP Yams, Creative Force in Hip-Hop, Dies at 26
description: ASAP Yams, the hip-hop executive who helped start the career of ASAP Rocky, the popular Harlem rapper whose 2013 studio album, Long.Live.ASAP, debuted at No. 1 on the Billboard album chart, has died. He was 26.

title: So He Let 20 Goals Past Him? In His Sport, Thats a Great Game
description: NANTES, France  Handball, virtually unknown in the United States as a team game, is one of the fastest-growing and most ostentatious sports in Europe, often drawing more fans than basketball. No one, though, loves it quite the way the French do.

title: Yoko Nagae Ceschina, Countess and Fairy Godmother to the Arts, Dies at 82
description: A long, long time ago  more than half a century, to be exact  there lived a young woman who journeyed to Italy from her native Japan. She went there to study the harp, an instrument on which she possessed uncommon skill.

title: N.S.A. Breached North Korean Networks Before Sony Attack, Officials Say
description: WASHINGTON  The trail that led American officials to blame North Korea for the destructive cyberattack on Sony Pictures Entertainment in November winds back to 2010, when the National Security Agency scrambled to break into the computer systems of a country considered one of the most impenetrable targets on earth.

title: As Content Pours From Everywhere, New Network Shows Strive for Boldness
description: PASADENA, Calif.  Jesus, a pregnant lesbian, an Asian-American family. A hip-hop empire, cybercrime fighters and the last man on earth. Those are among the cast of characters broadcasters now are depending on to rescue them from a season of troubling ratings declines.

title: Hating Good Government
description: Its now official: 2014 was the warmest year on record. You might expect this to be a politically important milestone. After all, climate change deniers have long used the blip of 1998  an unusually hot year, mainly due to an upwelling of warm water in the Pacific  to claim that the planet has stopped warming. This claim involves a complete misunderstanding of how one goes about identifying underlying trends. (Hint: Dont cherry-pick your observations.) But now even that bogus argument has collapsed. So will the deniers now concede that climate change is real?

title: In N.C.A.A.s Varied Landscape, Some Open Floodgates While Others Fear Drought
description: OXON HILL, Md.  At the annual N.C.A.A. convention over the weekend, the trendiest color was black.

title: Supreme Court to Review Bans on Solicitations in Judge Races
description: WASHINGTON  Almost five years to the day after the Citizens United decision reshaped American politics, the Supreme Court on Tuesday will turn its attention to judicial elections.

title: How Expensive It Is to Be Poor
description: Earlier this month, the Pew Research Center released a study that found that most wealthy Americans believed poor people today have it easy because they can get government benefits without doing anything in return.

title: Libya Militias Agree to Halt in Fighting, With Caveats
description: TOBRUK, Libya  The main factions fighting in Libya agreed to a provisional cease-fire on Sunday, apparently in response to pressure from the United Nations Security Council.

title: After 36 Years, a New York Town Sifts Through Suspicions on a Fatal Fire
description: GREECE, N.Y.  No obvious traces remain of the fire that killed 10 people here in 1978, no monument to remind local residents of the arson at the Holiday Inn that left an entire town in tears. A Red Lobster now occupies the spot on a busy road where the motel once stood.

title: As Playboy and Penthouse Fade, Newer Magazines Tilt Artistic
description: Pornography used to mean Playboy or Penthouse or another of the hundreds of glossy magazines kept on high shelves and purchased furtively.

title: Cubans Convicted in the U.S. Face New Fears of Deportation
description: MIAMI  For Amaury Villa, who arrived here from Cuba more than 15 years ago and became a permanent resident, pleading guilty in 2012 to federal charges that he sold stolen prescription drugs was a difficult choice. But there was one positive aspect: Unlike most foreign citizens convicted of serious crimes, Mr. Villa stood next to no chance of being deported back to his home country.

title: Banking Start-Ups Adopt New Tools for Lending
description: SAN FRANCISCO  When bankers of the future decide whether to make a loan, they may look to see if potential customers use only capital letters when filling out forms, or at the amount of time they spend online reading terms and conditions  and not so much at credit history.

title: Man Who Filmed Execution Is Arrested, Saudi Outlets Say
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon  In a recent video from Saudi Arabia, three uniformed security officers and a professional swordsman in a white gown struggled to placate a woman cloaked in black and sitting in the street. A Saudi court had convicted her of murder, but she was proclaiming her innocence.

title: After an Unthinkable Crime, a Second Chance
description: With its sloped lawns and dense shrubbery, its stately Colonials and svelte Corvettes, Watchung Road in Bound Brook, N.J., was a world apart from the cluttered street where Lora Pitoscia grew up nearby.

description: SPRINGFIELD, Ill.  Tariq Toran, the coach of the Central Illinois Xpress basketball team, presented his players with matching mouth guards for Christmas. He had made sure they all came in fluorescent green.

description: Season 4, Episode 2: Triggering

title: Lavish Malls Sprouting Up to Attract Iranian Elite
description: TEHRAN  The low rumble of powerful engines reverberated against the high-rises of Zaferanieh, an upmarket neighborhood, as Porsches and Mercedeses lined up to enter the multistory parking lot of a fancy new shopping mall, the Palladium, the latest addition to Tehrans shopping scene.

title: Boys Towns Rehab Vision Remains, Now Sharpening Minds and Skills
description: BOYS TOWN, Neb.  Juan Lopez, 17, lives in this home for wayward and neglected youths because he got in trouble back in school, skipping and taking drugs.

title: ComScore to Tally Viewers Across Their Many Devices
description: People are spending an exploding amount of time watching video on their mobile phones or streaming programs to their television sets, but so far the industry has struggled to track that behavior.

title: Frayed Around Edges, the Patriots Tom Brady Still Holds Up
description: FOXBOROUGH, Mass.  One man on my flight to the A.F.C. championship game Sunday was wearing a Tom Brady jersey that, like the player, had been through quite a bit. The fan had bought it not long after Brady became an N.F.L. star, back in 2002, after Brady won his first Super Bowl.

description: Season 5, Episode 3

title: Patriots Crush Colts and Advance to Super Bowl Against Seahawks
description: FOXBOROUGH, Mass.  Throughout the first half of Sundays A.F.C. championship game between the New England Patriots and the Indianapolis Colts, the Gillette Stadium crowd roared its approval whenever the referee announced that one of the Patriots offensive linemen was eligible for pass-catching duties.

title: Down Two Judges, New Yorks Court of Appeals Carries On
description: ALBANY  For the last few weeks, the grandiose courtroom of the New York State Court of Appeals, with its marble fireplace, dark walls hung with jurists portraits and elegant chandeliers, has been missing two fixtures: a pair of judges.

title: N.B.A.s Have-Nots Watch the Clock asJahlil Okafor Bides His Time
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky.  The arena was emptying and quiet, post-mortems of the game having concluded, when Mike Krzyzewski walked over to shake hands with Rick Pitino. In a clash of power coaches and premier college programs, Krzyzewskis Duke Blue Devils had scored a surprisingly easy 63-52 victory Saturday over Pitinos Louisville Cardinals.

title: Freedom for Yazidis, After Months of Torment
description: BAGHDAD  Nearly 200 members of the Yazidi religious minority in Iraq, held captive for months by Islamic State extremists and freed over the weekend, might have been released because the militants could no longer provide food and medicine for them, former captives and Iraqi officials said Sunday. The group of mostly elderly Yazidi hostages, many in poor health, were released on Saturday.

title: Popular Demand
description: Critics and fans praised, criticized and generally ranted about the Oscars online after the nominations on Thursday.

title: With Stunning Brevity, Russell Wilson Rises From His Worst to His Best
description: SEATTLE  Seahawks quarterback Russell Wilson scrambled madly as he tried to evade several Packers defenders. He ran to his right, whipsawed back and lofted the ball across the field. To the amazement of the record crowd at CenturyLink Field, tight end Luke Willson came down with the ball in the end zone.

title: Saturday Night in Taipei, and the Cool Kids Are at the Bookstore
description: It is late night on a Saturday and the floor is packed. On one side, two female fashion models huddle together, whispering. Across the room, a group of men cast furtive glances at other patrons from a raised platform.

title: Icy Rain Tests the New York Regions Unwary
description: It looked for all the world like another dreary January rain drenching the streets on Sunday morning. So it was that Scott Boudin, the producer for Z100s Elvis Duran and the Morning Show, ventured barefoot out his front door in Old Bethpage, on Long Island, to fetch the newspaper.

title: Winning Lottery Numbers for Jan. 18, 2015
As Her Father and Uncle Fight, a 2-Year-Old Girl Is Slashed in Manhattan
description: A 2-year-old girl was slashed on Sunday in Manhattan during a fight between her father and his older brother, who stabbed each other, the police said.

title: Fox News Apologizes for False Claims of Muslim-Only Areas in England and France
description: Fox News issued an unusual on-air apology on Saturday night for having allowed its anchors and guests to repeat the false claim that there are Muslim-only no-go zones in European countries like England and France that are not under the control of the state and are ruled according to Shariah law.

description: The Central Illinois Xpress basketball team is the only team of girls in a fifth-grade boys league. They have an 8-1 record and arent intimidated.

title: Oxfam Study Finds Richest 1% Is Likely to Control Half of Global Wealth by 2016
description: The richest 1 percent are likely to control more than half of the globes total wealth by next year, the charity Oxfam reported in a study released on Monday. The warning about deepening global inequality comes just as the worlds business elite prepare to meet this week at the annual World Economic Forum in Davos, Switzerland.

title: Max Scherzer and Nationals Said to Be Nearing Pact
description: The protracted free agency of Max Scherzer may be nearing a resolution at last. Scherzer, the former American League Cy Young Award winner, has been engaged in contract talks with the Washington Nationals, who could have an overpowering rotation if he signs.

title: Chinese Police Kill 2 Uighurs Fleeing to Vietnam, Reports Say
description: HONG KONG  The Chinese police shot and killed two members of the Uighur ethnic minority trying to flee into Vietnam after members of their group resisted arrest with knives, the state-run news media reported on Monday.

title: Ana Ivanovic, a Favorite in the Womens Field, Is Out at Australian Open
description: MELBOURNE, Australia  Ana Ivanovic of Serbia, who entered the Australian Open as a favorite after reaching the final of the Brisbane Open the week before, lost in the first round here Monday to Lucie Hradecka of the Czech Republic.

title: Whats On TV Monday
description: 8 P.M. (TMC) STARRING SIDNEY POITIER Stanley Kramers The Defiant Ones (1958), about an uneducated black convict on a chain gang who goes on the lam with his other half, a white Southern bigot portrayed by Tony Curtis, above left, ushers in this tribute to Mr. Poitier, right (between them is Cara Williams). In 1964, Mr. Poitier became the first black person to win a best-actor Oscar and three years later was the nations top box-office draw. In its candid presentment of racial conflict and resentment, Bosley Crowther wrote in The New York Times, it rips right into the subject with clawing ferocity and flails it about with merciless fury until all the viciousness in conflict is spent. In James Clavells To Sir, With Love (1967), at 10, Mr. Poitier stars as Thackeray, an idealistic new teacher in London assigned to a school near the citys docks, where his Cockney-accented students are ill mannered and insolent. Christian Roberts plays Denham, the arrogant teenager who incites Thackerays latest classroom edict: If the students want to be treated as the adults they are about to become, they must act like adults. A nice air of gentility suffuses this pretty color film, and Mr. Poitier gives a quaint example of being proper and turning the other cheek, Mr. Crowther wrote. And in Mr. Kramers Guess Whos Coming to Dinner (1967), at midnight, the liberal principles of an aging couple (Spencer Tracy and Katharine Hepburn) are tested when their daughter (Katharine Houghton) announces her engagement to a black doctor (Mr. Poitier). Mr. Crowther called the movie a most delightfully acted and gracefully entertaining film, fashioned much in the manner of a stage drawing-room comedy, that seems to be about something much more serious and challenging than it actually is.

title: N.B.A. Game of the Week: Pistons at Hawks
description: Every week, The New York Times will choose one essential game to watch, highlighting hot teams, winning and losing streaks and statistical intrigue in the N.B.A.

title: A Rout and Another A.F.C. Title for the Patriots
description: Tom Brady led New England to the A.F.C. championship, his sixth, with a rout of the Indianapolis Colts at Gillette Stadium in Foxborough, Mass.

title: Corrections: January 19, 2015
description: FRONT PAGE

title: Gun Battles in Capital Shake Yemen
description: SANA, Yemen  Troops loyal to Yemens president clashed with Houthi militiamen around the presidential palace and other areas for hours on Monday, in some of the worst violence in the capital in months.

title: Judges, With Hat in Hand
description: The Florida judiciary is no stranger to misconduct and corruption. During one tawdry stretch in the early 1970s, three of the states supreme court justices resigned over corruption scandals. One was caught on a gambling junket in Las Vegas that had been paid for by a greyhound track owner with a case pending before the court. Two others stepped down after trying to tamper with cases involving campaign supporters.

title: A Modest Move on Methane
description: There is much to like in the Obama administrations proposal, announced last Wednesday, to reduce harmful methane emissions from oil and gas drilling. The proposal  which calls for detailed rules to be unveiled in early summer  is the first federal effort to directly regulate methane, the main component of natural gas and a major contributor to climate change. The regulations will apply to all new oil and gas wells, and be national in scope, thus setting minimum standards for what is now a patchwork quilt of state laws.

title: An Inclusive French Republic
description: The recent terrorist attacks in Paris prompted millions to take to the streets to show national solidarity and to pay tribute to the 17 people murdered. The attacks have also inspired a lot of soul-searching, as the French struggle to understand how three men, born and raised in France, could have trained the murderous intent of Al Qaeda and the Islamic State on their own countrymen. And the attacks have revealed a larger, existential threat to France: that its social compact may be torn apart by sectarian polarization.

title: Suspicious Nonsense on Trade Agreements
description: I am in general a free trader; there is, Id argue, a tendency on the part of some people with whom I agree on many issues to demonize trade agreements, to make them responsible for evils that have other causes. And my take on both of the trade agreements currently under negotiation  Pacific and Atlantic  is that theres much less there than meets the eye.

title: Allied Irish Banks Chief to Depart for Clydesdale Bank
description: LONDON  The chief executive of Allied Irish Banks, a nationalized lender, is leaving for a similar position at Clydesdale Bank, the Scottish arm of National Australia Bank.

title: Indonesias Execution of Foreigners Prompts Diplomatic Storm
description: HONG KONG  Indonesias weekend executions of two foreigners convicted on drug charges have prompted an indignant diplomatic reaction, as Brazil and the Netherlands withdrew their ambassadors and Australia said it would not rule out such a move.

title: Dramatic Day Brings Bad News for Top-Seeded Women
description: MELBOURNE, Australia  It was a day of high drama for the top female tennis players at the Australian Open, with eight of the top seeds losing, another vomiting on court before eventually winning, and a former champion announcing that she was pregnant.

title: The Fight for Civil Rights, Long After Selma
Forceful Actions by China to Regulate Markets Send Shares Plunging
description: HONG KONG  Chinese regulators are making stock market investors nervous.

title: Daily Report: Microsoft Looks to Windows 10 for a Boost in Mobile
description: Microsoft plans to unveil details on Wednesday about Windows 10, a new operating system for PCs, at an event at its headquarters outside Seattle, Nick Wingfield reports.

title: Recipient of Artificial Heart Goes Home
description: PARIS  A patient who received an artificial heart in August has recovered sufficiently to return home, the French company that makes the device said on Monday, signaling a milestone toward the possible commercialization of the device.

title: Socit Gnrale Splits Chairman and Chief Executive Roles
description: PARIS  Socit Gnrale, one of Frances largest banks, is splitting the roles of chairman and chief executive to comply with European rules, it said on Monday.

title: Chinese Civilians Said to Be Trapped by Fighting in Myanmar
description: BEIJING  Hundreds of Chinese civilians, including jade miners and merchants, are trapped in an area of northeastern Myanmar where that countrys army is fighting ethnic Kachin guerrillas, according to reports on Monday by Chinese state news organizations.

title: Driven | 2015 Toyota Yaris
description: Toyotas thin-wallet transportation offering is the 2015 Yaris. At around $19,500 fully loaded, it still may be worth looking at the competition, including the Honda Fit.

title: Video Review: The 2015 Yaris Is Toyotas Bare-Bones Budget Car
description: AUTOMOTIVE engineers say the most difficult vehicle to produce is a budget subcompact. Certainly, luxury cars stuffed with tech are complex projects. But building a car thats compelling, affordable, comfortable and  heres the tricky part  profitable? Thats a black art of the highest order.

title: Accountable Care Organizations: Like H.M.O.s, but Different
description: In pursuit of greater efficiency in the United States health system, public programs and private insurers have begun to pay some hospitals and physicians differently. These new payment models take many forms, but they all impose greater responsibility for cost control and quality improvement on providers and bear some resemblance to failed health care financing arrangements from the 1990s. However, there are some distinctions that could make all the difference.

title: Big Data Underwriting for Payday Loans
description: ZestFinance traces its origins to a phone call Douglas Merrill received one winter day from his sister-in-law, Victoria, who needed new snow tires to drive to work and was short of cash. When Mr. Merrill asked what she would have done had she not been able to reach him, she replied that she would have taken out a payday loan.

title: E.U. Urges Cooperation to Combat Terrorism
description: BRUSSELS  European foreign ministers, meeting here in a city patrolled since Saturday by Belgian paratroopers as part of stepped-up precautions against terrorism, called on Monday for an alliance against Islamic extremism with the countries of North Africa and other Muslim nations like Yemen, where at least one of the gunmen responsible for attacks this month in Paris received training.

description: Danilo Prez has made promoting musicianship in Panama  using music as a springboard, cultural unifier and teaching tool  his lifes work.

description: On the first Martin Luther King, Jr., Day since the Civil Rights Act had its 50th anniversary, its worth reflecting on how  despite much progress in leveling societal playing fields  many environmental cleanups in this country simply shift problems to poor communities of color.

description: At first glance, Colorado would seem to be one of the federal health laws clearest success stories, offering nearly 200 plans and average premiums nearly unchanged in the coming year.

description: WASHINGTON  Alan P. Gross, the American released last month after five years of captivity in Cuba, and Scott Kelly, an astronaut scheduled to leave soon for a year aboard the International Space Station, will be among President Obamas guests at this weeks State of the Union address.

description: There were many verbal protestations of comradeship and support on Friday as Prime Minister David Cameron of Britain visited President Obama to pledge to fight terrorism (and receive what appeared to be Mr. Obamas blessing before the coming British election, which apparently included the term bro). But what I still have not been able to get out of my head three days later are the mirror-image leader outfits the two wore at the joint news conference.

description: There were no wrecking balls or jackhammers on hand for the demolition of 69 Vanderbilt Avenue. If a demolition could be delicate, this was it, all hands and hammers ripping at the wooden shingles and beams for the past two weeks on a busy corner in Clinton Hill, Brooklyn.

title: 1915: Germans at Soissons
description: LONDON  As yet the Germans are doing nothing to follow up their victory on the Aisne, north east of Soissons, although they are believed to be massing troops in the region. The few meters of territory won was taken at so heavy a cost that the disposition is to render a verdict of Victorious, but dont do it again. Many trains of wounded victims of the shrapnel fire of the French have arrived at Louvain, while the local hospitals in the towns behind the centre of the German line are filled with casualties too serious to permit their removal to Germany.  The New York Herald, European Edition, Jan. 20, 1915

title: Scalia Lands at Top of Sarcasm Index of Justices. Shocking.
description: WASHINGTON  Justice Antonin Scalia has a sharp tongue and a cutting writing style. His signature mode is sarcasm.

title: This Super Bowl Comes With a Script Written in the Stars

title: Iran Confirms Israeli Airstrike in Southern Syria Killed One of Its Generals
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon  Iran confirmed Monday that one of its generals was among the dead in an Israeli airstrike that also killed several Hezbollah fighters in southern Syria on Sunday, an announcement that added to the tension and unpredictability in the region after the strike.

description: BUENOS AIRES  Police sentries guarded the federal prosecutors luxury high-rise building. His door on the 13th floor had been locked from the inside, and a gun with a spent cartridge was found on the floor near his body. There was no suicide note.

title: Extreme Migration: Geese Hug the Himalayas
description: It has been called the most extreme migration on Earth: Twice a year, bar-headed geese fly over the Himalayas between India and Central Asia. Now, after years of speculation, scientists say they have discovered how the birds manage the high-altitude journey.

description: DEDHAM, Mass.  Jerome Medalie keeps his advance directive hanging in a plastic sleeve in his front hall closet, as his retirement community recommends. Thats where the paramedics will look if someone calls 911.

His approval rating has increased to around 46 percent over the last month, according to an average of polls taken over the last month, up from 42 percent in the weeks after the decisive Republican victory in the midterm elections.

title: Looking Ahead to October, Washington Banks on Pitching

title: Rising Above the Draft Class of 2012
description: FOXBOROUGH, Mass.  Before Muhammad Ali fought the imposing George Foreman in their Rumble in the Jungle in 1974, one of Alis trainers told him that there comes a point in every champions life when he has to go into the lions den and snatch the meat from the lions jaw.

title: Millennials Set to Outnumber Baby Boomers
description: 75 is the approximate number, in millions, of millennials that the United States will have this year. The total of millennials  those born from 1981 to 1997  will reach 75.3 million, overtaking baby boomers (1946 to 1964) as the United States largest living generation.

description: Once again, photographers are invited to apply for a weekend of critiques and community, where they will meet with gallerists, editors and publishers. Its free (and fun).

title: For D.J. Mick, a Diverted Flight Brings About a Blissful Train Ride
description: WHEN I was young I didnt fly a lot except to go see my grandparents in Naples, Fla., every summer. When I was in college I didnt fly a lot, either. I was focused on school and on getting a good job. I used to D.J. as a hobby in the evenings to pay for graduate school. Now working as a D.J. is my career, and I fly more than 225,000 miles a year.

description: WASHINGTON  One night last week Cody Keenan, the chief White House speechwriter President Obama has christened Hemingway, knew he needed help.

description: MOSCOW  Tens of thousands of people marched on Monday through Grozny, the capital of the mainly Muslim Chechnya region of Russia, in a conservative retort to the mass demonstrations in France this month expressing solidarity with the victims of the terror attacks in Paris.

title: An Age-Old Romantic Introduction, With Revitalizing Touches
description: The differences between danced versions of Prokofievs Romeo and Juliet  a mainstay of ballet repertory  tend to be relatively subtle. The Capulets and the Montagues usually meet in Renaissance Verona, and the individuals tend to quarrel, laugh, fall in love and die at more or less the same passages in the music.

title: Writing Your Way to Happiness
description: The scientific research on the benefits of so-called expressive writing is surprisingly vast. Studies have shown that writing about oneself and personal experiences can improve mood disorders, help reduce symptoms among cancer patients, improve a persons health after a heart attack, reduce doctor visits and even boost memory.
