description: Season 1, Episode 12, What the Little Bird Told Him

title: Appearing Together, de Blasio and Sharpton Urge Civility
description: For the first time in weeks, Mayor Bill de Blasio and the Rev. Al Sharpton appeared together, taking the stage on Monday at an event commemorating Martin Luther Kings Birthday.

title: At Selma Viewings, Lessons for a New Generation
description: Phyllis G. Mack moved to Harlem from Charleston, W.Va., after she graduated from college in 1963. Though she was at the top of her class at West Virginia State University, no one in her home state would give her a job because she was black, she said.

title: For Jets, Loose Ties to the Super Bowl
description: The Jets have not been in a Super Bowl for 46 years, but they do provide some backdrop for this one. Heres why:

title: Obamas Social Media Team Tries to Widen Audience for State of the Union Address
description: WASHINGTON  The Obama administration has revamped its digital communications strategy in an attempt to reach new audiences for the State of the Union speech  a classic old-media event  and sidestep the skeptical filter often applied by White House reporters.

title: Debates at Davos Get Around to Gay Rights
description: The World Economic Forum annual meeting in Davos, Switzerland, which begins this week, has been a top venue for controversial conversations over the years. Israelis and Palestinians have debated, for example, and luminaries from the public and private sectors have faced off on big topics like climate change, inequality and gender diversity.

title: Peter Wallenberg, Patriarch of a Swedish Dynasty, Dies at 88
description: Peter Wallenberg, who helped build a global conglomerate out of his familys closely held businesses, a dynasty that was often referred to as a Swedish version of the Rockefellers, died on Monday at his home on the island of Varmdo, in Stockholm County. He was 88.

title: As Growth Slows, China Pins Hopes on Consumer Spending
description: HONG KONG  As demand for exports slips and the real estate sector cools, China has been looking to consumers to help pick up the slack. But the countrys slowing growth will complicate those plans.

title: Members of Congress, in Cuba, Discuss Trade but Dont Meet With Castro
description: HAVANA  A delegation of members of Congress who have been some of the strongest advocates of lifting the American trade embargo with Cuba concluded a three-day visit here on Monday with optimism over trade deals but without an anticipated meeting with President Ral Castro  apparently because of its decision to meet with several Cuban dissidents.

title: Brooklyn Man Finds Solace on a Golf Course Made of Trash
description: The golfer summoned his focus on the cold Brooklyn street corner and tapped the ball with his rusted putter. A cigarette burned between his lips; his baseball cap was black. Cars rushed past. Two old ladies at a bus stop watched him play under the glow of sidewalk lights.

title: British Spies Seized Emails to Reporters
description: In November 2008, British spies captured email messages addressed to reporters and photographers with at least a dozen international news organizations, many United Nations officials, workers at far-flung oil companies and tens of thousands of other people, according to a newly disclosed classified document.

title: After Years in Foster Care, Creating a New Home
description: Miya Thomas has a hazy memory of the day she was taken away from her mother.

title: Chinas Economy Expands at Slowest Rate in Quarter-Century
description: China grew at its slowest rate in 24 years in 2014, according to data released by the National Bureau of Statistics on Tuesday.

title: Winning Lottery Numbers for Jan. 19, 2015
Canada: Troops Clash With ISIS in Iraq
description: Canadian soldiers exchanged fire with Islamic State fighters in Iraq over the past week, a commander said Monday. The officer, Brig. Gen. Michael Rouleau, the commander of Canadian special operations forces, said his troops were advising Iraqi officers at the front lines when the soldiers came under machine-gun and mortar fire. That resulted in the immediate requirement to return fire, he said. Canadian snipers, he said, then neutralized the fighters of the Islamic State group, also known as ISIS or ISIL. He did not say how many Canadians were involved nor did he say how many attackers were killed. As many as 69 Canadians are providing training and advice to Iraqis.

title: China: W.H.O. Reports 3 Deaths Among Bird Flu Cases in Humans
description: China has confirmed 15 serious cases of H7N9 avian flu in humans, the World Health Organization reported Monday. All the people first reported symptoms in December; three have died, the rest are in critical condition. Their ages range from 20 to 78, with most over 50. All but one had a known history of exposure to live poultry. Human infections with this bird flu strain were first noticed in March 2013. Since then, there have been more than 450 cases, with the numbers spiking in winter and vanishing in summer. Thus far, the H7N9 strain has not been known to move easily between humans, although there have been some family clusters. There has been no known spread to health care workers. China has tried to fight outbreaks by shutting live poultry markets for cleaning, but legal and illegal markets continue to operate, the W.H.O. has said.

title: Guatemala: Former Police Official Is Convicted in 1980 Embassy Siege
description: A court on Monday convicted a former police official of crimes against humanity and homicide in the 1980 siege of the Spanish Embassy that ended in a fire, killing 37 people, including diplomats, Guatemalan politicians and student and rural activists. Among the dead was the father of the Nobel Peace laureate Rigoberta Mench; he was a member of an indigenous group that seized the embassy to protest the militarys brutal campaign against Indian villages as part of its battle against leftist rebels. The three-judge tribunal ruled that the official, Pedro Garca Arredondo, 70, the leader of a special police investigative unit, cut off negotiations, ordered officers to attack the embassy and prevented anyone from leaving after the fire broke out. The cause of the fire has never been determined. Mr. Garca was sentenced to 90 years in prison for his actions in the embassy fire and the killing of two students at a subsequent mass funeral. He is already serving a 70-year prison sentence for his role in the 1981 disappearance of a student leader.

title: Comfort in Action
description: Administrivial New Puzzle Website Alert! Fred Piscop, author of the Split Decisions variety puzzles, has recently launched a website where he will occasionally post new ones. You can check out these fun puzzles here.

title: A Detainees Diary
description: Last week, several Republican senators, including John McCain, called on President Obama to stop releasing detainees from the prison at Guantnamo Bay, Cuba. Their argument was that after the terror attacks in Paris, the 122 prisoners still in Guantnamo should be made to stay right where they are, where they can do the West no harm.

title: Shaun White Is Back on His Board, With Something to Prove
description: Stowing his side projects as a mogul and a musician for a moment, Shaun White was back on his snowboard beneath the lights at Buttermilk Mountain in Aspen, Colo., on Monday night, launching himself from the halfpipe during practice for this weeks Winter X Games.

title: Miss Israels Selfie Puts Another Miss in a Bind
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon  Miss Lebanon was just minding her business, she says, when Miss Israel came along, pulled out a smartphone and snapped a selfie  posting it on her social media accounts and implying to all the world that the Lebanese beauty queen had been fraternizing with the enemy.

title: Mubaraks Wife Says Husband Has Been Vindicated
description: CAIRO  Nearly four years after the popular uprising that forced President Hosni Mubarak from power in disgrace, his wife, Suzanne Mubarak, is celebrating his vindication, she told a Kuwaiti journalist in an interview published online over the weekend.

title: Reinventing the Pig, and Causing Pain
description: Several experiments on pigs at the U.S. Meat Animal Research Center in Nebraska have caused injury, pain and premature death.

title: Animal Welfare at a Research Center
description: Practices at the U.S. Meat Animal Research Center are discussed by James Keen, who worked as a veterinarian and scientist at the center.

title: U.S. Research Lab Lets Livestock Suffer in Quest for Profit
description: At a remote research center on the Nebraska plains, scientists are using surgery and breeding techniques to re-engineer the farm animal to fit the needs of the 21st-century meat industry. The potential benefits are huge: animals that produce more offspring, yield more meat and cost less to raise.

title: Victoria Azarenka, Unseeded but Still Hungry, UshersSloane Stephens to an Early Exit
description: MELBOURNE, Australia  Victoria Azarenka and Sloane Stephens have played each other in Melbourne and only in Melbourne, and although the plot lines in their matches have varied greatly, the bottom line has remained the same.

title: Sleepy Hollow Recap: A Surprise Return, and a Relationship That Wont End
description: We learned an important lesson from Monday nights episode of Sleepy Hollow: We can all cross art restorer off our list of possible alternate careers.

title: Sorority Anti-Rape Idea: Drinking on Own Turf
description: WASHINGTON  Walking past some fraternity parties on the George Washington University campus Saturday night, Sivan Sherriffe wondered about a longstanding tradition at her school and colleges nationwide.

title: Well Before Scandals, Cosbys Wife Faulted Media Treatment of Blacks
description: Bill Cosbys public defenders have not been numerous of late, but they have included some serious, credible people like Whoopi Goldberg, Ben Vereen and, most recently, Phylicia Rashad  his wife on television for more than a decade  who expressed her full support for him as he confronted accusations that he was a serial sexual predator.

title: Benanti and Radnor to Star in She Loves Me on Broadway
description: The Roundabout Theater Company will continue its emphasis on musical revivals in its 50th anniversary season, announcing Monday a new Broadway production of She Loves Me, opening next spring.

title: James Pattersons Most Expensive, Exploding Book
description: For just under $300,000, one super (rich) fan of James Patterson will have the opportunity to purchase the authors next book and watch it explode a day after opening it.

title: Word of the Day | relish
description: relish \re-lish\ verb and noun

title: 2 Jets Searched at J.F.K. After Report of Bomb Threat
description: Two Delta Air Lines jets were searched at Kennedy International Airport on Monday night after a report of a bomb threat, officials said.

title: Its Time to Think About Refinancing Your Mortgage
description: The bond market is a complicated thing, and it is understandable if most people dont spend a lot of time thinking about it. But even for Americans who dont want to spend any mental energy on yield curves, convexity and term premia, there is one simple thing to know about the current tumult in the multitrillion dollar market: Its time to think about refinancing your mortgage.

title: Vietnam Shows China Its Resolve With Military Posters
description: The billboard sat in a leafy park east of the old presidential palace in the center of Ho Chi Minh City, near several other posters that, among other things, celebrated the 70th anniversary of the founding of the Peoples Army of Vietnam. This one had a white dove flying across a blue background with a long red ribbon in its beak. To the doves left was a red flag with the hammer and sickle, the symbol of the Communist Party. To its right was the national flag of Vietnam a red banner with a yellow star.

title: Whats On TV Tuesday
description: 4:30 P.M. (Starz Cinema) LAUREL CANYON (2003) Jane (Frances McDormand, above), an aging, hard-partying Los Angeles record producer, opens her California dwelling to her snobbish son (Christian Bale) and his fiance (Kate Beckinsale), both Harvard Medical School graduates. Alessandro Nivola plays the lead singer of the rock band whose album is being overseen by Jane, who has a history of sleeping with the musicians she produces. This situation is no exception, and soon the entire family is led into temptation. Having set up its domestic conflicts, the movie doesnt know exactly where to go or how far, but when the inevitable emotional explosions erupt, the mutual recriminations carry a sharp sting, Stephen Holden wrote in The New York Times about this film, written and directed by Lisa Cholodenko, who said she was partly inspired by Joni Mitchells album Ladies of the Canyon.

title: How Forbidding Foie Gras Increased the Appetite for It
description: LOS ANGELES  A lot of people didnt know they wanted foie gras ice cream sandwiches until California made them illegal.

title: In State of the Union Address, Obama Is to Move Past Hardship and Reset Goals
description: WASHINGTON  With the American job market surging to life, President Obama plans to use his State of the Union address on Tuesday night to effectively declare victory over the economic hard times that dominated his first six years in office and advocate using the nations healthier finances to tackle long-deferred issues like education and income inequality.

title: Quotation of the Day
description: Part of the idea is reminding people what M.L.K. Day is about. Its not just a day off work.

title: Corrections: January 20, 2015
description: NEW YORK

title: In China, an Ingenious Scheme for Getting Out of Jail Early
description: Getting out of prison early in China can be a matter of ingenuity. It might not even need to be ones own.

title: Citic in Deal to Sell $10 Billion Stake in China Conglomerate
description: HONG KONG  Citic, one of Chinas biggest state-owned conglomerates, has agreed to sell a 20 percent stake for more than $10 billion to Itochu of Japan and Charoen Pokphand Group of Thailand.

title: Nativist Lawsuit on the Texas Border
description: The first thing to know about the lawsuit brought by two dozen states to block President Obamas executive actions on immigration is that it is a meritless screed wrapped in flimsy legal cloth and deposited on the doorstep of a federal district judge in Brownsville, Tex.

title: A Legal Victory for Monetary Policy in Europe
description: Among the many reasons for economic stagnation in the eurozone is the failure of the European Central Bank to buy government bonds to stimulate lending. A damaging lawsuit filed by a group of German citizens in 2012 made the bank even less likely to act. Last week, that legal challenge suffered a defeat when a preliminary opinion from the European Court of Justice sided with the bank.

title: A Perilous Year for Abortion Rights
description: The start of 2015 finds no letup in the attacks on a womans constitutionally protected right to make her own childbearing decisions. Republican lawmakers and organizations devoted to dismantling reproductive freedom have succeeded in shrinking the already inadequate number of abortion providers, making it exceedingly difficult, if not impossible, for women  especially young and poor women  to obtain safe and legal abortion services in large swaths Texas and other parts of the country.

title: Hostage Crisis Challenges Pacifist Japanese Public
description: AMAMI, Japan  A video posted online Tuesday showing a masked militant threatening to kill two kneeling Japanese men has confronted Japan with the same sort of hostage nightmare already faced by the United States and other nations. Prime Minister Shinzo Abe vowed to try to save the men, while also saying he would not give in to intimidation.

title: 6 Qs About the News | They Dont Need a League of Their Own
description: In Teams Mission: Beat the Boys (and Maybe Make Them Cry), Scott Cacciola writes about the Central Illinois Xpress, a basketball team that stands out in its fifth-grade league.

title: What Would You Grab in a Fire?
description: People who have only a moment or two to safely grab their possessions before fleeing a fire often say they reached for sentimental items like photographs or things that once belonged to departed loved ones or things that would be costly or otherwise difficult to replace.

title: Test Yourself | Hackers for Hire
description: Here are the first several paragraphs from a Jan. 15 article, Need Some Espionage Done? Hackers Are for Hire Online.

title: North Korea Uses Defectors Partial Retraction to Lash Out at Washington
description: SEOUL, South Korea  North Korea on Tuesday demanded that Washington stop pressuring it over human rights, citing a prominent North Korean defectors partial recanting of his story as evidence that a United Nations report on its rights violations could not be trusted.

title: Third Annual New York Portfolio Review
description: We know how hard it is to be a photographer today and that every break counts. Thats why we are again putting together 150 photographers and 75 of the most influential editors, curators, gallerists and book publishers for two days of private photo critiques on April 11 and 12.

title: Joel and Ethan Coen to Preside Over Cannes Film Festival
description: PARIS  Joel and Ethan Coen will preside over the jury of the 68th annual Cannes International Film Festival in May, the festival announced on Tuesday.

title: E.U. Official Urges Google to Offer Greater Concessions in Antitrust Inquiry
description: LONDON  One of Europes top policy makers on Tuesday called on Google to offer more concessions in a long-standing antitrust investigation that the search giant is facing in the European Union.

title: Your Tuesday Briefing
description: Want to get the briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.

title: Boston Mayor Says He Wont Try to Block Referendum on Hosting 2024 Olympics
description: BOSTON  Mayor Martin J. Walsh, who is not in favor of holding a referendum on Bostons hosting the 2024 Summer Olympics, said Tuesday that he would not try to block one.

title: As I Lay Lying: The Web Fixes Faulkner
description: The past is never dead, William Faulkner wrote, rather famously. Its not even past. But that was before the Internet, which can shed the past so smoothly that we dont even notice.

title: Nigerias Army of Psychopaths
description: LAGOS, Nigeria  Here in Nigerias commercial hub, it is tempting to regard Boko Haram, the Islamist terrorist group that for more than five years has waged war in the countrys far northeast, as a distant tragedy. We are, of course, aware of the fallout: the thousands of deaths, the hundreds of thousands of displaced persons, the destroyed infrastructure  schools, churches, mosques, homes, police stations  that will take years, and millions of dollars, to rebuild. But in southern Nigeria, it is easy to feel removed from the crisis.

title: New York Today: The Airbnb Debate
description: Good morning on this tolerably cold Tuesday.

title: Xi Gets a Raise, But Beijing Apartments Still Out of His Reach
description: Xi Jinping, the leader of China, the worlds most populous country and soon to be (maybe) the planets biggest economy, draws a basic salary that is so low it could not cover the monthly rent at a modest Beijing apartment complex.

title: Brioni, and a New Group of Front-Row Fans
description: MILAN  The common cry among fashion week attendees is a plaint of exhaustion and overexertion, but the most committed of front-row regulars has nothing on Jack Huston, the actor who is in deep preproduction in Rome for the title role in a remake of Ben-Hur.

title: Daily Report: A G.O.P. About-Face in the Net Neutrality Debate
description: Last November, when President Obama proposed strict rules to prevent broadband companies from blocking or intentionally slowing down the web, Republicans pounced on what they called yet another heavy-handed liberal proposal Jonathan Weisman reports.

title: Today in Politics
description: State of the Union Speech Is Full of Ideas G.O.P. Already Dislikes

title: Shake Shack Sets Price Range for I.P.O.
description: Moving a potential market debut further along the line, the premium burger chain Shake Shack on Tuesday priced the range of its initial public offering at $14 to $16 a share.

title: The Ups and Downs of Tennis Doubles Who Go It Alone
description: MELBOURNE, Australia  Andy Murrays appreciation for womens tennis is not limited to his decision to hire Amlie Mauresmo as his coach; he also regularly watches the womens game. Last week, Karolina Pliskova, a lanky Czech with torpid footwork but impeccable timing, caught his eye during her run to the final in Sydney.

title: French Premier Says Apartheid Is Leaving Minorities on the Fringe
description: PARIS  Prime Minister Manuel Valls of France on Tuesday cited a deep divide in the country, likening it to a state of territorial, social, ethnic apartheid that has left part of the population on the cultural fringe.

title: Porch.com Raises $65 Million in Financing
description: Over its two years of existence, Porch.com has amassed huge amounts of data from customers who turn to the start-up to find home improvement professionals.

title: Morning Agenda: Davos Takes Up Gay Rights
description: Anything related to gay and lesbian rights has long seemed to have been officially off limits at the World Economic Forum annual meeting in Davos, Switzerland. But this year, for the first time, the World Economic Forum is addressing the issue on the formal agenda for Davos. And while this may be a good first step, the topic nevertheless looks buried on the Davos program, Andrew Ross Sorkin writes in the DealBook Column.

title: Giorgio Armani: Fall 2015 Menswear
description: Milan

title: Weekly News Quiz | Jan. 13-19, 2015
description: Have you been following the news?

title: Results Disappoint, but Profit at Morgan Stanley Increases
description: Morgan Stanley reported lower than expected quarterly profits on Tuesday, suggesting that the banks effort to rebuild itself into a more reliably profitable enterprise is going more slowly than expected.

title: Mayor de Blasio Pays His Respects in Paris After Attacks
description: PARIS  The bouquets lay beside the sprawling memorial at the Hyper Cacher grocery store in eastern Paris, labeled simply enough for any guest to understand.

title: Beijing Investigating Detention of 100 Chinese in Myanmar
description: BEIJING  The Chinese government is investigating the detention of more than 100 Chinese citizens by Myanmar on suspicion that they entered the country to engage in logging, a spokesman for the Chinese Embassy in Myanmar said Tuesday.

title: In Performance: Tony Danza and Jason Robert Brown of Honeymoon in Vegas
description: In this weeks video, Tony Danza sings the number A Little Luck from the new Broadway musical Honeymoon in Vegas, based on the 1992 film. The shows composer, Jason Robert Brown, accompanies him on piano. And in a first for this series, Mr. Danza, who plays a high-stakes gambler in the show, performs some crackerjack tap dancing. Honeymoon in Vegas, directed by Gary Griffin, is at the Nederlander Theater.

title: A Lineup of Missteps
description: This week, an extra-large grab bag of grammar, style and other lapses, compiled with help from colleagues and readers.

title: Daily Clip Report
description: Good morning. Here is Daily Clip Report, a collection of articles about The Times and the media sent by email each morning to senior executives and newsroom editors. The email is produced by the Corporate Communications Department at The Times.

title: Micrel, a Chip Maker, to Review Its Options
description: Micrel, a semiconductor maker based in San Jose, Calif., said on Tuesday that its board had decided toundertake a comprehensive review of strategic alternatives to enhance value for shareholders.

title: The Gucci Reality TV Show
description: Its been interesting reading the reviews of Guccis mens wear show on Monday in Milan  the first of the post-Frida Giannini, possibly-about-to-be-Alessandro Michele era.

title: Roberto Cavalli: Fall 2015 Menswear
description: Milan

title: Coinbase, a Bitcoin Start-Up, Raises $75 Million in Vote of Confidence
description: Coinbase, one of the most popular Bitcoin wallet providers, announced on Tuesday that it had closed a $75 million financing round, the biggest yet for a virtual currency start-up.

title: Twitter Acquires ZipDial, an Indian Start-Up
description: Twitter said on Tuesday that it had acquired ZipDial, a nearly five-year-old Indian start-up that aims to help businesses connect with customers in emerging markets who may not have access to the Internet.

title: A Cover-Up, of Sorts, at a Tabloid in Britain
description: LONDON  After more than 40 years of running a picture of a topless woman almost daily on its Page 3, The Sun, Britains raucous and best-selling newspaper, appears to have given in to changing social attitudes.

title: Restaurant Report: Char in Singapore
description: Along a sleepy stretch not far from the dark alleys of the often seedy Geylang neighborhood, two brothers are quietly trying to revolutionize Singapores roast meat scene. Char, a cozy 70-seater, opened last January with Chinese-style roast meats being the stars of the menu  specifically traditional meats like char siew (roast pork) and siew yoke (crispy roast pork belly), but done in somewhat untraditional ways.

title: A Trot, Not a Gallop, Toward Renewal in Lexington, KY.
description: Residents of Mentelle, a neighborhood on the east side of Lexington, Ky., once drove right past National Avenue, a half-mile street hemmed in by railroad tracks and the hum of traffic on U.S. 60.

title: In South Africa, Fine-Art Landscapes for Postcard Prices
description: Last month, driving along Route 62 through Montagu, in South Africas Western Cape province, my friend Sabiha and I spied a sign announcing a car boot sale  a sort of roadside flea market. We didnt pause to confer: They had us at sale.

title: A Run on Arrack at the Liquor Store
description: Dear Diary:

title: Setting His Place at the Head of the Table
description: One thing is pretty certain about Larry Wilmores new show on Comedy Central. Viewers will want to hear what he has to say on Tuesday night.

title: Brawl Disrupts Drafting of Constitution in Nepal
description: KATMANDU, Nepal  Maoist opposition leaders in Nepal threw chairs and microphones at members of the governing parties on Tuesday at a meeting of lawmakers working to draft a Constitution on deadline. Three lawmakers and about a dozen security guards were wounded.

title: Koch Primary Tests Hopefuls In the G.O.P.
description: WASHINGTON  When Senator Rand Paul of Kentucky went to Kansas last year to campaign for Gov. Sam Brownback, he quietly requested a private meeting with the oil billionaire Charles G. Koch in his Wichita headquarters.

title: Activist Investor to Step Up Push for a Merger of Staples and Office Depot
description: The prominent activist investment firm Starboard Value is still trying to push Staples into buying one of its best-known rivals in the office supplies world.

title: That Fake Baby and Other American Sniper Issues
description: Clint Eastwoods American Sniper has been the talk  or a talk  of the town since surprising prognosticators by mopping up six Oscar nominations last week.

title: Sycamore Partners Ends Effort to Acquire Express, a Clothing Retailer
description: The private equity firm Sycamore Partners has given up a monthslong effort to acquire Express, the clothing retailer focused on young adults, after failing to secure financing.

title: Greek Lefts New Issue: All-Inclusive Resorts
description: ATHENS  David Phillips has been vacationing for over a decade at the Electra Palace Hotel on the island of Rhodes.

title: Cuomos Education Agenda Sets Battle Lines With Teachers Unions
description: Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo of New York has been laying the groundwork for an aggressive education agenda as he begins his second term, signaling that he will seek several major changes that, atypically for a Democrat, will put him in direct conflict with teachers unions.

title: Among Snowden Leaks, Details of Chinese Cyberespionage
description: Edward J. Snowden, the former contractor for the National Security Agency whose revelations of American cyberspying were widely praised in Chinas state media, may have lost a little of his shine among Chinese leaders after his latest revelations gave details of Beijings own cyberespionage.

title: 1890: Prince Bismarcks Policy
description: CONSTANTINOPLE  Some interesting information has been given me by a high official which throws a curious light on the tricks and manners of Prince Bismarck at this Court. In 1885, when war between Russia and Great Britain seemed to be imminent, Prince Bismarcks hostility to Mr. Gladstones Government was so notorious that there is nothing surprising in the fact that Baron Radowitz, the Prussian Ambassador, received instructions at that time to press upon the Porte the imperative necessity of refusing the British fleet a free passage through the Dardanelles in the event of war between Russia and Great Britain.  The New York Herald, European Edition, Jan. 21, 1890

title: Hong Kong Tycoon Li Ka-shing to Buy British Passenger Train Provider
description: LONDON  Li Ka-shing, Asias richest man, has added a major passenger train provider in Britain to his vast empire of corporate holdings, which includes ports, utilities and retail stores.

title: Milan Mens Fashion Week: Giorgio Armani Fall/Winter 2015
description: Scenes from the Milan Fashion Week photo diary of Filippo Mutani.

title: How Your Facebook Likes Could Cost You a Job
Milan Mens Fashion Week: Giorgio Armani Fall/Winter 2015
description: Scenes from the Milan Fashion Week photo diary of Filippo Mutani.

title: The State(s) of the Union
description: Beginning with his 2009 address to a joint session of Congress, President Obama has focused on several themes that remain hallmarks of his State of the Union speeches.

title: Kenya Investigates Use of Tear Gas on Schoolchildren
description: NAIROBI, Kenya  Kenyan officials said Tuesday that they had opened a major internal investigation into the conduct of police officers who tear-gassed elementary schoolchildren during a protest over a playground, an episode that drew widespread condemnation.

title: Texas New Governor Echoes the Plans of Perry
description: AUSTIN, Tex.  Greg Abbott, the first new governor of Texas in more than a decade, was sworn in here Tuesday as he prepared to lead the state at a time of economic anxiety, partisan divisions and shifting demographics, and he appeared poised to continue the policies of his predecessor, Rick Perry.

title: ISIS Has Executed Scores in Iraq This Month, U.N. Says
description: GENEVA  Islamic State extremists have carried out scores of execution-style killings in Iraq this month, the United Nations said on Tuesday, reporting cruel and inhuman punishment of men, women and children in areas under their control.

title: Auto Collectibles That You Can Wear
description: Admirers of auto-theme lapel pins bearing logos and other images represent a small but fervent subset of the car-collecting world.

title: First Draft Focus: Running Through Her Lines
At Ferragamo, Fendi and Etro: The Good Earth
description: MILAN  Pity the well-shod in Milan this week. Mens wear editors and retailers  a population given to expensive shoes  have been confronted with runways unpaved and laid with all manner of sole-scuffing irritants. At Stefano Pilatis show for Ermenegildo Zegna on Saturday, one tramped through dirt to arrive at a seat; at John Varvatos the next day, there was a damp blanket of fall leaves; at Salvatore Ferragamo the day after, more earth. One is an exception and two is a coincidence, but three, as the singsong saw goes, is a trend.

title: A Movie Palace Rebounds
description: An army of volunteers has been restoring the Landmark Loews Jersey Theater in Jersey City.

title: Misha Nonoos Beijing Adventure
description: The New York-based designer recently took an inspiration-seeking trip to the Chinese city. Here, she discusses what caught her eye.

title: McConnell Allies Start Super PAC to Keep Senate Majority
description: Allies of Senator Mitch McConnell, the new majority leader, are moving to impose order on the profusion of Republican outside groups that have sprung up over the last two years by setting up a super PAC devoted exclusively to helping Republicans keep control of the Senate in 2016.

title: A Cordoba Market With Modern Tastes
description: The Mercado Victoria in Cordoba, Spain, may be open from 9 a.m. every day, but if would-be diners arrive before noon, they may be eating solo.

title: Unlocking Scrolls Preserved in Eruption of Vesuvius, Using X-Ray Beams
description: Researchers have found a key that may unlock the only library of classical antiquity to survive along with its documents, raising at least a possibility of recovering vanished works of ancient Greek and Roman authors such as the lost books of Livys history of Rome.

title: Coup Fears Rise in Yemen as Rebels Storm Palace
description: SANA, Yemen  Houthi rebel militiamen seized control of the palace of Yemens president and clashed with guards outside his residence on Tuesday in an escalation of the violent crisis that has gripped the capital for days, raising fears of a coup in one of the Arab worlds most impoverished and insecure states.

title: Justin Bieber Gets Comedy Central Roast
description: Justin Bieber, the multiplatinum-selling singer and living public service announcement for why young men require powerful adult role models and high automobile insurance rates, does a pretty good job of making fun of himself. Even so, Comedy Central has determined that television viewers needed an event where this 20-year-old pop heartthrob would be made fun of to his face (and could laugh at himself), and has announced that Mr. Bieber will be the headliner and guest of honor at its next Comedy Central Roast.

title: Redmayne & Jones: Swear Words
description: Part 3: The stars of The Theory of Everything reflect on what they learned from meeting the families of A.L.S. patients.

title: TimesTalks | Redmayne & Jones: Preview
description: Eddie Redmayne and Felicity Jones, the stars of The Theory of Everything, talk about recreating Jane and Stephen Hawkings unconventional love story.

title: Redmayne & Jones: Stephen Hawking
description: Part 4: The stars of The Theory of Everything describe meeting Stephen Hawking for the first time, and recall his reaction to the film.

title: Redmayne & Jones: Jane Hawking
description: Part 5: The stars of The Theory of Everything talk about Jane Hawkings influence on the film, and explain why an osteopath was hired to work with Eddie Redmayne during production.

title: Redmayne & Jones: Love in All Its Guises
description: Part 2: The stars of The Theory of Everything recall how they each became involved with the film.

title: Redmayne & Jones: Intro
description: Part 1: Carol Olsen Day, director of TimesTalks, introduces the actors Eddie Redmayne and Felicity Jones, the stars of the film The Theory of Everything.

title: Redmayne & Jones: Which Baby Is This?
description: Part 6: The stars of The Theory of Everything recall their struggles to understand the science behind Hawkings work, and talk about the challenges of shooting a biopic out of order.

title: Redmayne & Jones: Texts From Jane
description: Part 10: The stars of The Theory of Everything discuss what it was like to work on a film about A.L.S. during a year when the Ice Bucket Challenge focused attention on the disease.

title: Redmayne & Jones: The Hardest Scene
description: Part 7: The stars of The Theory of Everything talk about a crucial scene in the film and explain why it was so difficult to shoot.

title: Redmayne & Jones: Champagne on a Spoon
description: Part 8: The stars of The Theory of Everything explain how watching documentaries influenced their performances.

title: Redmayne & Jones: A Fan of Women
description: Part 9: The stars of The Theory of Everything talk about why they find Stephen Hawking so charismatic in person.

title: Redmayne & Jones: Moments of Letting Go
description: Part 12: The stars of The Theory of Everything talk about the scene in the film that most impressed Hugh Jackman,

title: Redmayne & Jones: Essence
description: Part 14: The stars of The Theory of Everything reveal the biggest thing that can go wrong for an actor on the first day of a film shoot.

title: Redmayne & Jones: Watching the Dailies
description: Part 11: The stars of The Theory of Everything explain the long-term effects that the physicality of Eddie Redmaynes performance had on him.

title: Redmayne & Jones: You Just Cope With It
description: Part 13: The stars of The Theory of Everything reflect on what they learned about humor from A.L.S. patients.

title: Which Literary Figure Is Overdue for a Biography?
description: Each week in Bookends, two writers take on questions about the world of books. This week, Thomas Mallon and Ayana Mathis on authors whose life stories should be told.

title: After Frida Gianninis Departure, a Brand-New Mens Collection at Gucci
description: By all outward signs  the location, on Piazza Oberdan, the milling crowds of gawkers and photographers outside, even the champagne-bearing waiters in the lacquered black atrium within  there was nothing unusual about the Gucci mens wear show Monday.

title: Prosecutors in Poland Send Polanski Extradition Request to Court
description: WARSAW  Polish prosecutors on Tuesday forwarded arequest for the extradition of the director Roman Polanskito the United States, over a 1977 conviction for having sex with a 13-year-old girl, to the district court in Krakow.

title: An Epic, Space-Bound New Album from the L.A. Musician Jack Name
description: Maybe its a strange thing to be a concept album person, but its just the way my brain works. I like long, epic, ridiculous things, says the Los Angeles-based musician Jack Name, a former member of the cult-favorite San Francisco psychedelic band White Fence whose latest LP, Weird Moons, is out today via Castle Face Records. On his last record, 2014s Light Show, Name revealed a twisted battle between light and shadows, the subtext of which was a criticism of the use of prescription drugs to suppress childrens creativity. The concept of Weird Moons is even more eccentric: a posthumous space trip in which the albums protagonists transform into werewolves and then shape-shift depending on their proximity to each of Jupiters 67 moons.

title: Meeting the Baby, Becoming a Family
description: Ive never been a big believer in signs from above or cosmic signals or any of that flimflam. But the package I saw on my doorstep on Jan. 6 gave me pause: a free sample of Enfamil formula.

title: 2 Wall Street Deal Makers Form an Activist Fund With a Twist
description: For years, Douglas L. Braunstein and James C. Woolery advised companies on how to defend themselves against activist investors. Now the two veteran Wall Street advisers plan to become shareholder activists themselves.

title: 1915: Zeppelin Raid Targets Royals
description: LONDON  The long-talked of Zeppelin air raid upon England is an accomplished fact. German airships, probably starting from Cuxhaven, came up over the North Sea to strike coward blows at undefended towns in East Anglia, on their way to bombard Englands King and Queen, at Sandringham, their Norfolk country home. The raiders dropped bombs at Yarmouth, Sheringham, Kings Lynn, Beeston, Dersingham, Grimston and Snettisham, with the result that several persons were killed and several injured, women and children among the number.  The New York Herald, European Edition, Jan. 21, 1915

title: Doctor Critically Wounded in Boston Hospital Shooting, Police Say
description: BOSTON  A man walked into a prestigious Boston hospital on Tuesday, asked for a particular doctor and then shot him twice before taking his own life, law enforcement officials said.

title: Analysis of Obamas State of the Union Address
description: President Obama delivered his State of the Union address on Tuesday night, outlining his agenda in front of a joint session of Congress, which is fully controlled by Republicans for the first time in his presidency.

title: Ban on Prison Beards Violates Muslim Rights, Supreme Court Says
description: WASHINGTON  The Supreme Court on Tuesday unanimously ruled that Arkansas corrections officials had violated the religious liberty rights of Muslim inmates by forbidding them to grow beards.

title: A Counterculture Spirit Flourishes, Preserved Under Fiberglass Domes
description: DAVIS, Calif.  The trill of panpipes from a yurt wafted across the mulch hillocks of the Domes, a 1970s experiment in communal housing in which students live in igloolike fiberglass domes and snuggle up in snow-white interiors of plastic foam.

title: Cuomo Wants Elevated Train Link Built to Ill-Served La Guardia Airport
description: It is a struggle known to generations of weary air travelers: the traffic-choked, anxiety-laden trip to La Guardia Airport, heartbeats and taxi meters rising in unison.

title: Fallout Builds From Ruling on Insider Trading
description: An appeals court decision in December that reversed the insider trading convictions of two hedge fund managers has been the equivalent of dropping a big rock into a calm lake as the waves keep spreading to other cases. The Justice Department is fighting to minimize the impact of the opinion, which raised the bar on what the government must show to establish a violation for trading on confidential information.

title: De Blasio Pays Tribute to Paris Victims
description: Mayor Bill de Blasio of New York, honoring victims in Paris, said the recent terror attack in the city was a turning point like Sept. 11.

title: Insurgents Attack Yemeni President
description: The president of Yemen, Abdu Rabbu Mansour Hadi, was believed to be inside the presidential palace when it was attacked by insurgents. It was not immediately clear if he was safe.

title: Japan Calls ISIS Acts Unforgivable
description: Prime Minister Shinzo Abe of Japan responded to the ISIS video showing two Japanese hostages, calling the Islamic States methods unforgivable.

title: Israeli Government Watchdog Investigates Militarys Conduct in Gaza War
description: JERUSALEM  Israels government watchdog, the state comptroller, said on Tuesday that he had opened an investigation into decisions made by military and political leaders during last summers 50-day war with the Hamas militant group in Gaza.

title: To Invest, or Not, as China Shifts
description: HONG KONG  On a tour of central Henan Province in May of last year, Chinas president, Xi Jinping, first raised the notion of the economy adjusting to a new normal. Eight months later, with the economy growing at its slowest pace in more than two decades, it is increasingly clear what this adjustment will mean for China.

title: Tempering a Worldview With Freedom and Fairness
description: How is it possible to construct a free-market economy that is also fair? That should be the central question for this years annual gathering of the global elite at the World Economic Forum in Davos, Switzerland.

title: Misha Nonoos Adventures in Beijing
description: As a designer in the CFDA Fashion Incubator, an initiative supported by W Hotels Worldwide that fosters young fashion brands, Misha Nonoo was given a round-trip ticket to travel abroad this winter to seek inspiration for her forthcoming resort and spring 2016 collections. She spun the globe and put her finger on Beijing. Ive always been fascinated by the Great Wall and the immense history of Beijing, she says. And now that China has the number-one economy, I was curious to see how it would change in the future. Having grown up in Bahrain and London before moving to Paris and later New York, Nonoo has something of a gypsy spirit, which is often evident in her collections. For spring 2013, she nodded to Havanas languid climes with crisp white silhouettes and colorful prints, while the following season she featured a palette of black-and-red fabrics and furry hats reminiscent of a trip to the Russian countryside.

title: AirAsia Jet Climbed Too Fast, Inquiry Finds
description: JAKARTA, Indonesia  The AirAsia plane that crashed into the Java Sea last month had climbed at excessive speeds to an unusually high altitude before plunging and disappearing from radar, Indonesias top transportation official said Tuesday.

title: The Art of Matching Actor and Role
description: For almost three decades, the Casting Society of Americas annual Artios Awards, which recognize achievement in the often overlooked profession of casting, have been announced long after the Oscars, making the casting directors seem less relevant to the awards season conversation. But after the 2013 documentary Casting By questioned why there wasnt a dedicated category at the Academy Awards, the society moved its ceremony, putting it in line with the similar events of guilds and other Hollywood organizations. The 30th Artios awards will take place Thursday, in both New York City (with Michael Urie as host) and Los Angeles (with Patton Oswalt doing the honors).

title: Keeping a Lid on What Happens in Davos
description: FRANKFURT  It was a parable in the unwritten rules of Davos party-giving.

title: Who Are the Houthis of Yemen?
description: The Houthis, an insurgent group based in northwestern Yemen, won major concessions from the countrys president Wednesday after its militiamen besieged the presidential palace in Sana. President Abdu Rabbu Mansour Hadis accession to the groups demands defused a violent standoff in the capital that raised fears about the stability of the government.

title: Cross-Dressing in Pakistan
description: In a conservative Islamic nation, some Pakistanis attempt to balance two identities.

title: Butter & Scotch Combines Cupcakes and Cocktails
description: To Indulge: Cupcakes and Cocktails Are on the Menu

title: Echoes of Piketty in Obama Proposal to Address Income Inequality
description: At the end of his book Capital in the Twenty-First Century, Thomas Piketty proposes a global wealth tax to help address the problem of runaway income inequality. In contrast with the careful research that went into the book, the suggestion of a global wealth tax struck many tax policy veterans as nave and unhelpful.

title: Exposure Offers Clarity in the Risky World of Investing
description: Last week, a conversation with a friend reminded me how easily we can confuse actual risk with our own exposure to that risk. My friend travels a lot for work, and I asked him where he planned to go this year. His answer surprised me. I dont know, he replied. With everything going on in the world, Im not sure I want to travel as much.

title: Rival Suitor for New York Clearinghouse Raises Bid
description: BGC Partners has increased its offer for the GFI Group, the New York brokerage firm and clearinghouse, in an effort to wrest the company from the arms of its chosen suitor, the operator of the Chicago Mercantile Exchange and the Chicago Board of Trade.

title: Stratford Festival Mainstay Will Be New Star of Beautiful on Broadway
description: Chilina Kennedy, who previously starred on Broadway in Jesus Christ Superstar, will take over the title role of Beautiful: The Carole King Musical on March 7. Ms. Kennedy has big shoes to fill: she is replacing Jessie Mueller, who won a Tony Award in June for her performance as the seminal singer-songwriter.

title: The State of the Union and the Minimum Wage
description: In his State of the Union speech on tonight, President Obama is expected to again call on Congress to raise the federal minimum wage. His case is unassailable. The minimum was last updated eight years ago, when lawmakers passed a plan to raise it in steps to $7.25 in 2009. That level was too low even back then. And with each passing year, its inadequacy becomes more apparent. The economic underclass is growing, the economy is becoming more unequal and taxpayers are being forced to subsidize low-wage employers by providing public aid to underpaid workers.

title: In State of the Union, Obama Sets an Ambitious Agenda
description: WASHINGTON  President Obama claimed credit on Tuesday for an improving economy and defiantly told his Republican adversaries in Congress to turn the page by supporting an expensive domestic agenda aimed at improving the fortunes of the middle class.

title: Christies Reports Strong Numbers for Postwar and Contemporary Art
description: The London-based auction house Christies said its 2014 art sales totaled 5.1 billion pounds, or about $7.7 billion, a 12 percent increase over 2013. Growth at Christies was led by postwar and contemporary art, which contributed 1.7 billion (about $2.6 billion) of the years 4.2 billion ($6.4 billion) in public sales.

title: Brennans
description: The famed New Orleans restaurant gets new owners and a face-lift.

title: Brennans in New Orleans Walks the Tightrope of Tradition
description: NEW ORLEANS  The busiest meal of the day is still breakfast, which for many customers still begins with a cocktail and ends with dessert. At tableside trolleys inside the many dining rooms, bananas still go up in flames every few minutes. The stucco facade on Royal Street in the French Quarter is still pink, although the paint manufacturer prefers to call it Tomato Cream Sauce. (The trim color is Mayonnaise.)

title: Better but Still Troubled: Our Take on the State of the Union
description: President Obama isnt going to offer an objective overview of the country when he delivers his sixth annual address to Congress on Tuesday night. No president does so in a State of the Union. He will instead emphasize the positive, mostly elide the negative and take a few wry digs at the other political party.

title: Life in the Domes
description: The counterculture still thrives at an alternative housing community at the University of California, Davis.

title: Sororities Should Throw Parties
description: With campus sexual assault a major topic of national concern and conversation, universities are experimenting with ways to reduce sexual violence. One popular strategy is to crack down on fraternities. The University of Virginia, for instance, suspended frat activities after the publication of the now-discredited Rolling Stone story on the gang rape of a freshman; then it announced new safety measures, including a rule stipulating that at least three sober and lucid frat members monitor parties. Clemson, Emory and Johns Hopkins, among others, have also moved to curtail Greek mayhem.

title: Cooking With Kimchi
description: Ask any native or transplanted Koreans about kimchi and you will be told that it is the very backbone of Korean cuisine. It is a cultural necessity, eaten enthusiastically at every meal, and daily life is unimaginable without it.

title: Guantnamo Diary, by Mohamedou Ould Slahi
description: On or about Sept. 11, 2001, American character changed. What Americans had proudly flaunted as our highest values were now judged to be luxuries that in a new time of peril the country could ill afford. Justice, and its cardinal principle of innocent until proven guilty, became a risk, its indulgence a weakness. Asked recently about an innocent man who had been tortured to death in an American black site in Afghanistan, former Vice President Dick Cheney did not hesitate. Im more concerned, he said, with bad guys who got out and released than I am with a few that, in fact, were innocent. In this new era in which all would be sacrificed to protect the country, torture and even murder of the innocent must be counted simply collateral damage.

title: Modernism on a Religious Kick, Monolithic Egyptian Sculpture and More from the Art Calendar
description: Ts list of happenings worth visiting in the week ahead.

title: Clinton the Musical Is Definitely Running Off Broadway
description: For those who cant get enough of Bill and Hillary Clinton  or want to see them lampooned in the tawdriest way possible  the stage satire Clinton the Musical is getting an open-ended commercial run at Off Broadways New World Stages complex, the producers announced on Tuesday. The show, which had a brief outing last summer in the New York Musical Theater Festival, focuses mostly on scandals in the Clinton administration (Monica Lewinsky features prominently) and splits the president into two characters  the diligent WJ and the roguish Billy  while portraying Mrs. Clintons character as politically ambitious.

title: More Work to Be Done at Morgan Stanley
description: Morgan Stanley has rained on its own parade. The Wall Street firm was progressing nicely in the first nine months of 2014. But a dismal fourth quarter exposed cracks that its boss, James P. Gorman, still needs to fix.

title: Scaling El Capitan, for Your Browser
description: Tommy Caldwell and Kevin Jorgeson, two highly skilled rock climbers, completed their trek to the top of El Capitan, in Yosemite National Park, last week.

title: First Draft Focus: Back to the Capitol for Reid
A Long Haul to the Top of El Capitan
description: Last week, Tommy Caldwell and Kevin Jorgeson climbed to the summit of El Capitan, in Yosemite National Park, by way of the Dawn Wall, the rock formations most challenging route.

title: The Heart of Robin Hood Delays Plans for Broadway
description: The springtime Broadway production of the new play The Heart of Robin Hood has been postponed, its producers announced on Tuesday. The decision appears to have come down to ticket sales: The show, an athletic, spectacle-driven reimagining of the Robin Hood story, is selling well for its current Toronto production, but two New York group sales agents said that seats for the Broadway run havent been snatched up in droves. The two sales agents spoke on condition of anonymity to describe confidential sales information.

title: From The Upshot: The State of the Union
description: Better but Still Troubled: Our Take on the State of the Union

title: My Very Educated Readers, Please Write Us a New Planet Mnemonic
description: When Pluto was demoted from planethood, the trusty mnemonic My Very Educated Mother Just Served Us Nine Pizzas lost its main dish. Teachers and students across the world came up with adjustments. My Very Educated Mother Just Served Us Noodles was an easy tweak. Others revamped the mnemonic entirely  Mean Very Evil Men Just Shortened Up Nature was the offering of Caltech astronomy professor Mike Brown.

title: A Sales Bump for Honeymoon in Vegas on Broadway
description: Its too soon to say if the new Broadway musical Honeymoon in Vegas will be able to capitalize on its mostly positive reviews last Thursday and turn around its lackluster ticket sales during recent weeks of preview performances. But ticket sales did almost triple last weekend, a spokesman for the producers said on Tuesday, though the producers declined to provide dollar amounts that would put that box-office jump in context. Meanwhile, according to ticket-sale data released on Tuesday, Honeymoon in Vegas  a musical adaptation of the 1992 film comedy of the same name  grossed a modest $440,476 last week, or 43 percent of the maximum possible amount.

title: Whether Patriots Used Deflated Footballs Is a Question of Logistics
description: This seasons N.F.L. playoffs have had it all: overtime thrillers, disputed penalties, trick plays. But with one game remaining in the season, the league must now grapple with an odd question: Did the Patriots deflate some of their game balls in the A.F.C. championship game Sunday against the Indianapolis Colts?

title: Indias Rebounding Tiger Population Grows 30 Percent in 4 Years
description: Indias tiger population has rebounded, growing more than 30 percent over the last four years to 2,226, according to a new government census released on Tuesday.

title: Palestinian Authority Gives Partial Salaries to Employees
description: JERUSALEM  The Palestinian Authority has paid its employees 60 percent of their December salaries, using loans to make up for a shortfall caused by Israels withholding of $127 million in tax revenue it collects on the Palestinians behalf.

title: Milan Street Style
description: Fashionable men and women flock to Milan for the mens fall 2015 collection shows.

title: Cinderella Sets: No Place for Pumpkins
description: When the Mariinsky Ballet brought Alexei Ratmanskys Cinderella to the Brooklyn Academy of Music last weekend for its New York premiere, its arrival seemed like a homecoming. The drop curtain, painted with the silhouette of a jagged skyline that could be Manhattan or Downtown Brooklyn, rose to reveal a pair of three-story scaffolds recalling New Yorks fire escapes. Two black columns punctuated the stage. The set was edgy and urban  no place for pumpkins.

title: Zuma, Mixing East and West, Is Opening on Madison Avenue
description: Headliner

title: The Editorial Boards State of the Union Wish List
description: There is even less suspense about this years State of the Union than usual. The White House has been frantically briefing news organizations about the proposals President Obama is going to make tonight  and in any case its extremely likely (perhaps certain?) that his entire agenda will be dead on arrival in the Republican-controlled Congress. Sometimes I think that if Mr. Obama proposed repealing the Affordable Care Act the Republicans would reflexively reject him.

title: L.R.A. Commander Ongwen Heads to Face Charges in Hague
description: A notorious Ugandan rebel commander accused of kidnapping children and planning massacres is on his way to face charges of crimes against humanity at the International Criminal Court in The Hague, court officials announced Tuesday.

title: 43 and Pregnant
description: I was interrupted midthought, midword, midbreath. In that moment I was stunned into stasis, neither exhaling nor inhaling. I froze in place trying to process this unexpected news. Except the pink line persisted. So did my disbelief.

title: In Philadelphia, Juniper Commons Offers Comfort Grub of the 80s With a Soundtrack
description: PHILADELPHIA  Imagine what might have happened if Wolfgang Puck, in the early days of Spago, had gotten his hands on a Golden Corral. That gives you a hint of how it feels to eat at Juniper Commons, a new restaurant here devoted to showcasing the food, dcor and music of the 1980s.

title: U.S. Charges Manhattan Man With Trying to Buy Ricin
description: A man has been charged in Manhattan with trying to buy three to five lethal doses of the highly toxic poison ricin, seemingly for the purpose of reselling it, according to a criminal complaint unsealed on Tuesday in Federal District Court.

title: By the Numbers: How State of the Union Addresses Stack Up
description: For everyone getting their popcorn ready for tonights State of the Union address, the archivist for the House of Representatives has provided a handy guide for putting the speech in historical context.

title: President of New York Police Union Will Face Election Challenge
description: Patrick J. Lynch, the president of New York Citys largest police union, who has openly clashed with the mayor in recent weeks, is facing a rare challenge to his leadership from a group within the union, the Patrolmens Benevolent Association.

title: Japanese Detox Tips From a Geisha-Inspired Beauty Brand
description: Japanese women, regarded for their porcelain-smooth complexions, often utilize a seven-step regimen to care for the skin. But for those too busy for such a meticulous approach, Victoria Tsai, the founder of the geisha-inspired beauty line Tatcha, offers a few smaller suggestionsfor achieving flawless skin. And theres a good chance youre already well on your way to a cleaner complexion this time of year: Like the body, the face requires a good detox because skin is a mirror of your mental and physical health, Tsai explains. I start from the inside out.

title: For a Few Whirlwind Days, Davos Becomes the Deal Capital
description: Even before deal makers descended on Davos, Switzerland, for the World Economic Forum, they were making an important decision: how to protect their feet from the elements.

title: From ArtsBeat: Clinton the Musical Returns
description: Clinton the Musical Is Definitely Running Off Broadway

title: Calpers Is Not in Danger of Breaking Up With Private Equity
description: Any investment decision by the California Public Employees Retirement System, the nations biggest pension fund with about $300 billion in assets, is closely watched by investors around the world.

title: The Latest on Travel to Cuba
description: As the United States reopens its Embassy in Havana, heres what you need to know about traveling to Cuba. Much has changed already since the publication of new regulations for travel to Cuba on Jan. 16, which losened some restrictions on travel for Americans, though some . travelers still cannot just hop on a plane and go.

title: Abandoning the Lollipop Ship
description: Abandoning

title: An Immigrants Dream for a Better Life
description: Going behind the numbers and beyond the political debate, Mark Abramson got close to a young immigrant whose parents took her to California despite not having proper authorization.

title: Super Bowl 2015: Patriots Red-Hot Offense Faces Seahawks Dominant Defense
description: Last years Super Bowl pitted one of the greatest single-season offenses in N.F.L. history against one of the greatest single-season defenses. Using slightly different time frames, this years Super Bowl can boast similar claims.

title: IBM Revenue Slides as Revamping Takes Hold
description: IBM is in the midst of a challenging transition, and its fourth-quarter financial results reflected that reality.

title: At the Fall/Winter 2015 Mens Shows, A Crop of Pumpkin Pieces
description: When it comes to the fall/winter 2015 mens wear shows, to declare that orange is the new black would be to misrepresent most guys willingness to experiment with color. So far this season, though, there have been enough pops of burnt orange on the runway to inspire at least somewhat adventurous men to take on the autumnal shade,  la River Phoenix in the film My Own Private Idaho. In London at the Margaret Howell show, an orange jumper  worn on a red-headed model for extra oomph  brought new life to the British designers usually somber palette. In Milan, where the shows concluded today, the color continued to permeate some of the bigger collections. For Bottega Veneta, Tomas Maier played with a range of hues,from purple and kelly green to what he called persimmon, an orange shade that was deftly implemented in knits, outerwear and accessories like the above scarf. For Jil Sanders mens debut under the creative direction of Rodolfo Paglialunga, the designer also deployed accents of retro-inspired colors, including mustard and hunter green as well as a rusty shade seen in a covetable drop-shouldered textured polo. Though the copper-colored teddy-bear coat in No.21s collection might be a stretch for some men, the matching sweater worn underneath is a much more palatable option to try next fall.

title: Megyn Kelly on Fox News
description: Challenging conservative rhetoric.

title: A Cheeseburger, a Suburban Traffic Stop and a Ticket for Eating While Driving
description: ATLANTA  For something that merited a police stop, it does not sound like much: eating while driving. But that is what a police officer wrote on the citation he issued Jan. 10 after he pulled over the 2009 BMW that H. Madison Turner was driving through suburban Atlanta.

title: What Were Reading
description: Get recommendations from New York Times reporters and editors, highlighting great stories from around the web. What Were Reading emails are sent twice a week. Sign up

title: Jury Selection Begins in Colorado Theater Shootings
description: CENTENNIAL, Colo.  Two and a half years after a gunman killed 12 people inside a Colorado movie theater, jury selection in the case began Tuesday afternoon. More than 100 potential jurors filtered into the county courthouse here to fill out questionnaires and hear a judges introduction to one of the most complicated and emotionally charged criminal cases in this states history.

title: Whoa, Girl, What Big Teeth You Have!
description: How can you tell when a werewolf show is meant for young viewers? In Wolfblood, a charming series from the BBCs childrens division, theres one obvious sign: When the human-wolf hybrids change back into human form, theyre fully clothed. Where do their jackets and sneakers go when theyre running around in the woods? They dont seem to care, so apparently we shouldnt, either.

title: Through Art and Forensics, Faces of Unidentified Victims Emerge
description: Anyone who walked into Room 501 at the New York Academy of Art in TriBeCa the other day would have seen a roomful of sculpture students molding clay into faces that looked nearly alive.

title: Mixing Shades of Gray Into a Chirpy Comedy and a Mothers Anguish
description: Poor Pergolesi.

title: In Vienna, a New Pass to See the Sights
description: Travelers to Vienna can now see the citys major attractions with a single purchase: Vienna PASS, which gives visitors entry into more than 60 sights, made its debut this week and can be purchased by visiting viennapass.com.

title: Mark Ronson and Michael Chabon on the Making of Uptown Special
description: Even amid the all-star lineup of guests that dot the liner notes of Mark Ronsons latest album, Uptown Special, one name stands out among the rest: Michael Chabon. Ronson tapped the Pulitzer Prize winner to write lyrics for the album after realizing that the music  a mix of early R&B, funk and soul, and a departure from the up-tempo dancetracks of the longtime D.J.s earlier efforts  called for a more cerebral approach to lyric writing than what he calls the usual heartache on the dance floor that we settle for sometimes. Here, the Grammy-winning superproducer and the The Amazing Adventures of Kavalier & Clay author discuss the origins of their unlikely, if highly fruitful, collaboration.

title: A Judicial Fund-Raising Case Causes Justices to Reflect on Their Own Jobs
description: WASHINGTON  A Supreme Court argument about how the First Amendment applies to judicial elections turned unusually personal on Tuesday, with several justices reflecting on the power and dignity of the judiciary.

title: Charges and Clashing Interests Mar Selection of a Cabinet for Afghanistan
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  Choosing the Afghan cabinet is to government what the national sport of buzkashi is to polo: a wild and woolly version with uniquely local characteristics and notably more carnage.

title: Pictures of the Day: Lebanon and Elsewhere
description: Lebanon and More  Pictures of the Day

title: Jan. 20, 2015  Pictures of the Day
description: Photos from Lebanon, Bahrain, Ukraine and India.

title: A Prisoner and His Beard Win at the Supreme Court
description: On the face of it, so to speak, Holt v. Hobbs was not a difficult case.

title: Still Hoping a Big Gamble Pays Off
description: Many top Broadway producers dont invest money in their own shows, given that most close at a loss. They trust their tastes and instincts, not focus groups. And they rule out some Broadway theaters as too big.

title: The Weight
description: Day by day, meal by meal, training kids to cope with a rare genetic form of obesity.

title: What You Get for  $1,050,000
description: Contemporaries in Dallas and Oregon and a farmhouse in Maine

title: Obama to Visit Selma to Commemorate Marches
description: President Obama will travel to Selma, Ala., in March to commemorate the 50th anniversary of the march that became one of the seminal moments of the civil rights struggle and the inspiration for a contentious new movie, the White House said on Tuesday.

title: Iranian Commander Vows to Avenge Israeli Airstrike
description: TEHRAN  Irans highest Revolutionary Guards commander issued a threat against Israel after the death of an Iranian general in an Israeli helicopter strike along the border with Syria, saying that destructive thunderbolts awaited.

title: The Limits of a Mouth
description: Nate Wooleys new work For Kenneth Gaburo is a setting of a sentence by Mr. Gaburo (1926-93), a searching composer, conductor, pianist and language theorist. But its presentation of the words is extreme, to say the least.

title: To a Gamer, Minimalism Is a Virtue
description: the fire is roaring  so states the mobile game Ive been obsessed with lately, the one with barely any graphics, but with the hint of some very bad things to come.

title: Italy Goes Global in Search for Museum Directors
description: ROME  Wanted: Directors for 20 of Italys leading museums, including the Uffizi in Florence, the Galleria Borghese in Rome and the Accademia in Venice. Strong art history background, management experience and an interest in improving visitor experience a must. Fluency in Italian a definite plus, but not a requirement.

title: Led by a Tender Heart, Before It Is Ripped Out
description: Using words is dangerous in this eastern corner of Oz, yet sound is everywhere: the mournful music of a violin, the rasp of a witch, the spooky wind of the woods.

title: Verge to Run $700 Super Bowl Ad in Small Montana Market
description: The Verge, a technology website owned by the online media company Vox, said on Tuesday that it would be airing a Super Bowl advertisement, before revealing that it would in fact be spending just $700 on a regional spot in Helena, Mont.

title: Ex-Union Leader Convicted in Philadelphia
description: PHILADELPHIA  A former union leader was found guilty on Tuesday of extortion, racketeering and conspiracy for overseeing a campaign of violence and vandalism intended to force nonunion contractors to hire union members.

title: Sit Down, Have a Beer and Dont Forget Your Name Tag
description: A show unlikely to please the shy, the claustrophobic or those with weak calf muscles, Mrs. Mayfields Fifth-Grade Class of 93 20-Year Reunion takes place in an apartment on the fifth floor of an East Village walk-up. Whose apartment? Unclear, though certificates on the walls congratulate her on her mastery of ear candling and reiki.

title: From Blissful Love to Homicidal Rage
description: For someone who murdered his own children, Marcus is really rather charming. Aggrieved, yes, and determined to tell his side of things, but not bad company. He understands that hes committed a horror.

title: Coronation Street Was New, and Prince Charles Was a Boy
description: In 1957, when Americans took for granted electric ovens, hand-held mixers and finned cars, their British cousins were, comparatively speaking, just emerging from the cave. In a telling indicator, only 5 percent of working-class Britons owned a refrigerator, and only 12 percent over all. Yet this was the year that Harold Macmillan, the new prime minister, proclaimed, Most of our people have never had it so good.

title: Photos Show American Held in Egypt Badly Bruised and Ill
description: Photographs of an American holding a hunger strike in Cairo to protest his imprisonment without charges show him badly bruised and gravely ill, raising alarms about his deteriorating health and possible abuse.

title: Google and Fidelity Put $1 Billion Into SpaceX
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Google likes its ambitions sky high. This time, it has gone a little further.

title: Existential Animation
description: Take your pick: Is God a huge floating head or a petulant little girl whose creations keep going wrong? Those are only two of the existential options on offer in Sundance Film Festival Animated Shorts, a diverse compendium of eight short films culled from past festival lineups.

title: Netflix Accelerates Ambitious Global Expansion as U.S. Growth Slows
description: Netflix is hoping that it will define Internet TV in Swahili, Spanish, Vietnamese, Filipino and dozens more languages within just two years.

title: Your Evening Briefing
description: Catch up on the days top stories.

title: How Xbox Could Help Microsoft and Windows 10
description: SEATTLE  Microsoft has a lot of work to do to win over developers of mobile apps. One of its best hopes for mounting a comeback may be its Xbox game console.

title: What America Thinks of the 2015 State of the Union Address
description: Updated at 11:11 PM.Whats unusual about this years State of the Union address, many have noted, is how much we know already. President Obama has revealed that hell call for a federal program to cover community college tuition and tax credits for middle-income Americanspaid for by an increase in capital-gains taxes, among other changes. But, some say, that doesnt mean we know everything about how Tuesday nights speech will go. Below, watch the address andfind out what observers are saying before, during and afterward  Op-Talk will be updating with reactions throughout the evening.

title: A Conversation With Helmut Jahn, the Architect Behind One Liberty Plaza in Philadelphia
description: Mr. Jahn, 75, is a German-born architect based in Chicago whose work around the world includes the Sony Center in Berlin and One Liberty Plaza, one of the tallest buildings in Philadelphia. He is currently working on 50 West, a luxury condominium tower in Lower Manhattan.

description: The home, in the Valle Escondido development, is on the market for $1,195,000.

description: For social drinkers seeking freedom from guilt, gluten or a hangover, the list of beverage options is growing longer.

description: Middle class.

description: MONTCLAIR, N.J.  This community is easily described as a place where the city meets the suburbs, but its residents are struggling to decide just how suburban their township should be.

description: Did the United States kill OPEC?
