description: Follow our coverage with analysis and reaction to the State of the Union address here:

title: Shareholders Face Quandary in Battle for Family Dollar
description: The Dollar Wars are coming to an end, but the question remains whether it was a takeover battle worth the effort.

title: Cradle to Ivory Tower
description: Leaving aside all of the other good arguments both for and against it, I have one big problem with the proposal for free community college that President Obama recently outlined and described anew in his State of the Union address on Tuesday night.

title: 2 Yemeni Men Are Charged With Conspiring to Attack American Soldiers
description: Federal prosecutors in Brooklyn have brought a case against two Yemeni men with suspected ties to Al Qaeda, accusing them of conspiring to attack American soldiers in the Middle East.

title: Pope Amuses and Insults With Remark on Parenting
description: ROME  Over the past two years, the world has become accustomed to Pope Francis folksy manner. Indeed, with his homespun anecdotes and off-the-cuff quips, the pope at times comes off more like a plainspoken uncle than the leader of the worlds 1.2 billion Roman Catholics.

title: Obamas Realistic Aim: Changing the Conversation, Not Minds
description: Despite the fact that more than 30 million people are expected to watch President Obamas State of the Union address tonight, the speech is unlikely to change anyones mind about Mr. Obama or contemporary political issues. Its not even a potential game-changer.

title: 2 Teenagers Shot Near Brooklyn High School
description: Two teenagers were shot near a high school in Brooklyn on Tuesday, officials said.

title: Reviving the Hogan Club Line and Returning It to Its Roots
description: In October 1953, after winning the Masters, the United States Open and the British Open in the same season, Ben Hogan wrote a letter to club pros, seeking their support for his fledgling line of golf clubs.

title: Mourners Bear Flowers and Hopes for Unabridged Liberty
description: PARIS  The light of a candle flickered across Silvana DiPonzeos face as she leaned down to read one of the hundreds of notes and cartoons strewn among heaps of flowers near the former offices of the satirical newspaper Charlie Hebdo.

title: Smartphones Dont Make Us Dumb
description: AS much as we love our digital devices, many of us have an uneasy sense that they are destroying our attention spans. We skitter from app to app, seldom alighting for long. Our ability to concentrate is shot, right?

title: Traces of Montana Oil Spill Are Found in Drinking Water
description: HELENA, Mont.  Work crews burrowed through thick ice and set up containment booms Tuesday in a struggle to vacuum up 50,000 gallons of oil that spilled into the Yellowstone River from a ruptured pipeline, contaminating drinking water.

title: Rare Moment of Consensus for Senate on Keystone Pipeline
description: WASHINGTON  The Senate on Tuesday overwhelmingly approved an amendment to the Keystone XL pipeline bill that is aimed at improving energy efficiency in buildings  a rare moment of bipartisan agreement in a tense debate that is nowhere near being settled.

title: For States, $48 Million to Help Cut Emissions
description: Two charitable groups will spend $48 million over the next three years to help states figure out how to reduce emissions from electricity production, an effort to seize the possibilities that are opening up as the cost of clean power falls.

title: Argentine Leader Criticizes Dead Official
description: BUENOS AIRES  Facing a public outcry over the mysterious death of Alberto Nisman, the prosecutor leading the investigation into the 1994 bombing of a Jewish community center here, President Cristina Fernndez de Kirchner and her allies lashed out at the dead man on Tuesday, questioning whether he had allied himself with forces seeking to weaken her government.

title: Faith Seidenberg, 91, Dies; Took OnMcSorleys, an All-Male Haven
description: One frigid January night in 1969, Faith Seidenberg vividly recalled a few years later, she and another woman, shivering as much from fear as from the cold, boldly swung open the double doors of McSorleys Old Ale House in Manhattan, which had withstood for 115 years the entry of female customers.

title: $447,000 Seized by Government Will Be Returned to Business
description: Loretta E. Lynch, the United States attorney for New Yorks Eastern District and President Obamas nominee for attorney general, signed off on Tuesday to a settlement that would return $447,000 seized from a family-run Long Island business under a controversial area of federal law known as civil asset forfeiture. The business, Bi-County Distributors, was initially targeted because of a pattern of cash deposits under $10,000, but its owners, the Hirsch family, argued that the deposits were legitimate and, though more than two years passed after the money was seized, no criminal charges were filed. Lawyers from the Institute for Justice filed a motion demanding the return of the money. In the resulting settlement, neither side in the case admitted wrongdoing. Last Friday, the outgoing Attorney General, Eric H. Holder Jr., announced a policy change to rein in federal participation in civil asset forfeiture.

title: Safety Unit Broadens Its Scrutiny of a Ford Recall
description: A week after the nations top auto regulator warned automakers that he would be more vigilant on safety, his agency has taken the unusual move of revisiting the 2013 recall of Fords biggest pickup trucks.

title: Say It Like It Is
description: Ive never been a fan of global conferences to solve problems, but when I read that the Obama administration is organizing a Summit on Countering Violent Extremism for Feb. 18, in response to the Paris killings, I had a visceral reaction: Is there a box on my tax returns that I can check so my tax dollars wont go to pay for this?

title: Pope Francis September Visit to New York Is Expected to Be Just One Day
description: Pope Francis first visit to New York City, announced this week, will most likely last only a day, Cardinal Timothy M. Dolan, the Roman Catholic archbishop of New York, wrote on his blog Tuesday.

title: Limits on Presidents Acting Alone
description: How a handful of presidential actions have been challenged in court, by Congress and by later presidents.

title: Standard & Poors  Is Near  Costly  Settlements With U.S.
description: Standard & Poors, the giant credit ratings agency, is closing in on a series of settlements with the government that will erode its profit and may damage its credibility as a major player on Wall Street.

title: New Party Harnesses Discontent in Greece
description: ILION, Greece  Harry Theoharis, whose relentless efforts as head of Greeces tax collection agency prompted one newspaper last year to nickname him Little Stalin, was out campaigning recently in a smoky cafe in this working-class suburb of Athens.

title: Reflections of a Student Protester Who Became a Police Sergeant
description: At age 23, Cyress Smith helped barricade buildings at City College, shutting down classes for a day in the spring of 1991 to protest tuition increases at the City University of New York, where he was a political science major.

title: For Freshman Members of Congress, State of the Union Address Is a Rite of Passage
description: WASHINGTON  Representative Carlos Curbelo, a freshman Republican of Florida, slipped into the Capitol on Monday night toting three freshly pressed dress shirts and a half a dozen ties. The building was quiet and nearly deserted; President Obamas State of the Union address was still a whole day away.

title: Bold Call to Action in Obamas State of the Union, Even if No Action Is Likely
description: WASHINGTON  Near the end of his State of the Union address, President Obama noted, I have no more campaigns to run. A few Republicans in the audience cheekily applauded.

title: C.I.A. Report Found Value of Brutal Interrogation Was Inflated
description: WASHINGTON  Years before the release in December of a Senate Intelligence Committee report detailing the C.I.A.s use of torture and deceit in its detention program, an internal review by the agency found that the C.I.A. had repeatedly overstated the value of intelligence gained during the brutal interrogations of some of its detainees.

title: The Personal and the Political Intersect
description: Carlos Vargas cannot sit still.

title: Republicans Have One Word for Presidents Proposals and Veto Threats: No
description: WASHINGTON  No seems to be all anyone wants to say in this town anymore. In his State of the Union address on Tuesday, President Obama enumerated policies that he opposed, from rolling back Wall Street regulations to exempting more businesses from their obligation to provide health insurance under the Affordable Care Act.

title: Success and Shortfalls in Effort to Diversify N.F.L. Coaching
description: Todd Bowles had at least six interviews for N.F.L. head coaching jobs over the past five years. After each interview and rejection, he called an adviser to report who had been present, what questions had been asked, how long the interview had lasted and how he had performed.

title: Obamas State of the Union 2015 Transcript(Full Text) and Video
description: Following is the transcript of President Obamas State of the Union address, as transcribed by the Federal News Service.

title: State of the Union: Biggest Obstacle for Obama Is Publics Lack of Attention
description: State of the Union addresses  like most presidential speeches  rarely produce a bump in job approval ratings or bring around lawmakers of the opposite party. So why does tonight matter?

title: Tournaments Lawn Is a Place to Knock the Froth Off
description: MELBOURNE, Australia  Wimbledon has Henman Hill, hallowed ground where thousands go to watch  nay, worship  Britains tennis greats. The Australian Open has a beer garden where many patrons barely noticed Tuesday night that Lleyton Hewitt, a local favorite, was battling to get into the tournaments second round.

title: Family Seeks Release of a Guantnamo Detainee Turned Author
description: WASHINGTON  On one of the roughest days in Mohamedou Ould Slahis 14 years of captivity at Guantnamo Bay, Cuba, an American interrogator initially suggested that he pray out loud, then ridiculed him when he began reciting the Quran.

title: U.S. Outpost in Cuba to Step Out of the Shadows
description: HAVANA  Fidel Castro called the building a nest of spies, routinely marshaling tens of thousands of people to protest at its doorstep. His government even made a television mini-series with what it called images of American diplomats lurking in a forest nearby, dropping off suspicious bags and marking benches in acts of espionage.

title: Obama: The State of the Union Is Strong
description: During his State of the Union address, the president said the economy was growing and its now up to us to choose where we go from here.

title: Guyana: President Announces Date for Elections
description: President Donald Ramotar, who suspended Parliament in November to avoid a no-confidence vote, announced Tuesday that general elections would be held on May 11. I expect to win the election and win back a majority in Parliament, Mr. Ramotar said. His Peoples Progressive Party, dominated by Indo-Guyanese, has held power for more than 20 years but fell short of a majority in the assembly in 2011 with the rise of a multiethnic third party as a political force. The two main parties have traditionally hewed to racial lines: one drawing support from the descendants of Africans, the other from the descendants of Indians.

title: Potential Buyers of New York City Opera Hold a Bidding War in Court
description: New York City Opera may have run out of money, filed for bankruptcy and sold its costumes and instruments, but two rival groups are so interested in trying to reinvent the company that they held a bidding war in court on Tuesday for its name and remaining assets.

title: Britain: Man Pleads Guilty to Terrorism Charges
description: A British man who joined a jihadist group to fight in Syria and then returned to Britain after faking his death has pleaded guilty to four terrorism offenses, the London police said Tuesday. The man, Imran Khawaja, 27, of Southall in West London, left last January, joined a group called Rayat al-Tawheed and, with his face concealed, was featured in a grisly video in Syria in which he was described as British ISIS fighter Abu Daigham al-Britani with government soldiers head Syria, the police said. Mr. Khawaja, who is to be sentenced next month, was arrested entering Britain at the port of Dover last June. He pleaded guilty last month to charges including attending a terrorism training camp and preparing terrorist acts, but restrictions on reporting his plea were lifted just Tuesday.

title: Winning Lottery Numbers for Jan. 20, 2015
Why the Guests? Because Heartwarming Stories Work
description: Among the guests who will hear President Obamas State of the Union speech in person  in the first ladys box  are a police captain who helped reduce crime in Los Angeles by 50 percent and a college student from Dallas whose undocumented parents are eligible for the administrations deferred action program for parents of lawful permanent residents.

title: Coming Off the Bench, a Basketball Ambassador
description: WASHINGTON  After Yuta Watanabes first workouts at George Washington University, his teammates recognized that he had the jump shot, the speed and the basketball intelligence to succeed at the Division I level.

title: Michigan Governor Backs Measure Raising Sales Tax
description: Gov. Rick Snyder, a Republican, on Tuesday night urged Michigan voters to approve a sales tax increase to help pay for what he sees as long-needed repairs to roads and bridges, making him one of a small but growing number of governors to endorse raising taxes.

title: Everyone Pays Their Own Way
description: WEDNESDAY PUZZLE  Youll love this puzzle if you are the type who is vigilant about dotting your is and crossing your ts. Well set aside the is for today, but Jim Hilger insists that you cross your ts, and that you do it with the letter T.

title: An Uneasy Rapport
description: Like father, like daughter. That sentimental notion, usually cooed to emphasize an endearing trait shared across the generation gap, takes on a bone-chilling dimension in Im Gonna Pray for You So Hard, a potently acted but punishing drama by Halley Feiffer about the destructive relationship between a famous playwright and his daughter, an aspiring actress.

title: Yankees to Return to WPIX-TV, 20 Times a Year
description: WPIX-TV will carry about 20 Yankees games annually under a multiyear deal that brings the team back to the station, its longtime broadcast home in the New York area, a person familiar with the negotiations said. The Yankees were on WPIX from 1951 to 1998, from Mel Allen and Red Barber to Phil Rizzuto and Bobby Murcer.

title: Obama Defends New Taxes on the Wealthy
description: The president discussed tax increases on high-income earners and large financial institutions that would fund new initiatives during his State of the Union address.

title: Obama Calls for More Internet Options for Consumers
description: When President Obama said in the State of the Union that he wanted to extend the reach of the Internet to every community, he was really talking about increasing competition among Internet providers.

title: Obama on Progress in the ISIS Fight
description: The president discussed the military campaign against the Islamic State, and the larger battle against violent extremism, during his State of the Union address.

title: Hearing Pits Tenants Who Denounce Airbnb Against Those Who Profit From It
description: At a raucous New York City Council hearing that pitted affordable housing advocates against proponents of the so-called sharing economy, city lawmakers on Tuesday railed against an expanding short-term rental market that they said was teeming with abuse and neglect and undermining low-income New Yorkers.

title: Obama Discusses Next Steps With Cuba
description: The president discussed the move to normalize relations with Cuba during his State of the Union address.

title: Obama on Actions Against Climate Change
description: The president discussed his recent landmark deal with China and the need for more action during his State of the Union address.

title: President Obama Delivers the State of the Union
description: For his last two years in office, the president offered areas of possible consensus with Republicans and urged them to support him on education, child care and tax breaks for the middle class.

title: Can Capitalists Save Capitalism?
description: Key Democrats have reached agreement on a set of policies known as inclusive capitalism: a forceful market-oriented economic agenda intended to counter inequality, restrain the accrual of vast wealth at the top and provide the working and middle classes with improved economic opportunities.

title: With Rick Nash Pacing Action, the Rangers Prevail in Overtime
description: Some critics believed Rick Nash was the reason the Rangers did not win the Stanley Cup last year.

title: Century Later, the Chinatown Water Feud Ebbs
description: OWENS LAKE, Calif.  For 24 years, traveling across the stark and dusty moonscape of what once was a glimmering 110-square-mile lake framed by snow-covered mountains, Ted Schade was a general in the Owens Valley water wars with Los Angeles. This was where Los Angeles began taking water for its own use nearly a century ago, leaving behind a dry lake bed that choked the valley with dust, turning it into one of the most polluted parts of the nation.

title: Obama on Diplomacy and Iran
description: The president discussed the continuing negotiations to prevent a nuclear-armed Iran during his State of the Union address.

title: At the State of the Union, a President Outgunned in Congress Is Still Combative
description: The circumstances facing President Obama as he delivered his State of the Union address Tuesday night could not have seemed less promising: a presidency with only two years left to get anything done in a Congress that is now totally in the control of a party that has routinely ignored his pleas for cooperation. So he chose wisely to send a simple, dramatic message about economic fairness, about the fact that the well-off  the top earners, the big banks, Silicon Valley  have done just great, while the middle and working classes remain dead in the water. His remedy: skim from the rich and redistribute to those below, while deploying other weapons to raise wages and increase jobs.

title: Was Joni Ernsts State of the Union Rebuttal Conciliatory, or Just More of the Same?
description: Every year after the State of the Union address, the party in opposition to the president produces a response speech from one of its members that, of course, is written long before the president enters Congress for this annual ritual. Its not a terribly difficult job.

title: On the Docket: Is a Judge a Politician?
description: Adam Liptak, Supreme Court correspondent for The Times, discussed a case on judicial elections, Williams-Yulee v. The Florida Bar, with the specific issue being whether judges can ask for campaign money.

title: Transcript of Republican Response to 2015 State of the Union Address
description: Following is the transcript of the official Republican response to President Obamas State of the Union address, as transcribed by the Federal News Service.

title: McConnells Allies Establish Fund to Keep Senate in G.O.P. Hands
description: Allies of Senator Mitch McConnell, the new majority leader, are moving to impose order on the proliferation of Republican outside groups that have sprung up over the last two years by setting up a super PAC devoted exclusively to helping Republicans keep control of the Senate in 2016.

title: Obamas Zinger in State of Union Address
description: The president had an off-the-cuff response during his speech after applause broke out when he said, I have no more campaigns to run.

title: Jets Hire Chan Gailey as Offensive Coordinator
description: For his most critical hire as the Jets new coach, Todd Bowles turned to Chan Gailey as offensive coordinator.

title: Justified Recap: Decline, Loss and the Good Cheer of Dewey Crowe
description: Season 6, Episode 1: Fates Right Hand

title: The Allure of Easy Money
Paris Mayor Plans to Sue Fox Over False Reports of No-Go Zones
description: Apparently unmoved by the Fox News channels on-air apology to the people of France for broadcasting the false claim that areas of Paris are Muslim-ruled enclaves  or no-go zones outside the control of the state  the citys mayor announced Tuesday that she intended to take legal action against the network.

title: R.V.s and Stolen Kidneys: Life on the Fringes in Justified
description: The FX crime drama Justified, which began its sixth and final season on Tuesday, unfolds in a fictional version of Harlan County, Ky.  a place of cellphones and late-model sedans that nonetheless may as well be wherever Harry Potter takes place, said Jere Burns, whose conniving Wynn Duffy is a fan favorite. I dont know what thats called, but it may as well be that, because you have people there who would not seem to exist anywhere else.

title: Why Joni Ernst Talked About Her Tough Upbringing
description: As she did in her stump speeches for Senate last fall, Joni Ernst of Iowa mentioned her upbringing in her response to the State of the Union speech Tuesday night. She talked about tough times walking to the school bus and her feelings about being different from the other families in her town. Politicians do this because they think it makes them relatable  its a shortcut to many people that says, I understand you.

title: Joni Ernst Delivers Republican Response
description: Senator Joni Ernst, the newly elected Republican from Iowa, gave the official G.O.P. response to President Obamas State of the Union address on Tuesday.

title: Resort Looks With a Masculine Twist
description: With mens fashion week currently showing in Paris, now is a fitting time to borrow style cues from the boys. J.W. Andersons resort offerings for ladies and gents were literally cut from the same cloth; his color-blocked bomber jacket for women combines an androgynous feel with a streamlined shape. Julien David, another young designer, added a tomboy touch to his womens resort looks with his signature sneakers, styled with a baggy silhouette. A Peace Treatys graphic scarf, Comme des Garonss oxford shirt, Marnis Mondrianesque backpack, Miu Mius retro-style shirt and MM6s high-waisted jeans are similar in spirit: inspired by a man, tailored for a woman.

title: A Sci-fi-Inspired Music Video From a Buzzy Indie Band
description: For a few short years and just two albums, the Canadian band Women released some of the best art rock of the new millennium. Following the dissolution of the group in 2012 due to the death of the guitarist Christopher Reimer, the band members Matt Flegel and Mike Wallace enlisted their fellow Canadian musicians Scott Munro and Daniel Christiansen  of Lab Coast and Sharp Ends, respectively  to form Viet Cong, an indie-rock band with a shared penchant for charred, factious punk. We all embrace all of our musical histories and wouldnt be making the kind of music we make now if we hadnt learned from all the music weve played in the past, says Flegel, who plays bass and sings in the new outfit.

title: Word of the Day | transitory
description: transitory \tran(t)-s-tor-e, tran-z-\ adjective

title: Shanghai Blames Local Officials and Police in Deadly New Years Stampede
description: HONG KONG  The Shanghai city government dismissed two officials on Wednesday after releasing a report that blamed poor preparations and lax policing for a stampede that killed 36 people at a popular tourist site on New Years Eve.

title: Obama Says Family Leave Is an Economic Necessity, Not Just a Womens Issue
description: When the Labor Department recently gave states grants to expand paid family leave, the money came from the departments Womens Bureau. But in the State of the Union address on Tuesday, President Obama argued that paid leave is not just a womens issue. Its time we stop treating child care as a side issue, or a womens issue, and treat it like the national economic priority that it is for all of us, he said. Its often an economic necessity today for both parents in a household to work, he said.

title: An Emissary on the Court
description: Yuta Watanabe, the first mens Division I scholarship basketball player from Japan, has become something of a hero in his homeland as well as his adopted country.

title: Police Investigate Death of Man in Midtown Manhattan
description: A man died on Tuesday night after he was found unresponsive near Times Square, officials said.

title: Quotation of the Day
description: Will we accept an economy where only a few of us do spectacularly well? Or will we commit ourselves to an economy that generates rising incomes and chances for everyone who makes the effort?

title: Corrections: January 21, 2015
description: FRONT PAGE

title: Obamas 2015 State of the Union Address
description: The president delivered his State of the Union speech on Tuesday, addressing a wide range of issues, including the economy, immigration and national security.

title: What to Look For During Paris Mens Fashion Week
description: PARIS  When the traveling circus arrives at last in Paris, creakier and grouchier than it began weeks ago in London but no less properly dressed, the mens wear marathon begins its final lap.

title: Totally Tubular
description: I didnt watch the SOTU  I probably wouldnt have even if I had been on the right side of the Pacific. But Im reading some of the reporting; and because evil is more interesting than good, I think the most revealing remarks actually came from Joni Ernsts GOP reply.

title: Line Drawn on Purported Corruption in Calligraphy
description: In Chinese culture, calligraphy holds a hallowed status. In ancient times, emperors, mandarins and poets prized the skill of using ink and a brush to render words, texts and poems on paper with such vigor and grace that the complex characters of written Chinese become an art form of their own.

title: Chinas National Soccer Team Winning Games, and Fans
description: CANBERRA, Australia  For Chinese soccer fans, the new year is already an unusual one. After years of frustration, disappointment and cynicism with the national team, the 2015 Asian Cup is becoming a big success, with China winning all three games so far and finishing first in Group B.

title: Suspicious Death in Argentina
description: Some Argentines are calling Alberto Nisman, the maverick prosecutor, the 86th casualty of one of the deadliest, unsolved terrorists attacks in modern history: the 1994 bombing of a Jewish community center in Buenos Aires. That seems fitting whether his death over the weekend turns out to be a suicide, as the government of President Cristina Fernndez de Kirchner seems eager to establish, or the murder of a man who had learned too much.

title: Stabbing on Tel Aviv Bus Breaks a Fragile Calm
description: JERUSALEM  A Palestinian man stabbed and wounded up to a dozen Israelis on Wednesday as he rampaged through a bus in central Tel Aviv during the morning rush, the police said. He then fled on foot but was shot and wounded by security forces.

title: Test Yourself | Snapchat Stories
description: Here are the first several paragraphs from a Jan. 14 article, Be the Star of Your Own Snapchat Story.

title: Obama, Citing China as Rival, Warns Lawmakers Over Inaction on Trade Measure
description: President Obama held up China as a formidable rival to the global influence of the United States in his annual State of the Union address on Tuesday, warning lawmakers that failure to take action on trade legislation could be tantamount to ceding Americas leadership role to Beijing.

title: Why Is Binge Drinking So Common Among Young People in the United States?
description: The drinking age in all 50 states is 21 years old, yet under-age drinking is widespread. According to the National Institute on Alcohol Abuse and Alcoholism: Although youth drink less often than adults do, when they do drink, they drink more. That is because young people consume more than 90 percent of their alcohol by binge drinking.

title: The Megyn Kelly Moment
description: On a gray Wednesday in November, the Fox News anchor Megyn Kelly and four producers gathered around a conference table on the 17th floor of the News Corporation building in Manhattan. They were there to plan the 281st episode of The Kelly File, which would be shown live in a few hours, at 9 p.m. Kellys executive producer, Tom Lowell, a 25-year veteran of TV news, ticked through the program blocks, the between-commercial bits that are the basic unit of television programming. The A Block would contain a Fox News exclusive on the presidents plans to halt millions of deportations. The B and C Blocks would focus on the Obama health care adviser Jonathan Grubers declaration, caught on tape, that the Affordable Care Act passed in part because of the stupidity of the American voter. Slated for the D block was Jonathan Gilliam, a former Navy SEAL.

title: An Immigrants Dream for a Better Life
description: The pictures of Blancas life in California look ordinary: relaxing with her parents on the banks of a river, dressed up for her quinceaera, studying at school, moving into her first off-campus apartment. Yet to her  and to thousands of other immigrants whose parents brought them to this country without authorization  the pictures represent lives that reach for the future, aware of the obstacles that could one day take it all away.

title: France Vows Forceful Measures Against Terrorism
description: PARIS  The French government promised a sweeping legislative response on Wednesday to this months terrorist attacks, setting out proposals to monitor potential threats more closely and wading deeper into an emerging debate over balancing security and civil liberties.

title: Shakily, Rafael Nadal and Maria Sharapova Survive Upset Bids
description: MELBOURNE, Australia  His knees, back, wrist and appendix have all failed Rafael Nadal recently. On Wednesday, his stomach joined the list of ailments, but he gutted out a five-set victory, 6-2, 3-6, 6-7 (2), 6-3, 7-5, to reach the third round of the Australian Open.

title: After a Tragedy, the Memorabilia
description: New year, new tragedy  new fashion statement?

title: Your Wednesday Briefing
description: Good morning.

title: The State of Our Union, Tweeted
description: Members of Congress once had two primary means of responding to presidents while the yearly State of the Union address was delivered: stand and applaud, or sit on their hands and glare. Thanks to smartphones (or staff tucked away in offices with the passwords to official Twitter accounts), senators and representatives can now comment in real time to every word a president speaks. As they did in January 2014, the congressional audience wrote more than a thousand tweets during the approximately 65 minutes that President Obama spent delivering the State of the Union.

title: New York Today: Snow, but Not Like Last Years
description: Good morning on this cloudy Wednesday.

title: Champions League: How to Solve the Seeding Problem
description: The governing body of European soccer, UEFA, is soon expected to ratify a revamping of the seeding system for the Champions League, one of the worlds most popular sporting events.

title: Daily Report: Google Makes a Big Bet on SpaceX
description: Google likes its ambitions sky high. This time, it has gone a little further, Quentin Hardy and Conor Dougherty report.

title: Helping an Island by Helping Hawks
description: PAL DA SERRA, Portugal  It was warm and sunny when we started out from Funchal, the harbor town that is the capital of the Madeira archipelago of Portugal, on a recent morning. After a drive of about 45 minutes, we were high in the mountains. Thick fog was streaming across the rugged red and green landscape, and it was cold enough to make us want to put on hats and gloves.

title: Today in Politics
description: Republicans After the Speech: Obama Needs a Reality Check

title: A Tale of Two Pegs
description: Im still in Hong Kong, and theres a curious discussion here about the upward collapse of Switzerlands peg to the euro. You see, by the numbers Switzerlands monetary situation pre-collapse and Hong Kongs now look remarkably similar. Both were pegged to the currency of a much larger economy; in both cases the monetary authorities had accumulated huge reserves. Both found themselves at the mercy of that larger economys monetary policies  much obsession here over when the Fed will raise rates, much discussion of how low rates and QE in the US fed housing prices. So is the Hong Kong dollar at risk of a franc-like event?

title: Morning Agenda: Dollar Store Predicament
description: Shareholders are facing a predicament in the battle for Family Dollar, Steven Davidoff Solomon writes in the Deal Professor column. On Thursday, Family Dollar shareholders will vote on a proposed $8.5 billion acquisition by Dollar Tree, which is offering about $76 a share. If they vote yes, it will be the death knell for a competing bid by Dollar General that is about $4 a share higher, Mr. Davidoff Solomon writes.

title: Battery Ventures Hires Intel Capital Executive
description: Battery Ventures, a venture capital firm with offices in Boston, Menlo Park, Calif., and Israel, has hired Dharmesh Thakker,a former Intel Capital managing director, as a general partner.

title: Shazam at $1 Billion Valuation After Investment
description: LONDON  Shazam, a smartphone application that can identify songs, announced on Wednesday that it had raised $30 million in new funding round that valued the company at roughly $1 billion.

title: New Yorker Writer Is Surprised by Byline in Chinese Newspaper: His Own
description: Readers of Peter Hessler, the author of River Town and other well-received books about China, may have been surprised to see his byline this week in China Daily, a state-run newspaper.

title: Bank of England Dissenters Dropped Call to Raise Rates, Meeting Minutes Show
description: LONDON  Two Bank of England officials dropped their recent calls for higher interest rates and joined a unanimous vote this month to keep the benchmark rate unchanged, according to central bank minutes released on Wednesday.

title: 6 Qs About the News | In State of the Union Speech, Obama Defiantly Sets an Ambitious Agenda

description: To combat afternoon slumps in enthusiasm and focus, take a walk during the lunch hour.

title: Mirror, Mirror
description: Happy endings in opera are few and far between  especially for women. Outside of comic opera, it is rare for a heroine to survive the final act; the price for love is usually death. Tchaikovskys one-act opera, Iolanta, is an exception to this rule, a luscious setting of a fairy tale in which a blind princess finds love and the gift of sight.

description: While Republicans have been openly positioning themselves for the 2016 presidential election, the rumblings among Democrats have been more subtle.

title: After Fire, 2 Brooklyn Families Linked by Work Are Now Bound by Grief
description: Decades before a Russian billionaire brought a pro basketball team to Downtown Brooklyn and a trendy doughnut shop opened down the block, two immigrant families saw nothing but opportunity in the humble stretch of Flatbush Avenue between St. Marks Avenue and Bergen Street.

title: For Encore, Obama Takes His One America Tour to Idaho and Kansas
description: BOISE, Idaho  President Obamas presence here Wednesday said as much as his words, which, after all, mostly reiterated the middle-class economics agenda laid out in his State of the Union address the night before.

description: HONG KONG  The Chinese Communist Party has demanded an end to arrest and conviction goals for the police, prosecutors and courts, state-run news media said Wednesday.

description: What if the Academy Awards were reimagined, and instead of best actor and other traditional categories, films were nominated according to what kind of viewer they appealed to? You might get a technophile category in which the contenders are the cinematography of Mr. Turner, the sound mix of American Sniper and the performance-capture technique of Dawn of the Planet of the Apes. To see the nominations remixed, start here.

description: For years, renting a tuxedo was a simple proposition. Men went to a specialty retailer or the giant of black-tie rentals, Mens Wearhouse, and chose an outfit.

description: PARIS  The French novelist Michel Houellebecq, whose best-selling novel Submission imagines a Muslim becoming president of France, has made his first public remarks since jihadists killed 12 in an attack on the satirical weekly Charlie Hebdo  the same day of his books release in France.

title: 1915: Murder From the Skies
description: LONDON  Fierce indignation is the predominant sentiment in this country now that the full results of the cowardly Zeppelin raid on the undefended East Anglian towns are known to the public. For months past the enemy has threatened England with attack by airships, and the very fulfilment of his threat has done more than anything else could have done to dispel the bogey of his creation. Put briefly, all that the Germans have accomplished by their dastardly night attack is the murder of two women, one boy and a man, the injuring of a baby girl and thirty-one adults, nearly all non- combatants, and the destruction of some thousands of pounds worth of property.  The New York Herald, European Edition, Jan. 22, 1915

description: The stealing of the Owens Valley water was the inspiration for the movie Chinatown. But the fight may be over.

title: Ways of Seeing
description: The first things we learn about Zulay, a first grader with pigtails like two fluffy pompoms on top of her head and a big, bright smile, are that she likes numbers, she likes symmetry and she likes being connected to her friends. In her classroom, she tells us, there are 22 chairs and 22 desks, along with 22 pencils, books, hooks, smocks and people. She in one of four best friends who help each other, four best friends who help themselves  Maya, Nancy, Zulay, and Chyng. We soon see this mutuality in action when Maya helps Zulay draw a pyramid, then Zulay helps Maya understand tens and ones.

title: Have Photo Albums, Will Travel
description: Polish films about the Holocaust have been nominated for Oscars before, notably Agnieszka Hollands In Darkness just three years ago, but strictly speaking, Pawel Pawlikowskis Ida, a nominee this year, is a post-Holocaust movie. It takes place in the early 1960s, when the title character, an 18-year-old novitiate, learns that she is actually Jewish and meets up with her aunt Wanda, a disillusioned Communist prosecutor who guides the nave teenager through the familys grim, hidden history.

title: All-Ohio Convention Year? Awaiting the Democrats Pick
description: Republicans are all-in for the swing state of Ohio in 2016. They have set a mid-July date for the partys convention in Cleveland and announced that the first primary debate will be in August in the Buckeye State.

title: North Korean Leader May Visit Moscow, Russia Says
description: SEOUL, South Korea  The leader of North Korea, Kim Jong-un, may visit Moscow in May on what would be his first trip abroad since taking control of his country in late 2011, the Russian government said on Wednesday.
