title: Cuomo Recasts Social Agenda for a New Term
description: ALBANY  Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo, delivering his State of the State address along with a budget proposal heavy on infrastructure, laid out an ambitious social agenda on Wednesday that focuses on problems not so easily solved with cash: the erosion of confidence in the criminal justice system, public schools and teachers that he said were failing students, and a creeping sense that economic mobility is not what it once was.

title: At Risk of Fragmenting, Yemen Poses Dangers to U.S.
description: WASHINGTON  Only months ago, American officials were still referring to Yemens negotiated transition from autocracy to an elected president as a model for post-revolutionary Arab states.

title: Verbatim: Biden on the Patriots Scandal
description: Vice President Joseph R. Biden Jr., in an appearance on CBS This Morning, weighed in on reports that the New England Patriots deflated balls in the A.F.C. championship game. Mr. Biden added that he was a wide receiver, and that he wasnt bad at it.

title: Taliban Fissures in Afghanistan Are Seen as an Opening for ISIS
description: KANDAHAR, Afghanistan  Across a violent swath of southern Afghanistan, rumors are swirling about a band of former Taliban fighters who have claimed allegiance to the Islamic State and are said to be fighting their former comrades for dominance.

title: Color Guard Is David Byrnes New Project. Yes, Color Guard.
description: Since Talking Heads broke up in the early 90s, David Byrnes eclectic projects have focused on everything from visual art and musical theater to bicycles and gentrification. His latest obsession? Color guard.

title: Philharmonic Outlines 2015-16 Season
description: The composer and conductor Esa-Pekka Salonen will begin a three-year stint as composer in residence, and the bass-baritone Eric Owens will be named artist in residence. A Rachmaninoff festival will feature the pianist Daniil Trifonov, a Messiaen week will explore the legacy of the French composer and organist, and the NY Phil Biennial of new music will live up to its name by returning two years after it made its debut.

title: State of the Union, State of the Presidency
description: Last nights State of the Union found President Obama in a somewhat better position politically than in the weeks immediately following his partys big midterm defeat. The improving economy has finally boosted his poll numbers toward at least the mid-40s, probably because plunging gas prices have finally delivered an effective wage increase. His power grab on immigration also seems to have been a limited political success: The move was broadly unpopular but neither immigration nor executive power are top-of-mind issues for most voters, the presidents standing with Hispanics has clearly improved, a brief period of media chiding soon gave way (predictably) to media forgetfulness, and the Republican opposition has been (also predictably) divided and disorganized. And on foreign policy, while the days of presidential rhetoric about allegedly ending wars and routing Al Qaeda are over, there hasnt been a return to the crisis atmosphere of last spring and summer, giving the president breathing room to claim (plausibly in the case of Russia, less so in the case of ISIS) that his strategies are working.

title: Brigham and Womens Surgeon Dies After Hospital Shooting
description: BOSTON  A cardiac surgeon who was shot when a man opened fire inside a Boston medical center Tuesday has died of his wounds, hospital and police officials said.

title: Voices From the Front Lines
description: Manohla Dargis interviewed a number of women in the movie industry about the challenges they face. These are excerpts from those conversations.

title: Reeling Through Life and Silver Screen Fiend
description: Are the movies entirely to be trusted as a design for living? You cant expect me to keep up that level of charm, Id have a heart attack, Woody Allen complains in Play It Again, Sam, the 1972 film in which he takes dating tips from Humphrey Bogart. He realizes reality must win in the end, although the fact that the scene that symbolizes this  his ex-wife shooting Bogart in the chest  is itself a re-enactment of a scene from They Drive by Night tells you something about the elasticity of the medium, which, like Eschers eternal stairwell, feeds even our dreams of escape from the movies. We all agree with Allen, on some level. A life lived at a constant pitch of screwball comedy is a recipe for exhaustion. The relationship of most movie couples would not last five minutes beyond the closing credits of the films in which they appear. And yet such is the movies unrivaled express train to the limbic brain, where Ingrid Bergmans face appears projected the size of a mother as seen by an infant, that trying to see what the medium has done to the shape of our desires can be as difficult as trying to see the edges of the sky.

title: How Warmest Ever Headlines and Debates Can Obscure What Matters About Climate Change
description: If you track developments related to human-driven global warming, my guess is youre aware that the federal agencies that analyze climate conditions released the final word on 2014s climate on Friday.

title: Fatal Blaze in Prospect Heights
description: A five-alarm fire tore through a Brooklyn building early Wednesday morning.

title: The Sorry State of In-Flight Wi-Fi
description: 35,000 FEET, SOMEWHERE OVER THE MIDWEST  Ive finally found something on commercial flights thats worse than airplane food: the Wi-Fi. Its so slow and unreliable that it shouldnt be allowed to call itself Wi-Fi. Renaming it Airplane Dial-Up would be unfair to dial-up.

title: To Some in California, Founder of Church Missions Is Far From Saint
description: SAN FRANCISCO  For generations, fourth graders in Californias schools, often with a parents touch, built models of church missions out of poster board or sugar cubes to celebrate the Rev. Junipero Serra and the religious communities he established along the West Coast in the late 1700s.

title: Tell Me Your Party and Ill Tell You How You Feel
description: If youre a Democrat, you probably feel pretty good about the economy. If youre a Republican, you probably dont. At least thats the take away from a new Washington Post-ABC News poll.

title: 1940: Russians Abandon Positions
description: WITH FINLANDS NORTHERN ARMY  The Russian forces that are still holding on to the village of Markajaervi, on the south Salla road, to which they retreated early in the week, abandoned strong defensive positions without a battle. They were forced out of their fortifications near Joutsijaervi, thirty miles away, by a series of rapier-like flank attacks that made their front line untenable. They picked up their baggage and moved slowly back along the highway that leads to Salla and the Soviet border without taking time to destroy their machine gun nests and dugouts.  New York Herald Tribune, European Edition, Jan. 22, 1940

title: Euro Style Bond Buying
description: The European Central Bank is expected to announce a broad bond-buying program, like the quantitative easing program that largely proved successful in the United States and Britain.

title: Lights, Camera, Taking Action
description: The American movie mainstream needs a revolution  and if some women have their way, it just might get one. Its time. Not because Ava DuVernay wasnt tapped as a best director in the recent Academy Award nominations, even though her acclaimed movie Selma received a best picture nod. There has been a lot of speculation about the snub, but the reasons are less crucial than the message that the largely white, male directors in the Academy sent: This woman doesnt deserve credit for her own movie. Women in film are routinely denied jobs, credits, prizes and equal pay, so the rebuke was familiar. Thats because while individual men struggle in the industry, women struggle as a group.

title: 36 Hours in Denver
description: The signs of Denvers economic high times and progressiveness can be found in the citys innovative art, nightlife, food and shopping scenes.

title: What to Do in Denver
description: The signs of Denvers economic high times as a pot boomtown and bastion of progressive urban policies are everywhere. There is the B-cycle bike-share program, among the most affordable and best-run systems in the country, and the newly renovated Union Station, which has taken a still-in-use 1881 train station and made it the focal point of the thriving LoDo neighborhood. And there are the inconspicuous marijuana dispensaries that dot nearly every neighborhood, and more stunning public spaces  from Washington Park to the Cherry Creek bike path  than one city has a right to.

title: A Kinder, Gentler Investor Activism
description: Can old dogs make money out of old tricks?

title: Bond-Buying Programs: Simple in Theory but Complex in Eurozone
description: FRANKFURT  The European Central Bank is widely expected to announce on Thursday that it will finally begin buying government bonds as part of a so-called quantitative easing program.

title: Gucci Picks Alessandro Michele as Its Next Creative Director
description: PARIS  Hoping to reverse a prolonged sales slump at Gucci, its marquee brand, the French luxury group Kering said on Wednesday that it had promoted Alessandro Michele, Guccis head of accessories, to creative director.

title: Dropbox Buys CloudOn, a Microsoft Document Start-Up
description: In its quest to go global, the online file-sharing giant Dropbox has again turned to deal-making.

title: Bitter Chinatown Water Feud Ebbs
description: The stealing of the Owens Valley water was the inspiration for the movie Chinatown. But the fight may be over.

title: Holding the Democratic Convention in Brooklyn? Fuhgeddaboudit.
description: AT some point in the next few weeks, the Democratic National Committee will announce the location of its 2016 convention. Philadelphia and Columbus are in the running, but for many, the money is on Brooklyn. And the site does seem attractive: The convention would take place at the Barclays Center, a state-of-the-art arena in the hippest borough of the nations media capital.

title: Jill Leovys Ghettoside
description: In her timely new book, Jill Leovy examines one of the most disturbing facts about life in America: that African-American males are, as she puts it, just 6 percent of the countrys population but nearly 40 percent of those murdered. Leovy describes neighborhoods steeped in pain: A mother, dressed in a baggy Tshirt adorned with her murdered sons picture, spends all day indoors, too terrified to step outside; the brother of a homicide victim purposely meanders through violent streets in the hopes that he too will meet the same fate; grieving parents all wear the same haunted expression, the empty stare that one police chaplain calls homicide eyes. Leovys focus is South Los Angeles, though similar stories abound in many of the nations poorest communities.

title: Animals Suffer in Meat Industry Profit Quest:  Reporters Notebook
description: Michael Moss wrote a front-page article on Tuesday about scientific efforts to re-engineer the farm animal to fit the needs of the modern meat industry.

title: One by One, Protesters Interrupt Supreme Court
description: WASHINGTON  A Supreme Court argument Wednesday about housing discrimination started with a disruption and included a surprise.

title: A Cocktail Week for Paris
description: Paris bars were once known largely for mediocre mojitos, but in the last few years, places like Experimental Cocktail Club, Candelaria and Sherry Butt have won considerable acclaim.

title: Bankers at Forum Say They Support Regulation, With Some Caveats
description: DAVOS, Switzerland  Top bankers attending the World Economic Forum here are saying that they support the deluge of new regulations introduced since the financial crisis of 2008.

title: Next Question, Please
description: Its the right color, all right?

title: Prada and Armani Reassert the Power of Consistency
description: MILAN  One of the commonest sights outside fashion shows, in whatever city theyre held, is hordes of shutterbugs racing to snap pictures of what is loosely described as street fashion. Often the photographers form a phalanx, a kind of flying wedge, and back shoulder to shoulder into traffic snapping away as their quarry advances. Theyre like crazy birders. Watch them long enough, though, or track their Instagram accounts and you will soon observe that theyre tracking just one kind of bird: the fashion cuckoo.

title: The State of the Union: A View of the Economy From Ground Level
description: The economy President Obama described Tuesday night during his State of the Union address sounded pretty good  with unemployment down and jobs added at the fastest past since 1999.

title: Battle Rages With Rebels at Border Post in Ukraine
description: KRAMATORSK, Ukraine  Shelling from both Ukrainian military and rebel separatist positions continued Wednesday over a remote border checkpoint northwest of Luhansk that Ukraine said was seized Monday by Russian troops, a chief spokesman for the Ukrainian military said.

title: Classical Playlist: Puccini, Mendelssohn, Wagner and More
description: PUCCINI: Turandot Joan Sutherland, soprano; Luciano Pavarotti, tenor; Montserrat Caball, soprano; Zubin Mehta, conductor; London Philharmonic Orchestra(Decca 478 7815; two CDs)Full disclosure: I am no audiophile. Im still catching up with Blu-ray as a video technology. But now Decca has issued some classic opera recordings from its catalog remastered from the original tapes in what is called Blu-ray Pure Audio. Im loath to apply the word pure to anything. Still, listening to this reissue of the landmark 1972 recording of Puccinis Turandot, with the dynamic Zubin Mehta conducting the London Philharmonic Orchestra and a dream cast headed by Joan Sutherland and Luciano Pavarotti, I have to say the sound quality is clean, vivid and strikingly detailed. Ms. Sutherland, the reigning bel canto soprano of her day, was tempted into the studio to sing Turandot, a vocally weighty role she never performed in a house. Her voice is gleaming and penetrating, and Mr. Mehta draws surprising intensity from an artist who could be stolid. Mr. Pavarotti is in his prime as Calaf. With the sumptuous Montserrat Caball as Li, Nicolai Ghiaurov as Timur and, of all people, Peter Pears as the old emperor, this is quite the cast. (Anthony Tommasini)

title: A Plan for a Chapel in Chile Based on Designs by  Gaud
description: A new chapel based on the art nouveau architect Anton Gauds designs will be built in Chile, about 90 years after his death. When complete, the chapel  a modest building with a spire rendered in his signature neo-Baroque style  will be the only Gaud-designed building outside of his native Spain.

title: French Premier on Investment Plan
description: Manuel Valls, the French prime minister, announced new investment in the French intelligence services in the wake of the attack on Charlie Hebdo.

title: In a Way, Todd Bowles and Mike Maccagnan Are Reuniting
description: FLORHAM PARK, N.J.  For preseason football, the Elizabeth High School team would travel about 40 miles south along the New Jersey Turnpike to the Peddie School in Hightstown, where a football-loving teenager named Mike Maccagnan would watch practice.

title: Venture Capital Outpaces Buyouts in Investment Returns
description: In the years since the dot-com crash of 2000, Silicon Valleys venture capital firms have generally lagged behind their Wall Street cousins that take companies private in leveraged buyouts.

title: A New Paris Boutique Proves That Good Things Come in Small Packages
description: Since 2012, the MAN/WOMAN trade shows, where a tightly edited selection of fashion and lifestyle brands showcase their newest offerings, have been paramount for magazine editors and retail buyers seeking the next big thing. To bring that curatorial point of view to the public, MAN/WOMAN recently opened its first retail location in Pariss trendy Marais district. The shop, called Small, invites international retailers and brands to install their visions on a monthly basis in a cozy retail venue measuring just under 500 square feet. Small appears as a good and quite easy option for designers to target a new consumer and market, says one of its founders, Antoine Floch. Traveling between Paris, New York, Tokyo and sometimes Los Angeles on what seems like a weekly basis, Floch, along with his partners Olivier Migda and Romain Bernardie James, has developed a keen eye for fashions soon-to-be-cultish brands. We are lucky to work with the most creative and most well-produced brands right now, as well as the most beautifully designed and curated stores on the planet, he says. Some of them have been friends for a long time.

title: Cannes Winners Selected for New Directors/New Films
description: Myroslav Slaboshpytskiys silent film The Tribe is among the first nine selections for the annual New Directors/New Films series presented by the Film Society of Lincoln Center and the Museum of Modern Art, those organizations announced Wednesday.

title: How the Brain Stores Trivial Memories, Just in Case
description: The surge of emotion that makes memories of embarrassment, triumph and disappointment so vivid can also reach back in time, strengthening recall of seemingly mundane things that happened just beforehand and that, in retrospect, are relevant, a new study has found.

title: Best Twitter Ad Practices Include Narrow Targets, Videos and Brevity
description: More than four years after introducing advertising on its platform, Twitter has changed the way businesses create ads. And as with any game in which the rules have shifted, players adapt by developing new strategies.

title: 36 Hours in Denver
description: Explore street view, find our points of interest and sign in to your Google account to save your map.

title: Pretty Filthy, Musically Speaking
description: The Civilians are laying bare the lives of porn stars in their newest production, Pretty Filthy. A behind-the-scenes musical about the adult entertainment industry, drawn as always from extensive interviews with players in the business itself, the new show features songs by the companys go-to composer-lyricist, the supremely gifted Michael Friedman (known for Bloody Bloody Andrew Jackson, among others); a book by Bess Wohl; and direction by Steve Cosson, the troupes founding artistic director.

title: Scientists Work to Contain Modified Organisms to Labs
description: Could genetically modified bacteria escape from a laboratory or fermentation tank and cause disease or ecological destruction?

title: At Windows 10 Event, Microsoft Jumps Into Augmented Reality With HoloLens Headset
description: REDMOND, Wash.  Microsoft wants back in the game, and it is using a little science fiction to get there.

title: Chancellor Set to Centralize Management of New York City Schools
description: Chancellor Carmen Faria is expected to announce changes on Thursday that will restore a centralized hierarchy to New York Citys schools, largely dispensing with one of the core management philosophies of the previous mayoral administration.

title: App Smart | Unleash Your Inner Musician
description: Look no further than your smartphone to do everything from tuning your stringed instrument to storing sheet music.

title: German Activist Against Islamization Posed as Hitler for Facebook Photo
description: A leading figure in a German protest movement against the supposed Islamization of Europe by Muslim immigrants stepped down Wednesday after the German tabloid Bild reported on its front page that he had posed as Adolf Hitler for a photograph posted on Facebook in September.

title: Below the Line: Shooting The Grand Budapest Hotel
description: The cinematographer Robert Yeoman has long been helping to craft meticulous and precise images for Wes Andersons films. He has shot every one of the directors live-action movies since Bottle Rocket, contributing to a motif that is instantly recognizable, frequently praised and sometimes parodied. With The Grand Budapest Hotel (Oscar-nominated for best cinematography), Mr. Yeoman and Mr. Anderson took the visuals a level further, shooting in multiple aspect ratios for the different time periods in which the film takes place.

title: Video Feature: For Musicians, Apps for Tuning, Keeping Time and Organizing Charts
description: SMARTPHONES and tablets are powerful music devices. You can listen to music, you can create music and, with the right app, you can get an assist when playing an instrument.

title: Apple Acquires Semetric, a Data Analysis Company
description: Apple has acquired Semetric, a company that analyzes data about music online, a move that may hint at Apples ambitions as it prepares to revamp iTunes and Beats Music.

title: Justices Rule Dismissal of Air Marshal Unlawful
description: WASHINGTON  The Supreme Court ruled on Wednesday in favor of a fired air marshal, saying he was covered by a federal law protecting whistle-blowers.

title: German Anti-Immigrant Figure Quits Post After Posing as Hitler
description: BERLIN  The leader of an anti-immigrant movement that has attracted tens of thousands of supporters and upended political debate in Germany stepped down on Wednesday after he was found to have posted an online image of himself as Adolf Hitler, after weeks of denying any Nazi sympathies.

title: Rehabilitating 11 Acres on the Waterfront
description: A half-million square feet of space in the former Brooklyn Army Terminal will be renovated by the city in a $100 million project.

title: Valentino: Fall 2015 Menswear
description: Paris

title: Cuomo Delivers State of the State Address
description: Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo, whose State of the State speech was delayed after the Jan. 1 death of his father, former Gov. Mario M. Cuomo, delivered his yearly address to members of the Legislature in Albany. He also introduced his budget proposal for the fiscal year that begins April 1. Mr. Cuomo, a Democrat beginning his second four-year term, has signaled in recent days that he has ambitious plans in education, job creation, criminal justice reform, income inequality, property taxes and infrastructure.

title: Hamas and Israel React to Bus Attack
description: Hamas and Israeli government spokesmen reacted to the attack in which a Palestinian man stabbed up to a dozen Israelis on a bus in Tel Aviv. Tensions between the two sides are high.

title: Credit Suisse Previews Effect of Rise in Swiss Franc on Profit
description: LONDON  Credit Suisse on Wednesday gave investors a preview of the potential effect that the recent sharp rise in the value of the Swiss franc will have on its profit. The bank emphasized that it had not suffered any material trading losses since Switzerland eliminated a cap on its currency last week.

title: Predictions, Pet Peeves and Random Musings From Davos
description: DAVOS, Switzerland  Finance-related panels at the World Economic Forum here on Wednesday focused on the impact of low oil prices, anticipation of the potential impact of the European Central Banks decision on Thursday to buy significant pools of sovereign bonds, liquidity concerns and the consequences of heavy-handed regulation.

title: Players Drop Fight Against Turf at Womens World Cup
description: A group of prominent womens soccer players pressing FIFA to install natural grass for matches at this summers Womens World Cup withdrew its complaint Wednesday, grudgingly accepting that the event will be played entirely on artificial turf.

title: Where Is the Governor of Georgia? His Office Wont Say
Canadas Central Bank Cuts a Key Rate
description: OTTAWA  Forecasting a major economic slowdown in the face of lower oil prices, the Bank of Canada unexpectedly cut its key lending rate on Wednesday.

title: Flaunting Guns in the Washington Statehouse
description: A scene that played out in the Washington state legislature was fit for a Clint Eastwood movie. Last week, a group of angry citizens showed up in the House gallery openly waving pistols and high powered rifles as they looked down upon the debating chamber below.

title: Whats on TV Wednesday
description: 12:30 P.M. (Sundance) (500) DAYS OF SUMMER (2009) Tom Hansen (Joseph Gordon-Levitt) is an unapologetic believer in true love, soul mates and other touchstones of greeting card mythology (and romantic comedy ideology), A. O. Scott wrote in his review of this film in The New York Times. Summer Finn (Zooey Deschanel), Mr. Scott said, is skeptical of such notions and refuses to promise commitment or even consistency, but she does seem to want more and more of Toms company, and this leads him to believe that her carefully maintained barriers to intimacy are beginning to fall. That pretty much sums up this Marc Webb movie.

title: Amid the Chattering of the Global Elite, a Silent Interlude
description: DAVOS, Switzerland  For 10 minutes at the World Economic Forum here on Wednesday afternoon, a conference room jammed with more than 100 high-powered delegates was entirely silent.

title: Belgian Artists Painting Infringes Upon Photographers Work, Court Rules
description: PARIS  The Belgian artist Luc Tuymans faces fines of up to 500,000 euros (about $580,000), after a court ruled that his washed-out painting of a sweating politician is a copyright infringement that plagiarizes a photo taken by a news photographer.

title: Loyal Knicks Fans May Deserve a Medal. But a Refund?
description: Loyal Knicks fans will not be surprised after this painful season when they learn that their ticket prices will not rise in 2015-16.

title: Rikers Officers Who Hogtied and Beat an Inmate in 2012 Are Fired
description: The New York City correction commissioner announced on Wednesday that he was firing a captain and five Rikers Island guards who hogtied an inmate and then, while his hands were still cuffed behind him and his ankles shackled, savagely beat him in April 2012.

title: A Delicate Operation
description: Maneuvering a sizable model of the ocean liner Queen Mary out of its Lower Manhattan home was one of the first challenges in getting it across the country.

title: Its Not Easy to Steer the Queen Mary, Even a Model of It
description: The distance from a particular storefront in Lower Manhattan to Long Beach, Calif., is roughly 2,815 miles by truck, which is how this Queen Mary is going there  by truck. Not through the Panama Canal or around Cape Horn. Not this time. Not this Queen Mary.

title: Have Questions About Winter Cooking?
description: Cold weather lends itself to bubbling baked dishes and hearty root vegetables. But the season also brings bright citrus to the table, as in this weeks recipe for lemon bars from Melissa Clark.

title: A Theme in Davos: Fear of Financial Instability
description: DAVOS, Switzerland  Fear is back in the valley of the privileged.

title: The Investigation Into Whether the Patriots Used Deflated Footballs
description: N.F.L. officials are investigating whether the Patriots violated league rules by using footballs that were not properly inflated during the A.F.C. championship game against the Colts on Sunday.

title: Ben-Gurion: Father of Modern Israel, by Anita Shapira
description: Recently, there was something of an ideological fistfight at the grave of Israels founding father. During a ceremony at Sde Boker in the Negev desert marking the 41 years since the death of David Ben-Gurion, the former and current presidents of Israel  Shimon Peres and Reuven Rivlin  slammed efforts to pass new legislation to enshrine Israels status as a Jewish state, a bill that many critics say will roll back Israels status as a democracy and turn the countrys Arabs, who are about 20 percent of the population, into second-class citizens. The chief sponsor of the so-called Jewish nation-state bill, Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu, sat stewing in the front row. When it was his turn to speak, he said that no one knows what Ben-Gurion would say were he alive today.

title: Workers at Hunts Point Terminal Produce Market Approve Contract
description: Workers at the Hunts Point Terminal Produce Market in the Bronx voted on Wednesday to approve a three-year contract, ending a contentious dispute over wage increases and health benefits that had threatened to lead to their first strike in nearly three decades.

title: Uber Closes $1.6 Billion in Financing
description: Uber, the popular ride-hailing start-up, has closed $1.6 billion in financing from clients of Goldman Sachss private wealth arm, the investment bank confirmed on Wednesday.

title: First Draft Focus: A Dusting for Washington
Paris Mens Fashion Week: Christophe Lemaire Fall/Winter 2015
description: Scenes from the Paris Fashion Week photo diary of Valerio Mezzanotti.

title: Ideas for E.L.L.s | Teaching About Weather and Seasons
description: Related article

title: Marissa Mayers Plan for Yahoo Takes Hold. The Question Now Is Time.
description: When Marissa Mayer was offered the chief executive job at Yahoo in the summer of 2012, she had a script for returning the pioneering Internet company to the tiny club of Silicon Valley powerhouses.

title: U.S. Not Expected to Fault Officer in Ferguson Case
description: WASHINGTON  Justice Department lawyers will recommend that no civil rights charges be brought against the police officer who fatally shot an unarmed teenager in Ferguson, Mo., after an F.B.I. investigation found no evidence to support charges, law enforcement officials said Wednesday.

title: Boehner Comments on Netanyahu Invitation
description: Speaker John A. Boehner discusses his decision to ask Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu of Israel to address Congress without consulting the White House, saying he is not poking anyone in the eye.

title: New Plays by Churchill, Shawn Will Be Part of National Theater Season
description: New plays by Caryl Churchill and Wallace Shawn, a new musical, wonder.land, by the Blur frontman Damon Albarn and the playwright Moira Buffini, and an updated version of the 15th-century English drama Everyman, starring Chiwetel Ejiofor, are among the highlights of next seasons programming at Londons National Theater.

title: Young Players Give Signs of Australian Tennis Revival
description: MELBOURNE, Australia  It was Rafael Nadals night at Melbourne Park on Wednesday, as he found a way to win when his body was sending him all the wrong signals.

title: Paris Mens Fashion Week: Christophe Lemaire Fall/Winter 2015
description: Scenes from the Paris Fashion Week photo diary of Valerio Mezzanotti.

title: Rubio Treads Carefully on Another Romney Run
description: Senator Marco Rubio was a high-profile supporter of Mitt Romneys 2012 bid for the presidency, campaigning with him repeatedly in the senators home state, Florida, a perennial battleground.

title: A Drink a Day to Lower Heart Failure Risk
description: A daily cocktail may be associated with a lower risk for heart failure.

title: Reid to Have Eye Surgery on Monday
SpaceX Is a Throwback to the 1990s
description: Elon Musks satellite dream is a throwback to the 1990s.

title: Julianne Moore
description: A general feeling of What cant she do? clings to the actress in her work and her fashion.

title: Decree Reflects Rift in Boston Over 2024 Olympics
description: BOSTON  On the day that the promoters of Bostons plan to host the 2024 Summer Olympics finally made their bid public, a surprising bit of counterprogramming emerged from City Hall.

title: A Most Unwelcome Return
description: Some plays are better staged after the holidays, when audience members are less likely to hyperventilate in sympathetic response. Heres one: Brian Watkinss Wyoming, in which a familys Thanksgiving is jolted by the arrival of a surprise guest  the long-lost son who killed his father and has barely been mentioned since.

title: Bronx Museum of the Arts Plans Art Exchange With Cuba
description: The Bronx Museum of the Arts and the National Museum of Fine Arts in Cuba announced Wednesday that a major exchange of works from their collections would take place this year and next in the most sweeping collaboration between the two countries museums in more than 50 years.

title: Meghan Trainor Opens at No. 1
description: Meghan Trainors debut album, Title, opened at the top of the Billboard chart this week, riding the momentum of her anthem All About That Bass and her latest hit single, Lips Are Movin.

title: A Caustic Detective on the Beat
description: An annoying and offensive detective, Everett Backstrom (Rainn Wilson), is called to a wet, wooded campus crime scene where a student has been found dead, a possible suicide. Im a rich white senators pretty-boy son, I get up before the dawn in the pouring rain, and I hang myself from a bridge, Backstrom asks aloud, puffing on a fat cigar. Why?

title: Another Loss for Nice Guys; This One Wins Praise
description: MELBOURNE, Australia  Tim Smyczek, a qualifier from Milwaukee ranked 112th, wielded his racket exceptionally well Wednesday night, striking 64 winners and coming within one game of upsetting third-ranked Rafael Nadal in the second round of the Australian Open.

title: In Williamsburg, a Wedding Salon for Very Brooklyn Brides
description: Im hoping to help brides feel more comfortable not wearing white to their weddings, says Caitlin Mociun, gesturing toward a lemon-yellow gown. Thats not the only tradition the Brooklyn-based designer  noted among the betrothed for her sculptural fine jewelry and eponymous design shop  is looking to upend with todays opening of Mociun White, her new wedding-oriented boutique. Its about a specific experience for a bride, she says. I wanted to create a space that redefined what a bridal salon is. Mociun, who is returning to creating clothing after a three-year hiatus, has set her own not-so-bridal bridal collection  expertly cut Italian lace dresses, shirt-and-skirt combos and plenty of color  against a not-so-bridal interior: railings painted bright hues, intricate tile work, tables made with Archer Modern, a Bec Brittain chandelier and loop lights by Lucas Peet. Embellished pieces by Naeem Khan round out the assortment. The idea for the store came to her after time spent shopping at bridal salons with friends: There were little vases of white flowers and rococo furniture, and it smelled like potpourri  it felt like a little girls dream, not the dream of an adult woman whos really into design, she recalls. Instead, she says, I wanted a beautiful space that was cool architecturally.

title: Celebrating the Art of Song
description: Since her retirement, the mezzo-soprano Marilyn Horne has been a mentor to young singers, offering guidance at festivals and workshops including The Song Continues at Carnegie Hall, a series of master classes that culminates in a public performance.

title: EBay to Cut 2,400 Jobs, and Weighs 2nd Spinoff
description: EBay has made billions reinventing ways to sell items on the Internet. Now, in the face of declining growth, the company must reinvent itself once more.

title: Belgium Offers Partial IDs of 2 Killed in Police Raid
description: BRUSSELS  The Belgian authorities on Wednesday partly identified two men believed to be Islamic militants who died last week in a police raid, releasing the first names and nationalities  one Belgian, one Belgian-Moroccan  of the pair, who were suspected of belonging to a terrorist network and plotting an imminent attack.

title: Protesters Stage Die-In at Capitol
description: Never come between a hungry lawmaker and lunch. But a few dozen protesters tried to do just that on Wednesday, staging a die-in in a House cafeteria to raise awareness of the Black Lives Matter movement.

title: Russia Presses Ahead With Plan for Gas Pipeline to Turkey
description: LONDON  President Vladimir V. Putin surprised the world in December when he aborted long-laid plans for a natural gas pipeline under the Black Sea to Europe, saying Russia would run pipes to Turkey instead.

title: When Measles Spreads From Disneyland, Its a Small World After All
description: The latest measles outbreak, which began at Disneyland in California between Dec. 17 and 20, is spreading. The seven confirmed cases first reported less than two weeks ago have quickly multiplied to 54 confirmed cases as of this writing. This includes two cases in Utah, two in Washington and one in Mexico. Some of the people infected were nowhere near Disneyland in December, suggesting that those infected in the park have begun infecting others. Most of those infected were under-immunized, which can mean they have been vaccinated against some illnesses but not others, or have not had all the recommended doses of a vaccine for their age.

title: Reading The Times With Phil Klay
description: Phil Klay is a writer and a Marine Corps veteran of the Iraq war. His collection of short stories, Redeployment, received the 2014 National Book Award, and was recently named the recipient of the National Book Critics Circles John Leonard Prize.

title: Anne Hathaway and Julie Taymor Team Up for Grounded
description: The Academy Award winner Anne Hathaway (Les Misrables) and the Tony Award winner Julie Taymor (The Lion King) will team up this spring at the Public Theater on the prize-winning drama Grounded, a 70-minute monologue about a fighter pilot who is reassigned to operate drone strikes when she becomes pregnant, the Public announced on Wednesday.

title: Pictures of the Day: Syria and Elsewhere
description: Syria and Elsewhere  Pictures of the Day

title: Kinder Morgan to Buy Oil Pipeline Company From Harold Hamm for $3 Billion
description: Kinder Morgan said on Wednesday that it had agreed to buy Hiland Partners, an oil pipeline and gathering company owned by the billionaire Harold Hamm, for about $3 billion, expanding its presence in the oil-rich Bakken rock formation in the northern United States.

title: Executive Shake-Up at Procter & Gamble
description: Procter & Gamble announced a reshuffling of its top ranks on Wednesday in a move that might provide a clue to who will become the next leader of the consumer products giant.

title: Free of Gluten, but Not of Arsenic (or of Guilt)
description: Until last week, my children ate arsenic daily. Once used to poison royalty, arsenic (among other metals from the soil) is currently tainting rice, and I fed my daughters rice pasta for dinner, rice bread sandwiches for lunch, rice bagels for breakfast and rice cakes for snacks.

title: Unlocking Prisons and Reopening Wounds
description: Peter Careys Amnesia has been received by some as an excitingly timely novel: the story of WikiLeaks as if transmogrified by Dickens and turned into a thrilling fable for our post-Edward Snowden era, as a writer in The Guardian has put it. But anyone expecting that kind of urgency can plow a long way into Amnesia, wondering when the fireworks start.

title: The $210 Million Baseball Contract That Explains How Inflation Works
description: The Washington Nationals have signed one of the best pitchers in the game to a blockbuster contract, bolstering an already excellent team. This is all very exciting news for baseball fans in Washington, as the $210 million contract for Max Scherzer gives the team perhaps the best pitching rotation in the sport.

title: Jan. 21, 2015  Pictures of the Day
description: Photos from Syria, Pakistan, Israel and the United States.

title: Let Everyone Mingle, Awkward as It May Be
description: Everything youre feeling is appropriate, says Taylor Mac, repeatedly, as if to soothe anxious children, during the second three-hour installment of his opus in progress, A 24-Decade History of Popular Music, which is having its premiere at New York Live Arts as part of the Under the Radar festival. The assurance may well be needed for anyone in the audience uncomfortable with being uncomfortable  either physically, emotionally or politically.

title: A Heart Broken and Dissected
description: The big news about Bjrks ninth studio album, Vulnicura, shouldnt be the fact that she released it suddenly online, two months before its planned appearance, in response to having it leaked prematurely. It should be that in her latest songs, Bjrk leads as much with her heart as her brain.

title: Disinherited Daughters Battle Their Fathers City Over Missing Artworks
description: BARCELONA, Spain  Nria Rivero, an art historian, gave a tour one recent day of a sumptuous mansion from Barcelonas own bygone gilded age, one now owned by the city. But to her frustration, much of it was about what was not on the walls, instead of what was.

title: Night Life
description: More than 670,000 photos have been posted on Instagram with the #nightshift hashtag, a window into a shadow world of workers.

title: With Each Star Turn, a Feeling of a Collective Force Begins to Brew
description: As the curtain rises on George Balanchines Serenade, were plunged into a drama about selflessness. Seventeen young women are all facing front, all dressed alike, all slowly going through a ritual that strikingly resembles that of religious devotees. In what follows  as we watch loners; connections between individuals; kernel-like groups of three, four and five; and suggestions of love, loss, consolation and transcendence  we constantly see how lives are absorbed in something larger than private concerns.

title: A Deal From the Joan Gerard District 3 Winter Regional
description: At the Joan Gerard District 3 Winter Regional in Rye Brook, N.Y., from Jan. 13 to Monday, the most successful player was Brian Glubok of New York City.

title: Excerpt: Backstrom
description: Rainn Wilson plays a surly detective in this new Fox series.

title: Your Evening Briefing
description: Catch up on the days top stories.

title: Twitter Now Helps You Catch Up on Missed Tweets
description: Twitter prides itself on being a real-time information service. If something big is going on right now, more and more people will post messages about it, and eventually the news will find its way into your Twitter feed.

title: When Films and Facts Collide in Questions
description: The issue of historical accuracy continues to dog Selma, though its hard to gauge how much the brouhaha contributed to the films inability to land best director and actor Oscar nods.

title: New York Attorney General Adds to Lawsuit Over Barclays Dark Pool
description: New York States top law enforcer has claimed that Barclays made a false statement in court documents and that it defied subpoenas seeking the testimony of two executives, a move that builds on a previous lawsuit over the banks private stock trading platform.

title: This Is Your Grandmother
description: ANN ARBOR  I had two saved messages, and both began the same way: Hello, Rebecca. This is your grandmother. In Florida.

title: Just Dont Call Them Weeds
description: Studio Drift, a design group founded by Lonneke Gordijn and Ralph Nauta in Amsterdam, has built its reputation on fluff. A decade ago, Ms. Gordijn began gluing dandelion seeds to LEDs to produce lamps that softly filter light. The most ambitious versions take the form of chandeliers called Fragile Future, where the reconstituted dandelion heads are set in graceful bronze cages.

title: How Do I Stage a Bathroom for Showings?
description: Q. How do I stage a bathroom for showings?

title: They Make a Big Deal Even Bigger
description: There is nothing precious about Tom Dixon, who designs frequently in cold, practical metal. So even when he makes coffers to store treasures, you can be sure there is nothing precious about them, either.

title: Sales at Lalique, Canvas, Gus Modern and Pan American Phoenix
description: Many items are up to half off at Laliques sample sale, through Sunday (a Lalique Maison black lacquer Raisins mirror, originally $22,000, is $13,200); 133 Fifth Avenue (20th Street), 212-355-6550, lalique.com.

title: Shopping With Ken Fulk
description: One designer believes that accessories for the hearth are a kind of jewelry.

title: Hillary Clinton Gives Her Own State of the Union
description: Hillary Rodham Clinton on Wednesday denounced the recent attacks by Muslim extremists in Paris, weighed in on the proposals President Obama outlined in his State of the Union address and talked about how the United States could alleviate income inequality. She even impersonated President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia.

title: Fireplace Accessories
description: Many people dread Januarys subfreezing temperatures. But for those with a fireplace, like Ken Fulk, winter is something to look forward to.

title: 'Give Us Back Our Antiquities!'
Rethinking Our Diagnoses of Mental Disorders
description: To the Editor:

title: Solitary-Confinement Limits
description: To the Editor:

title: Look Closely Before You Sit
description: Aaron Scaturro, a 31-year-old self-taught woodworker, recently introduced a variation on the Windsor chair that he calls a fan-back dining chair. It takes two days to make, he said, and sells for $2,600. But thats because of details the untrained eye may not notice: The legs are hand-turned and shaved, the spindles are hand-turned and scored, the tenons are tapered, and all the joints are wedged with ebony.

title: Justice Scalias Sarcasm
description: To the Editor:

title: Scraps to Fight Over
description: Alabama Chanins first home collection in more than seven years includes throws, decorative pillows, napkins, candles, potholders and even drink cozies, almost all of it made in the companys Florence, Ala., studio. And because it includes a combination of machine- and handmade items, the collection isnt quite as pricey as the handmade quilts the company is known for.

title: Residency Rules for Police
description: To the Editor:

title: The Rise of the Smartbulb
description: With integrated stereo speakers, colors that pulse to the music and other innovations, programmable LEDs are booming.

title: When Women Become Terrorists
description: DURHAM, N.C.  SINCE the terror attacks in Paris two weeks ago, the French police have been on the hunt for Hayat Boumeddiene, the partner of Amedy Coulibaly, one of the slain gunmen. She is now suspected to be in Syria. Some news reports speculate that Ms. Boumeddiene, 26, may have been the more radical of the two. Yet one of the first questions that French authorities intend to ask her is, they say, if she did this under influence, if she did it by ideology, if she did it to aid and abet.

title: Skiing Record Snow in Italy
description: A group of professional skiers traveled to Sella Nevea, Italy, to ski during the one of the snowiest winters in history.

title: How Pink Is Your Floyd?
description: Get ready to dust off the old jokes about how many (fill in the blank) people it takes to change a light bulb. I just spent a week changing some of the bulbs in my house, and the complexity was enough to give me a migraine.

title: At Home with Esther Freud
description: An old house on the coast of England inspired the novelists latest book, about Charles Rennie Mackintosh.

title: They Stooped to Enter
description: Esther Freud first visited Walberswick, a village on the Suffolk coast in England, 30 years ago, when she was a young actress living in London and fed up with city life. She complained one day to her father, the painter Lucian Freud.

title: A Manor of Family and Fiction
description: Andrea Chapin, an actress turned book editor, spent more than a decade helping writers publish their fiction before she embarked on a novel of her own. Due out next month from Riverhead Books, The Tutor is the story of Katharine de LIsle, muse of a gifted, honey-tongued young writer. With her guidance, Katharines protg produces several sonnets and his first narrative poem, and goes on to a career as the actor and playwright we all know as William Shakespeare.

title: Obamas Bad Economic Ideas
description: PRESIDENT OBAMAS economic proposals in Tuesdays State of the Union address were a disappointment. His ideas  free community college, an enhanced tax credit for child care and higher taxes on high-income earners and large financial institutions  failed to go beyond mere talking points. With no chance of engaging the Republicans, they will surely die without a hearing.

title: Little House on the Alley
description: In Vancouver, a gift of land brings three generations closer.

title: At Home in the Out-Back
description: For more than a year, Petto Chan refused to consider his wifes idea of building a small, sustainable house in the backyard behind the large Vancouver home where he grew up with his extended family.

title: Rare Alan Turing Document, Outlining Mathematical Thought, to be Auctioned
description: It is short, just 56 pages long, and much of it consists of complicated mathematical musings written out in longhand. But it has never been seen before in public, and it provides an exciting insight into how Alan Turing, its author, formulated his theories about mathematical notation and computer science, according to Bonhams auction house.

title: Off the Hook?
description: So the Republican establishment is breathing easy now that the Supreme Court is on the verge of issuing a ruling in favor of same-sex marriage, thus taking the question out of nasty old politics? I think its probably going to be a relief, a Republican committeeman from California told Jeremy W. Peters and Jonathan Martin of The New York Times, explaining that with such a ruling, then its off the table. Praise the Lord and thank the court.

title: Cozy Onesies, Blanket Scarves and More for the Winter Chill
description: In the face of punishing temperatures, going home on Friday and re-emerging on Monday may sound like a dream weekend. Think of it: binge-watching the first season of The Fall as you lounge in one of these luxe onesies. They will make you feel less guilty about having lunch delivered, and if you deign to leave the house, they can be layered up for a storm. You could even put on a nice pair of heels if theres a party nearby.

title: Recalling Romanias Revolution
description: Joseph Rodriguez may be best known for his work in urban America, but his new book, Romania, shows him to be a photographer of the world.

title: The Rise of the Smartbulb
description: With integrated stereo speakers, colors that pulse to the music and other innovations, programmable LEDs are booming.

title: Power Lunches Are Out. Crumbs in the Keyboard Are In.
description: In early November, the television anchor Bryant Gumbel was standing in the middle of a sweaty crowd at the restaurant Michaels, on West 55th Street. It was a little after 7 p.m., and Mr. Gumbel was shoulder-to-shoulder with other media luminaries, many of them household names for decades: Jann Wenner, Jay McInerney, Jeffrey Bewkes, Al Roker and Dr. Ruth Westheimer among them.

title: Are You Man Enough for a Peel?
description: To prepare for important meetings, Robert Tomson, the owner of a womens activewear company, has a secret weapon: an at-home two-step facial peel.

title: Next-Generation Balms to Soothe Winter Lips
description: For most of the year, Chapstick will do. Come winter, with bracing winds and goth lipsticks, finding the perfect lip moisturizer takes on Monty Python proportions.

title: Obama Unbowed: Grading the Speech
Jean-Claude Baker, Son of Josephine Baker, Is Remembered
description: He told a few friends last week that he had finished his will, an impressive gesture even for the famously unbridled Jean-Claude Baker, irrepressible impresario of his own improbable life.

title: Why Celebrities Are So Into the Artist Daniel Arsham
description: Usher, the R&B star, discovered the artist Daniel Arsham the way most people find out about things: through friends. In this case, his friends happened to be Swizz Beatz, Jay Z and Pharrell Williams.

title: A Look at Noteworthy Milan Mens Collections
description: MILAN  Standing backstage after his Ermenegildo Zegna show on Saturday, the designer Stefano Pilati said functionality was one of the things on his mind as he created his fall 2015 collection. But the important function of anything Mr. Pilati produces is probably not to add a zippered elbow to an overcoat but to bring us his singular conception of beauty.

title: Grand Jury Recommends Pennsylvania Attorney General Be Charged With Perjury
description: PHILADELPHIA  A Pennsylvania grand jury has recommended that Kathleen G. Kane, the states attorney general, be charged with perjury and other crimes in connection with her offices disclosure of details about the secret investigation of a Philadelphia civil rights leader, according to documents released Wednesday.

title: Inequality in the Air We Breathe?
description: I grew up in the small town of Gibsland, in northern Louisiana. It is dirt poor, but proud. And its an overwhelmingly African-American community.

title: Guy Bourdins Work Stands the Test of Time
description: London  The French fashion photographer Guy Bourdin died in 1991, but his influence can be felt in the pages of many of the fashion magazines that overwhelm the newsstands here.

title: A Seamstress Who Handed Off to the N.F.L. for 48 Years
description: ADA, Ohio  The first day Jane Helser went to work sewing footballs at the Wilson Sporting Goods factory in town, Lyndon Johnson was building his Great Society, Johnny Unitas was tossing passes for the Colts, and Apollo 11 was three years from landing on the moon.

title: Hope Solo Is Suspended by U.S. Soccer for 30 Days
description: U.S. Soccer suspended goalkeeper Hope Solo for 30 days on Wednesday after learning through news reports that she was present and arguing with the police when her husband was arrested on suspicion of driving under the influence early Monday.

title: Shannons Scouts vs. Shermans Armies
description: By late January 1865, the death knell was tolling loudly for the Confederacy. It was a month after the fall of Savannah, Ga., the finale to Union Gen. William T. Shermans March to the Sea. On Jan. 21, as his army rested in Savannah, Sherman penned a letter to Gen. James H. Wilson, commander of the federal cavalry. Using his typically brash and cocksure language, Sherman congratulated Wilson and himself on the success of the march. I Knocked daylight through Georgia, and in retreating to s[outh] like a sensible man I gathered up some plunder and walked into this beautiful City, Sherman wrote, whilst you & Thomas gave Hood & Forest (sic) a taste of what they have to Expect by trying to meddle with our Conquered Territory.

title: Take-Along Chargers That Pack Power
description: SPEND any time in an airport, and youll witness the electrical outlet acting as the 21st centurys fire pit. Armed with their smartphones, travelers huddle around outlets, hoping to warm their portable devices with some extra power before flying.

title: Where the Road Meets the Walrus
description: Lets raise the gas tax.

title: Republicans Push Plan in Net Neutrality Debate
description: WASHINGTON  The debate on Capitol Hill over the future of the Internet spilled into public view on Wednesday, as a pair of hearings took up a Republican proposal to put the issue in lawmakers hands.

title: Senate Rejects Climate Measures
description: The Senate on Wednesday twice rejected measures declaring that humans are causing climate change. But in the course of those votes, 15 Republicans, including Senator Rand Paul of Kentucky, voted yes. Mr. Paul, who is considered a likely presidential contender next year, was joined by Senators Bob Corker and Lamar Alexander of Tennessee, Kelly Ayotte of New Hampshire, Lisa Murkowski of Alaska and Jeff Flake of Arizona, among others. Two other potential Republican presidential candidates, Senators Marco Rubio of Florida and Ted Cruz of Texas, voted no. It was the first time in years that senators had voted on a climate change measure, and it came in the course of a debate on a bill forcing approval of the Keystone XL oil pipeline. President Obama is expected to veto the bill if it passes, as is likely, but lawmakers are using it to send their own political messages. Democrats had hoped to force Republicans on the record on the issue of climate change by introducing the two amendments.

title: Microsoft HoloLens: A Sensational Vision of the PCs Future
description: ITS generally wise to take demonstrations of new technologies with a grain of salt. That was especially true for the Microsoft HoloLens  the hologram-projecting glasses that the tech giant unveiled on Wednesday  which a small number of reporters were allowed to use for a few minutes.

title: Turkey: 2 Officers Sentenced in Death
description: Two Turkish police officers were sentenced Wednesday to 10 years in prison for their role in the fatal beating of a university student during antigovernment protests in 2013, a case that has become a symbol of police violence. Four other people received lesser sentences in the death of the student, Ali Ismail Korkmaz, 19, who was hit in the head with clubs several times by men in civilian clothing in Eskisehir, a northwestern town. He died more than a month after falling into a coma. On Wednesday the police in Kayseri, a central Anatolian town where the hearing took place, used tear gas to disperse crowds that criticized the terms as too lenient, news reports said. The 2013 protests grew into nationwide riots against the authoritarian tendencies of Prime Minister Recep Tayyip Erdogan, now president, who called the protesters looters and terrorists seeking to overthrow his government.

title: Inside a Wilson Football Factory
description: Jane Helser recently retired after working for nearly 50 years at the Wilson Sporting Goods factory, the source of the N.F.L.s handmade footballs.

title: Euroblunders
description: The contrast between the mood in the US and in Europe is amazing. Obama wasnt exactly able to claim morning in America in this weeks SOTU, but he was able to talk about success and moving forward. Meanwhile Mario Draghi is doing what he can and should, but I dont know anyone who really believes that it will be enough.

title: Day After Presidents Speech, Some Doubts Linger Over Nations Recovery
description: DENVER  As a web developer benefiting from an 8 percent pay raise, Brad McLaughlin is looking good economically. He and his girlfriend are spending more money on natural groceries, ski weekends in Colorados mountains and vacations to England and Austin, Tex. Not that he credits President Obama for any of it.

title: Too Big to Fail on Financial Regulators Agenda Again
description: Top financial regulators on Wednesday discussed ways to improve how so-called too-big-to-fail institutions are singled out for closer supervision, but they stopped well short of reversing any designations made so far.

title: Once Incendiary, a Book Debuts Quietly in a Reshaped Nation
description: NEW DELHI  Five years ago, the release in India of The Red Sari, about the president of the then-governing Indian National Congress Party, Sonia Gandhi, was unthinkable. Mrs. Gandhi was considered by some the de facto prime minister of the country, and her loyalists were incensed by the books contents, which they said was riddled with lies. They burned effigies of its Spanish author, Javier Moro, in Delhis streets, and according to the Spanish publisher, lawyers representing the Gandhi family threatened a lawsuit.

title: Goldman Sachs Investments Test the Volcker Rule
description: Goldman Sachs has been on a shopping spree with its own money, snapping up apartments in Spain, a mall in Utah and a European ink company, all of which the bank hopes eventually to sell for a profit.

title: Measles Cases Linked to Disneyland Rise, and Debate Over Vaccinations Intensifies
description: LOS ANGELES  A measles outbreak that began at Disneyland is spreading across California and beyond, prompting health officials to move aggressively to contain it  including by barring unvaccinated students from going to school in Orange County. The outbreak has increased concerns that a longstanding movement against childhood vaccinations has created a surge in a disease that was declared eliminated in the United States in 2000.

title: For Former Assistants at Duke, Moving Up Means Moving Out
description: Chris Carrawell knew he had to go far away when his time came. That was the way it was with all the former Duke players who had gone on to coaching roles at the university. Life in Durham, N.C., is so nice and cozy for the teams assistant coaches  top talent, sustained national relevance and consistent job offers  that it is hard to find a reason to leave.

title: Google Hopes to Take the Web Directly to Billions Lacking Access
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Google has never shied from novelty or spending big to find ways to connect more people to the Internet. Over the last two years, its ideas have included fleets of little satellites, solar-powered drones that would fly around the world and balloons that float high into the stratosphere, beaming the Internet to those below.

title: Gov. Cuomo Takes On Education
description: As presented in his State of the State address on Wednesday, Gov. Andrew Cuomos ambitious projects for his second term include a much-needed increase in the minimum wage, reform of the justice system, some forgiveness of student loans and a new commission to determine fair pay for legislators. At the top of his list is reforming the New Yorks educational system. This is a laudable undertaking that has long needed addressing, Mr. Cuomo said, but also one that will put him directly at loggerheads with the powerful teachers unions.

title: Obama: Middle-Class Economics Works
description: The president laid the groundwork for middle-class economics during his State of the Union address on Jan. 20.

title: Talk of Wealth Gap Prods the G.O.P. to Refocus
description: WASHINGTON  President Obamas push for a new middle-class economics may go nowhere in Congress, but his ambitious array of proposals to raise stagnant incomes and provide more government support for struggling working families will frame his last two years in office and help make the politics of rich and poor a central issue in the campaign to succeed him.

title: Argentine Phone Calls Detail Efforts to Shield Iran
description: BUENOS AIRES  Intercepted conversations between representatives of the Iranian and Argentine governments point to a long pattern of secret negotiations to reach a deal in which Argentina would receive oil in exchange for shielding Iranian officials from charges that they orchestrated the bombing of a Jewish community center in 1994.

title: Patriots Drag the N.F.L. Back Into Turbulence
description: Just when you think that the N.F.L. has temporarily halted its descent into the maelstrom, here comes an old reliable, the New England Patriots.

title: U.S. Seeking a Stronger World Media Voice
description: WASHINGTON  Andrew Lack was sworn in this week as the first chief executive of the Broadcasting Board of Governors, putting him in charge of an agency with a $700 million budget and an outsize influence on shaping world opinion about the United States. Foreign policy experts and some critics say the appointment of Mr. Lack, the former president of NBC News and a prominent news media executive, represents a sea change for the often-criticized agency, which oversees United States government-supported civilian international news media such as Voice of America, Radio Free Europe/Radio Liberty, the Middle East Broadcasting Networks and Radio Free Asia.

title: Reagan, Obama and Inequality
description: Since the end of the 1970s, something has gone profoundly wrong in America.

title: U.S. and Cuba Set to Discuss Diplomatic Ties
description: HAVANA  Seeking to restore relations ruptured more than five decades ago, the United States and Cuba began talks here on Wednesday by agreeing to disagree on a central issue dividing them  the privilege of Cubans who arrive in the United States to automatically qualify for residency.

title: Boston's 2024 Olympic Bid
description: The bid prepared by Boston 2024, a group of business leaders, construction magnates and politicians that was presented to the United States Olympic Committee in December. The committee chose Boston over Los Angeles, San Francisco and Washington on Jan. 8.

title: Gloom Lifts, and Obama Goes All Out
description: WASHINGTON  The morning after major Democratic losses in last years midterm elections, President Obama walked into the Roosevelt Room with a message for his despondent staff: Im not done yet.

title: Topless Photos Return to Page 3 ofBritains Sun Tabloid
description: The news swept the world, applauded as a sign of progress. After 40 years Britains Sun newspaper, according to news reports this week, would stop running photographs of topless women on its Page 3.

title: Decoder Ring, for Short
description: THURSDAY  Were building columns today, but theyre not the kind that hold up buildings. Timothy Polin is back, and he has hidden a group of subversives in our puzzle. Were going to have to keep an eye on him.

title: Queens Van Driver Accused of Fatally Shooting a Rival
description: A livery van driver from Queens was charged on Wednesday in the fatal shooting of a second driver who the police believe was a rival in the shadow transportation network of unlicensed dollar vans.

title: Rejecting a Life of Crime, and Hoping to Help Others
description: Gordon Raymond is not proud when he talks about his past, and the various crimes he once carried out without a second thought. Today, at 53, Mr. Raymond is trying to atone; he wants to make a difference in the lives of others.

title: When Digital Thieves Strike, Artists Act Quickly to Seize Opportunity
description: When nearly 30 new Madonna songs, many of them unfinished demos, surfaced online last month, the singer and her team reacted both emotionally and with a savvy business acumen tailored to the digital era.

title: In Journal, Man Wrote of Creating Silk Road, an Online Black Market, Prosecutors Say
description: Long before the website Silk Road became an online black market for drugs and other illicit goods, it began its life of underground commerce with the sale of homegrown hallucinogenic mushrooms, prosecutors have said.

title: Edgewater Fire Drives Hundreds From Apartment Building
description: A huge fire ripped through an apartment building near the Hudson River in New Jersey on Wednesday night, forcing the evacuation of hundreds of people and sending large plumes of black smoke billowing into the air.

title: Tony Verna, Who Started Instant Replay and Remade Sports Television, Dies at 81
description: The Army-Navy game of 1963 was an important one in that seasons college football landscape. With a Heisman Trophy winner and future pro star at quarterback, Roger Staubach, Navy, the No. 2 team in the nation, won by 21-15 and went on to face top-ranked Texas in the Cotton Bowl. (Texas won.)

title: Melvin J. Gordon, Who Ran Tootsie Roll Industries, Dies at 95
description: Melvin J. Gordon, who ran Tootsie Roll Industries for more than 50 years, died on Wednesday in Boston. He was 95.

title: Facing 76ers, Knicks Earn a Win. Someone Had To.
description: PHILADELPHIA  What happens when an anemic force meets an infirm object? That premise was tested on Wednesday when the Knicks and the Philadelphia 76ers, who had combined for 14 wins, met at Wells Fargo Center.

title: Alan J. Hirschfield, Who Led Film Studio Through Financial Scandal, Dies at 79
description: LOS ANGELES  Alan J. Hirschfield, an executive who ran two major film studios and saw Columbia Pictures through one of Hollywoods most colorful and chronicled financial scandals, died on Jan. 15 at his home in Wilson, Wyo. He was 79.

title: Serena and Venus Williams Advance in Straight Sets, With a Bit of Levity
description: MELBOURNE, Australia  Venus and Serena Williams made their first long journey to the Australian Open in 1998 and played each other in the second round, with Venus, the big sister, coming out on top.

title: John Bayley, Oxford Don Who Wrote of His Wife, Iris Murdoch, Dies at 89
description: John Bayley, an Oxford don and literary critic who found an international readership with his memoir Elegy for Iris, a moving account of his life with the novelist Iris Murdoch, his wife, after she was struck by Alzheimers disease, died on Jan. 12 at his home in Lanzarote, in the Canary Islands. He was 89.

title: Romney and Jeb Bush to Meet in Utah
description: WASHINGTON  Jeb Bush and Mitt Romney are scheduled to meet privately this week in Utah, raising the possibility that the two former governors will find a way to avoid competing presidential campaigns that would split the Republican establishment next year, two prominent party members said Wednesday night.

title: Faten Hamama, Actress Hailed as Lady of the Arabic Screen, Dies at 83
description: Faten Hamama, the Egyptian-born actress whose victory in a beauty contest when she was only 7 inspired a cinematic career that would span nearly 100 films and establish her as the unrivaled Lady of the Arabic Screen, died on Saturday in Cairo. She was 83.

title: Lottery Numbers
Renowned Gay Mecca on Fire Island Goes to Auction
description: When three local residents bought up the commercial district along the harbor in Fire Island Pines almost five years ago, they planned to transform the renowned yet rundown gay mecca for a new age of gay acceptance and success.

title: Eerie Self-Portraits Inspired by an Abandoned Vintage Suitcase
description: In this weekly series, Ts photo editors share the most compelling visual projects theyve discovered.

title: Word of the Day | saline
description: saline \sa-len, -lin\ noun and adjective

title: Small Screen Is Big Player at Sundance
description: PARK CITY, Utah  The Sundance Television Festival this is not.

title: Sheldon Silver, New York Assembly Speaker, Faces Arrest on Corruption Charges
description: Federal authorities are expected to arrest Sheldon Silver, the powerful speaker of the New York State Assembly, on corruption charges on Thursday, people with knowledge of the matter said. The case is likely to throw Albany into disarray at the beginning of a new session.

title: Hyderabads Old City
description: In a quest for modernization, much of Hyderabads architectural legacy was dismantled.

title: Adhering to Exacting Specifications
description: At the Wilson Sporting Goods factory in Ada, Ohio, employees accustomed to precise specifications see the Patriots deflation scandal as a distant issue.

title: Africas Economy Is Rising. Now What Happens to Its Food?
description: For decades, the economies of Africa were the worlds economic laggards. They arent anymore. Over the last decade, Africas per capita income has grown at a rate nearly identical to that of the rest of the world.

title: For The Love Of Capital Income
description: Shorter Glenn Hubbard: Means-tested programs and tax credits are a terrible thing, because benefits that fall when your income rises discourage work. Also, we must save money by means-testing Social Security and Medicare.

title: E.C.B. Stimulus Calls for 60 Billion Euros in Monthly Bond-Buying
description: FRANKFURT  The European Central Bank said on Thursday that it would begin buying hundreds of billions of euros worth of government bonds in an aggressive  though some say belated  attempt to prevent the eurozone from becoming trapped in long-term economic stagnation.

title: Paging Robert Burns
description: Here.

title: Quotation of the Day
description: The Yemeni state has always been weak, but now theres a real danger of economic meltdown, and of the kind of fragmentation that could ultimately make Yemen almost ungovernable.
