Anyone could have played the same deals simultaneously at the Common Game website. Combined with sponsorship from Netjets, about $100,000 was raised.

title: Shopping Sales and Events in New York City
description: Attention sneakerheads: Beginning Thursday, the athletic-shoe-inspired Alexander Wang spring collection will be available at Bergdorf Goodman in a pop-up on 5F. The installation is made from the same black-and-gray speckled performance rubber used for the set of the runway show. Get in the game with a graphic mesh tee dress ($950) or a striped poplin romper ($1,450); spend $500 and youll receive a USB playlist by Jesse Marco, a D.J. who collaborates with Mr. Wang.

title: This. Has People Clamoring for an Invite
description: This is now more than a pronoun. In the online realm of social media, this is a statement, a proclamation, a call to action. Written often in caps, or as a hashtag (#THIS), this means I second this sentiment, This is great or Read this.

title: Newly Released Books
description: HARRAGA

title: This Bed Keeps No Secrets
description: Aaron Poritzs new bed was originally designed as a custom piece for a buyer from Design Within Reach, who commissioned it after seeing a daybed Mr. Poritz was showing at the International Contemporary Furniture Fair.

title: Great Ideas Just Down the Road
description: One of CB2s newest lines, a 15-piece collection of furniture, lighting, textiles and accessories, was created by design students from the School of the Art Institute of Chicago. Conceived for small-space living, it is filled with clever ideas, among them a mirrored wall-mounted jewelry cabinet and a set of tables with a big presence but a small profile (Paradox nesting tables, $249). Prices range from $3.50 for a plate to $699 for a rug.

title: Loretta Lynch Revisits an Ultra-Long Prison Sentence
description: Loretta Lynch fielded mostly predictable questions at her confirmation hearing on Wednesday. Senators weighing her nomination to be the next attorney general wondered: Does she believe President Obama has the legal authority to grant amnesty to five million undocumented immigrants? Will she just be another Eric Holder? Duke or UNC? And so on.

title: Full Bloom in a World of White
description: There were thistles, Kangaroo Paw, ranunculus and peonies, hydrangeas, delphiniums and over 40 varieties of roses. In all, 14 species of 16,000 individual flowers lay in sweet-smelling drifts on lunch tables set up last weekend at the Viacom building in Times Square, home of MTV. There, more than 200 volunteers threaded blooms onto lengths of copper wire that were then gathered into bundles and hung above the buildings two entrances and in the visitors center. Standing under them and looking up, you were caught in a different sort of blizzard than the one that was expected this week. It was spring, abstracted, designed and orchestrated by Rebecca Louise Law, a British artist whose medium is flowers.

title: I Dont Want to Spend Much on Window Treatments. What Are the Most Appealing Options?
description: Q. I dont want to spend too much on window treatments, because Ill leave them behind when I sell. What are some affordable but attractive options?

title: A Tip of the Cap
description: On any given night, bartenders at Spuyten Duyvil, a craft beer bar in Williamsburg, Brooklyn, open about 200 bottles of beer. Joe Carroll, who owns the bar (as well as Fette Sau, St. Anselm, Gotham Artisanal and Lake Trout), doesnt tend bar anymore  his role is strictly managerial now  but he did for three years. And he has strong opinions about bottle openers.

title: Coming Full Circle
description: When Glen Rosenbaum was a teenager, his parents commissioned a midcentury architect named Arthur Steinberg to design a house in the Meyerland neighborhood in Houston. My parents, Max and Helen, were really proud of it, said Mr. Rosenbaum, who is now 66, a tax lawyer and the former board chairman at the Houston Grand Opera Association. I was, too.

title: As Sales Dip, McDonalds Is Replacing Don Thompson as Chief
description: McDonalds announced on Wednesday that its chief executive would step down, just days after the fast-food restaurant chain posted one of its worst financial performances in years.

title: A Potluck for Product Development
description: FirstBuild, a subsidiary of GE, operates like an in-house start-up. Its home products are designed with input from a community of makers and hackers, produced in low quantities and fast-tracked to the marketplace. The misses quietly fade away; the hits can then be manufactured on a larger scale.

title: After Three Years, Its Time to Turn on the Lights
description: How long does it take to create a lighting collection? Three years, apparently  at least if youre self-described super type-A creatives, like Julian Peploe, an art director, and David Ryan, a painter and sculptor.

title: Swing, Sit and Sleep for Less
description: In-stock duvets are 20 percent off, and all orders of beds, mattresses, wardrobes, furniture and linen sets are 15 percent off at Flou in January (the narrow Biss trundle bed, originally $4,086, is about $3,473); 42 Greene Street (Broome Street), 212-941-9101, flou.com.

title: Faulty Hood and Fire Hazard Lead to Twin Recalls for Nissan
description: Nissan is recalling almost 640,000 vehicles in two actions for a fire hazard and because the hood could open while the vehicle is moving, the automaker has informed federal regulators.

title: Keira Knightley
description: The actress received her first Oscar nomination for Pride and Prejudice. Her second is for her role in The Imitation Game.

title: Beyond Luxurious
description: New York developers are redefining the meaning of amenity. Once it was a steam room. Now its a hamam.

title: Over-the-Top Amenities: Sweating the Details
description: At the Cast Iron House, a late-19th-century landmark in TriBeCa reimagined by Shigeru Ban, the Pritzker Prize-winning architect, into 13 shiny white condos, you will find another flourish designed by Mr. Ban: a Turkish-style hamam, complete with a plunge pool and a deluge shower. (Well circle back to that deluge later.)

title: French Video Tries to Blunt Jihads Allure Among Youth
description: PARIS  In a bid to stop the flow of disaffected youth to the battlefields of Syria and Iraq, the French government on Wednesday released a graphic two-minute video showing clips of executions, wounded children and crucifixions that tells potential recruits that the glory promised to them is a lie.

title: Swept Away by a Love for Dust
description: Klaus Pichler went looking for something most people want to avoid: dust.

title: Five Minutes to Moonflower
description: The professionals said it could not be done. They had never tried it, and they didnt know any public garden that had tried it, and they wouldnt recommend anyone else give it a try.

title: Study Finds H.I.V. Drugs Priced Out of Reach
description: Drugs to treat H.I.V. and AIDS are being priced out of reach for many patients enrolled in insurance plans through the new health care exchanges, despite warnings that such practices are illegal under the Obama administrations health care law, according to a new analysis by Harvard researchers.

title: As Profit Slows, Ikea Notes Need to Move Online
description: When Ikea burst onto the American retail scene in 1985, it was a trailblazer. Ikea, the Swedish retailer, had mastered a clean, simple aesthetic long before Apple opened its sleek stores. It figured out how shoppers would flock to buy hip, if not very durable, products at low prices, long before H&M or Zara made that their business model.

title: New York Citys First Lady Shares Family History as She Unveils Push on Mental Health Care
description: Chirlane McCray, the wife of Mayor Bill de Blasio, revealed on Wednesday that she had been surrounded by mental illness most of her life  first as a child of parents who had depression and later as a mother of a daughter who is recovering from depression, anxiety and substance abuse.

title: The People vs. Boko Haram
description: Through the fall and winter, the Islamist militant group Boko Haram has seemed nearly unstoppable. It has captured town after town in northeastern Nigeria and laid siege to the fishing hamlet Baga and nearby villages, killing hundreds of people. But over the weekend, the group finally suffered a significant setback. The militants tried to invade Maiduguri, a city of two million in the northeast, as well as two towns in the area, Monguno and Konduga. While Monguno  which is 80 miles north of Maiduguri and houses a military base  fell under Boko Haram control on Sunday, Maiduguri and Konduga held their ground, in no small part because of vigilantes who fought alongside the Nigerian military.

title: Bill Belichick Wore Flip-Flops
description: Bill Belichick wore flip-flops.*

title: Alan J. Hirschfield, 79, Hollywood Executive, Is Dead
description: LOS ANGELES  Alan J. Hirschfield, an executive who ran two major film studios and saw Columbia Pictures through one of Hollywoods most colorful and chronicled financial scandals, died on Jan. 15 at his home in Wilson, Wyo. He was 79.

title: Michelle Obama Praised for Bold Stand She Didnt Take in Saudi Arabia
description: As images of President Obama and the first lady, Michelle Obama, with the new Saudi leader, King Salman, circulated online after their brief visit to Riyadh on Tuesday, commentators, observers watching from afar, seized on the fact that Mrs. Obama had not covered her hair during the audience with the new monarch.

title: Oil Company Sasol Delays Huge Louisiana Project as Prices Slide
description: HOUSTON  In the biggest retrenchment in the United States as oil prices fall, Sasol has delayed an expansive $14 billion project in southwestern Louisiana to make diesel out of natural gas.

title: In Pakistan, a Charity Project Points to Official Tolerance of Militants
description: KARACHI, Pakistan  Violence and mayhem are the hallmarks of Lashkar-e-Taiba, the Pakistani group that waged the deadly 2008 Mumbai attacks. But this week, the group publicly expanded its operations in an entirely different domain: health care.

title: As New Leadership Takes Over in Washington, Fiscal Battles Resurface
description: WASHINGTON  With the era of falling budget deficits coming to an end, President Obama and Congress are hurtling toward a clash over spending as the White House and Democrats press for an easing of fiscal austerity just as Republicans redouble efforts to balance the budget.

title: Homeowners in Poland Borrowed in Swiss Francs, and Now Pay Dearly
description: WARSAW  Piotr Szczepaniak, an apartment manager here, had just finished work, checking faucets and making sure rents were paid. After making himself a coffee, he logged on to a Polish social network and noticed that someone had posted the current exchange rate of the Swiss franc.

title: Harvards Endowment Remains Biggest of All
description: Some things do not change: Harvards $36 billion endowment is still the largest of any university, according to the 2014 NACUBO-Commonfund Study of Endowments. The University of Texas System endowment, at $25 billion, was in second place, edging last years No. 2, Yale, at $24 billion. The average market value of college and university endowments increased 15.5 percent in the 2014 fiscal year, the study found, compared with 11.7 in 2013. A separate survey, by the Council for Aid for Education, found that charitable contributions to colleges and universities in the United States increased 10.8 percent in 2014, the largest increase since 2000. The five institutions that raised the most money took in more than 10 percent of the $37.45 billion in charitable contributions to higher education. In that study, too, Harvard led the pack, taking in $1.16 billion. Stanford was second, at $928 million.

title: Ukraine Clamps Down on Travel to and From Rebel Areas
description: DONETSK, Ukraine  For Larisa Horlova, a cashier, making the trip from rebel-held territory to Ukraine proper had been a routine matter, despite the shells that sometimes pounded into fields near the road as she drove. She did it every week or so to get money from her Ukrainian bank account, since A.T.M.s are no longer functioning in Donetsk.

title: Motorcyclist Pleads Guilty to Assault in 2013 Attack on S.U.V. Driver in Manhattan
description: In the widely viewed confrontation between a swarm of motorcyclists and a family in a Range Rover on the Henry Hudson Parkway, Christopher Cruz played a minor but key role.

title: The New Pleasures of Photo Printing
description: NOT long ago I donned a vest and a top hat, gathered my pocketwatch and monocle, and rode my penny-farthing to the general store. The get-up seemed appropriate because I was on the hunt for one of the old-timiest machines still floating about our digital world: A photo printer.

title: Robert Pirie, 80, Lawyer and Banker in Mergers and Takeovers, Dies
description: Robert S Pirie, a combative corporate lawyer when the risky but lucrative field of mergers and acquisitions was emerging and later a prominent investment banker on Wall Street, died on Jan. 15 in Manhattan. He was 80.

title: After Alibaba Spinoff, Yahoo May Become a Takeover Target
description: The real Yahoo can now stand up.

title: Rev. Richard McBrien, Dissenting Catholic Theologian, Dies at 78
description: The Rev. Richard P. McBrien, a theologian and professor at Notre Dame who unflinchingly challenged orthodoxy in the Roman Catholic Church for five decades and popularized and perpetuated the reforms of the Second Vatican Council, died on Sunday at his home in Farmington, Conn. He was 78.

title: Patriots Mix Things Up to Gain Cohesion in Their Running Game
description: PHOENIX  There are patterns to be found in chaos, but anyone who claims to know how effectively the New England Patriots will run the ball in Super Bowl XLIX on Sunday has not been paying attention to the team this season.

title: The Virtual Reality Content Race
description: Now that the Oculus Rift has some competition, the virtual reality content race has begun.

title: Video Feature: Signs That Virtual Reality Is on the Verge of Taking Off
description: READY or not, here comes virtual reality.

title: Don Harron, Actor on Broadway and in Hee Haw, Dies at 90
description: Don Harron, a Shakespearean actor who became a star on Canadian television and a familiar face on Hee Haw as the country bumpkin Charlie Farquharson, died on Jan. 17 at his home in Toronto. He was 90.

title: Xu Shilin, a Young Chinese Player, Tries to Step Into the Void Left by Li Na
description: MELBOURNE, Australia  Xu Shilin might become the next great Chinese tennis player, but her path to success has only recently led her back to China.

title: Chevron and BP in Deal to Search for Oil Deep Beneath the Gulf of Mexico
description: LONDON  Chevron and BP said on Wednesday that they would work together to explore, appraise and, possibly, develop 24 offshore leases in a deepwater part of the Gulf of Mexico known as the lower tertiary.

title: Judged by Their Covers, Atlanta Hawks Fascinate Bettors
description: As the Atlanta Hawks exceed the most pie-in-the-sky expectations in the N.B.A. standings this season, with a 38-8 record after Wednesday nights home win over the Nets, their ledger against the spread is equally astonishing.

title: Margaret Bloy Graham, Harry the Dirty Dog Illustrator, Dies at 94
description: Margaret Bloy Graham, a picture-book illustrator best known for Harry the Dirty Dog, a cautionary ablutionary tale from 1956 that remains a staple of childhood, died on Jan. 22 in Belmont, Mass. She was 94.

title: Blizzard Warnings
description: There is no point in second-guessing the decisions that were made from Sunday to Monday involving the New York City megablizzard that never arrived, including the one to shut down the city subways  the first time in 110 years that the system stopped because of a snow forecast.

title: Happy to Air Their Views
description: PHOENIX  Not far from where the Super Bowl will be played Sunday, at a party store called Dulceria La Nueva Pico Rico, Norma Rios, an employee, stood next to a tank of helium. The store sells hundreds of balloons each week, and underinflation can ruin a childs day. Rios pointed to the ceiling.

title: Administration Official Criticizes Israeli Ambassador Over Netanyahu Visit
description: WASHINGTON  The Obama administration, after days of mounting tension, signaled on Wednesday how angry it is with Israel that Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu accepted Republican leaders invitation to address Congress on Iran without consulting the White House.

title: G.O.P.s Invitation to Netanyahu Is Aiding Obamas Cause on Iran
description: WASHINGTON  President Obamas relations with Democrats on Capitol Hill have never been especially close. But one man is helping to bring them a little closer together: Benjamin Netanyahu.

title: Lottery Numbers
Andrew Sullivan Retires From Blogging
description: Andrew Sullivan, a prolific writer on politics and culture who was a web journalism pioneer, announced on Wednesday that he would stop blogging.

title: Loss to Knicks Leaves Thunder Less Room to Err
description: Some coaches and players would be perfectly happy if the grueling N.B.A. regular season were shorter. The Knicks, who have firmly acknowledged that this is not their year, might not protest much about ending the whole thing tomorrow.

title: Iran Bows to Pressure in Naming U.N. Envoy
description: Relenting to American opposition, Iran named a substitute United Nations ambassador on Wednesday, withdrawing its first choice, whom the United States had accused of aiding the plotters of the 1979 Iranian hostage crisis.

title: New York Blood Donations Are Sought After Storm Disrupts Giving
description: New York Blood Center and city officials called on people in the New York region to give blood to make up for thousands of donations that were canceled by this weeks winter storm.

title: In Bid to Host Democratic National Convention in 2016, de Blasio Makes a Fiscal Case
description: Mayor Bill de Blasio is showcasing New Yorks financial wherewithal, and its civic leaders, in the final stages of the citys competition with Philadelphia and Columbus, Ohio, to host the Democratic National Convention in 2016.

title: Buy or Sell Direct
description: THURSDAY PUZZLE  This past Sunday, I sat in the lobby of the very cool Ace Hotel in New York City with a terrific group of crossword solvers and we discussed, among other things, why certain kinds of themes appear on different days of the week.

title: Vanderbilt Rape Convictions Stir Dismay and Denial
description: NASHVILLE  The crime was horrific and the verdict stunningly swift. Two former Vanderbilt University football players are facing the possibility of decades in prison after it took a jury less than four hours to convict them for their roles in a 2013 sexual assault of an unconscious woman. Two more former football players await trial.

title: Canada Agency Monitors File-Sharing, Reports Say
description: OTTAWA  Every day, Canadas electronic spy agency examines tens of millions of electronic documents and videos  and some of the people who downloaded them  as part of an antiterrorism effort involving the United States and other allies, a document leaked by Edward J. Snowden indicates.

title: On Long Island, a Different Scene
Finding Out Who Shoveled the Boston Marathon Finish Line
description: BOSTON  As the blizzard raged on Tuesday, Philip L. Hillman, a guest staying at a downtown hotel, peered out his window. He saw that someone had shoveled through the snow accumulating on Boylston Street and revealed the finish line of the Boston Marathon, a rectangle of bare pavement in a sea of white.

title: 6 Days That Felled Sheldon Silver, the Speaker Who Ruled Albany for Decades
description: ALBANY  After 21 years dominating Albany through his stoicism and unyielding will, Sheldon Silver met his downfall, appropriately enough, after an uncomfortable silence.

title: Iran: Washington Post Reporters Trial to Be Soon, but Charges Are Unclear
description: Jason Rezaian, The Washington Posts Tehran correspondent, who has been incarcerated for unexplained reasons since July 22, will be tried soon, Irans state-run Islamic Republic News Agency said Wednesday, but there was still no word on the charges he faces. The agencys report came two weeks after it announced that Mr. Rezaian, 38, had been formally charged and that his case would be heard by Irans Revolutionary Court. Mr. Rezaians family, American officials and The Post have all urged Iran to free him and have questioned why the charges have not been made public. Mr. Rezaian, a dual Iranian-American citizen, has been denied access to a lawyer. Martin Baron, The Posts executive editor, said in a statement this month, It is appalling and outrageous that Jason remains behind bars.

title: Russia: Court Rules for Rights Group
description: Russias Supreme Courton Wednesdaydismissed a government effort to shut down Memorial, the countrys oldest human rights advocacy group, which has been singled out for its investigations of Soviet-era and current civil violations. The Ministry of Justice had accused Memorial of structuring its organization in violation of its own charter. The judge threw out the lawsuiton Thursdayafter the Justice Ministry said Memorial had rectified the charter violation. In a separate case, Memorial is challenging a decision by the ministry to register it as a foreign agent, a term defined under a 2012 law as a nongovernmental organization that receives foreign funds and engages in politics.

title: Cuba: Party Paper Reports on Meeting of Fidel Castro and Brazilian Author
description: Cubas former leader Fidel Castro met with Frei Betto, a Brazilian intellectual, this week, the first such meeting reported in the state-run Cuban news media since a recent swell of rumors that Mr. Castro was dead. A brief article in Granma, the Communist Partys official newspaper, reported late Tuesday that Mr. Castro had had a friendly conversation that day with Frei Betto, a leftist Dominican friar who wrote a book in the 1980s on Mr. Castros views on Christianity, Fidel and Religion. Granma did not publish a photograph of the meeting. On Monday Granma published Mr. Castros first remarks on the restoration of diplomatic relations with the United States, which was announced in December. His lack of comment then fueled intense speculation that he was dead or so mentally frail that he could not comment.

title: 2 Sentenced in Murders in Chile Coup
description: SANTIAGO, Chile  Two former Chilean intelligence officials have been sentenced in the murders of two American citizens shortly after the 1973 coup led by Gen. Augusto Pinochet.

title: Former Top Venezuela Aide Said to Flee Amid Inquiry
description: CARACAS, Venezuela  The whole thing had the feel of a Cold War defector drama  Caribbean style.

title: Police Bullets Killed a Hostage in Sydney Cafe Siege, Inquest Is Told
description: SYDNEY  One of the two hostages who died during a 17-hour siege of a downtown Sydney cafe by a lone gunman in December was killed by police bullet fragments, a coroners inquest into the siege and the police assault that ended it was told on Thursday.

title: The Americans Recap: Mother Russia and Her Children
description: Season 3, Episode 1: EST Men

title: Fans Rebelling Against the Red Bulls
description: A billboard will go up sometime before the Red Bulls home opener on March 22, right by Exit 16 on I-280, the main access road to Red Bull Arena in Harrison, N.J. It will denounce the clubs new management team and its Austrian energy-drink-selling ownership. Most notably, it will profess support not for the teams new coach, Jesse Marsch, but for his ousted predecessor.

title: Player Ratings: U.S. (2) vs. Chile (3)
description: The beginning of 2015 is looking a lot like the end of the 2014 for the United States national team, which endured another collapse in the second half and lost to Chile, 3-2, in Rancagua on Wednesday.

title: Quotation of the Day
description: Youve got to look that parent in the eye and demonstrate through actions, not words, that you are doing things to create a better, safer environment for their child. Otherwise, guys, were in trouble.

title: Producing Biofuels
description: A selection of sources are currently in use, or are being studied, as potential biofuels.

title: New Report Urges Western Governments to Reconsider Reliance on Biofuels
description: Western governments have made a wrong turn in energy policy by supporting the large-scale conversion of plants into fuel and should reconsider that strategy, according to a new report from a prominent environmental think tank.

title: A Warm Cinnamon Curry From a Farm in St. Lucia
description: When he is not making photos, the fashion photographer and T contributor Greg Kessler is also a farmer at Long Islands Quail Hill farm. Occasionally, for T he explores more remote agricultural areas.

title: Maine, One Coffee Roaster at a Time
description: Sure, the morning sun sparkles off a harbor packed with lobster boats and schooners. And yes, it feels good to breathe the sea air and watch the gulls cross the lighthouse at the tip of the breakwater. All well and good. But hows the coffee?

title: U.S. Suddenly Goes Quiet on Effort to Bolster Afghan Forces
description: WASHINGTON  The United States has spent about $65 billion to build Afghanistans army and police forces, and until this month the American-led coalition regularly shared details on how the money was being put to use and on the Afghan forces progress.

title: Word of the Day | stem
description: stem \stem\ noun and verb

title: Maria Sharapova and Serena Williams Win in Australian Open Semifinals
description: MELBOURNE, Australia  As it turned out, an Australian Open semifinal was not Maria Sharapovas toughest all-Russian match in Melbourne this year.

title: Hawks Merrily Roll Past Nets to Their 17th Straight Win
description: ATLANTA  The Atlanta Hawks have roared past being a curiosity and are in full bloom as a phenomenon. Their last loss was on Dec. 26, and they look indestructible, with balance and chemistry on offense and defense.

title: A Rich Person Is Someone Who Makes 50 Percent More Than You
description: The first rule of modern tax policy is raise taxes only on the rich. The second rule is that your family isnt rich, even if you make a lot of money.

title: Whats on TV Thursday
description: 9 P.M. (HBO2) THE COUNSELOR (2013) In this thriller directed by Ridley Scott from a screenplay by Cormac McCarthy, Michael Fassbender portrays the title character  a corrupt, high-flying Texas lawyer who gets in over his head in a drug deal with Reiner (Javier Bardem), a nightclub owner involved with a Mexican cartel promising an astronomical return. Brad Pitt is the Counselors wary business associate, Cameron Diaz is Reiners predatory girlfriend, and Penlope Cruz is the woman the Counselor intends to marry. From all the ellipses, as well as the eccentric, mesmerizing poetry of his dialogue, Mr. McCarthy appears to have never read a screenwriting manual in his life. (Thats a compliment; this is his first produced film script.), Manohla Dargis wrote in The New York Times.

title: 1989 Cables Offer New Detail, and Questions, on Tiananmen
description: The release of Canadian diplomatic cables from 1989 has offered new detail on the deadly crackdown on protesters in Beijing that year. The cables describe the killing of unarmed civilians, rumors of widespread executions and fears that the Canadian Embassy in Beijing could be overrun by the Chinese military if it sheltered protest leaders wanted by the government.

title: Corrections: January 29, 2015
description: FRONT PAGE

title: Deutsche Bank Posts a Profit, Upending Predictions of a Loss
description: Deutsche Bank, the largest German bank, said on Thursday that it returned to profit in the fourth quarter of 2014, as revenue in the investment banking unit rose and the bank set aside less money to cover legal problems.

title: Microsoft Brings Outlook to iPhone, Other Mobile Devices
description: SEATTLE  Its easy to overlook the following of a product like Outlook, Microsofts email program, if you havent spent any time working in a large company.

title: A Response to Azerbaijan
description: To the Editor:

title: Romneys Mormonism
description: To the Editor:

title: How Do We Increase Empathy?
description: In my last column, I wrote about a high school buddy, Kevin Green, a warm and helpful man who floundered in a tough job market, hurt his back and died at the age of 54. The column was a call for empathy for those who are struggling, but, predictably, scolds complained that Kevins problems were of his own making.

title: Charlestons Historic Core
description: To the Editor:

title: Intent and Racial Bias
description: To the Editor:

title: The Days of Wine and Droning
description: The case of the intoxicated government worker who flew a drone onto the White House lawn launched a million jokes. Although none was actually better than the straight-faced headline in The New York Times: White House Drone Crash Described as a U.S. Workers Drunken Lark.

title: Moonshot Medicine Will Let Us Down
description: ROCHESTER, Minn.  PRESIDENT OBAMAS new budget is expected to include hundreds of millions of dollars for so-called precision medicine. The initiative, which he introduced last week in his State of the Union address, has bipartisan support and is a bright spot in the otherwise tight funding environment for medical research. Unfortunately, precision medicine is unlikely to make most of us healthier.

title: Republicans Try to Pre-empt the F.C.C.
description: Many Republicans have no fondness for net neutrality  the idea that cable and phone companies should treat all information equally as it travels over their broadband Internet networks. So it comes as no surprise that some of them are trying to throw a wrench into the Federal Communications Commissions plan to adopt strong Internet rules.

title: Inconvenient Truths in Afghanistan
description: In late December, as they do every few months, American military officials in Kabul sent a trove of data to the office of the Special Inspector General for Afghanistan Reconstruction for its quarterly report. Over the years, such figures have told an often dispiriting story about Washingtons enormous investment in the countrys security forces, laying out their size, readiness, attrition level and the state of their infrastructure.

title: Baby, Its Cold Outside (and Inside, Too!)
Europes Anti-Business Stance
description: TOO often the debate over how to restart Europes economy veers into the conveniently crisp alternatives of stimulus versus austerity. Should the pressure to reduce government deficits be relaxed? Should central bank actions to lower interest rates have come sooner and been more aggressive?

title: Nobody Behind the Wheel
Royal Dutch Shell Posts Rise in Earnings Despite Lower Oil Prices
description: LONDON  The financial impact of the sharp fall in oil prices has begun to show in the earnings of big energy companies.

title: Test Yourself | Times Square at a Crossroads of Its Own
description: Here are several paragraphs from a Jan. 26 article, Times Squares Crushing Success Raises Questions About Its Future.

title: 6 Qs About the News | Outliving Horror for 70 Years and Never Forgetting
description: In Outliving Horror for 70 Years and Never Forgetting, Joanna Berendt writes about how Holocaust survivors, ever dwindling in number, gathered at Auschwitz-Birkenau this week to remember.

title: Swept Away by a Love for Dust
description: Most people want nothing to do with the stuff Klaus Pichler photographs. If anything, they want to remove it from their lives. Yet he is probably one of the few among us who would tell you that his subject is, in fact, quite beautiful.

title: Comments Used in Case Against Pu Zhiqiang Spread Online
description: Calamity comes through the mouth, warns a Chinese saying. And for Pu Zhiqiang, one of Chinas most prominent human rights lawyers, calamity has come in 28 passionate, scathing remarks that the police say he made on the Internet.

title: In Tokyo, Creating a Community
description: The developer of Aomame House designed the eight-unit building to encourage interaction among its residents.

title: How Much Freedom Have Your Parents Given You?
description: How old were you when your parents first let you cross the street alone? Walk home from school or a friends house? Take public transportation alone? How much, in general, do your parents hover and worry over your academic, physical and psychological development? Would you call them helicopter parents? Why or why not?

title: Doctors as Advocates for Family Leave
description: Birdlike and in his 80s, the patient had come to the hospital complaining of a new cough. But it was not he whom my colleagues and I found most disquieting.

title: Your Thursday Briefing
description: Good morning.

title: Co-Pilot of AirAsia Plane Was at Controls Just Before Crash
description: JAKARTA, Indonesia  Indonesian investigators said Thursday that the co-pilot of AirAsia Flight 8501 was at the controls when the plane made its final radio transmission to ground control before plunging minutes later into the Java Sea, killing all 162 people aboard.

title: New York Today: Cloudy With a Chance of Uncertainty
description: Good morning on this chilly Thursday.

title: Australian Company Crocmedia Fined for Not Paying Interns
description: SYDNEY, Australia  An Australian media company that did not pay its interns and breached the nations labor laws has been fined in federal court in a decision that will affect workers across Australia.

title: China Wary as Violence Spills From North Korea
description: HELONG, China  On a cold, clear winter day last month, a North Korean soldier packed a pistol and slipped across the frozen Tumen River into northeastern China. He trekked about a mile to the tiny village of Jidi Tun. Then at dusk he opened fire on two older couples, killing all four people.

title: Hunt for Hezbollah Tunnels Goes on, Even as Border Tensions Fade
description: ZARIT, Israel  It is quiet most nights in this small, hilltop community in northern Israel on the border with Lebanon, and these days quite tense. So when residents began reporting strange sounds coming from underground recently, military engineers came running.

title: In Tom Stoppards Hard Problem, a Search for Certainty and Order
description: LONDON  The beautiful young couple, hair mussed and eyes glazed, has just had a tumble in the sheets. It has clearly been a fulfilling encounter for both parties. Yet something unspoken still hovers between them.

title: Narendra Modi Replaces Indias Foreign Secretary With Envoy to U.S.
description: NEW DELHI  After a visit from President Obama that was widely seen as a success, India has abruptly removed its highest-ranking diplomat and replaced her with its ambassador to the United States.

title: Daily Report: Yahoo May Become Takeover Target After Spinning Off Alibaba Stake
description: The real Yahoo can now stand up.

title: Today in Politics
description: Democrats Meet in Philadelphia. But Where Do They Go From There?

title: Throwback Thursday | The Blizzard of 1888
description: Though the great blizzard of 2015 mostly missed New York City in the end, it had New Yorkers, and the New York Times Archives Twitter feed, remembering storms of the past  and none was more dramatic than the Great White Hurricane of 1888.

title: North Korea Sought Talks and Attached a Hefty Price Tag, Souths Ex-Leader Says
description: SEOUL, South Korea  North Korea repeatedly but unsuccessfully pushed for a summit meeting with the former South Korean leader Lee Myung-bak, demanding a huge aid package, including $10 billion in cash, as an incentive, Mr. Lee says in a memoir to be published next week.

title: Loss of Malaysia Airlines Flight 370 Is Declared an Accident
description: HONG KONG  The Malaysian government declared on Thursday that the loss of Malaysia Airlines Flight 370 last March was an accident according to the terms of an international air agreement and that the 239 passengers and crew members aboard the plane were presumed dead.

title: Morning Agenda: Yahoo as Takeover Target
description: After Yahoo completes the spinoff of its $39 billion stake in the Alibaba Group, the Silicon Valley stalwart may not have much time to turn its core Internet businesses around, DealBooks Michael J. de la Merced reports. When the spinoff is done, investors and analysts say, Yahoo could become a takeover target.

title: Why Are Cubans So Special?
description: SANTA BARBARA, Calif.  Every Cuban knows the wet foot, dry foot drill: Risk fleeing to the United States and get caught at sea, and you will be sent back to the island; but if you wangle just one toe onto dry land, youre home free. From there, typically, its a fast track to permanent residency, and eligibility for all manner of benefits, from green cards to welfare, then citizenship  all compliments of the Cuban Adjustment Act of 1966. Indeed, for almost a half century, Cubans have been the most privileged immigrants in the United States.

title: In Shanghai, Easing of One-Child Rule Isnt Seen as Cure for Challenges Ahead
description: Thirty years ago, Peoples Daily, the newspaper of the ruling Communist Party, ran an article with the headline: Its good to have just one child; the government will support you in old age.

title: Race Relations on the Family Tree
description: Black or White, Mike Binders steady, well-intentioned exploration of the racial tensions affecting two branches of a Southern California family, is notable for what it doesnt try to do. It doesnt assess Americas racial attitudes based on the headlines of the day or use its story, which revolves around custody of a biracial child, to placate or to inflame.

title: Blackstones Falling Earnings Still Beat Forecasts
description: The Blackstone Group reported lower fourth-quarter earnings on Thursday that, despite a decline in its credit business and less robust returns on real estate, exceeded analysts expectations.

title: Showtime Plans a Global Push, Starting With a Canadian Deal
description: Showtime is crossing the border.

title: Daily Clip Report
description: Good morning. Here is Daily Clip Report, a collection of articles about The Times and the media sent by email each morning to senior executives and newsroom editors. The email is produced by the Corporate Communications Department at The Times.

title: Alibaba Profit Surges, but a Revenue Gain of 40% Still Misses Forecasts
description: HONG KONG  Just a day after a surprisingly blunt exchange with a Chinese regulator that unnerved investors, the e-commerce giant Alibaba Group on Thursday reported a 40 percent revenue increase in its final quarter of 2014, though the total was weaker than expected.

title: In Berlin, History Squares Off Against Hip
description: Berlin is a divided city.

title: Life in the Garment District
description: Dear Diary:

title: E.C.B. Warns Lenders Over Dividends and Executive Pay
description: FRANKFURT  The European Central Bank, asserting its new role as the eurozones chief bank supervisor, advised lenders on Thursday not to dispense too much of their profits in dividends to shareholders or in pay packages to executives, in order to gird themselves for global financial stress.

title: The Fire on the 57 Bus in Oakland
description: It was close to 5 oclock on the afternoon of Nov. 4, 2013, and Sasha Fleischman was riding the 57 bus home from school. An 18-year-old senior at a small private high school, Sasha wore a T-shirt, a black fleece jacket, a gray newsboy cap and a gauzy white skirt. For much of the long bus ride through Oakland, Calif., Sasha  who identifies as agender, neither male nor female  had been reading a paperback copy of Anna Karenina, but eventually the teenager drifted into sleep, skirt draped over the edge of the bus seat.

title: In Windsor Terrace, Brooklyn, One Roof for Two Households
description: Expecting twins, Elizabeth Clark-Garvey and her husband, Mathew Sullivan, needed a larger place.

title: A Trove of Vintage Counterculture Photographs Sees the Light of Day
description: For most of their lives, Kate and Devon Steffens thought of their father not as a photographer, but simply as someone who always had a camera in one hand. (And, likely, a joint in the other.) But when Roger Steffens hired Devon to spend a year scanning some 40,000 slides hed shot over the last 40-plus years  many of which are now collected in a new book, The Family Acid, debuting from Sun at this weekends L.A. Art Book Fair  a bigger picture emerged.

title: Dartmouth Cites Student Misconduct in Its Ban on Hard Liquor
description: With colleges under growing pressure to reduce alcohol-soaked student misbehavior, Dartmouth College said Thursday that it would ban hard liquor on campus, going beyond the changes that all but a few of its peers have been willing to make.

title: Ford Earnings Plummet, Weighed by Expenses
description: DETROIT  After several years as the leader in profits and performance among American automakers, the Ford Motor Company hit a speed bump in 2014.

title: In Etan Patz Case, High Hurdles for Prosecutors and Defense
description: In a typical murder trial, a videotape of a defendant calmly describing how he throttled a young boy  an admission repeated more than once  would be nearly impossible evidence for the defense to overcome, defense lawyers say.

title: After Semifinal Win, Murray Puts Focus on New Coach, Not His Old One
description: MELBOURNE, Australia  What began as a battle against a former coach turned into a tribute to a new one as Andy Murray reached a Grand Slam final for the first time since 2013.

title: 1915: Princess Is Awarded Damages
description: LONDON  Lida Eleanor, Princess of Thurn and Taxis, was awarded 250 damages in Mr. Justice Darlings Court yesterday [Jan. 28] against Messrs. E. Hulton and Co., proprietors of the Daily Sketch, for libel, trespass, and breach of copyright.

title: Colleen McCullough, Author of The Thorn Birds, Dies at 77
description: Colleen McCullough, a former neurophysiological researcher at Yale who, deciding to write novels in her spare time, produced The Thorn Birds, a multigenerational Australian romance that became an international best seller and inspired a hugely popular television mini-series, died on Thursday on Norfolk Island in the South Pacific, where she had made her home for more than 30 years. She was 77.

title: Jordan Lets Islamic States Deadline for a Prisoner Exchange Pass
description: AMMAN, Jordan  Jordan refused to release an imprisoned female militant on Thursday to meet a deadline set by the Islamic State, demanding that it first needed proof that a captured Jordanian pilot was still alive.

title: Unicef, Seeking More Aid, Points to Children Touched by Armed Conflict
description: GENEVA  With more than one in 10 of the worlds children living in areas affected by armed conflict, the United Nations childrens agency said Thursday that it is struggling to deal with a new generation of emergencies.

title: Theres Something Funny in This Saloon
description: CHICAGO  Nathan Lane is making people laugh in a rehearsal room here, ribbing a fellow actor about his guttural delivery of one of Eugene ONeills simpler exclamations.

title: Foxcatcher Postscript: A Wrestlers Widow Still Goes to Meets
Politicizing U.S.-Israel Ties? In 1996, Accuser Was Netanyahu
description: The Israeli prime minister stood accused of politicizing relations with the United States on the eve of his countrys elections.

title: Malaysia Declares Flight 370 an Accident
description: Azharuddin Abdul Rahman, the director general of Malaysias Department of Civil Aviation, proclaimed the crash of Flight 370 an accident, paving the way for compensation claims.

title: Is College Sexual Assault a Fraternity Problem?
description: As colleges and universities continue to struggle with the issue of sexual assault on their campuses, fraternities remain a subject of intense focus.

title: Why You Should Tell Your Children How Much You Make
description: When Scott Parker wanted his six offspring to know more about the value of money, he decided to do something that many parents would consider radical: show them exactly what he earned.

title: Reader Idea | Using an Op-Doc Video to Teach Argumentative Writing
description: Below we share an idea from Allison Marchetti, an English teacher at Trinity Episcopal School in Richmond, Va., who uses an Op-Doc video about the problem of Internet addiction among Chinas youth to teach argumentative writing to her ninth graders. This lesson is part of a larger unit of study on editorial and commentary writing.

title: Nickelodeon to Offer a Streaming Service as Viacom Steps Up Digital Efforts
description: Nickelodeon, the entertainment group focused on childrens programming, said on Thursday that it would start a new subscription streaming service in March that will be available outside traditional cable or satellite television packages.

title: Jordan on Hostage Talks With ISIS
description: The Jordanian information minister, Mohammad al-Momani, said Jordan was still waiting for ISIS to give proof of life for the Jordanian pilot it captured in order to carry out a prisoner exchange.

title: Long Lines, and Odds, for New Yorks Subsidized Housing Lotteries
description: Sitting in the back pew of a packed church in Fort Greene, Brooklyn, William Jamieson hoped to learn winning tips from a workshop on how to play New York Citys housing lotteries.

title: Gas Explosion at Mexico City Hospital Kills 3 and Wounds Dozens
description: MEXICO CITY  A gas refueling truck exploded outside a maternity and childrens hospital here on Thursday, killing three people, two of them babies, and leaving dozens injured in the destruction of nearly the entire building.

title: Connecting the Dots on the Art Map
description: An interesting crop of group shows will take art-lovers to the East Side, West Side, all around Chelsea and SoHo and more.

title: 15 Group Shows Not to Miss
description: Group shows are a staple of the New York gallery scene, but right now they are not only more plentiful than usual, they are especially good. The 15 group shows reviewed or mentioned here form a welcome antidote to the deluge of monolithic, big-name, single-artist shows that have drawn most of the air in the art world over the last year. They take us to a place where money is not king and give us small snapshots from the gigantic disorderly sprawl that is contemporary art. These shows often represent dealers, their gallery directors or invited curators  usually artists or critics  thinking slightly or very outside the box, putting together disparate works often by younger or lesser-known artists, in new and illuminating combinations. The dizzying bounty here reveals not only the elastic nature of the words art and artist but also of the group-show format itself.

title: Helping a Perfectionist Child Worry Less and Do More
description: A question Ive been getting a lot recently, both via email and in person, is this: How can I help my perfectionist child worry less, and understand that its normal to make mistakes?

title: Sam Waterston to Star in The Tempest in Central Park
description: The Public Theater on Thursday announced the lineup for its free Shakespeare in the Park program this summer: Sam Waterston will star as Prospero in The Tempest at the Delacorte Theater, followed by the Tony Award-winning director Daniel Sullivans staging of Cymbeline.

title: Clothes and Character: Theory, Selma and Hobbit
description: Though the Academy may have overlooked their costume designs, three films competing in other categories have made strong cases this season for the impact a characters clothing can have on the actor, the film and finally, the audience.

title: Lotte Hass, Pioneering Diver Known for Beauty and Bravery, Dies at 86
description: Lotte Hass, an Austrian diver and underwater filmmaker who at midcentury helped shatter the glass floor that had long kept women from the oceans depths, died on Jan. 14 in Vienna. She was 86.

title: Will the Next Attorney General Crack Down on Marijuana?
description: Despite substantial scientific evidence that marijuana is not as harmful as alcohol, many law enforcement officials continue to pretend otherwise. Add to that list Loretta Lynch, President Obamas nominee for attorney general.

title: A Long Run in Goal
description: A look at the career of goaltender Martin Brodeur, a son of Montreal who won three Stanley Cups in his 22-season N.H.L. career, almost all of it with the New Jersey Devils.

title: A New York Icon Who Shone Just Outside the Bright Lights
description: Martin Brodeur is a New York icon who belongs in the same company as Jeter and Seaver, Clyde and Broadway Joe, L. T. and Jackie Robinson and the Babe.

title: Airbus Shakes Up Its Military Aircraft Unit
description: PARIS  Faced with mounting criticism from European governments over production problems with its newest military transport plane, the Airbus Group on Thursday announced a management shake-up at its military aircraft unit and promised a restructuring of the business to address what it said were unacceptable delivery delays.

title: Sariling Atin in Elmhurst, Queens
description: Filipino specialties on a block once dominated by furniture showrooms.

title: A Buffet of Filipino Specialties
description: Fish are stacked on the glass over the steam table, fried whole without interfering batter, all crackly veneer and quick-tearing flesh. There are galunggong, like swollen cigars with the flavor of a shyer mackerel; pompano in puckering silver; and, best of all, bangus (pronounced ban-GOOSE), or milkfish, flaky and sweet, stripped of bones and butterflied flat, but with the brittle fletch of a tail intact.

title: Temple St. Clair Carrs Jeweled Creatures
description: The jewelry designer introduced her nine newest creations during Paris Couture Week.

title: Graham Is Latest Republican to Explore Presidential Run
description: Senator Lindsey Graham of South Carolina has been hinting that he might vie for the Republican presidential nomination, and on Thursday he came a step closer to putting it in writing.

title: Jim Parsons to Play the Title Role in An Act of God on Broadway
description: Jim Parsons is God  and not just to fans of his character, Sheldon Cooper, on the hit CBS series The Big Bang Theory, for which he has won four best actor Emmy Awards. No, Mr. Parsons is actually going to play the Almighty on Broadway beginning May 5 in the new comedy An Act of God by David Javerbaum, a former head writer and executive producer of The Daily Show With Jon Stewart, the plays producer announced on Thursday.

title: French Police Question Boy, 8, After Remarks on Paris Attacks
description: PARIS  Police officials in the southern French city of Nice questioned an 8-year-old boy who is believed to have made comments in school defending the gunmen who killed 17 people in terrorist attacks in and near Paris this month, a senior regional police official confirmed on Thursday.

title: At Reed Krakoffs New SoHo Boutique, the Art and Design Are as Compelling as the Fashion
description: From the moment a customer enters Reed Krakoffs new SoHo boutique to find lamps that appear to have burst in right through the sheetrock, its clear that the store is no ordinary luxury flagship. Its surprising, Krakoff says, referring to both the site-specific lighting installation by Nick Allman and the 2,700-square-foot storefront, his second in New York, which opens Sunday. The idea was to have a space that combines art and fashion and design in a way that is sort of un-self-conscious and natural. Krakoffs well-documented affinity for art and design informed many other elements of the marble-floored interior: Also present are an opalescent table by Mattia Bonetti, which Krakoff says reads almost like a sculpture; a custom Ronan and Erwan Bouroullec Clouds installation rendered in felt, one of Krakoffs favorite materials; and a wall installation of chairs created by Krakoff and his wife Delphine that was originally exhibited at Salon 94 and will double as shelving for merchandise. Steven Sebrings 360-degree photographs of Krakoffs designs  the same signature technique utilized in the photographers recent book featuring Coco Rocha, Study of Pose  will also be on prominent display. The juxtaposition of these things tells a story, Krakoff says. Its different than the typical shopping experience.

title: The Top Five Fall/Winter 2015 Mens Wear Collections in Paris
description: Ts mens fashion editors share their favorites from the latest round of shows.

title: Online Political Ads Have Been Slow to Catch On as TV Reigns
description: After being hit with a television advertisement attacking his position on womens issues, Mike Coffman, a Colorado Republican running for re-election in 2014 to the House of Representatives, did the natural thing: His campaign responded with an ad of its own.

title: U.S. Textbook Skews History, Prime Minister of Japan Says
description: TOKYO  Prime Minister Shinzo Abe of Japan on Thursday criticized an American textbook that he said inaccurately depicted Japans actions during World War II, opening a new front in a battle to sway American views of the countrys wartime history.

title: At Bocuse dOr, Americans Take 2nd
description: On Tuesday, the culinary team from the United States placed second out of 24 teams in the biennial Bocuse dOr international culinary competition in Lyon, France. Its the first time the Americans have earned a medal. Their highest finish had been sixth place.

title: Alibabas Lesson in Government Relations
description: Alibaba is teaching its shareholders a useful lesson about Chinese business: There is no such thing as having a good relationship with the government. The companys shares fell 4.4 percent on Wednesday after a regulator lambasted its sales habits. Alibaba says the State Administration for Industry and Commerce is being irrational. That is little comfort to investors who, on paper, are now $11 billion worse off.

title: For Athletes, the Time of an Event Can Affect Performance
description: Athletes have long sought ways to gain even a small edge that can make the difference between getting a medal and finishing in the middle of the pack, like altitude training or even performance-enhancing drugs.

title: Houthis Reach Out as They Cement Power in Yemen
description: SANA, Yemen  Abu Raad strutted through the streets of the Yemeni capital as if he owned them. His obvious glee, at a time of crisis in the country, bordered on navet. But he had his reasons to be happy.

title: China Further Tightens Grip on the Internet
description: BEIJING  Jing Yuechen, the founder of an Internet start-up here in the Chinese capital, has no interest in overthrowing the Communist Party. But these days she finds herself cursing the nations smothering cyberpolice as she tries  and fails  to browse photo-sharing websites like Flickr and struggles to stay in touch with the Facebook friends she has made during trips to France, India and Singapore.

title: A Quirky Car Collection on the Cape, in Red and Mostly British
description: HYANNIS PORT, Mass.  BILL PUTMAN is a collector, and no ordinary one. Step behind the doors of his Simmons Homestead Inn here on Cape Cod, and a visitor is allowed a glimpse into the quirky mind of its 78-year-old proprietor.

title: 1940: Daladier Addresses Civilians
description: In an earnest radio talk to the French nation last night [Jan. 28], Premier Edouard Daladier told civilians that their lives must undergo as complete a transformation as those of the men in the front line if a powerful, destructive and unscrupulous enemy is to be defeated in the total war which will not be long now in being let loose. When they left for the frontier, our sons accepted a total transformation of their lives, he said. Those who have stayed behind and do not have to put up with the same sufferings and dangers must also agree to transform their lives.  New York Herald Tribune, European Edition, Jan. 30, 1940

title: A Digital Upgrade at the Tower of David Museum
description: When the Tower of David Museum opened in Jerusalems Old City in 1989, with video models, dioramas and even a rainbow-hued hologram among its offerings, its technology was considered cutting-edge.

title: A Dark, Delicate New Track From Elvis Perkins
description: Its a record thats been in the offing for a while, says the songwriter Elvis Perkins about his forthcoming third LP, I Aubade, which sees its release on his own MIR label on Feb. 24. Its a culmination of past visions, present inclinations and a lot of guesswork. And a lot of accidents.

title: F.C.C. Sharply Revises Definition of Broadband
description: The Federal Communications Commission on Thursday sharply revised its benchmark definition of broadband Internet service. The new definition increases download speeds to more than six times faster than the previous standard, set more than four years ago.

title: David Landau, Mideast Journalist and Biographer of Sharon, Dies at 67
description: JERUSALEM  David Landau, a prominent British-Israeli reporter, newspaper editor and author who practiced an unusual mix of religious Orthodoxy, ardent Zionism and leftist politics, died on Tuesday at a hospital here. He was 67.

title: Reddit Issues First Transparency Report
description: Reddit, the hugely popular Internet message board, released its first transparency report Thursday afternoon, giving its 174 million regular visitors a closer look into how often outside agencies request user information.

title: The College Partying Crackdown
description: Sick of bad press about dangerous parties and concerned that young people cant handle the social freedoms offered by college, will universities retake the in loco parentis role they abandoned long ago and impose stricter rules? Its starting to look that way.

title: Senate Approves Keystone XL Pipeline Bill, Testing Obama
description: WASHINGTON  The Senate passed a bill on Thursday to force approval of the Keystone XL oil pipeline, which President Obama is certain to veto in his first official clash with the new Republican-majority Congress.

title: Greece Steps Back Into Line With European Union Policy on Russia Sanctions
description: BRUSSELS  Gathering in Brussels, European foreign ministers scrambled on Thursday to hold a united front against Russia over Ukraine, calming worries that the election of a far-left government in Greece hostile to sanctions could upend Europes policy toward Moscow.

title: Bipartisan Praise for Lynch as Confirmation Hearings End
description: Testimony in the confirmation hearings of Loretta E. Lynch wrapped up Thursday with members of both parties praising her performance and with her winning her first declared Republican supporter, Senator Orrin G. Hatch of Utah.

title: The Top Five Fall/Winter 2015 Mens Wear Collections in Paris
description: Ts mens fashion editors share their favorites from the latest round of shows.

title: Chaos in Paris Commute as RER Train Drivers Go on Strike Over Assault
description: PARIS  Railway traffic on Europes busiest commuter line came to a near standstill in Paris and its suburbs on Thursday as train drivers went on strike to protest the assault of a driver on Wednesday night.

title: Treasury Fight Is Over, but Wall Street Animosity Lingers
description: On Monday, Antonio Weiss, the 48-year-old former global head of investment banking at Lazard, took up his new position as counselor to Jacob J. Lew, the Treasury secretary. In a note to his friends and Lazard colleagues, Mr. Weiss explained that he will be advising Mr. Lew on financial markets, regulatory reform, job creation and on fostering broad-based economic growth. It sounds like a full plate, and a job worth giving up his high-powered career at Lazard to take.

title: Do Your Children Know How Much It Costs to Support Your Family?
description: The excerpt from Ron Liebers book The Opposite of Spoiled opens with a bang  or at least, with a dramatic thump: the sound of one parents entire months salary, in bills, sliding out of an unmarked bag onto the dining room table.

title: In the Way Cancer Cells Work Together, a Possible Tool for Their Demise
description: A tumor, as strange as it may sound, is a little society. The cancer cells that make it up cooperate with one another, and together they thrive.

title: A Climatologist Answers Questions on Weather Forecasts
description: After the blizzard that wasnt in New York City, many people have been wondering about weather forecasts and meteorology.

title: I Do Not Think That Number Means What You Think It Means
description: Steve Rattner has a very puzzling piece in todays Times. Leave aside the dismissal of the austerity debate  which has, if nothing else, been a dramatic illustration of the immense relevance of macroeconomic analysis  as simplistic; Dean Baker has that one covered. What really gets me is this chart:

title: By Breaking Mold of Receiver, Edelman Fits In With Patriots
description: PHOENIX  In professional sports, being listed as 6 feet tall often means you are somewhere between 5-8 and 5-11. The rounding up is considered a courtesy, since being undersize carries something of a stigma. Julian Edelman, New Englands jack-of-all-trades wide receiver, freely admits that he is 5 feet 10 even if the Patriots website used to give him a couple of extra inches.

title: From Steep Hillsides, a Depth of Flavor
description: The reds of the northern Rhne Valley are some of my favorite wines in the world. When not wrapped in the homogenizing influence of new oak aromas and textures, the wines radiate a combination of savory intensity, freshness and nuance I find almost unrivaled.

title: More Than 1,000 in Arizona Are Watched for Measles
description: DENVER  Arizona health officials on Thursday were tracking more than 1,000 people, including at least 195 children, who might have been exposed to measles as part of an outbreak that began at Disneyland in Southern California and has grown to 67 cases in seven states.

title: Counting by Chickens
description: Researchers demonstrated that chickens naturally order numbers left to right. When the number five is in the middle, chickens naturally go left for lower numbers and to the right for higher numbers.

title: Chickens Agree: Left Means Less; Right Means More
description: Asked to picture the numbers from one to 10, most people will imagine a straight line with one at the left end and 10 at the right.

title: With a Few Bits of Data, Researchers Identify Anonymous People
description: Even when real names and other personal information are stripped from big data sets, it is often possible to use just a few pieces of the information to identify a specific person, according to a study to be published Friday in the journal Science.

title: Your Next Lesson: Langhe Nebbiolo
description: Heres a Wine School problem for you: Barolo and Barbaresco are among the worlds most beautiful wines, made from the nebbiolo grape, which is known partly for a tannic austerity that can take years of aging to soften. The young Barolos and Barbarescos available in most wine shops wont be ready to drink for several more years, while older examples are expensive and hard to find. How should we approach these wines?

title: At Valentinos Spring 2015 Couture Presentation, a Shimmering Ode to Love
description: Valentinos couture presentation was an homage to romance. Words like Amore were emblazoned across the busts of dresses and seen in poetry verses swirled in cursive around the sheer, full skirts of gowns. Less literal takes on the theme came in the form of Russian folkloric embroidered vests and jackets, garnet velvet dresses and ethereal, pale lace gowns. The standout that this editor loved:a golden dress constructed like armor on top, with hand-beaded sentences of rapturous prose sparkling across the skirt.

title: Paris Couture Week: Valentino Spring/Summer 2015
description: Scenes from the Paris Couture Week photo diary of Schohaja.

title: Sheldon Silvers Departure Creates Rare Opportunity in Albany
description: Sheldon Silver, the New York State Assembly speaker, was arrested last week on charges he exploited his office for personal gain. As The Times reported Thursday, an idealistic new wave of Assembly members forced him to resign his post. The Times editorial board member Eleanor Randolph, who has covered Albany and New York politics for nearly 20 years, reflects on what she sees as an opportune moment.

title: Man Lost Contact With Drone Before It Sped to White House, Friend Says
description: WASHINGTON  In retrospect, flying the drone out the apartment window at 3 a.m. might not have been the best idea.

title: Anatomy of a Scene | Boyhood
description: Richard Linklater discusses a sequence from his drama Boyhood, with Ellar Coltrane and Ethan Hawke.

title: Marshawn Lynch Has Some Words for Reporters, and a Few Stares
description: PHOENIX  The smiling Marshawn Lynch from media day was officially gone Thursday when the Seattle Seahawks running back faced the news media for the final time before the Super Bowl. No longer content to answer every question with a stock answer like Im just here so I dont get fined, Lynch briefly addressed the large crowd and tried to explain his point of view.

title: Paris Couture Week: Zuhair Murad Spring/Summer 2015
description: Scenes from the Paris Couture Week photo diary of Alfredo Piola.

title: Lawyers in Anti-Police Video Knew of Violent Tone, Inquiry Finds
description: The music video opens with symbols of the police protest movement that gained traction last fall: images of Eric Garner being wrestled to a sidewalk on Staten Island and of black men with their arms raised in a pose of surrender.

title: In a Time of Racial Turmoil, Why Change Course on Covering Race?
description: To state the obvious, it seems like an odd time to discontinue the one Times beat devoted solely to race and ethnicity. (A few words of reminder: Michael Brown of Ferguson, Eric Garner of Staten Island, Tamir Rice of Cleveland.)

title: Maria Sharapova vs. Serena Williams: A One-Sided Rivalry
description: MELBOURNE, Australia  The un-rivalry is back with Maria Sharapova facing Serena Williams in the Australian Open final.

title: Government Allies Are Said to Have Slaughtered Dozens of Sunnis in Iraq
description: BAGHDAD  Some of the men were shot on their doorsteps, their bodies left crumpled in the streets. Others were lined up, led to a field and killed there. Their relatives, ordered to stay in their homes, heard the gunfire.

title: Uber Accused of Lax Safety Practices by Delhi Woman
description: A woman who says she was sexually assaulted by an Uber driver last month in New Delhi has filed a lawsuit against the company, arguing that Ubers hollow safety and driver screening practices put her in an unsafe situation.

title: Blackstone Courts Wealthy Individuals With New Private Equity Fund
description: The Blackstone Group, the biggest alternative investment firm, which typically relies on pension funds and other institutions to amass capital for deals, has begun an effort to raise more of that capital from individuals.

title: Richard Linklater Narrates a Scene From Boyhood
description: A road trip turns melancholy in this scene from Richard Linklaters Oscar-nominated film Boyhood. Here, the writer and director narrates a sequence in which Mason (Ellar Coltrane) has a talk with his dad (Ethan Hawke) about the Pontiac GTO his dad owned but has since sold and replaced with a minivan.

title: Tim Ryans Switch on Abortion Rights
description: Representative Tim Ryan, an Ohio Democrat who previously opposed abortion rights, has officially changed sides. Hes very welcome in the pro-choice camp. With reproductive freedom under attack in the Republican-led Congress and in G.O.P.-controlled state legislatures around the country, the embattled cause needs all the new supporters it can get.

title: A Road Map of Home Values and Street Names
description: Streets named for trees, presidents and more, and how they compare.

title: How to Avoid Frauds in Investments, and Personnel Hires
description: Carson C. Block is the director of research for Muddy Waters, a research and investment firm. He is on Twitter at @muddywatersre

title: As New Leadership Takes Over in Washington, a Major Fiscal Clash Takes Shape
description: WASHINGTON  President Obama will propose breaching statutory spending caps in the fiscal year that begins in October, putting out a budget Monday that raises spending at Congresss discretion by $74 billion  or 7 percent, the White House announced Thursday.

title: David Kochel, Romneys Iowa Strategist, Jumps to Bush
description: David Kochel, a Republican strategist based in Iowa who worked on both of Mitt Romneys presidential campaigns, is joining Jeb Bushs political action committee as a senior strategist and is in line to serve as Mr. Bushs national campaign manager.

title: SoundExchange Says It Paid $773 Million in Music Royalties Last Year
description: As streaming music becomes more popular with consumers, the agency that processes much of the licensing income behind outlets like Pandora and Sirius XM has quickly grown to be one of the music industrys biggest sources of royalties.

title: A Bloom in TVs Asian-American Desert
description: On Fresh Off the Boat, the new ABC family sitcom based on the memoir of the same name by the rowdy, bawdy chef Eddie Huang, the young Eddie is played by Hudson Yang, an amiable 11-year-old with an air of preternatural chill. In the book, Eddie is a bit of a rabble-rouser, but on the show, hes a fast-learning fish out of water with a gift for comic self-presentation.

title: Front Seat to an Escalating Global Conflict
description: The not so distant future looks a lot like the recent past in The Road to Damascus, a serious and mostly satisfying new political thriller at 59E59 Theaters.

title: Eurozone Takes on Quantitative Easing, and Its Risks
description: FRANKFURT  As central banks have injected cash into their nations economies, a question has raged over whether they have helped average people or simply made the rich even richer.

title: Paris Couture Week: Valentino Spring/Summer 2015
description: Scenes from the Paris Couture Week photo diary of Schohaja.

title: McCain Calls Hecklers Low-Life Scum
description: Senator John McCain, Republican of Arizona, admonished members of an antiwar group who were heckling former Secretary of State Henry A. Kissinger during a committee hearing.

title: A New York Movie Marathon
description: Scenes at some of the 12 theaters and museums that a reporter visited on a two-day movie binge.

title: Video: McCain Calls Hecklers Low-Life Scum
12 Theaters, Two Days, One Kick in the Head
description: I try to keep it quiet, but what I really want to do is go to the movies. Not for the same reasons as Binx Bolling in The Moviegoer  he wants to escape the sadness of daily life  but because so much is going on that sometimes I need to get out of my head, and I like to do it in a cinema instead of in front of a computer.

title: Super Bowl Parties at Bars, No Cover Required
description: Football isnt for everyone, but it sure is for a lot of people: Its Americas most popular sport. Last years Super Bowl on Fox averaged 111.5 million viewers  the most for any single broadcast in American television history.

title: Department of Investigation Report on the Bronx Defenders
description: An inquiry into a government-funded legal organizations involvement in a music video with song lyrics that included For Mike Brown and Sean Bell, a cop got to get killed.

title: Rand Paul Pushes Buttons, in a New Medium
description: Senator Rand Paul has been quite the pot stirrer on Twitter and Facebook recently, poking fun at Mitt Romney and Jeb Bushs lunch meeting last week in Salt Lake City, going after Senator Marco Rubio on Cuba policy and having some fun with the Seinfeld holiday Festivus.

title: In Los Angeles, a Crop of Art Fairs to Suit All Tastes
description: As the dust has settled on Snowpocalypse, the sun is shining in California and increasingly international factions of the art world are making their way to Los Angeles for the citys biggest art week of the year. Three fairs that could not be more different (or far away) from each other converge this weekend, along with a host of collateral events and exhibitions organized by Angelenos and visitors alike.

title: Medicare Payments Surge for Stents to Unblock Blood Vessels in Limbs
description: At a time of increasing scrutiny of procedures to open blocked heart arteries, cardiologists are turning to  and reaping huge payments from -- controversial techniques that relieve blockages in the arms and legs.

title: Amazon Reports a Profit, Citing Prime as the Key
description: Amazons profits fell in the fourth quarter. Revenue did not meet expectations. The company said it might lose money in the current quarter.

title: Points of Interest
description: Reflective metal hardware turns otherwise architecturally simple shoes and bags into modern art.

title: Murder Trial Begins for Former Patriot
description: FALL RIVER, Mass.  Aaron Hernandez wore a dark suit on Thursday, just as his former teammates with the New England Patriots had worn coats and ties earlier in the week. The difference was that they were flying to the Super Bowl and he was walking into his trial on a charge of first-degree murder.

title: Temple St. Clair Carrs Jeweled Creatures
description: What began as an errand to find an ancient coin to make into a necklace for my mother turned into a lifelong passion, says the New York-based jewelry designer Temple St. Clair Carr. Since she began her line, Temple St. Clair, in 1986, St. Clair Carrs designs have evolved from mostly gold pieces featuring antique amulets and cabochon stones and crafted with historic techniques  into the elaborate fine-jewelry treasures she unveiled today at the Muse des Arts Dcoratifs during Paris Couture Week. Called Mythical Creatures from the Golden Menagerie, the collection includes nine pieces: Great Horned Owl, Sleeping Fox, Flying Fish, Medusa Moon Jellyfish, Phoenix Chicks, Frog Prince, Sea Dragon, Secret Garden Serpent and Turtles on the Rocks (which, to St. Clair Carr, evoke swimming in country ponds with her family). This is slow jewelry! declares St. Clair Carr, who worked on the collection for three years, flying back and forth to Florence as her Italian craftsmen came across anything particularly beautiful or rare. The whole set, as seen in the above slideshow, remains on view at Chahan Gallery (by appointment only) until Feb. 6.

title: Google Revenue Is Higher, but Profit Misses Expectations
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Everybody knows Google is working on a lot of things besides search. Wall Street wants to know when all those projects will start making a lot of money.

title: Harvard Art Museums Director to Step Down
description: Thomas W. Lentz, who directed the Harvard Art Museums for more than a decade and shepherded them through a long and sometimes contentious $350 million renovation and expansion that was completed last November, has announced that he will step down on July 1, the university announced.

title: Notes On A Scandale
description: For years, Frances leaders have been caught up in a sex farce of their own making, proving that bedfellows make for very strange politics.

title: Paris Couture Week: Zuhair Murad Spring/Summer 2015
description: Scenes from the Paris Couture Week photo diary of Alfredo Piola.

title: Celebrating Images of a Long-Gone Florida
description: As soon as 19th-century developers started carving Floridas swampland and palm groves into resorts and subdivisions, colonies of artists formed there to document the vanishing landscape. On Feb. 8, a new building devoted to the art of the region opens at the Museum of Arts and Sciences in Daytona Beach.

title: Noguchi Show Is Planned for Brooklyn Botanic Garden
description: Gardens have been formative playgrounds for great artists at least since Michelangelo spent his teenage years poring over antiquities in the Medici gardens in Florence. But few artists have made gardens as central to their work as Isamu Noguchi, whose museum and sculpture garden in Long Island City, Queens, turns 30 this year.

title: Should Unvaccinated Children Stay Home to Protect a Vulnerable Classmate?
description: The father of a 6-year-old boy with leukemia in Marin County, Calif., has asked the superintendent of his school district to keep unvaccinated children out of school.

title: From the White House to the Super Bowl
description: A sampling of Doug Millss work.

title: Beautiful Unrest
description: Vivid botanical prints lose their ladylike sweetness when paired with utilitarian samples.

title: From the White House to the Super Bowl, With a Times Photographer
description: Doug Mills, a staff photographer for The New York Times based in the Washington bureau for the better part of two decades, has seen it all: from presidential inaugurations to Super Bowls, from the campaign trail to court-side champions.

title: No Detail Goes Unnoticed When Art Is a Click Away
description: The construction of new art museum buildings like that of the Whitney Museum of American Art in Manhattans meatpacking district naturally receives a lot of attention. But theres another kind of construction going on that tells more about where museums are at and where they are going than any shiny new edifice: their websites. That might sound surprising to anyone not professionally involved in museum work, but if you want to know how museums are changing their philosophies and programs in a time of increasing financial pressure and the continuing rise of private museums like Eli Broads in Los Angeles, websites are the most visible and informative places to look.

title: A Long, Strange Trip Indeed
description: The Golden Toad, the latest work by the experimental troupe the Talking Band, is a long, often amusing journey of discovery, but its characters do most of the discovering.

title: A Deep, Dark Fight for Dignity
description: The story James Green has to tell in The Devil Is Here in These Hills: West Virginias Coal Miners and Their Battle for Freedom is among the best and largely forgotten American stories. Its about property rights versus human rights, about hard men and women and about violent conflict. Its a tale about a working-class insurgency thats as piney as an Appalachian ballad.

title: Marshawn Lynch Has Only One Answer
description: The Seattle Seahawks running back replied to every question at a Super Bowl news conference with a variation of you know why Im here.

title: On the Margins, but Moving Toward the Center
description: Outsider art has changed significantly over the last decade. Where it used to come with a story and a diagnosis (the work was found in an attic or a Dumpster and made by a person with schizophrenia), it has now been included in the 2013 Venice Biennale, Rosemarie Trockels 2012 retrospective at the New Museum and acquired by the Museum of Modern Art.
